1.text: The purpose of art is washing the dust of daily life off our souls.
1.author: Pablo Picasso

2.text: Art is not what you see, but what you make others see.
2.author: Edgar Degas

3.text: Be true to yourself, help others, make each day your masterpiece, make friendship a fine art, drink deeply from good books - especially the Bible, build a shelter against a rainy day, give thanks for your blessings and pray for guidance every day.
3.author: John Wooden

4.text: This world is but a canvas to our imagination.
4.author: Henry David Thoreau

5.text: Procrastination is the art of keeping up with yesterday.
5.author: Don Marquis

6.text: Love of beauty is taste. The creation of beauty is art.
6.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

7.text: Every production of an artist should be the expression of an adventure of his soul.
7.author: W. Somerset Maugham

8.text: Vision is the art of seeing what is invisible to others.
8.author: Jonathan Swift

9.text: Sometimes being a friend means mastering the art of timing. There is a time for silence. A time to let go and allow people to hurl themselves into their own destiny. And a time to prepare to pick up the pieces when it's all over.
9.author: Octavia Butler

10.text: Creativity is allowing yourself to make mistakes. Art is knowing which ones to keep.
10.author: Scott Adams

11.text: Excellence is an art won by training and habituation. We do not act rightly because we have virtue or excellence, but we rather have those because we have acted rightly. We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act but a habit.
11.author: Aristotle

12.text: The true work of art is but a shadow of the divine perfection.
12.author: Michelangelo

13.text: Youth is the gift of nature, but age is a work of art.
13.author: Stanislaw Jerzy Lec

14.text: I decided on the spot that I would be an artist, and I assure you, it was no ordinary artist I had in mind.
14.author: Henry Ossawa Tanner

15.text: Feelings aroused by the touch of someone's hand, the sound of music, the smell of a flower, a beautiful sunset, a work of art, love, laughter, hope and faith - all work on both the unconscious and the conscious aspects of the self, and they have physiological consequences as well.
15.author: Bernie Siegel

16.text: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
16.author: Sun Tzu

17.text: Art is like baby shoes. When you coat them with gold, they can no longer be worn.
17.author: John Updike

18.text: It is the supreme art of the teacher to awaken joy in creative expression and knowledge.
18.author: Albert Einstein

19.text: To me, photography is an art of observation. It's about finding something interesting in an ordinary place... I've found it has little to do with the things you see and everything to do with the way you see them.
19.author: Elliott Erwitt

20.text: If you hear a voice within you say 'you cannot paint,' then by all means paint, and that voice will be silenced.
20.author: Vincent Van Gogh

21.text: Where the spirit does not work with the hand, there is no art.
21.author: Leonardo da Vinci

22.text: The art of art, the glory of expression and the sunshine of the light of letters, is simplicity.
22.author: Walt Whitman

23.text: Art attracts us only by what it reveals of our most secret self.
23.author: Alfred North Whitehead

24.text: Riding a race bike is an art - a thing that you do because you feel something inside.
24.author: Valentino Rossi

25.text: The essence of all beautiful art, all great art, is gratitude.
25.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

26.text: Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things that give value to survival.
26.author: C. S. Lewis

27.text: Motivation is the art of getting people to do what you want them to do because they want to do it.
27.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

28.text: Good management is the art of making problems so interesting and their solutions so constructive that everyone wants to get to work and deal with them.
28.author: Paul Hawken

29.text: Some painters transform the sun into a yellow spot, others transform a yellow spot into the sun.
29.author: Pablo Picasso

30.text: Art consists of limitation. The most beautiful part of every picture is the frame.
30.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

31.text: You must not fight too often with one enemy, or you will teach him all your art of war.
31.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

32.text: Without tradition, art is a flock of sheep without a shepherd. Without innovation, it is a corpse.
32.author: Winston Churchill

33.text: Photography is more than a medium for factual communication of ideas. It is a creative art.
33.author: Ansel Adams

34.text: Diversity: the art of thinking independently together.
34.author: Malcolm Forbes

35.text: Architecture is a visual art, and the buildings speak for themselves.
35.author: Julia Morgan

36.text: The aim of art is to represent not the outward appearance of things, but their inward significance.
36.author: Aristotle

37.text: Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it everywhere, diagnosing it incorrectly and applying the wrong remedies.
37.author: Groucho Marx

38.text: The art of being wise is the art of knowing what to overlook.
38.author: William James

39.text: The art of simplicity is a puzzle of complexity.
39.author: Douglas Horton

40.text: Life is the art of drawing without an eraser.
40.author: John W. Gardner

41.text: Beautiful music is the art of the prophets that can calm the agitations of the soul; it is one of the most magnificent and delightful presents God has given us.
41.author: Martin Luther

42.text: The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and science.
42.author: Albert Einstein

43.text: The art of healing comes from nature, not from the physician. Therefore the physician must start from nature, with an open mind.
43.author: Paracelsus

44.text: Every painting is a voyage into a sacred harbour.
44.author: Giotto di Bondone

45.text: Be true to yourself. Make each day a masterpiece. Help others. Drink deeply from good books. Make friendship a fine art. Build a shelter against a rainy day.
45.author: John Wooden

46.text: Creative without strategy is called 'art.' Creative with strategy is called 'advertising.'
46.author: Jef I. Richards

47.text: Drawing is the honesty of the art. There is no possibility of cheating. It is either good or bad.
47.author: Salvador Dali

48.text: Don't only practice your art, but force your way into its secrets; art deserves that, for it and knowledge can raise man to the Divine.
48.author: Ludwig van Beethoven

49.text: Most art is fragile and some should be placed and never moved away.
49.author: Donald Judd

50.text: Art in Nature is rhythmic and has a horror of constraint.
50.author: Robert Delaunay

51.text: Artists don't talk about art. Artists talk about work. If I have anything to say to young writers, it's stop thinking of writing as art. Think of it as work.
51.author: Paddy Chayefsky

52.text: All nature is but art unknown to thee.
52.author: Alexander Pope

53.text: An artist never works under ideal conditions. If they existed, his work wouldn't exist, for the artist doesn't live in a vacuum. Some sort of pressure must exist. The artist exists because the world is not perfect. Art would be useless if the world were perfect, as man wouldn't look for harmony but would simply live in it.
53.author: Andrei Tarkovsky

54.text: The art of being happy lies in the power of extracting happiness from common things.
54.author: Henry Ward Beecher

55.text: Sculpture is the art of the intelligence.
55.author: Pablo Picasso

56.text: You don't take a photograph, you make it.
56.author: Ansel Adams

57.text: I have seen many storms in my life. Most storms have caught me by surprise, so I had to learn very quickly to look further and understand that I am not capable of controlling the weather, to exercise the art of patience and to respect the fury of nature.
57.author: Paulo Coelho

58.text: Thou art not for the earth, nor for the Heaven the world is for thee, thou art not for the world.
58.author: Muhammad Iqbal

59.text: The art of effective listening is essential to clear communication, and clear communication is necessary to management success.
59.author: James Cash Penney

60.text: Building art is a synthesis of life in materialised form. We should try to bring in under the same hat not a splintered way of thinking, but all in harmony together.
60.author: Alvar Aalto

61.text: The art of war is simple enough. Find out where your enemy is. Get at him as soon as you can. Strike him as hard as you can, and keep moving on.
61.author: Ulysses S. Grant

62.text: My art is an attempt to reach beyond the surface appearance. I want to see growth in wood, time in stone, nature in a city, and I do not mean its parks but a deeper understanding that a city is nature too-the ground upon which it is built, the stone with which it is made.
62.author: Andy Goldsworthy

63.text: Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television.
63.author: Woody Allen

64.text: Be slow to fall into friendship; but when thou art in, continue firm and constant.
64.author: Socrates

65.text: Controversy is part of the nature of art and creativity.
65.author: Yoko Ono

66.text: Medicine is a science of uncertainty and an art of probability.
66.author: William Osler

67.text: Art is I; science is we.
67.author: Claude Bernard

68.text: I have never denied my background or my culture. I have taught my child to embrace her Mexican heritage, to love my first language, Spanish, to learn about Mexican history, music, folk art, food, and even the Mexican candy I grew up with.
68.author: Salma Hayek

69.text: The art of war teaches us to rely not on the likelihood of the enemy's not coming, but on our own readiness to receive him; not on the chance of his not attacking, but rather on the fact that we have made our position unassailable.
69.author: Sun Tzu

70.text: It is not in life, but in art that self-fulfillment is to be found.
70.author: Wilson Mizner

71.text: Great artists suffer for the people.
71.author: Marvin Gaye

72.text: The modern work of art, as I have said, is a symbol.
72.author: Herbert Read

73.text: The artist one day falls through a hole in the brambles, and from that moment he is following the dark rapids of an underground river which may sometimes flow so near to the surface that the laughing picnic parties are heard above.
73.author: Cyril Connolly

74.text: Rationalism is the enemy of art, though necessary as a basis for architecture.
74.author: Arthur Erickson

75.text: Politics is the art of choosing between the disastrous and the unpalatable.
75.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

76.text: All architecture is great architecture after sunset; perhaps architecture is really a nocturnal art, like the art of fireworks.
76.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

77.text: My life is a monument to procrastination, to the art of putting things off until later, or much later, or possibly never.
77.author: Craig Brown

78.text: An artist is somebody who produces things that people don't need to have.
78.author: Andy Warhol

79.text: Photography takes an instant out of time, altering life by holding it still.
79.author: Dorothea Lange

80.text: The artist is a receptacle for emotions that come from all over the place: from the sky, from the earth, from a scrap of paper, from a passing shape, from a spider's web.
80.author: Pablo Picasso

81.text: I found I could say things with color and shapes that I couldn't say any other way - things I had no words for.
81.author: Georgia O'Keeffe

82.text: A man paints with his brains and not with his hands.
82.author: Michelangelo

83.text: There hasn't been any art yet. Art is just beginning.
83.author: Constantin Brancusi

84.text: I realize that every picture isn't a work of art.
84.author: Conrad Hall

85.text: Art is never finished, only abandoned.
85.author: Leonardo da Vinci

86.text: To say nothing, especially when speaking, is half the art of diplomacy.
86.author: Will Durant

87.text: Courtesy is a silver lining around the dark clouds of civilization; it is the best part of refinement and in many ways, an art of heroic beauty in the vast gallery of man's cruelty and baseness.
87.author: Bryant H. McGill

88.text: The art and science of asking questions is the source of all knowledge.
88.author: Thomas Berger

89.text: Art is basically made by dissatisfied people who are willing to find some means to relieve the dissatisfaction.
89.author: John Chamberlain

90.text: It'll be the Internet and piracy that will kill film. There's a philosophy that the Internet should be free, but the reality is that piracy will destroy the film industry and film as an art form because it's expensive to make a movie. Maybe you'll have funky little independent movies, and it'll go back and then start up again some other way.
90.author: Helen Mirren

91.text: Jazz music is America's past and its potential, summed up and sanctified and accessible to anybody who learns to listen to, feel, and understand it. The music can connect us to our earlier selves and to our better selves-to-come. It can remind us of where we fit on the time line of human achievement, an ultimate value of art.
91.author: Wynton Marsalis

92.text: If you're not trying to be real, you don't have to get it right. That's art.
92.author: Andy Warhol

93.text: Once you learn to look at architecture not merely as an art more or less well or more or less badly done, but as a social manifestation, the critical eye becomes clairvoyant.
93.author: Louis Sullivan

94.text: Leadership is the art of getting someone else to do something you want done because he wants to do it.
94.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

95.text: What strikes me is the fact that in our society, art has become something which is only related to objects, and not to individuals, or to life.
95.author: Michel Foucault

96.text: There's no art to find the mind's construction in the face.
96.author: William Shakespeare

97.text: Society is like a large piece of frozen water; and skating well is the great art of social life.
97.author: Letitia Elizabeth Landon

98.text: Simplicity is the final achievement. After one has played a vast quantity of notes and more notes, it is simplicity that emerges as the crowning reward of art.
98.author: Frederic Chopin

99.text: In visual perception a color is almost never seen as it really is - as it physically is. This fact makes color the most relative medium in art.
99.author: Josef Albers

100.text: The surrealists, and the modern movement in painting as a whole, seemed to offer a key to the strange postwar world with its threat of nuclear war. The dislocations and ambiguities, in cubism and abstract art as well as the surrealists, reminded me of my childhood in Shanghai.
100.author: J. G. Ballard

101.text: Creating a wonderful drama is an art form, while comedy is just entertainment.
101.author: Jason Reitman

102.text: Vulnerability is the essence of romance. It's the art of being uncalculated, the willingness to look foolish, the courage to say, 'This is me, and I'm interested in you enough to show you my flaws with the hope that you may embrace me for all that I am but, more important, all that I am not.'
102.author: Ashton Kutcher

103.text: The temple of art is built in words.
103.author: Josiah Gilbert Holland

104.text: Through a painting we can see the whole world.
104.author: Hans Hofmann

105.text: The task of art today is to bring chaos into order.
105.author: Theodor Adorno

106.text: I think you can do anything with comics that you could do in just about any art form.
106.author: Harvey Pekar

107.text: The art of pleasing is the art of deception.
107.author: Luc de Clapiers

108.text: Art teaches nothing, except the significance of life.
108.author: Michael Korda

109.text: Nude nail polish wins hands down over intricate nail art.
109.author: Ashley Madekwe

110.text: Writing stopped being fun when I discovered the difference between good writing and bad and, even more terrifying, the difference between it and true art. And after that, the whip came down.
110.author: Truman Capote

111.text: Art is dangerous. It is one of the attractions: when it ceases to be dangerous you don't want it.
111.author: Duke Ellington

112.text: Science is what we understand well enough to explain to a computer. Art is everything else we do.
112.author: Donald Knuth

113.text: Works of art make rules; rules do not make works of art.
113.author: Claude Debussy

114.text: We want to raise the art of living well.
114.author: Robert Mondavi

115.text: You say a new era in art is preparing; you sensed it coming; continue your studies without weakening. God will do the rest.
115.author: Paul Cezanne

116.text: I think it is more of an intuitive, circular kind of personality, for starters. And, as I say of horses, the secret to breeding great horses is the three B's: bones, brains, and balance. If you look at art, it shares some of the same qualities.
116.author: Alice Walton

117.text: I like writing letters and receiving letters. It's a shame that we've lost the art of letter-writing and saving correspondence. I mourn that.
117.author: Elizabeth McGovern

118.text: Let's say intelligence is your ability to compose poetry, symphonies, do art, math and science. Chimps can't do any of that, yet we share 99 percent DNA. Everything that we are, that distinguishes us from chimps, emerges from that one-percent difference.
118.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

119.text: Because theatre is a story-telling art form, we feel entitled to assume that the playwright got there before we got there.
119.author: Tom Stoppard

120.text: The very essence of the creative is its novelty, and hence we have no standard by which to judge it.
120.author: Carl Rogers

121.text: An artist cannot fail; it is a success to be one.
121.author: Charles Horton Cooley

122.text: That's why people listen to music or look at paintings. To get in touch with that wholeness.
122.author: Corita Kent

123.text: Works of art, in my opinion, are the only objects in the material universe to possess internal order, and that is why, though I don't believe that only art matters, I do believe in Art for Art's sake.
123.author: E. M. Forster

124.text: Painting is easy when you don't know how, but very difficult when you do.
124.author: Edgar Degas

125.text: What art offers is space - a certain breathing room for the spirit.
125.author: John Updike

126.text: Great art picks up where nature ends.
126.author: Marc Chagall

127.text: Good art is art that allows you to enter it from a variety of angles and to emerge with a variety of views.
127.author: Mary Schmich

128.text: It is art that makes life, makes interest, makes importance and I know of no substitute whatever for the force and beauty of its process.
128.author: Max Eastman

129.text: It is through art, and through art only, that we can realise our perfection.
129.author: Oscar Wilde

130.text: An artist is forced by others to paint out of his own free will.
130.author: Willem de Kooning

131.text: To make pictures big is to make them more powerful.
131.author: Robert Mapplethorpe

132.text: A line is a dot that went for a walk.
132.author: Paul Klee

133.text: The works must be conceived with fire in the soul but executed with clinical coolness.
133.author: Joan Miro

134.text: The perfection of art is to conceal art.
134.author: Quintilian

135.text: An empty canvas is a living wonder... far lovelier than certain pictures.
135.author: Wassily Kandinsky

136.text: I am not strong on perfection.
136.author: Jasper Johns

137.text: Painting is the most magical of mediums. The transcendence is truly amazing to me every time I go to a museum and I see how somebody figured another way to rub colored dirt on a flat surface and make space where there is no space or make you think of a life experience.
137.author: Chuck Close

138.text: You can't do sketches enough. Sketch everything and keep your curiosity fresh.
138.author: John Singer Sargent

139.text: The mission of art is to represent nature not to imitate her.
139.author: William Morris Hunt

140.text: Layer by layer art strips life bare.
140.author: Robert Musil

141.text: History repeats itself, but the special call of an art which has passed away is never reproduced. It is as utterly gone out of the world as the song of a destroyed wild bird.
141.author: Joseph Conrad

142.text: Art can never exist without naked beauty displayed.
142.author: William Blake

143.text: Nothing is art if it does not come from nature.
143.author: Antoni Gaudi

144.text: When you live under the power of terror and segregation, you can't ever start a work of art.
144.author: Jeanne Moreau

145.text: If a man devotes himself to art, much evil is avoided that happens otherwise if one is idle.
145.author: Albrecht Durer

146.text: By the will art thou lost, by the will art thou found, by the will art thou free, captive, and bound.
146.author: Angelus Silesius

147.text: Performance art is about joy, about making something that's so full of kind of a wild joy that you really can't put into words.
147.author: Laurie Anderson

148.text: In Art, man reveals himself and not his objects.
148.author: Rabindranath Tagore

149.text: So then learn to conquer your fear. This is the only art we have to master nowadays: to look at things without fear, and to fearlessly do right.
149.author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

150.text: The public needs art - and it is the responsibility of a 'self-proclaimed artist' to realize that the public needs art, and not to make bourgeois art for a few and ignore the masses.
150.author: Keith Haring

151.text: Works of art often last forever, or nearly so. But exhibitions themselves, especially gallery exhibitions, are like flowers; they bloom and then they die, then exist only as memories, or pressed in magazines and books.
151.author: Jerry Saltz

152.text: Architecture is basically the design of interiors, the art of organizing interior space.
152.author: Philip Johnson

153.text: Diplomacy is the art of saying 'Nice doggie' until you can find a rock.
153.author: Will Rogers

154.text: Music is God's gift to man, the only art of Heaven given to earth, the only art of earth we take to Heaven.
154.author: Walter Savage Landor

155.text: I say that democracy can never prove itself beyond cavil, until it founds and luxuriantly grows its own forms of art, poems, schools, theology, displacing all that exists, or that has been produced anywhere in the past, under opposite influences.
155.author: Walt Whitman

156.text: The art of living is the art of knowing how to believe lies.
156.author: Cesare Pavese

157.text: The work of art, just like any fragment of human life considered in its deepest meaning, seems to me devoid of value if it does not offer the hardness, the rigidity, the regularity, the luster on every interior and exterior facet, of the crystal.
157.author: Pope Paul VI

158.text: I don't need the money, dear. I work for art.
158.author: Maria Callas

159.text: In art and dream may you proceed with abandon. In life may you proceed with balance and stealth.
159.author: Patti Smith

160.text: Patience is the art of hoping.
160.author: Luc de Clapiers

161.text: There is in fact no such thing as art for art's sake, art that stands above classes, art that is detached from or independent of politics. Proletarian literature and art are part of the whole proletarian revolutionary cause.
161.author: Mao Zedong

162.text: Were I called on to define, very briefly, the term Art, I should call it 'the reproduction of what the Senses perceive in Nature through the veil of the soul.' The mere imitation, however accurate, of what is in Nature, entitles no man to the sacred name of 'Artist.'
162.author: Edgar Allan Poe

163.text: The art of using deceit and cunning grow continually weaker and less effective to the user.
163.author: John Tillotson

164.text: The chief function of the city is to convert power into form, energy into culture, dead matter into the living symbols of art, biological reproduction into social creativity.
164.author: Lewis Mumford

165.text: I am still a victim of chess. It has all the beauty of art - and much more. It cannot be commercialized. Chess is much purer than art in its social position.
165.author: Marcel Duchamp

166.text: I think of horror films as art, as films of confrontation. Films that make you confront aspects of your own life that are difficult to face. Just because you're making a horror film doesn't mean you can't make an artful film.
166.author: David Cronenberg

167.text: Art is not the application of a canon of beauty but what the instinct and the brain can conceive beyond any canon. When we love a woman we don't start measuring her limbs.
167.author: Pablo Picasso

168.text: Every happening, great and small, is a parable whereby God speaks to us, and the art of life is to get the message.
168.author: Malcolm Muggeridge

169.text: Modernity is the transient, the fleeting, the contingent; it is one half of art, the other being the eternal and the immovable.
169.author: Charles Baudelaire

170.text: There can be nothing exclusive about substantial art. It comes directly out of the heart of the experience of life and thinking about life and living life.
170.author: Charles Ives

171.text: Everyone in those days expected that art students were wild, licentious characters. We didn't know how to be, but we sure were anxious to learn.
171.author: Norman Rockwell

172.text: The Dancer believes that his art has something to say which cannot be expressed in words or in any other way than by dancing.
172.author: Doris Humphrey

173.text: No art is any good unless you can feel how it's put together. By and large it's the eye, the hand and if it's any good, you feel the body. Most of the best stuff seems to be a complete gesture, the totality of the artist's body; you can really lean on it.
173.author: Frank Stella

174.text: A performance art piece is unprecedented. It is difficult to censor since it has a good possibility of never being done before.
174.author: Jack Bowman

175.text: Modernity is the transitory, the fugitive, the contingent, which make up one half of art, the other being the eternal and the immutable. This transitory fugitive element, which is constantly changing, must not be despised or neglected.
175.author: Charles Baudelaire

176.text: Art will never be able to exist without nature.
176.author: Pierre Bonnard

177.text: Even in modern art, artists have used methods based on calculation, inasmuch as these elements, alongside those of a more personal and emotional nature, give balance and harmony to any work of art.
177.author: Max Bill

178.text: That's something I learned in art school. I studied graphic design in Germany, and my professor emphasized the responsibility that designers and illustrators have towards the people they create things for.
178.author: Eric Carle

179.text: You can have information and ease of use and have artistic integrity at the same time. The art of being a good Web designer is getting yourself into that middle ground and treating it as a final destination instead of as a compromise.
179.author: Mike Davidson

180.text: You should carefully study the Art of Reasoning, as it is what most people are very deficient in, and I know few things more disagreeable than to argue, or even converse with a man who has no idea of inductive and deductive philosophy.
180.author: William John Wills

181.text: Art is a liaison between some sort of deranged mentality and others who are not going through it.
181.author: John Chamberlain

182.text: And I have exposed myself to art so that my work has something beyond just the usual potter.
182.author: Beatrice Wood

183.text: A work of art when placed in a gallery loses its charge, and becomes a portable object or surface disengaged from the outside world.
183.author: Robert Smithson

184.text: If you respect the art and you have some talent about you, I'm on your team.
184.author: Anthony Anderson

185.text: As I grew older, I realized that it was much better to insist on the genuine forms of nature, for simplicity is the greatest adornment of art.
185.author: Albrecht Durer

186.text: I would be willing to do almost anything to make Art happy. I care about our friendship. The only thing I won't do is change the essence of my work.
186.author: Paul Simon

188.text: Although even when I am being idle I have plenty of food for thought both early and late - thoughts both about and not about art.
188.author: Gustav Klimt

189.text: Pop Art looks out into the world. It doesn't look like a painting of something, it looks like the thing itself.
189.author: Roy Lichtenstein

190.text: Science, like art, religion, commerce, warfare, and even sleep, is based on presuppositions.
190.author: Gregory Bateson

191.text: People of art should never get married and have children, because it's a selfish experience.
191.author: Mikhail Baryshnikov

192.text: Juggling is sometimes called the art of controlling patterns, controlling patterns in time and space.
192.author: Ronald Graham

193.text: The huge problem in our society is the enormous ignorance of the ideas that underlie modern art.
193.author: Thom Mayne

194.text: Art is the elimination of the unnecessary.
194.author: Pablo Picasso

195.text: Yoga is an art and science of living.
195.author: Indra Devi

196.text: The art of interpretation is not to play what is written.
196.author: Pablo Casals

197.text: The art of leadership is saying no, not saying yes. It is very easy to say yes.
197.author: Tony Blair

198.text: Next to the Word of God, the noble art of music is the greatest treasure in the world.
198.author: Martin Luther

199.text: Art does not reproduce what we see; rather, it makes us see.
199.author: Paul Klee

200.text: Only in art will the lion lie down with the lamb, and the rose grow without thorn.
200.author: Martin Amis

201.text: Art, as far as it is able, follows nature, as a pupil imitates his master; thus your art must be, as it were, God's grandchild.
201.author: Dante Alighieri

202.text: They teach you there's a boundary line to music. But, man, there's no boundary line to art.
202.author: Charlie Parker

203.text: Art is man's constant effort to create for himself a different order of reality from that which is given to him.
203.author: Chinua Achebe

204.text: Look. Art knows no prejudice, art knows no boundaries, art doesn't really have judgement in it's purest form. So just go, just go.
204.author: K. D. Lang

205.text: The body is your instrument in dance, but your art is outside that creature, the body.
205.author: Martha Graham

206.text: True art selects and paraphrases, but seldom gives a verbatim translation.
206.author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

207.text: You have to master not only the art of listening to your head, you must also master listening to your heart and listening to your gut.
207.author: Carly Fiorina

208.text: The art of the cuisine, when fully mastered, is the one human capability of which only good things can be said.
208.author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

209.text: Art lies by its own artifice.
209.author: Ovid

210.text: Anybody can direct a picture once they know the fundamentals. Directing is not a mystery, it's not an art. The main thing about directing is: photograph the people's eyes.
210.author: John Ford

211.text: Thought is more important than art. To revere art and have no understanding of the process that forces it into existence, is finally not even to understand what art is.
211.author: Amiri Baraka

212.text: Art is a way to express yourself and through that you can escape a bad situation.
212.author: Russell Simmons

213.text: Art never seems to make me peaceful or pure.
213.author: Willem de Kooning

214.text: Wisdom is nothing but a preparation of the soul, a capacity, a secret art of thinking, feeling and breathing thoughts of unity at every moment of life.
214.author: Herman Hesse

215.text: Oh, if it be to choose and call thee mine, love, thou art every day my Valentine!
215.author: Thomas Hood

216.text: The first piece of art that I ever bought-when I could afford it-was a Warhol sketch from the period when he was just getting out of doing commercial work and more into art. It's a sketch of a young guy's face. I guess the gallery that I bought it from thought I would like it because the young guy kind of looked like James Dean.
216.author: James Franco

217.text: I'm a disciple of Raymond Chandler, who said in his essays that there's a quality of redemption in anything that can be called art.
217.author: Michael Connelly

218.text: Celebrity doesn't have anything to do with art or craft. It's about being rich and thinking that you're better than everybody else.
218.author: Joseph Gordon-Levitt

219.text: I started to make a study of the art of war and revolution and, whilst abroad, underwent a course in military training. If there was to be guerrilla warfare, I wanted to be able to stand and fight with my people and to share the hazards of war with them.
219.author: Nelson Mandela

220.text: Female artists are the perfect example of a creator: They know how to make life and art with their bodies. Life comes from their bodies, so on a very basic level, they have more to write about.
220.author: Brandon Boyd

221.text: My dad's side of the family had lots of artists and musicians. There's an emotional, quite sentimental quality to Slavic culture. It's very open, it loves art, it loves music, it loves literature. It's very warm, it's very up, it's very down. I would celebrate that.
221.author: Nick Clegg

222.text: Does art have a future? Performance genres like opera, theater, music and dance are thriving all over the world, but the visual arts have been in slow decline for nearly 40 years. No major figure of profound influence has emerged in painting or sculpture since the waning of Pop Art and the birth of Minimalism in the early 1970s.
222.author: Camille Paglia

223.text: It's high time for the art world to admit that the avant-garde is dead. It was killed by my hero, Andy Warhol, who incorporated into his art all the gaudy commercial imagery of capitalism (like Campbell's soup cans) that most artists had stubbornly scorned.
223.author: Camille Paglia

224.text: The beginning of a friendship, the fact that two people out of the thousands around them can meet and connect and become friends, seems like a kind of magic to me. But maintaining a friendship requires work. I don't mean that as a bad thing. Good art requires work as well.
224.author: Charles de Lint

225.text: If my art has nothing to do with people's pain and sorrow, what is 'art' for?
225.author: Ai Weiwei

226.text: In art, at a certain level, there is no 'better than.' It's just about trying to operate for yourself on the most supreme level, artistically, that you can and hoping that people get it.
226.author: Frank Ocean

227.text: Anime is intended to have ambiguous features. That's part of the art form.
227.author: M. Night Shyamalan

228.text: And that's what art is, a form in which people can reflect on who we are as human beings and come to some understanding of this journey we are on.
228.author: Wendell Pierce

229.text: It took the Metropolitan Museum of Art nearly 50 years to wake up to Pablo Picasso. It didn't own one of his paintings until 1946, when Gertrude Stein bequeathed that indomitable quasi-Cubistic picture of herself - a portrait of the writer as a sumo Buddha - to the Met, principally because she disliked the Museum of Modern Art.
229.author: Jerry Saltz

230.text: 'Untitled' is a time machine that can transport you to 1992, an edgy moment when the art world was crumbling, money was scarce, and artists like Tiravanija were in the nascent stages of combining Happenings, performance art, John Cage, Joseph Beuys, and the do-it-yourself ethos of punk. Meanwhile, a new art world was coming into being.
230.author: Jerry Saltz

231.text: Auction houses run a rigged game. They know exactly how many people will be bidding on a work and exactly who they are. In a gallery, works of art need only one person who wants to pay for them.
231.author: Jerry Saltz

232.text: Art is for anyone. It just isn't for everyone. Still, over the past decade, its audience has hugely grown, and that's irked those outside the art world, who get irritated at things like incomprehensibility or money.
232.author: Jerry Saltz

233.text: I love contemporary art, although I wouldn't want a pickled shark in my house.
233.author: Bruno Tonioli

234.text: You should never feel afraid to become a piece of art. It's exhilarating.
234.author: Nicki Minaj

235.text: The best preparation for tomorrow is doing your best today.
235.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

236.text: Good, better, best. Never let it rest. 'Til your good is better and your better is best.
236.author: St. Jerome

237.text: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched - they must be felt with the heart.
237.author: Helen Keller

238.text: Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later.
238.author: Og Mandino

239.text: A strong, positive self-image is the best possible preparation for success.
239.author: Joyce Brothers

240.text: The best thing to hold onto in life is each other.
240.author: Audrey Hepburn

241.text: Health is the greatest gift, contentment the greatest wealth, faithfulness the best relationship.
241.author: Buddha

242.text: An investment in knowledge pays the best interest.
242.author: Benjamin Franklin

243.text: Ultimately, leadership is not about glorious crowning acts. It's about keeping your team focused on a goal and motivated to do their best to achieve it, especially when the stakes are high and the consequences really matter. It is about laying the groundwork for others' success, and then standing back and letting them shine.
243.author: Chris Hadfield

244.text: My best friend is the one who brings out the best in me.
244.author: Henry Ford

245.text: At the end of the day, life is about being happy being who you are, and I feel like we are so blessed to have the support system and the best family to really just support each other no matter what we're going through.
245.author: Kim Kardashian

246.text: The price of success is hard work, dedication to the job at hand, and the determination that whether we win or lose, we have applied the best of ourselves to the task at hand.
246.author: Vince Lombardi

247.text: I am as bad as the worst, but, thank God, I am as good as the best.
247.author: Walt Whitman

248.text: The best way to find yourself is to lose yourself in the service of others.
248.author: Mahatma Gandhi

249.text: The best way to pay for a lovely moment is to enjoy it.
249.author: Richard Bach

250.text: We must develop and maintain the capacity to forgive. He who is devoid of the power to forgive is devoid of the power to love. There is some good in the worst of us and some evil in the best of us. When we discover this, we are less prone to hate our enemies.
250.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

251.text: Nobody can predict the future. You just have to give your all to the relationship you're in and do your best to take care of your partner, communicate and give them every last drop of love you have. I think one of the most important things in a relationship is caring for your significant other through good times and bad.
251.author: Nick Cannon

252.text: The best argument against democracy is a five-minute conversation with the average voter.
252.author: Winston Churchill

253.text: I'm selfish, impatient, and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I'm out of control, and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best.
253.author: Marilyn Monroe

254.text: My life motto is 'Do my best, so that I can't blame myself for anything.'
254.author: Magdalena Neuner

255.text: To help yourself, you must be yourself. Be the best that you can be. When you make a mistake, learn from it, pick yourself up and move on.
255.author: Dave Pelzer

256.text: The best way to find out if you can trust somebody is to trust them.
256.author: Ernest Hemingway

257.text: If you have a positive attitude and constantly strive to give your best effort, eventually you will overcome your immediate problems and find you are ready for greater challenges.
257.author: Pat Riley

258.text: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
258.author: Peter Drucker

259.text: Always Do Your Best. Your best is going to change from moment to moment; it will be different when you are healthy as opposed to sick. Under any circumstance, simply do your best, and you will avoid self-judgment, self-abuse and regret.
259.author: Don Miguel Ruiz

260.text: Technology can be our best friend, and technology can also be the biggest party pooper of our lives. It interrupts our own story, interrupts our ability to have a thought or a daydream, to imagine something wonderful, because we're too busy bridging the walk from the cafeteria back to the office on the cell phone.
260.author: Steven Spielberg

261.text: I believe in pink. I believe that laughing is the best calorie burner. I believe in kissing, kissing a lot. I believe in being strong when everything seems to be going wrong. I believe that happy girls are the prettiest girls. I believe that tomorrow is another day and I believe in miracles.
261.author: Audrey Hepburn

262.text: Look at the sky. We are not alone. The whole universe is friendly to us and conspires only to give the best to those who dream and work.
262.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

263.text: My dream is of a place and a time where America will once again be seen as the last best hope of earth.
263.author: Abraham Lincoln

264.text: No one wants to die. Even people who want to go to heaven don't want to die to get there. And yet death is the destination we all share. No one has ever escaped it. And that is as it should be, because Death is very likely the single best invention of Life. It is Life's change agent. It clears out the old to make way for the new.
264.author: Steve Jobs

265.text: The best thing one can do when it's raining is to let it rain.
265.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

266.text: One of the best ways to make yourself happy in the present is to recall happy times from the past. Photos are a great memory-prompt, and because we tend to take photos of happy occasions, they weight our memories to the good.
266.author: Gretchen Rubin

267.text: Write it on your heart that every day is the best day in the year.
267.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

268.text: She's always there for me when I need her; She's my best friend; she's just my everything.
268.author: Ashley Olsen

269.text: Heavy hearts, like heavy clouds in the sky, are best relieved by the letting of a little water.
269.author: Christopher Morley

270.text: I look my best when I'm totally free, on holiday, walking on the beach.
270.author: Rosamund Pike

271.text: I follow three rules: Do the right thing, do the best you can, and always show people you care.
271.author: Lou Holtz

272.text: I prefer to win titles with the team ahead of individual awards or scoring more goals than anyone else. I'm more worried about being a good person than being the best football player in the world. When all this is over, what are you left with? When I retire, I hope I am remembered for being a decent guy.
272.author: Lionel Messi

273.text: The best way to cheer yourself up is to try to cheer somebody else up.
273.author: Mark Twain

274.text: My mama always used to tell me: 'If you can't find somethin' to live for, you best find somethin' to die for.'
274.author: Tupac Shakur

275.text: The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you, whose presence calls forth your best.
275.author: Epictetus

276.text: The boundaries which divide Life from Death are at best shadowy and vague. Who shall say where the one ends, and where the other begins?
276.author: Edgar Allan Poe

277.text: Walking is the best possible exercise. Habituate yourself to walk very far.
277.author: Thomas Jefferson

278.text: Education is the best friend. An educated person is respected everywhere. Education beats the beauty and the youth.
278.author: Chanakya

279.text: I'm just thankful for everything, all the blessings in my life, trying to stay that way. I think that's the best way to start your day and finish your day. It keeps everything in perspective.
279.author: Tim Tebow

280.text: Things are never quite as scary when you've got a best friend.
280.author: Bill Watterson

281.text: The best remedy for those who are afraid, lonely or unhappy is to go outside, somewhere where they can be quiet, alone with the heavens, nature and God. Because only then does one feel that all is as it should be.
281.author: Anne Frank

282.text: Age appears to be best in four things; old wood best to burn, old wine to drink, old friends to trust, and old authors to read.
282.author: Francis Bacon

284.text: It is no use saying, 'We are doing our best.' You have got to succeed in doing what is necessary.
284.author: Winston Churchill

285.text: Happiness does not come from doing easy work but from the afterglow of satisfaction that comes after the achievement of a difficult task that demanded our best.
285.author: Theodore Isaac Rubin

286.text: Far and away the best prize that life has to offer is the chance to work hard at work worth doing.
286.author: Theodore Roosevelt

287.text: Heroes represent the best of ourselves, respecting that we are human beings. A hero can be anyone from Gandhi to your classroom teacher, anyone who can show courage when faced with a problem. A hero is someone who is willing to help others in his or her best capacity.
287.author: Ricky Martin

288.text: My best friend is the man who in wishing me well wishes it for my sake.
288.author: Aristotle

289.text: One's philosophy is not best expressed in words; it is expressed in the choices one makes... and the choices we make are ultimately our responsibility.
289.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

290.text: Do what you love to do and give it your very best. Whether it's business or baseball, or the theater, or any field. If you don't love what you're doing and you can't give it your best, get out of it. Life is too short. You'll be an old man before you know it.
290.author: Al Lopez

291.text: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.
291.author: Lao Tzu

292.text: The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury.
292.author: Marcus Aurelius

293.text: Speak when you are angry - and you'll make the best speech you'll ever regret.
293.author: Laurence J. Peter

294.text: We are all travelers in the wilderness of this world, and the best we can find in our travels is an honest friend.
294.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

295.text: I have the simplest tastes. I am always satisfied with the best.
295.author: Oscar Wilde

296.text: Work hard, stay positive, and get up early. It's the best part of the day.
296.author: George Allen, Sr.

297.text: With me, what you see is what you get. Yes, call me naive, but I love life. I am happy, and for that, I make no apologies. I do like to see the best in people, and when someone is nice to my face, I tend to believe them.
297.author: Joyce Giraud

298.text: The best kids are going to become the best. But the best thing about it is that you're going to learn lessons in playing those sports about winning and losing and teamwork and teammates and arguments and everything else that are going to affect you positively for the rest of your life.
298.author: Carl Lewis

299.text: At his best, man is the noblest of all animals; separated from law and justice he is the worst.
299.author: Aristotle

300.text: In any moment of decision, the best thing you can do is the right thing, the next best thing is the wrong thing, and the worst thing you can do is nothing.
300.author: Theodore Roosevelt

301.text: I am prepared for the worst, but hope for the best.
301.author: Benjamin Disraeli

302.text: I'm human, I'm not perfect. I make mistakes all the time, but I guess my job is to keep those mistakes to myself, which I'm already fine doing and just try to be the best I can be for those kids.
302.author: Selena Gomez

303.text: All the adversity I've had in my life, all my troubles and obstacles, have strengthened me... You may not realize it when it happens, but a kick in the teeth may be the best thing in the world for you.
303.author: Walt Disney

304.text: With modeling, you pose. You want to look your best all the time. With acting, you have to be aware of the camera, but the more you show your imperfections, the better you're going to be.
304.author: Diane Kruger

305.text: It's a funny thing about life; if you refuse to accept anything but the best, you very often get it.
305.author: W. Somerset Maugham

306.text: Our prayers should be for blessings in general, for God knows best what is good for us.
306.author: Socrates

307.text: 'Thank you' is the best prayer that anyone could say. I say that one a lot. Thank you expresses extreme gratitude, humility, understanding.
307.author: Alice Walker

308.text: You don't fight racism with racism, the best way to fight racism is with solidarity.
308.author: Bobby Seale

309.text: To have faith doesn't mean you get any less frustrated when you don't do your best, but you know that it's not life and death. Take what you're given, and when you continue to work hard, you will see results. That will give you the confidence you need to keep going.
309.author: Tom Lehman

310.text: Use what talents you possess; the woods would be very silent if no birds sang there except those that sang best.
310.author: Henry Van Dyke

311.text: There's nothing better than having a baby. I've always loved children. I used to work summers at the YMCA and be in charge of, like, 30 preschool kids. I knew that when I had a child, I'd be overwhelmed, and it's true... I can't tell you how much my attitude has changed since we've got Frances. Holding my baby is the best drug in the world.
311.author: Kurt Cobain

312.text: Having lots of siblings is like having built-in best friends.
312.author: Kim Kardashian

313.text: The best part about being alone is that you really don't have to answer to anybody. You do what you want.
313.author: Justin Timberlake

314.text: Smiling is definitely one of the best beauty remedies. If you have a good sense of humor and a good approach to life, that's beautiful.
314.author: Rashida Jones

315.text: Battle is the most magnificent competition in which a human being can indulge. It brings out all that is best; it removes all that is base. All men are afraid in battle. The coward is the one who lets his fear overcome his sense of duty. Duty is the essence of manhood.
315.author: George S. Patton

316.text: I never had a policy; I have just tried to do my very best each and every day.
316.author: Abraham Lincoln

317.text: A problem is a chance for you to do your best.
317.author: Duke Ellington

318.text: Do right. Do your best. Treat others as you want to be treated.
318.author: Lou Holtz

319.text: Every age has its storytelling form, and video gaming is a huge part of our culture. You can ignore or embrace video games and imbue them with the best artistic quality. People are enthralled with video games in the same way as other people love the cinema or theatre.
319.author: Andy Serkis

320.text: My best friend is the most important girl, outside of family, to me. I met her when I went to college and we bonded immediately. I'd do anything for her at any time. We phone each other every day.
320.author: Dawn French

321.text: A wise man is superior to any insults which can be put upon him, and the best reply to unseemly behavior is patience and moderation.
321.author: Moliere

322.text: Arrogance, ignorance, and incompetence. Not a pretty cocktail of personality traits in the best of situations. No sirree. Not a pretty cocktail in an office-mate and not a pretty cocktail in a head of state. In fact, in a leader, it's a lethal cocktail.
322.author: Graydon Carter

323.text: The human body is the best picture of the human soul.
323.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

324.text: Things turn out best for the people who make the best of the way things turn out.
324.author: John Wooden

325.text: The ultimate victory in competition is derived from the inner satisfaction of knowing that you have done your best and that you have gotten the most out of what you had to give.
325.author: Howard Cosell

326.text: Outside of a dog, a book is a man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read.
326.author: Groucho Marx

327.text: The best revenge is massive success.
327.author: Frank Sinatra

328.text: I think it's very important to have a feedback loop, where you're constantly thinking about what you've done and how you could be doing it better. I think that's the single best piece of advice: constantly think about how you could be doing things better and questioning yourself.
328.author: Elon Musk

329.text: Good teachers know how to bring out the best in students.
329.author: Charles Kuralt

330.text: The best teamwork comes from men who are working independently toward one goal in unison.
330.author: James Cash Penney

331.text: In the practice of tolerance, one's enemy is the best teacher.
331.author: Dalai Lama

332.text: To be nobody but yourself in a world which is doing its best, night and day, to make you everybody else - means to fight the hardest battle which any human being can fight; and never stop fighting.
332.author: e. e. cummings

333.text: Nobody's life is a bed of roses. We all have crosses to bear, and we all just do our best. I would never claim to have the worst situation. There are many widows, and many people dying of AIDS, many people killed in Lebanon, people starving all over the planet. So we have to count our lucky stars.
333.author: Yoko Ono

334.text: Our criminal justice system is fallible. We know it, even though we don't like to admit it. It is fallible despite the best efforts of most within it to do justice. And this fallibility is, at the end of the day, the most compelling, persuasive, and winning argument against a death penalty.
334.author: Eliot Spitzer

335.text: Knowing your own darkness is the best method for dealing with the darknesses of other people.
335.author: Carl Jung

336.text: God always gives His best to those who leave the choice with him.
336.author: Jim Elliot

337.text: We are at our very best, and we are happiest, when we are fully engaged in work we enjoy on the journey toward the goal we've established for ourselves. It gives meaning to our time off and comfort to our sleep. It makes everything else in life so wonderful, so worthwhile.
337.author: Earl Nightingale

338.text: Our flag honors those who have fought to protect it, and is a reminder of the sacrifice of our nation's founders and heroes. As the ultimate icon of America's storied history, the Stars and Stripes represents the very best of this nation.
338.author: Joe Barton

339.text: In times of great stress or adversity, it's always best to keep busy, to plow your anger and your energy into something positive.
339.author: Lee Iacocca

340.text: Sometimes when you innovate, you make mistakes. It is best to admit them quickly, and get on with improving your other innovations.
340.author: Steve Jobs

341.text: My cell phone is my best friend. It's my lifeline to the outside world.
341.author: Carrie Underwood

342.text: Sometimes your best investments are the ones you don't make.
342.author: Donald Trump

343.text: The best advice I ever got was that knowledge is power and to keep reading.
343.author: David Bailey

344.text: Good manners will open doors that the best education cannot.
344.author: Clarence Thomas

345.text: Expect the best. Prepare for the worst. Capitalize on what comes.
345.author: Zig Ziglar

346.text: Men are like wine - some turn to vinegar, but the best improve with age.
346.author: Pope John XXIII

347.text: I look my best when I take my helmet off after a long motorcycle ride. I have a glow and a bit of helmet hair.
347.author: Eric Bana

348.text: Personally, I just think rap music is the best thing out there, period. If you look at my deck in my car radio, you're always going to find a hip-hop tape; that's all I buy, that's all I live, that's all I listen to, that's all I love.
348.author: Eminem

349.text: Yes'm, old friends is always best, 'less you can catch a new one that's fit to make an old one out of.
349.author: Sarah Orne Jewett

350.text: A satisfied customer is the best business strategy of all.
350.author: Michael LeBoeuf

351.text: Any captain can only do his best for the team and for cricket. When you are winning, you are a hero. Lose, and the backslappers fade away.
351.author: Richie Benaud

352.text: Learn to say 'no' to the good so you can say 'yes' to the best.
352.author: John C. Maxwell

353.text: When you have balance in your life, work becomes an entirely different experience. There is a passion that moves you to a whole new level of fulfillment and gratitude, and that's when you can do your best... for yourself and for others.
353.author: Cara Delevingne

354.text: I've known my best friend since I was a baby, and I don't know what I would do without her. She is always straight with me and can make me laugh hysterically. Everyone should have someone like that in their life.
354.author: Jasmine Guinness

355.text: Baseball was, is and always will be to me the best game in the world.
355.author: Babe Ruth

356.text: If you want to do really important things in life and big things in life, you can't do anything by yourself. And your best teams are your friends and your siblings.
356.author: Deepak Chopra

357.text: The ideal man bears the accidents of life with dignity and grace, making the best of circumstances.
357.author: Aristotle

358.text: A man's friendships are one of the best measures of his worth.
358.author: Charles Darwin

359.text: The sacrifices made by veterans and their willingness to fight in defense of our nation merit our deep respect and praise - and to the best in benefits and medical care.
359.author: Sue Kelly

360.text: A person who has been punished is not less inclined to behave in a given way; at best, he learns how to avoid punishment.
360.author: B. F. Skinner

362.text: The season of failure is the best time for sowing the seeds of success.
362.author: Paramahansa Yogananda

363.text: Success is peace of mind, which is a direct result of self-satisfaction in knowing you made the effort to become the best of which you are capable.
363.author: John Wooden

364.text: I would like to be remembered as someone who did the best she could with the talent she had.
364.author: J. K. Rowling

365.text: The best way to look stylish on a budget is to try second-hand, bargain hunting, and vintage.
365.author: Orlando Bloom

366.text: There are some things you learn best in calm, and some in storm.
366.author: Willa Cather

368.text: You must accept that you might fail; then, if you do your best and still don't win, at least you can be satisfied that you've tried. If you don't accept failure as a possibility, you don't set high goals, you don't branch out, you don't try - you don't take the risk.
368.author: Rosalynn Carter

369.text: Difficult times often bring out the best in people.
369.author: Bernie Sanders

370.text: Sometimes people just want you to fail. Except your really good friends. I've always known who my best friends were.
370.author: Kato Kaelin

371.text: The best things in life are often waiting for you at the exit ramp of your comfort zone.
371.author: Karen Salmansohn

372.text: So much of what is best in us is bound up in our love of family, that it remains the measure of our stability because it measures our sense of loyalty. All other pacts of love or fear derive from it and are modeled upon it.
372.author: Haniel Long

373.text: A failure is not always a mistake, it may simply be the best one can do under the circumstances. The real mistake is to stop trying.
373.author: B. F. Skinner

374.text: The best weapon against an enemy is another enemy.
374.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

375.text: I always believe that to be the best, you have to smell like the best, dress like the best, act like the best. When you throw your trash in the garbage can, it has to be better than anybody else who ever threw trash in the garbage can.
375.author: Lil Wayne

376.text: Employees are a company's greatest asset - they're your competitive advantage. You want to attract and retain the best; provide them with encouragement, stimulus, and make them feel that they are an integral part of the company's mission.
376.author: Anne M. Mulcahy

377.text: Health is the thing that makes you feel that now is the best time of the year.
377.author: Franklin Pierce Adams

378.text: The biggest ingredient in a best friend is someone whose actions you respect and who you can truly be yourself around.
378.author: Renee Olstead

379.text: Never die easy. Why run out of bounds and die easy? Make that linebacker pay. It carries into all facets of your life. It's okay to lose, to die, but don't die without trying, without giving it your best.
379.author: Walter Payton

380.text: That best portion of a man's life, his little, nameless, unremembered acts of kindness and love.
380.author: William Wordsworth

381.text: When the best leader's work is done the people say, 'We did it ourselves.'
381.author: Lao Tzu

382.text: Climate change is destroying our path to sustainability. Ours is a world of looming challenges and increasingly limited resources. Sustainable development offers the best chance to adjust our course.
382.author: Ban Ki-moon

383.text: With the Union my best and dearest earthly hopes are entwined.
383.author: Franklin Pierce

384.text: If it's your job to eat a frog, it's best to do it first thing in the morning. And If it's your job to eat two frogs, it's best to eat the biggest one first.
384.author: Mark Twain

385.text: I am extraordinarily lucky, I was born in a family of strong moral values, and in my life I was able to do what I liked best: debuts, great theatres, but above all, inner and deep satisfaction.
385.author: Jose Carreras

386.text: One of the best things for a woman to hear is that she is sexy.
386.author: Scarlett Johansson

387.text: When we seek to discover the best in others, we somehow bring out the best in ourselves.
387.author: William Arthur Ward

388.text: Now I see the secret of making the best person: it is to grow in the open air and to eat and sleep with the earth.
388.author: Walt Whitman

389.text: Champions are not the ones who always win races - champions are the ones who get out there and try. And try harder the next time. And even harder the next time. 'Champion' is a state of mind. They are devoted. They compete to best themselves as much if not more than they compete to best others. Champions are not just athletes.
389.author: Simon Sinek

390.text: To refrain from imitation is the best revenge.
390.author: Marcus Aurelius

391.text: I just always expect the best because I'm a competitor and if I'm competing, then obviously I'm trying to be better in everything.
391.author: Lil Wayne

392.text: Surround yourself with good people. People who are going to be honest with you and look out for your best interests.
392.author: Derek Jeter

393.text: Voting is a right best exercised by people who have taken time to learn about the issues.
393.author: Tony Snow

394.text: As long as you as an individual... can convince yourself that in order to move forward as best you can you have to be optimistic, you can be described as 'one of the faithful,' one of those people who can say, 'Well, look, something's going to happen! Let's just keep trying. Let's not give up.
394.author: Tom Hanks

395.text: One of the very best reasons for having children is to be reminded of the incomparable joys of a snow day.
395.author: Susan Orlean

396.text: Mama and Daddy King represent the best in manhood and womanhood, the best in a marriage, the kind of people we are trying to become.
396.author: Coretta Scott King

397.text: I don't want to say everything happens for a reason but every day is lined up right next to the other one for a reason. The best you can do is do each day well with kindness and as a good person.
397.author: Mayim Bialik

398.text: The best ideas come as jokes. Make your thinking as funny as possible.
398.author: David Ogilvy

399.text: Living well is the best revenge.
399.author: George Herbert

400.text: This is the precept by which I have lived: Prepare for the worst; expect the best; and take what comes.
400.author: Hannah Arendt

401.text: The best road to progress is freedom's road.
401.author: John F. Kennedy

402.text: The best cure for the body is a quiet mind.
402.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

403.text: Do the best you can, and don't take life too serious.
403.author: Will Rogers

404.text: The things we know best are the things we haven't been taught.
404.author: Luc de Clapiers

405.text: The best revenge is to live on and prove yourself.
405.author: Eddie Vedder

406.text: I don't think of myself as a role model for others, but I like to live my life by my own integrity. So, in that sense, I might be a positive influence. I do believe you should get over your insecurities and just try to be the best you can.
406.author: Lily Cole

407.text: Let go of yesterday. Let today be a new beginning and be the best that you can, and you'll get to where God wants you to be.
407.author: Joel Osteen

408.text: Part of what made the Macintosh great was that the people working on it were musicians, poets, and artists, and zoologists, and historians. They also happened to be the best computer scientists in the world. But if it hadn't been computer science, these people would have been doing amazing things in other fields.
408.author: Steve Jobs

409.text: The best part of beauty is that which no picture can express.
409.author: Francis Bacon

410.text: The ladder of success is best climbed by stepping on the rungs of opportunity.
410.author: Ayn Rand

411.text: The best years of your life are the ones in which you decide your problems are your own. You do not blame them on your mother, the ecology, or the president. You realize that you control your own destiny.
411.author: Albert Ellis

412.text: When everything is lonely I can be my best friend.
412.author: Conor Oberst

413.text: Remember, always give your best. Never get discouraged. Never be petty. Always remember, others may hate you. But those who hate you don't win unless you hate them. And then you destroy yourself.
413.author: Richard M. Nixon

414.text: If you do what you love, it is the best way to relax.
414.author: Christian Louboutin

415.text: Lay this unto your breast: Old friends, like old swords, still are trusted best.
415.author: John Webster

416.text: The best way to destroy the capitalist system is to debauch the currency.
416.author: Vladimir Lenin

417.text: Dad needs to show an incredible amount of respect and humor and friendship toward his mate so the kids understand their parents are sexy, they're fun, they do things together, they're best friends. Kids learn by example. If I respect Mom, they're going to respect Mom.
417.author: Tim Allen

418.text: Autumn wins you best by this its mute appeal to sympathy for its decay.
418.author: Robert Browning

419.text: Experience taught me a few things. One is to listen to your gut, no matter how good something sounds on paper. The second is that you're generally better off sticking with what you know. And the third is that sometimes your best investments are the ones you don't make.
419.author: Donald Trump

420.text: All the best performers bring to their role something more, something different than what the author put on paper. That's what makes theatre live. That's why it persists.
420.author: Stephen Sondheim

421.text: In 1985, I was living with my sister in Virginia, and since I was still in high school, I worked at McDonald's to save money to get an abortion. It sounds really terrible, but it was the best decision I ever made. It was the first time I took responsibility for my actions. I messed up, had sex without contraception, and got pregnant at 15.
421.author: Kathleen Hanna

422.text: Modeling is the best because you have to look hot, which comes easy to me, you know. I'm blessed with that.
422.author: Ashton Kutcher

423.text: There is only one thing for us to do, and that is to do our level best right where we are every day of our lives; To use our best judgment, and then to trust the rest to that Power which holds the forces of the universe in his hands.
423.author: Orison Swett Marden

425.text: I have the best roommates in the world! It creates a fun sense of family... and that's really important to me. Things can get so lonely without it.
425.author: Kristen Bell

426.text: I think people should have fun. And don't get so down on yourself. Enjoy life and be the best person you can be.
426.author: Keke Palmer

427.text: The best protection any woman can have... is courage.
427.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

428.text: Having an aim is the key to achieving your best.
428.author: Henry J. Kaiser

429.text: My aim is to put down on paper what I see and what I feel in the best and simplest way.
429.author: Ernest Hemingway

430.text: You know, the period of World War I and the Roaring Twenties were really just about the same as today. You worked, and you made a living if you could, and you tired to make the best of things. For an actor or a dancer, it was no different then than today. It was a struggle.
430.author: James Cagney

431.text: The best way to make your dreams come true is to wake up.
431.author: Paul Valery

432.text: If you can do what you do best and be happy, you're further along in life than most people.
432.author: Leonardo DiCaprio

433.text: The best preparation for good work tomorrow is to do good work today.
433.author: Elbert Hubbard

434.text: Cheerfulness is the best promoter of health and is as friendly to the mind as to the body.
434.author: Joseph Addison

435.text: Man, being reasonable, must get drunk; the best of life is but intoxication.
435.author: Lord Byron

436.text: Being forced to work, and forced to do your best, will breed in you temperance and self-control, diligence and strength of will, cheerfulness and content, and a hundred virtues which the idle will never know.
436.author: Charles Kingsley

437.text: The Lord gets his best soldiers out of the highlands of affliction.
437.author: Charles Spurgeon

438.text: I thought in this country, the best social program was a job. Yet minimum wage jobs aren't paying enough to keep families out of poverty.
438.author: Barbara Mikulski

439.text: You are capable of more than you know. Choose a goal that seems right for you and strive to be the best, however hard the path. Aim high. Behave honorably. Prepare to be alone at times, and to endure failure. Persist! The world needs all you can give.
439.author: E. O. Wilson

440.text: The best part is still ahead of me - I haven't experienced my 'good old days' yet.
440.author: Luther Vandross

441.text: While I relish our warm months, winter forms our character and brings out our best.
441.author: Tom Allen

442.text: Let me be the first to tell you, drinking alcohol is the worst thing to do in cold weather. Hot soup is the best because the process of digesting food helps to warm you up.
442.author: Morgan Freeman

443.text: Can a woman become a genius of the first class? Nobody can know unless women in general shall have equal opportunity with men in education, in vocational choice, and in social welcome of their best intellectual work for a number of generations.
443.author: Anna Garlin Spencer

444.text: In sports, you simply aren't considered a real champion until you have defended your title successfully. Winning it once can be a fluke; winning it twice proves you are the best.
444.author: Althea Gibson

445.text: Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose. You are already naked. There is no reason not to follow your heart.
445.author: Steve Jobs

446.text: If you want to be the best, you have to do things that other people aren't willing to do.
446.author: Michael Phelps

447.text: I love natural beauty, and I think it's your best look, but I think makeup as an artist is so transformative.
447.author: Marina and the Diamonds

448.text: Whether it's a friendly match, or for points, or a final, or any game - I play the same. I'm always trying to be my best, first for my team, for myself, for the fans, and to try and win.
448.author: Lionel Messi

449.text: To give anything less than your best, is to sacrifice the gift.
449.author: Steve Prefontaine

450.text: If education does not create a need for the best in life, then we are stuck in an undemocratic, rigid caste society.
450.author: Sargent Shriver

451.text: The best reason why Monarchy is a strong government is, that it is an intelligible government. The mass of mankind understand it, and they hardly anywhere in the world understand any other.
451.author: Walter Bagehot

452.text: Soap and water and common sense are the best disinfectants.
452.author: William Osler

453.text: Sometimes the solitary voice can be the best one.
453.author: Frank Miller

454.text: The best actors instinctively feel out what the other actors need, and they just accommodate it.
454.author: Christopher Nolan

455.text: In marketing I've seen only one strategy that can't miss - and that is to market to your best customers first, your best prospects second and the rest of the world last.
455.author: John Romero

456.text: Money is the best rule of commerce.
456.author: William Petty

457.text: I was at my best at a little past forty, when I was a professor at Oxford.
457.author: G. H. Hardy

458.text: What I do say is that I can write verse, and that the writing of verse in strict form is the best possible training for writing good prose.
458.author: Philip Pullman

459.text: The best thing I can think of would be to create a union between something as beautiful and powerful and wonderful as Hollywood films and a criticism of the status quo. That's my dream, to make such a German film.
459.author: Rainer Werner Fassbinder

460.text: From my earliest acquaintance with the science of political economy, it has been evident to my mind that capital was the product of labor, and that therefore, in its best analysis there could be no natural conflict between capital and labor.
460.author: Leland Stanford

461.text: If we perform as a unit and if every single player gives it his very best, everything can happen.
461.author: Oliver Kahn

462.text: In general we are least aware of what our minds do best.
462.author: Marvin Minsky

463.text: The best thing to do is just leave them alone. Alligators want to be away from you just as much as you want to be away from them.
463.author: Jack Hannah

464.text: It is my belief that we all have the need to feel special. It is this need that can bring out the best in us, yet the worst in us.
464.author: Janet Jackson

465.text: Often the best guys are just those that can suffer longer, who don't give up. And it's so easy to give up, when you're on a mountain and it's really hurting. We go through a lot physically.
465.author: David Millar

466.text: Humor is one of the best ingredients of survival.
466.author: Aung San Suu Kyi

467.text: Fatherhood will put a man through a lot, but it's a tremendous job, the best in the world - even better than playing basketball.
467.author: Derek Fisher

468.text: I'm either my best friend or my worst enemy.
468.author: Whitney Houston

469.text: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
469.author: Winston Churchill

470.text: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
470.author: Lao Tzu

471.text: You gain strength, courage, and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face. You are able to say to yourself, 'I lived through this horror. I can take the next thing that comes along.'
471.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

472.text: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone else's life. Don't be trapped by dogma - which is living with the results of other people's thinking. Don't let the noise of others' opinions drown out your own inner voice. And most important, have the courage to follow your heart and intuition.
472.author: Steve Jobs

473.text: I learned that courage was not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it. The brave man is not he who does not feel afraid, but he who conquers that fear.
473.author: Nelson Mandela

474.text: All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them.
474.author: Walt Disney

475.text: We don't develop courage by being happy every day. We develop it by surviving difficult times and challenging adversity.
475.author: Barbara De Angelis

476.text: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them.
476.author: Bruce Lee

477.text: If you have no confidence in self, you are twice defeated in the race of life.
477.author: Marcus Garvey

478.text: You may not always have a comfortable life and you will not always be able to solve all of the world's problems at once but don't ever underestimate the importance you can have because history has shown us that courage can be contagious and hope can take on a life of its own.
478.author: Michelle Obama

479.text: Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.
479.author: Winston Churchill

480.text: He who is not courageous enough to take risks will accomplish nothing in life.
480.author: Muhammad Ali

481.text: Goodness is about character - integrity, honesty, kindness, generosity, moral courage, and the like. More than anything else, it is about how we treat other people.
481.author: Dennis Prager

482.text: America was not built on fear. America was built on courage, on imagination and an unbeatable determination to do the job at hand.
482.author: Harry S Truman

483.text: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
483.author: T. S. Eliot

484.text: Life is the most exciting opportunity we have. But we have one shot. You graduate from college once, and that's it. You're going out of that nest. And you have to find that courage that's deep, deep, deep in there. Every step of the way.
484.author: Andrew Shue

485.text: Courage, sacrifice, determination, commitment, toughness, heart, talent, guts. That's what little girls are made of.
485.author: Bethany Hamilton

486.text: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear, not absence of fear.
486.author: Mark Twain

487.text: The greatest test of courage on earth is to bear defeat without losing heart.
487.author: Robert Green Ingersoll

488.text: All you need is the plan, the road map, and the courage to press on to your destination.
488.author: Earl Nightingale

490.text: Courage is being scared to death... and saddling up anyway.
490.author: John Wayne
