961.text: Faith is to believe what you do not see; the reward of this faith is to see what you believe.
961.author: Saint Augustine

963.text: Religion is part of the human make-up. It's also part of our cultural and intellectual history. Religion was our first attempt at literature, the texts, our first attempt at cosmology, making sense of where we are in the universe, our first attempt at health care, believing in faith healing, our first attempt at philosophy.
963.author: Christopher Hitchens

964.text: Indeed, this life is a test. It is a test of many things - of our convictions and priorities, our faith and our faithfulness, our patience and our resilience, and in the end, our ultimate desires.
964.author: Sheri L. Dew

965.text: As you keep your mind and heart focused in the right direction, approaching each day with faith and gratitude, I believe you will be empowered to live life to the fullest and enjoy the abundant life He has promised you!
965.author: Victoria Osteen

966.text: Through hard work, perseverance and a faith in God, you can live your dreams.
966.author: Ben Carson

967.text: It's lack of faith that makes people afraid of meeting challenges, and I believed in myself.
967.author: Muhammad Ali

968.text: We are twice armed if we fight with faith.
968.author: Plato

969.text: Technology is nothing. What's important is that you have a faith in people, that they're basically good and smart, and if you give them tools, they'll do wonderful things with them.
969.author: Steve Jobs

970.text: I am still far from being what I want to be, but with God's help I shall succeed.
970.author: Vincent Van Gogh

971.text: With faith, discipline and selfless devotion to duty, there is nothing worthwhile that you cannot achieve.
971.author: Muhammad Ali Jinnah

972.text: No human race is superior; no religious faith is inferior. All collective judgments are wrong. Only racists make them.
972.author: Elie Wiesel

973.text: Faith is permitting ourselves to be seized by the things we do not see.
973.author: Martin Luther

974.text: God will never give you anything you can't handle, so don't stress.
974.author: Kelly Clarkson

975.text: The foundation stones for a balanced success are honesty, character, integrity, faith, love and loyalty.
975.author: Zig Ziglar

976.text: Without faith, nothing is possible. With it, nothing is impossible.
976.author: Mary McLeod Bethune

977.text: I am a bit of a hopeless romantic. I really do have a faith and a belief in love, and when I love, I love hard.
977.author: Melanie Fiona

978.text: A wise ruler ought never to keep faith when by doing so it would be against his interests.
978.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

979.text: Take a leap of faith and begin this wondrous new year by believing. Believe in yourself. And believe that there is a loving Source - a Sower of Dreams - just waiting to be asked to help you make your dreams come true.
979.author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

980.text: Pray as though everything depended on God. Work as though everything depended on you.
980.author: Saint Augustine

981.text: God has already done everything He's going to do. The ball is now in your court. If you want success, if you want wisdom, if you want to be prosperous and healthy, you're going to have to do more than meditate and believe; you must boldly declare words of faith and victory over yourself and your family.
981.author: Joel Osteen

982.text: If you have God on your side, everything becomes clear.
982.author: Ayrton Senna

983.text: My mother was a piano teacher, my father an inventor. He invented the reflective paint they still use on airstrips. They had faith in my ambition, and I think that made all the difference.
983.author: Chuck Close

984.text: Nor shall derision prove powerful against those who listen to humanity or those who follow in the footsteps of divinity, for they shall live forever. Forever.
984.author: Khalil Gibran

985.text: Before the throne of the Almighty, man will be judged not by his acts but by his intentions. For God alone reads our hearts.
985.author: Mahatma Gandhi

986.text: It is truer to say that martyrs create faith more than faith creates martyrs.
986.author: Miguel de Unamuno

987.text: To one who has faith, no explanation is necessary. To one without faith, no explanation is possible.
987.author: Thomas Aquinas

988.text: I think faith is incredibly important because you will become overwhelmed with what's happening and you will have waves of grief, but when you turn to your faith, I believe God will give you waves of grace to get through it.
988.author: Joel Osteen

989.text: People who believe they have the power to exercise some measure of control over their lives are healthier, more effective and more successful than those who lack faith in their ability to effect changes in their lives.
989.author: Albert Bandura

990.text: Liberty cannot be established without morality, nor morality without faith.
990.author: Alexis de Tocqueville

991.text: It is a great consolation for me to remember that the Lord, to whom I had drawn near in humble and child-like faith, has suffered and died for me, and that He will look on me in love and compassion.
991.author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

992.text: The other day the President said, I know you've had some rough times, and I want to do something that will show the nation what faith that I have in you, in your maturity and sense of responsibility. He paused, then said, would you like a puppy?
992.author: Dan Quayle

993.text: I have great faith in fools; self-confidence my friends call it.
993.author: Edgar Allan Poe

994.text: Faith is the great cop-out, the great excuse to evade the need to think and evaluate evidence. Faith is belief in spite of, even perhaps because of, the lack of evidence.
994.author: Richard Dawkins

995.text: Faith makes all things possible... love makes all things easy.
995.author: Dwight L. Moody

996.text: The issue of equal rights for lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender individuals has vexed politicians for decades. I have my own cloudy history with the issue, having supported a law in Mississippi that made it illegal for LGBT couples to adopt children. I believed at the time this was a principled position based on my faith.
996.author: Ronnie Musgrove

997.text: Many have a vague idea that they must make some wonderful effort in order to gain the favor of God. But all self-dependence is vain. It is only by connecting with Jesus through faith that the sinner becomes a hopeful, believing child of God.
997.author: Ellen G. White

998.text: For most of us, the great danger is not that we will renounce our faith. It is that we will become so distracted and rushed and preoccupied that we will settle for a mediocre version of it. We will just skim our lives instead of actually living them.
998.author: John Ortberg

999.text: In a democracy, dissent is an act of faith.
999.author: J. William Fulbright

1000.text: Happy is the son whose faith in his mother remains unchallenged.
1000.author: Louisa May Alcott

1001.text: Faith and prayer are the vitamins of the soul; man cannot live in health without them.
1001.author: Mahalia Jackson

1002.text: Machiavelli's teaching would hardly have stood the test of Parliamentary government, for public discussion demands at least the profession of good faith.
1002.author: Lord Acton

1003.text: I believe though I do not comprehend, and I hold by faith what I cannot grasp with the mind.
1003.author: Saint Bernard

1004.text: Remember the sufferings of Christ, the storms that were weathered... the crown that came from those sufferings which gave new radiance to the faith... All saints give testimony to the truth that without real effort, no one ever wins the crown.
1004.author: Thomas Becket

1005.text: We have all sinned and fall short of the glory of God. So when we are in the mess, remember Jesus made it right. We got to hang on to that by faith.
1005.author: Jud Wilhite

1006.text: I just want to grow spiritually with the Lord. I'm keeping strong at it, just trying to make my walk with faith a little better.
1006.author: Kevin Durant

1007.text: It is the job of the historian to say what is likely, and of faith to say what is possible.
1007.author: Reza Aslan

1008.text: As members of Congress, we take an oath to uphold the Constitution and bear true faith and allegiance to the United States, not the Republican or Democratic party. I have been willing to stand up to my own leadership when it's in the national interest.
1008.author: Jackie Speier

1009.text: God never made a promise that was too good to be true.
1009.author: Dwight L. Moody

1010.text: There are many things that are essential to arriving at true peace of mind, and one of the most important is faith, which cannot be acquired without prayer.
1010.author: John Wooden

1012.text: Doubt is not the opposite of faith; it is one element of faith.
1012.author: Paul Tillich

1013.text: Faith consists in believing when it is beyond the power of reason to believe.
1013.author: Voltaire

1014.text: Now, God be praised, that to believing souls gives light in darkness, comfort in despair.
1014.author: William Shakespeare

1015.text: Faith gives you an inner strength and a sense of balance and perspective in life.
1015.author: Gregory Peck

1016.text: Of all the things Christ wants for us, loving Him and focusing our attention on Him are the most important.
1016.author: Charles Stanley

1017.text: Anybody who has been seriously engaged in scientific work of any kind realizes that over the entrance to the gates of the temple of science are written the words: 'Ye must have faith.'
1017.author: Max Planck

1018.text: I have always marveled that so many religions exact such revenge against dissenters. It only weakens the appeal of their faith and contradicts any claims they might have made that 'all religions are basically the same.'
1018.author: Ravi Zacharias

1019.text: Christ commands those who believe to be baptized. Pedobaptists adopt a system which tends to preclude the baptism of believers. They baptize the involuntary infant and deprive him of the privilege of ever professing his faith in the appointed way. If this system were universally adopted, it would banish believers' baptism out of the world.
1019.author: Adoniram Judson

1020.text: You block your dream when you allow your fear to grow bigger than your faith.
1020.author: Mary Manin Morrissey

1021.text: To be an atheist requires an indefinitely greater measure of faith than to recieve all the great truths which atheism would deny.
1021.author: Joseph Addison

1022.text: My faith always has been and always will be important to me.
1022.author: Aretha Franklin

1023.text: Faith is the first factor in a life devoted to service. Without it, nothing is possible. With it, nothing is impossible.
1023.author: Mary McLeod Bethune

1024.text: It is only by risking our persons from one hour to another that we live at all. And often enough our faith beforehand in an uncertified result is the only thing that makes the result come true.
1024.author: William James

1025.text: There is nothing wrong with America that faith, love of freedom, intelligence, and energy of her citizens cannot cure.
1025.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

1026.text: It's faith in something and enthusiasm for something that makes a life worth living.
1026.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

1027.text: No lover, if he be of good faith, and sincere, will deny he would prefer to see his mistress dead than unfaithful.
1027.author: Marquis de Sade

1028.text: The past is a source of knowledge, and the future is a source of hope. Love of the past implies faith in the future.
1028.author: Stephen Ambrose

1029.text: Blind faith, no matter how passionately expressed, will not suffice. Science for its part will test relentlessly every assumption about the human condition.
1029.author: E. O. Wilson

1030.text: Put your faith in God and confidence in yourself.
1030.author: Alberta Hunter

1031.text: I ground my faith upon God's word, and not upon the church.
1031.author: Jane Grey

1032.text: A person who has sympathy for mankind in the lump, faith in its future progress, and desire to serve the great cause of this progress, should be called not a humanist, but a humanitarian, and his creed may be designated as humanitarianism.
1032.author: Irving Babbitt

1033.text: It's a war of attrition. If you have patience and a modicum of faith in yourself your chances are not too bad.
1033.author: Julie Bowen

1034.text: In the last analysis, of course, an oath will encourage fidelity in office only to the degree that officeholders continue to believe that they cannot escape ultimate accountability for a breach of faith.
1034.author: James L. Buckley

1035.text: It comes with faith, for with complete faith there is no fear of what faces you in life or death.
1035.author: Jacqueline Cochran

1036.text: Amidst the confusion of the times, the conflicts of conscience, and the turmoil of daily living, an abiding faith becomes an anchor to our lives.
1036.author: Thomas S. Monson

1037.text: I wasn't with Joseph, but I believe him. My faith did not come to me through science, and I will not permit so-called science to destroy it.
1037.author: Thomas S. Monson

1038.text: Should doubt knock at your doorway, just say to those skeptical, disturbing, rebellious thoughts, I propose to stay with my faith, with the faith of my people.
1038.author: Thomas S. Monson

1039.text: A witness, in the sense that I am using the word, is a man whose life and faith are so completely one that when the challenge comes to step out and testify for his faith, he does so, disregarding all risks, accepting all consequences.
1039.author: Whittaker Chambers

1040.text: If he have faith, the believer cannot be restrained. He betrays himself. He breaks out. He confesses and teaches this gospel to the people at the risk of life itself.
1040.author: Martin Luther

1041.text: When you have put all your faith in man and continue to be disappointed, don't you hope there is something out of there that is not of human element?
1041.author: Natalie Cole

1042.text: Faith, there hath been many great men that have flattered the people who ne'er loved them.
1042.author: William Shakespeare

1043.text: Anyone who is to find Christ must first find the church. How could anyone know where Christ is and what faith is in him unless he knew where his believers are?
1043.author: Martin Luther

1044.text: I still have a belief and a faith that some great things are still going to happen in my career. If I didn't believe that, it makes no sense for me to be out there, and on top of that, I know this is a period of time that God wants me to persevere through.
1044.author: Michael Chang

1045.text: The difficulties we face originate from one of three sources. Some are sent to us by the Lord to test our faith, others are the result of Satan's attacks, and still others are due to our own sinful choices.
1045.author: Charles Stanley

1046.text: Sigmund Freud was the apostle of disbelief. He was the one who made psychoanalysis a part of our culture, and in so doing he kicked out a flying buttress that had been essential for holding up our cathedral of faith.
1046.author: Tony Campolo

1047.text: It's okay to have faith in something that you can't see or touch.
1047.author: Chad Kroeger

1048.text: Any of us can be happy and have a good attitude when everything is going our way. But I believe it's the real test of your character and of your faith to say, 'Things are not going our way, but I'm still being good to people; I'm still attending church; I still have a good attitude.'
1048.author: Joel Osteen

1049.text: When the faith is strong enough, it is sufficient just to be. It's a journey towards simplicity, towards quietness, towards a kind of joy that is not in time. It's a journey that has taken us from primary identification with our body and our psyche, on to an identification with God, and ultimately beyond identification.
1049.author: Ram Dass

1050.text: Let me say that I consider myself a deep believer in the reality of God. I might define God quite differently from the way some people in the Christian faith would do so, but I do not doubt the reality of that experience.
1050.author: John Shelby Spong

1051.text: My characters tend to be more dynamic because they're reaching that point in their lives where their old way of being is breaking down. They're conflicted by the idea that they don't know what's next. You could call it Kierkegaard's leap of faith, when you get tired of sort of reinventing yourself on a very superficial level.
1051.author: Chuck Palahniuk

1052.text: I would suggest that faith is everyone's business. The advance or decline of faith is so intimately connected to the welfare of a society that it should be of particular interest to a politician.
1052.author: William Wilberforce

1053.text: For a believer, Christian faith is true to the human heart, not in the sense that any old thing we fancy believing in will become conveniently true - but because the complicated truth about our hearts, as we struggle to perceive it, tells us what we are and where we are, and consequently what we need.
1053.author: Francis Spufford

1054.text: It's an article of faith that the novels I've loved will live inside me forever.
1054.author: Pat Conroy

1055.text: That deep emotional conviction of the presence of a superior reasoning power, which is revealed in the incomprehensible universe, forms my idea of God.
1055.author: Albert Einstein

1056.text: In faith there is enough light for those who want to believe and enough shadows to blind those who don't.
1056.author: Blaise Pascal

1057.text: Belief is a wise wager. Granted that faith cannot be proved, what harm will come to you if you gamble on its truth and it proves false? If you gain, you gain all; if you lose, you lose nothing. Wager, then, without hesitation, that He exists.
1057.author: Blaise Pascal

1058.text: I gave in, and admitted that God was God.
1058.author: C. S. Lewis

1059.text: Prayer should be the key of the day and the lock of the night.
1059.author: George Herbert

1060.text: Doubt is a pain too lonely to know that faith is his twin brother.
1060.author: Khalil Gibran

1061.text: Faith is an oasis in the heart which will never be reached by the caravan of thinking.
1061.author: Khalil Gibran

1062.text: Faith is a knowledge within the heart, beyond the reach of proof.
1062.author: Khalil Gibran

1063.text: Faith is not something to grasp, it is a state to grow into.
1063.author: Mahatma Gandhi

1064.text: There is nothing that wastes the body like worry, and one who has any faith in God should be ashamed to worry about anything whatsoever.
1064.author: Mahatma Gandhi

1065.text: If patience is worth anything, it must endure to the end of time. And a living faith will last in the midst of the blackest storm.
1065.author: Mahatma Gandhi

1066.text: Be a sinner and sin strongly, but more strongly have faith and rejoice in Christ.
1066.author: Martin Luther

1067.text: All who call on God in true faith, earnestly from the heart, will certainly be heard, and will receive what they have asked and desired.
1067.author: Martin Luther

1069.text: Knowledge is only one half. Faith is the other.
1069.author: Novalis

1070.text: The dearest friend on earth is a mere shadow compared to Jesus Christ.
1070.author: Oswald Chambers

1071.text: Belief in a cruel God makes a cruel man.
1071.author: Thomas Paine

1072.text: To believe in God is impossible not to believe in Him is absurd.
1072.author: Voltaire

1073.text: Faith means belief in something concerning which doubt is theoretically possible.
1073.author: William James

1074.text: The love of heaven makes one heavenly.
1074.author: William Shakespeare

1076.text: If you believe in God, He will open the windows of heaven and pour blessings upon you.
1076.author: Mahalia Jackson

1077.text: Faith is not simply a patience that passively suffers until the storm is past. Rather, it is a spirit that bears things - with resignations, yes, but above all, with blazing, serene hope.
1077.author: Corazon Aquino

1078.text: Faith activates God - Fear activates the Enemy.
1078.author: Joel Osteen

1079.text: God didn't make a mistake when He made you. You need to see yourself as God sees you.
1079.author: Joel Osteen

1080.text: Faith is about trusting God when you have unanswered questions.
1080.author: Joel Osteen

1081.text: I die the king's faithful servant, but God's first.
1081.author: Thomas More

1082.text: He wants you all to Himself to put His loving, divine arms around you.
1082.author: Charles Stanley

1083.text: I live and love in God's peculiar light.
1083.author: Michelangelo

1084.text: You were made by God and for God, and until you understand that, life will never make sense.
1084.author: Rick Warren

1085.text: Fight the good fight of faith, and God will give you spiritual mercies.
1085.author: George Whitefield

1086.text: Man, I just feel blessed... I was in a situation where the only way I could come out of it was by putting my faith in God. No matter how good my lawyers were, no matter how much celebrity I had, everything was just stacked up against me.
1086.author: Sean Combs

1087.text: What does God the Father look like? Although I've never seen Him, I believe - as with the Holy Spirit - He looks like Jesus looked on earth.
1087.author: Benny Hinn

1088.text: Put your nose into the Bible everyday. It is your spiritual food. And then share it. Make a vow not to be a lukewarm Christian.
1088.author: Kirk Cameron

1089.text: Faith is the substance of hope - of things hoped for and the evidence of things not seen. So if you can hope for it and imagine it, and keep imagining and hoping and seeing yourself driving a new car, or seeing yourself getting that job, or seeing yourself excel, seeing yourself help that person - that is faith.
1089.author: Duane Chapman

1090.text: God continues to work miracles in my life.
1090.author: Willie Aames

1091.text: I do respect people's faith, but I don't respect their manipulation of that faith in order to create fear and control.
1091.author: Javier Bardem

1092.text: Faith has to do with things that are not seen and hope with things that are not at hand.
1092.author: Thomas Aquinas

1093.text: Resist your fear; fear will never lead to you a positive end. Go for your faith and what you believe.
1093.author: T. D. Jakes

1094.text: Oh, it is wonderful to know that our Heavenly Father loves us - even with all our flaws! His love is such that even should we give up on ourselves, He never will.
1094.author: Joseph B. Wirthlin

1095.text: The truth is that killing innocent people is always wrong - and no argument or excuse, no matter how deeply believed, can ever make it right. No religion on earth condones the killing of innocent people; no faith tradition tolerates the random killing of our brothers and sisters on this earth.
1095.author: Feisal Abdul Rauf

1096.text: Many churches of all persuasions are hiring research agencies to poll neighborhoods, asking what kind of church they prefer. Then the local churches design themselves to fit the desires of the people. True faith in God that demands selflessness is being replaced by trendy religion that serves the selfish.
1096.author: Billy Graham

1097.text: I wouldn't ever say if you're having tough times then there must be something wrong with you or your attitude. Life's a fight. It's a good fight of faith. I encourage people to stay up, stay hopeful, stay faith-filled.
1097.author: Joel Osteen

1098.text: That is not to say that we can relax our readiness to defend ourselves. Our armament must be adequate to the needs, but our faith is not primarily in these machines of defense but in ourselves.
1098.author: Chester W. Nimitz

1099.text: I committed my life to Christ, and that faith has been most important to me ever since.
1099.author: Peyton Manning

1100.text: One of the things I learned the hard way was that it doesn't pay to get discouraged. Keeping busy and making optimism a way of life can restore your faith in yourself.
1100.author: Lucille Ball

1101.text: Many are needed to plant and water what has been planted now that the faith has spread so far and there are so many people... No matter who plants or waters, God gives no harvest unless what is planted is the faith of Peter and unless he agrees to his teachings.
1101.author: Thomas Becket

1102.text: My family, frankly, they weren't folks who went to church every week. My mother was one of the most spiritual people I knew but she didn't raise me in the church, so I came to my Christian faith later in life and it was because the precepts of Jesus Christ spoke to me in terms of the kind of life that I would want to lead.
1102.author: Barack Obama

1103.text: Growing up around Amish farmland, I enjoyed the opportunity to witness firsthand their love of family, of the domestic arts - sewing, quilting, cooking, baking - as well as seeing them live out their tradition of faith in such a unique way.
1103.author: Beverly Lewis

1104.text: My parents shared not only an improbable love, they shared an abiding faith in the possibilities of this nation. They would give me an African name, Barack, or blessed, believing that in a tolerant America your name is no barrier to success.
1104.author: Barack Obama

1105.text: My coming to faith did not start with a leap but rather a series of staggers from what seemed like one safe place to another. Like lily pads, round and green, these places summoned and then held me up while I grew. Each prepared me for the next leaf on which I would land, and in this way I moved across the swamp of doubt and fear.
1105.author: Anne Lamott

1106.text: Faith that it's not always in your hands or things don't always go the way you planned, but you have to have faith that there is a plan for you, and you must follow your heart and believe in yourself no matter what.
1106.author: Martina McBride

1107.text: Faith in the Lord Jesus Christ is the foundation upon which sincere and meaningful repentance must be built. If we truly seek to put away sin, we must first look to Him who is the Author of our salvation.
1107.author: Ezra Taft Benson

1108.text: Among the many signs of a lively faith and hope we have in eternal life, one of the surest is not being overly sad at the death of those whom we dearly love in our Lord.
1108.author: Saint Ignatius

1109.text: Humble prayer to our Heavenly Father, in deep faith in Jesus Christ, is essential to qualify us for the companionship of the Holy Ghost.
1109.author: Henry B. Eyring

1110.text: Having a Christian worldview shapes my decision-making with respect to all aspects of my life. I always respect people in public life who are principled, and those principles have to be connected to something. And my faith is what serves as the anchor and directs my actions.
1110.author: John Thune

1111.text: Practice means to perform, over and over again in the face of all obstacles, some act of vision, of faith, of desire. Practice is a means of inviting the perfection desired.
1111.author: Martha Graham

1112.text: Comedy is an escape, not from truth but from despair; a narrow escape into faith.
1112.author: Christopher Fry

1114.text: Anyone who knows history, particularly the history of Europe, will, I think, recognize that the domination of education or of government by any one particular religious faith is never a happy arrangement for the people.
1114.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

1115.text: The mysteries of faith are degraded if they are made into an object of affirmation and negation, when in reality they should be an object of contemplation.
1115.author: Simone Weil

1116.text: Flatter not thyself in thy faith in God if thou hast not charity for thy neighbor.
1116.author: Francis Quarles

1117.text: A faith is something you die for, a doctrine is something you kill for. There is all the difference in the world.
1117.author: Tony Benn

1118.text: Non-violence is the article of faith.
1118.author: Mahatma Gandhi

1119.text: Let judges secretly despair of justice: their verdicts will be more acute. Let generals secretly despair of triumph; killing will be defamed. Let priests secretly despair of faith: their compassion will be true.
1119.author: Leonard Cohen

1120.text: A small body of determined spirits fired by an unquenchable faith in their mission can alter the course of history.
1120.author: Mahatma Gandhi

1121.text: I don't have to have faith, I have experience.
1121.author: Joseph Campbell

1122.text: Prayer is as natural an expression of faith as breathing is of life.
1122.author: Jonathan Edwards

1123.text: Talk unbelief, and you will have unbelief; but talk faith, and you will have faith. According to the seed sown will be the harvest.
1123.author: Ellen G. White

1124.text: In other words, a person who is fanatic in matters of religion, and clings to certain ideas about the nature of God and the universe, becomes a person who has no faith at all.
1124.author: Alan Watts

1125.text: I think people who are creative are the luckiest people on earth. I know that there are no shortcuts, but you must keep your faith in something Greater than You, and keep doing what you love. Do what you love, and you will find the way to get it out to the world.
1125.author: Judy Collins

1126.text: As a world view, Darwinism cannot of course be refuted, since Faith is, always has been, and always will be, stronger than facts.
1126.author: Francis Parker Yockey

1127.text: I have an almost complete disregard of precedent, and a faith in the possibility of something better. It irritates me to be told how things have always been done. I defy the tyranny of precedent. I go for anything new that might improve the past.
1127.author: Clara Barton

1128.text: Faith is like a kernel of wheat.
1128.author: Joe Bob Briggs

1129.text: I forbid you, agnostic, doubting thoughts, to destroy the house of my faith.
1129.author: Thomas S. Monson

1130.text: Of all our dreams today there is none more important - or so hard to realise - than that of peace in the world. May we never lose our faith in it or our resolve to do everything that can be done to convert it one day into reality.
1130.author: Lester B. Pearson

1131.text: I believe that we must reach our brother, never toning down our fundamental oppositions, but meeting him when he asks to be met, with a reason for the faith that is in us, as well as with a loving sympathy for them as brothers.
1131.author: Dorothy Day

1132.text: It is easier to have faith that God will support each House of Hospitality and Farming Commune and supply our needs in the way of food and money to pay bills, than it is to keep a strong, hearty, living faith in each individual around us - to see Christ in him.
1132.author: Dorothy Day

1133.text: Your faith in yourself is all you will ever have. Don't let anyone take it away from you, ever.
1133.author: Holly Marie Combs

1134.text: Do not tell secrets to those whose faith and silence you have not already tested.
1134.author: Elizabeth I

1135.text: Let us be sure that those who come after will say of us in our time, that in our time we did everything that could be done. We finished the race; we kept them free; we kept the faith.
1135.author: Ronald Reagan

1136.text: The parents have a right to say that no teacher paid by their money shall rob their children of faith in God and send them back to their homes skeptical, or infidels, or agnostics, or atheists.
1136.author: William Jennings Bryan

1137.text: In my career as an actor, there is a catchphrase that Scofield always says often in regards to his brother, 'Have a little faith.' In my own career as an actor, there were times when I was the only one who believed in myself in the face of the odds.
1137.author: Wentworth Miller

1138.text: Life's a fight. It's a good fight of faith.
1138.author: Joel Osteen

1139.text: There's a loss of faith in the banking system that for so long has been the backbone of prosperity and growth.
1139.author: Lucy Powell

1140.text: Man doesn't dictate what you do or how you do it. If you believe in God, believe in God; have your faith in him. That's where my faith lies.
1140.author: Ray Lewis

1141.text: Faith is the first step to understanding. Either it's the Word of an infallible God, the fallible words of men, or faith in what you personally believe. You've got to have faith in something. Believe me.
1141.author: Ray Comfort

1142.text: There were periods of my life when a lot of people didn't believe in me. I still had faith in myself. I really had to ask myself life questions. Where do I see myself in five years? Create a ladder for yourself, and walk up the steps. Climb that ladder.
1142.author: Fergie

1143.text: I am politically pro-choice, but personally pro-life. I have my faith but refuse to force it on the world at large - especially this world, so brutal and unjust. I cannot make these wrenching personal life and death decisions for others - nor do I believe they should be made by a church run by childless men.
1143.author: Julianna Baggott

1144.text: The fundamental idea which defines a human being as a Muslim is the declaration of faith: that there is a creator, whom we call God - or Allah, in Arabic - and that the creator is one and single. And we declare this faith by the declaration of faith, where we... bear witness that there is no God but God.
1144.author: Feisal Abdul Rauf

1145.text: I always pray for God's guidance in my life and he always provides it. He opens the right doors he shuts the right doors. And I have tremendous faith in him. He just guided my career in an amazing way.
1145.author: Ben Carson

1146.text: Only through repentance and faith in Christ can anyone be saved. No religious activity will be sufficient, only true faith in Jesus Christ alone.
1146.author: Ravi Zacharias

1147.text: The assurance of Heaven is never given to the person. And that's why at the core of the Christian faith is the grace of God. If there's one word I would grab from all of that, it's forgiveness - that you can be forgiven. I can be forgiven, and it is of the grace of God. But once you understand that, I think the ramifications are worldwide.
1147.author: Ravi Zacharias

1148.text: I am totally convinced the Christian faith is the most coherent worldview around.
1148.author: Ravi Zacharias

1149.text: As a pastor, I have a deep desire to lead people to God and encourage people to pray, read the Bible, and carry their faith into every part of their lives.
1149.author: Adam Hamilton

1150.text: Those who embrace belief in Christ Jesus are bound together in Him, in a real yet incomplete way, in his Body, the Church. Faith is never a solitary activity, nor can it be simply private. Faith in Christ always draws us into a community and has a public dimension.
1150.author: Vincent Nichols

1151.text: The great moral powers of the soul are faith, hope, and love.
1151.author: Ellen G. White

1152.text: The name 'Seventh-day Adventist' carries the true features of our faith in front and will convict the inquiring mind. Like an arrow from the Lord's quiver, it will wound the transgressors of God's law, and will lead to repentance toward God, and faith in our Lord Jesus Christ.
1152.author: Ellen G. White

1153.text: I'd be saying, 'No, I'm so not a DJ, I'm a producer.' But no matter how much faith you may have in yourself, until you have a hit you can't really run around telling everyone you're a producer.
1153.author: Mark Ronson

1154.text: As long as I have my faith in God, I'm good. I know everything else is going to come.
1154.author: Derrick Rose

1155.text: Through faith in the Lord Jesus alone can we obtain forgiveness of our sins, and be at peace with God; but, believing in Jesus, we become, through this very faith, the children of God; have God as our Father, and may come to Him for all the temporal and spiritual blessings which we need.
1155.author: George Muller

1156.text: The roles of art, morality, religion, political faith, science itself are not to repair organic exhaustion nor to provide sound functioning of the organs. All this supraphysical life is built and expanded not because of the demands of the cosmic environment but because of the demands of the social environment.
1156.author: Emile Durkheim

1157.text: We all face storms in life. Some are more difficult than others, but we all go through trials and tribulation. That's why we have the gift of faith.
1157.author: Joyce Meyer

1158.text: Stay active. Read the Word. Worship with other believers. Continue to give. Keep learning and growing. Your faith will be unleashed!
1158.author: Joyce Meyer

1159.text: Sin, also for those who don't have faith, exists when one goes against one's conscience. To listen to and obey it means, in fact, to decide in face of what is perceived as good or evil. And on this decision pivots the goodness or malice of our action.
1159.author: Pope Francis

1160.text: We can't solve modern problems by going back in time. Retreating to the safety of the familiar is an understandable response, but God has called us to a life of faith. And faith requires us to face the unknown while trusting Him completely.
1160.author: Charles R. Swindoll

1161.text: I always try to put a seed of hope into people's hearts. I'm not there to teach them doctrine necessarily, but to let them know that God is a good God, and has a plan for their lives. Hopefully, that will restore their faith, or draw them into faith.
1161.author: Joel Osteen

1162.text: I think every person should have some faith inside him, in his heart. What matters is not an external display of this faith, but the inner state of the soul.
1162.author: Vladimir Putin

1163.text: I believe in having a more open mind and including others who don't share your faith and having dialogue with them. And just having a pure heart and being a good person can bring you closer to God. Because once you believe in one particular religion fully and not others, that requires you to start disliking people who don't share your views.
1163.author: Ishmael Beah

1164.text: You must have faith to pray. You must have faith to ponder the word of God. You must have faith to do those things and go to those places which invite the Spirit of Christ and the Holy Ghost.
1164.author: Henry B. Eyring

1165.text: Prayer is a privilege and the soul's sincere desire. We can move beyond routine and 'checklist' prayers and engage in meaningful prayer as we appropriately ask in faith and act, as we patiently persevere through the trial of our faith, and as we humbly acknowledge and accept 'not my will, but Thine, be done.'
1165.author: David A. Bednar

1166.text: A woman of faith is fearless. There is no ambiguity, no uncertain trump in her life. She can live a principled life because she studies the doctrine and teachings of a perfect teacher, the Master. She is a noble example to all who know her.
1166.author: Margaret D. Nadauld

1167.text: Take heed, then, often to come together to give thanks to God, and show forth His praise. For when you assemble frequently in the same place, the powers of Satan are destroyed, and the destruction at which he aims is prevented by the unity of your faith.
1167.author: Ignatius of Antioch

1168.text: I think you make the best with what you've got, you know? Sometimes you have very little. And you just always try to rise to higher ground, because you're going to suffer one way or the other, so you just hope that you have strength and perseverance and good friends and faith, some kind of faith, to endure and move on to greener pastures.
1168.author: Pierce Brosnan

1169.text: Faith is salted and peppered through everything at Christmas. And I love at least one night by the Christmas tree to sing and feel the quiet holiness of that time that's set apart to celebrate love, friendship, and God's gift of the Christ child.
1169.author: Amy Grant

1170.text: God has entrusted us with his most precious treasure - people. He asks us to shepherd and mold them into strong disciples, with brave faith and good character.
1170.author: John Ortberg

1173.text: To fear love is to fear life, and those who fear life are already three parts dead.
1173.author: Bertrand Russell

1174.text: The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.
1174.author: Mark Twain

1175.text: Red is such an interesting color to correlate with emotion, because it's on both ends of the spectrum. On one end you have happiness, falling in love, infatuation with someone, passion, all that. On the other end, you've got obsession, jealousy, danger, fear, anger and frustration.
1175.author: Taylor Swift

1176.text: I've learned that fear limits you and your vision. It serves as blinders to what may be just a few steps down the road for you. The journey is valuable, but believing in your talents, your abilities, and your self-worth can empower you to walk down an even brighter path. Transforming fear into freedom - how great is that?
1176.author: Soledad O'Brien

1177.text: This world of ours... must avoid becoming a community of dreadful fear and hate, and be, instead, a proud confederation of mutual trust and respect.
1177.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

1178.text: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light.
1178.author: Plato

1179.text: Some days, 24 hours is too much to stay put in, so I take the day hour by hour, moment by moment. I break the task, the challenge, the fear into small, bite-size pieces. I can handle a piece of fear, depression, anger, pain, sadness, loneliness, illness. I actually put my hands up to my face, one next to each eye, like blinders on a horse.
1179.author: Regina Brett

1181.text: Fear keeps us focused on the past or worried about the future. If we can acknowledge our fear, we can realize that right now we are okay. Right now, today, we are still alive, and our bodies are working marvelously. Our eyes can still see the beautiful sky. Our ears can still hear the voices of our loved ones.
1181.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

1182.text: When your time comes to die, be not like those whose hearts are filled with fear of death, so that when their time comes they weep and pray for a little more time to live their lives over again in a different way. Sing your death song, and die like a hero going home.
1182.author: Tecumseh

1183.text: If you know the enemy and know yourself you need not fear the results of a hundred battles.
1183.author: Sun Tzu

1184.text: Don't let fear or insecurity stop you from trying new things. Believe in yourself. Do what you love. And most importantly, be kind to others, even if you don't like them.
1184.author: Stacy London

1185.text: Power is of two kinds. One is obtained by the fear of punishment and the other by acts of love. Power based on love is a thousand times more effective and permanent then the one derived from fear of punishment.
1185.author: Mahatma Gandhi

1187.text: The deepest fear we have, 'the fear beneath all fears,' is the fear of not measuring up, the fear of judgment. It's this fear that creates the stress and depression of everyday life.
1187.author: Tullian Tchividjian

1189.text: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
1189.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

1190.text: It is better to be feared than loved, if you cannot be both.
1190.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

1191.text: We are afraid to care too much, for fear that the other person does not care at all.
1191.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

1193.text: Our heavenly Father understands our disappointment, suffering, pain, fear, and doubt. He is always there to encourage our hearts and help us understand that He's sufficient for all of our needs. When I accepted this as an absolute truth in my life, I found that my worrying stopped.
1193.author: Charles Stanley

1194.text: I fear not the man who has practiced 10,000 kicks once, but I fear the man who has practiced one kick 10,000 times.
1194.author: Bruce Lee

1195.text: Love is a really scary thing, and you never know what's going to happen. It's one of the most beautiful things in life, but it's one of the most terrifying. It's worth the fear because you have more knowledge, experience, you learn from people, and you have memories.
1195.author: Ariana Grande

1196.text: I tremble for my country when I reflect that God is just; that his justice cannot sleep forever.
1196.author: Thomas Jefferson

1197.text: Love is the master key that opens the gates of happiness, of hatred, of jealousy, and, most easily of all, the gate of fear.
1197.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

1198.text: I really believe that all of us have a lot of darkness in our souls. Anger, rage, fear, sadness. I don't think that's only reserved for people who have horrible upbringings. I think it really exists and is part of the human condition. I think in the course of your life you figure out ways to deal with that.
1198.author: Kevin Bacon

1199.text: All religion, my friend, is simply evolved out of fraud, fear, greed, imagination, and poetry.
1199.author: Edgar Allan Poe

1200.text: I hope for nothing. I fear nothing. I am free.
1200.author: Nikos Kazantzakis

1202.text: It is not power that corrupts but fear. Fear of losing power corrupts those who wield it and fear of the scourge of power corrupts those who are subject to it.
1202.author: Aung San Suu Kyi

1203.text: Where there is charity and wisdom, there is neither fear nor ignorance.
1203.author: Francis of Assisi

1204.text: Thinking will not overcome fear but action will.
1204.author: W. Clement Stone

1205.text: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.
1205.author: Marie Curie

1206.text: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
1206.author: Marcus Aurelius

1208.text: I'm not afraid of storms, for I'm learning how to sail my ship.
1208.author: Louisa May Alcott

1209.text: The mind of America is seized by a fatal dry rot - and it's only a question of time before all that the mind controls will run amuck in a frenzy of stupid, impotent fear.
1209.author: Hunter S. Thompson

1210.text: The key to success is to focus our conscious mind on things we desire not things we fear.
1210.author: Brian Tracy

1211.text: Terrorism is a psychological warfare. Terrorists try to manipulate us and change our behavior by creating fear, uncertainty, and division in society.
1211.author: Patrick J. Kennedy

1212.text: The more you can increase fear of drugs and crime, welfare mothers, immigrants and aliens, the more you control all the people.
1212.author: Noam Chomsky

1214.text: Expose yourself to your deepest fear; after that, fear has no power, and the fear of freedom shrinks and vanishes. You are free.
1214.author: Jim Morrison

1215.text: The fear really hits you. That's what you feel first. And then it's the anger and frustration. Part of the problem is how little we understand about the ultimate betrayal of the body when it rebels against itself.
1215.author: Charles Bronson

1216.text: I don't have no fear of death. My only fear is coming back reincarnated.
1216.author: Tupac Shakur

1217.text: The oldest and strongest emotion of mankind is fear, and the oldest and strongest kind of fear is fear of the unknown.
1217.author: H. P. Lovecraft

1218.text: Limits, like fear, is often an illusion.
1218.author: Michael Jordan

1219.text: Human spirit is the ability to face the uncertainty of the future with curiosity and optimism. It is the belief that problems can be solved, differences resolved. It is a type of confidence. And it is fragile. It can be blackened by fear and superstition.
1219.author: Bernard Beckett

1221.text: Our deepest fear is not that we are inadequate. Our deepest fear is that we are powerful beyond measure. It is our Light, not our Darkness, that most frightens us.
1221.author: Marianne Williamson

1222.text: People react to fear, not love; they don't teach that in Sunday School, but it's true.
1222.author: Richard M. Nixon

1224.text: Only when we are no longer afraid do we begin to live.
1224.author: Dorothy Thompson

1225.text: I have learned over the years that when one's mind is made up, this diminishes fear; knowing what must be done does away with fear.
1225.author: Rosa Parks

1226.text: Most fears are basic: fear of the dark, fear of going down in the basement, fear of weird sounds, fear that somebody is waiting for you in your closet. Those kinds of things stay with you no matter what age.
1226.author: R. L. Stine

1227.text: Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.
1227.author: Salvador Dali

1228.text: I love the man that can smile in trouble, that can gather strength from distress, and grow brave by reflection. 'Tis the business of little minds to shrink, but he whose heart is firm, and whose conscience approves his conduct, will pursue his principles unto death.
1228.author: Thomas Paine

1229.text: My friends, love is better than anger. Hope is better than fear. Optimism is better than despair. So let us be loving, hopeful and optimistic. And we'll change the world.
1229.author: Jack Layton

1231.text: No work or love will flourish out of guilt, fear, or hollowness of heart, just as no valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
1231.author: Alan Watts

1232.text: Vaccines save lives; fear endangers them. It's a simple message parents need to keep hearing.
1232.author: Jeffrey Kluger

1233.text: Even death is not to be feared by one who has lived wisely.
1233.author: Buddha

1234.text: The poet does not fear death, not because he believes in the fantasy of heroes, but because death constantly visits his thoughts and is thus an image of a serene dialogue.
1234.author: Salvatore Quasimodo

1235.text: Fear is a good thing. Fear is going to lead you to take action.
1235.author: Stephen Bannon

1236.text: Advance, and never halt, for advancing is perfection. Advance and do not fear the thorns in the path, for they draw only corrupt blood.
1236.author: Khalil Gibran

1237.text: What comes out when life squeezes you? When someone hurts or offends you? If anger, pain and fear come out of you, it's because that's what's inside.
1237.author: Wayne Dyer

1238.text: Fear runs our lives. It doesn't matter who you are. You have to understand your relationship with fear. Whether you're scared of getting into a relationship; or taking the new job; or a confrontation - you have to size fear up.
1238.author: Chris Pine

1239.text: We are afraid of the enormity of the possible.
1239.author: Emile M. Cioran

1240.text: The pleasures of love are always in proportion to our fears.
1240.author: Stendhal

1241.text: I say I am stronger than fear.
1241.author: Malala Yousafzai

1242.text: The whole secret of existence is to have no fear. Never fear what will become of you, depend on no one. Only the moment you reject all help are you freed.
1242.author: Swami Vivekananda

1243.text: Boredom, anger, sadness, or fear are not 'yours,' not personal. They are conditions of the human mind. They come and go. Nothing that comes and goes is you.
1243.author: Eckhart Tolle

1244.text: The more knowledge you have, the greater will be your fear of Allah.
1244.author: Abu Bakr

1245.text: My aim, then, was to whip the rebels, to humble their pride, to follow them to their inmost recesses, and make them fear and dread us. Fear is the beginning of wisdom.
1245.author: William Tecumseh Sherman

1246.text: I've always had a huge fear of dying or becoming ill. The thing I'm most afraid of, though, is being alone, which I think a lot of performers fear. It's why we seek the limelight - so we're not alone, were adored. We're loved, so people want to be around us. The fear of being alone drives my life.
1246.author: Jennifer Lopez

1247.text: Fear is the main source of superstition, and one of the main sources of cruelty. To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.
1247.author: Bertrand Russell

1249.text: I have no fear of losing my life - if I have to save a koala or a crocodile or a kangaroo or a snake, mate, I will save it.
1249.author: Steve Irwin

1251.text: With something like cancer, there is a feeling that you can fight it in some way or control your response to it, but with dementia there is the fear of losing control of your mind and your life.
1251.author: Kevin Whately

1252.text: People fear death even more than pain. It's strange that they fear death. Life hurts a lot more than death. At the point of death, the pain is over. Yeah, I guess it is a friend.
1252.author: Jim Morrison

1253.text: Follow the path of the unsafe, independent thinker. Expose your ideas to the dangers of controversy. Speak your mind and fear less the label of 'crackpot' than the stigma of conformity. And on issues that seem important to you, stand up and be counted at any cost.
1253.author: Chauncey Depew

1254.text: If we take the generally accepted definition of bravery as a quality which knows no fear, I have never seen a brave man. All men are frightened. The more intelligent they are, the more they are frightened.
1254.author: George S. Patton

1255.text: I fear all we have done is to awaken a sleeping giant and fill him with a terrible resolve.
1255.author: Isoroku Yamamoto

1256.text: Fear not for the future, weep not for the past.
1256.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

1257.text: The Cuban people still live in constant fear of a brutal totalitarian regime that has demonstrated time and again its utter disregard for basic human dignity. The fight for a free Cuba has gone on for far too long.
1257.author: Mitt Romney

1258.text: You cannot avoid war in life, you cannot avoid the fear of terrorism, you cannot avoid those things now, they are a part of everyday demeanor.
1258.author: John Mayer

1259.text: Let children read whatever they want and then talk about it with them. If parents and kids can talk together, we won't have as much censorship because we won't have as much fear.
1259.author: Judy Blume

1260.text: Turning pro is a mindset. If we are struggling with fear, self-sabotage, procrastination, self-doubt, etc., the problem is, we're thinking like amateurs. Amateurs don't show up. Amateurs crap out. Amateurs let adversity defeat them. The pro thinks differently. He shows up, he does his work, he keeps on truckin', no matter what.
1260.author: Steven Pressfield

1261.text: If you want to conquer fear, don't sit home and think about it. Go out and get busy.
1261.author: Dale Carnegie

1263.text: There are few things more liberating in this life than having your worst fear realized.
1263.author: Conan O'Brien

1264.text: An appeal to fear never finds an echo in German hearts.
1264.author: Otto von Bismarck

1265.text: Change comes with both fear and some pain. Those two ingredients create mistrust, misunderstanding and misinformation. Such is the process of democracy.
1265.author: David Mixner

1266.text: I had the fear of heights when I was young, along with many other fears and phobias, including the fear of dogs, bees, horses, and blood.
1266.author: David D. Burns

1267.text: No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear.
1267.author: C. S. Lewis

1268.text: Hate is the consequence of fear; we fear something before we hate it; a child who fears noises becomes a man who hates noise.
1268.author: Cyril Connolly

1269.text: Do what you fear and fear disappears.
1269.author: David Joseph Schwartz

1270.text: One had to take some action against fear when once it laid hold of one.
1270.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

1272.text: Yoga is a way to freedom. By its constant practice, we can free ourselves from fear, anguish and loneliness.
1272.author: Indra Devi

1273.text: To live a creative life, we must lose our fear of being wrong.
1273.author: Joseph Chilton Pearce

1274.text: No one should fear to undertake any task in the name of our Saviour, if it is just and if the intention is purely for His holy service.
1274.author: Christopher Columbus

1275.text: A line from one of my 1997 columns - 'Do one thing every day that scares you' - is now widely attributed to Eleanor Roosevelt, though I have yet to see any evidence that she ever said it and I don't believe she did. She said some things about fear, but not that thing.
1275.author: Mary Schmich

1276.text: In religion, there's a certain type of fear that if somebody believes differently from me, that it's a threat. Because I'm right, and there cannot be two ways that are right, so if I'm right, anything different than this must be wrong; and we attack those things and it's really due to insecurity, ego and fear.
1276.author: Radhanath Swami

1277.text: The fear of murder has grown so enormous in the United States that it leaves a taint, like the mark of Cain, on everyone murder touches.
1277.author: Eric Schlosser

1278.text: There is no fear when you choose love. The more you choose love, the more love is in your life. It gets easier and easier.
1278.author: Melissa Etheridge

1279.text: I do fear for the generations of people who came of age thinking that pop-punk is what punk is, and that all the rebellion you need is just to stick your tongue out in the mirror every once in a while.
1279.author: Jello Biafra

1280.text: Love takes off masks that we fear we cannot live without and know we cannot live within.
1280.author: James A. Baldwin

1281.text: The day which we fear as our last is but the birthday of eternity.
1281.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

1283.text: Do not fear mistakes. There are none.
1283.author: Miles Davis

1284.text: I would sum up my fear about the future in one word: boring. And that's my one fear: that everything has happened; nothing exciting or new or interesting is ever going to happen again... the future is just going to be a vast, conforming suburb of the soul.
1284.author: J. G. Ballard

1285.text: I believe that fear of life brings a greater fear of death.
1285.author: David Blaine

1286.text: If people would know how little brain is ruling the world, they would die of fear.
1286.author: Ivo Andric

1287.text: Men! The only animal in the world to fear.
1287.author: D. H. Lawrence

1288.text: Some days it is a heroic act just to refuse the paralysis of fear and straighten up and step into another day.
1288.author: Edward Albert

1289.text: Fear is the only true enemy, born of ignorance and the parent of anger and hate.
1289.author: Edward Albert

1290.text: When you advise any person you should be guided by the fear of God.
1290.author: Abu Bakr

1291.text: We all look to have transcendent experiences that lift us out of the everyday, and fear is a good one. But, I think it's the same reason why people want to laugh their heads off.
1291.author: Adam Arkin

1293.text: Hopeful thinking can get you out of your fear zone and into your appreciation zone.
1293.author: Martha Beck

1294.text: You don't want too much fear in a market, because people will be blinded to some very good buying opportunities. You don't want too much complacency because people will be blinded to some risk.
1294.author: Ron Chernow

1295.text: Hunger and fear are the only realities in dog life: an empty stomach makes a fierce dog.
1295.author: Robert Falcon Scott

1296.text: Fear may very well be a caveman fear of the predator, of the giant lizard chasing them - maybe that's what Steven Spielberg connects with so well in Lost World.
1296.author: Oliver Stone

1297.text: I have withstood the power of convictions a long time; and therefore I fear I shall be finally left of God.
1297.author: David Brainerd

1298.text: Great fear is concealed under daring.
1298.author: Lucan

1299.text: Fear is the passion of slaves.
1299.author: Patrick Henry

1300.text: The greatest problem about old age is the fear that it may go on too long.
1300.author: A. J. P. Taylor

1302.text: Fear is a question. What are you afraid of and why? Our fears are a treasure house of self-knowledge if we explore them.
1302.author: Marilyn French

1303.text: I can't understand people calling themselves religious and being hateful. If a preacher is preaching hate, to fear God that's not religion, that's not helping humanity, that's organizing an army to defeat somebody.
1303.author: Mojo Nixon

1304.text: Fear has nothing to do with cowardice. A fellow is only yellow when he lets his fear make him quit.
1304.author: Jerome Cady

1305.text: There's no fear when you're having fun.
1305.author: Will Thomas

1306.text: I was trying to talk about where we are right now as a society, and talk about the fear we all live in, and certainly since 9-11, how it's affected us and the world.
1306.author: Paul Haggis

1307.text: I don't want to wake up and be bored. That's probably my greatest fear is to have nothing to do. What better job is there than to play quarterback for an NFL team, and certainly one that I've been on for a long time and had success with? I don't plan on giving it up any time soon.
1307.author: Tom Brady

1308.text: I think one of the terrible things today is that people have this deathly fear of food: fear of eggs, say, or fear of butter. Most doctors feel that you can have a little bit of everything.
1308.author: Julia Child

1310.text: Whether you like it or not, you're forced to come to the realisation that death is out there. But I don't fear death, I'm a fatalist. I believe when it's your time, that's it. It's the hand you're dealt.
1310.author: Clint Eastwood

1311.text: The scariest thought in the world is that someday I'll wake up and realize I've been sleepwalking through my life: underappreciating the people I love, making the same hurtful mistakes over and over, a slave to neuroses, fear, and the habitual.
1311.author: George Saunders

1312.text: I do support artists standing by their beliefs and walking with integrity. We have to find a better way to commercially exploit music while giving artists their proper respect. This cannot be done while taking their contributions for granted or trying to control the scope of their growth and power through threats and fear tactics.
1312.author: Lauryn Hill

1313.text: To me, my biggest fear is getting a big head, and that is when I get the hammer. Because it's very easy in this game to believe you're something special.
1313.author: Keith Richards

1315.text: I've always felt that if you back down from a fear, the ghost of that fear never goes away. It diminishes people.
1315.author: Hugh Jackman

1316.text: Finally, a good prosecutor knows that her job is to enforce the law without fear or favor. Likewise, a Supreme Court Justice must interpret the laws without fear or favor.
1316.author: Amy Klobuchar

1317.text: To drive an F1 car you have to be a little mad. On the morning of a race there's a mix of excitement and fear. If it's a wet track, then it's worse as you're not in control most of the time, which is the thing all drivers fear the most.
1317.author: Jenson Button

1318.text: We, the people. Manifest Destiny. Conceived in liberty. Fear itself. Ask not. Morning in America. United we stand. Yes, we can. In times of great change and tumult, presidents seek to inspire beleaguered Americans by reminding them of their national identity.
1318.author: Ron Fournier

1319.text: Many a time freedom has been rolled back - and always for the same sorry reason: fear.
1319.author: Molly Ivins

1320.text: I'd like to jump out of a plane. I have a fear of heights I'd like to face.
1320.author: Freida Pinto

1321.text: I've never told anyone this. But I suffer from terrible stage fright. True. You can't tell though, can you? Unbelievable, the panic. I nearly die of fear before I go on stage. Something wicked. I can't eat a thing the day before a gig. It'd make me vomit.
1321.author: John Lydon

1322.text: My biggest fear is mindlessly and stupidly repeating myself.
1322.author: John Lydon

1323.text: When someone fears losing your affection, he or she will strive to keep it. Perhaps you have strived to keep someone's affection, too. Fear of loss is not love.
1323.author: Gary Zukav

1324.text: Whatever hardships there have been in my life I still live in a very privileged position. Fear is not knowing where your next meal is coming from. Fear is seeing a child get hurt. Fear is watching someone you love waste away. Fear is knowing you are going to die yourself. But there's no fear in what I do. I write books.
1324.author: James Frey

1325.text: Most of us experience a life full of wonderful moments and difficult moments. But for many of us, even when we are most joyful, there is fear behind our joy.
1325.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

1326.text: People have a hard time letting go of their suffering. Out of a fear of the unknown, they prefer suffering that is familiar.
1326.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

1327.text: All art is an intensely vulnerable gesture, and it is made with no small amounts of risk, and fear. So, I have plenty of sympathy for self-defense mechanisms, especially among artists.
1327.author: Steven Erikson

1328.text: Shyness is about the fear of social judgments - at a job interview or a party you might be excessively worried about what people think of you. Whereas an introvert might not feel any of those things at all, they simply have the preference to be in a quieter setting.
1328.author: Susan Cain

1329.text: If there is anything besides the Self there is reason to fear? Who sees the second? First, the ego arises and sees objects as external. If the ego does not rise, the Self alone exists and there is no second.
1329.author: Ramana Maharshi

1330.text: I have stepped outside my comfort zone enough to know that, yes, the world does fall apart, but not in the way that you fear.
1330.author: Tan Le

1331.text: Mediocrity scares me. It's the fear of not being as good as you want to be. If you give over to that fear, it will sabotage you. As much as I can, I try to use that fear to guide me.
1331.author: Chris Pine

1332.text: When the AIDS epidemic broke, because I happened to be a science nerd and knew a lot about viruses and a lot about that virus at the time, I felt a moral obligation to go out and try to stem the fear and get out and explain to people what the disease was and how it worked.
1332.author: Morgan Fairchild

1333.text: When you don't have anything to lose, you discover something wonderful: you're free to take great risks without fear or reservation.
1333.author: Tullian Tchividjian

1334.text: I don't have a fear of becoming a parent, but I do have a fear of taking care of a newborn because they are so tiny and vulnerable.
1334.author: Lindsay Price

1335.text: Fear is an underrated emotion. And that's why I think it's very dangerous to try and cosset children from it. A healthy scare is as good as as a healthy laugh. In fact, they're two sides of the same coin. There is a desire to shield from the knocks and bumps of reality.
1335.author: Mark Gatiss

1336.text: I am always scared before going on stage; this is the fear which makes me do well.
1336.author: Kapil Sharma

1337.text: The topic of leadership is a touchy one. A lot of leaders fail because they don't have the bravery to touch that nerve or strike that chord. Throughout my years, I haven't had that fear.
1337.author: Kobe Bryant

1338.text: I really believed that fear is contagious.
1338.author: Joel Osteen

1339.text: Civilization must stand up and combat the current collapse of governance, the rise of violence, and the spread of chaos and fear in many parts of the world.
1339.author: Rudy Giuliani

1340.text: Why are people afraid of ghosts? 'Ooh, no, I wouldn't want to see one! I'd be too scared' - accompanied by a tremolo of fear in the voice - is the common reaction. This puzzles me. I'd think anyone would welcome he opportunity. I've never heard of a ghost hurting anybody.
1340.author: Dick Cavett

1341.text: In Israel, waves of anger and fear circulate all the time, but so do jokes and gossip and silky evening breezes. So, too, in America.
1341.author: P. J. O'Rourke

1342.text: The purpose of torture is not getting information. It's spreading fear.
1342.author: Eduardo Galeano

1343.text: Throughout the ages, Christians have adapted John of Patmos's visions to changing times, reading their own social, political and religious conflicts into the cosmic war he so powerfully evokes. Yet his Book of Revelation appeals not only to fear and desires for vengeance but also to hope.
1343.author: Elaine Pagels

1344.text: I do not fear truth. I welcome it. But I wish all of my facts to be in their proper context.
1344.author: Gordon B. Hinckley

1345.text: The raccoons, foxes, beavers, chinchillas, minks, rabbits, and yes, sometimes even dogs and cats that are killed for fur are not very different from your beloved dog or cat. They all have eyes, ears and hearts. They all experience pain when they are physically maimed. They shake with fear when they experience terror.
1345.author: Jane Velez-Mitchell

1346.text: The process of spotting fear and refusing to obey it is the source of all true empowerment.
1346.author: Martha Beck

1347.text: From racial profiling and being pulled over just for 'driving while black' to this new phenomenon of killing unarmed people out of some preconceived idea of fear, our lives and our children's lives are not being valued.
1347.author: Al Sharpton

1348.text: I'm a De Niro fan. I went eleven years without seeing a movie; the last one before that, February 1980, was De Niro and Scorsese in 'Raging Bull,' and when I went back, it was 'Cape Fear,' with De Niro and Scorsese. I picked up right where I left off at.
1348.author: August Wilson

1349.text: With each assignment, I weigh the looming possibility of being killed, and I chastise myself for allowing fear to hinder me. War photographers aren't supposed to get scared.
1349.author: Lynsey Addario

1350.text: Your timeless self does not age and has no fear of the future. Contemplate your physical self and all its possessions, and practice laughing peacefully at it all.
1350.author: Wayne Dyer

1351.text: So much of Hollywood is this kind of overly machismo, nonsensical view of masculinity, which I just don't find honest. I think it's this idea of - you know, we're told, well, 'Be a man, be a man.' But what does that mean, exactly? Does that mean you can't carry yourself with any fear? That you can't acknowledge that you're scared?
1351.author: Joe Carnahan

1352.text: Men's most superficial feelings lead them to prefer cruel laws. Nevertheless, when they are subjected to them themselves, it is in each man's interest that they be moderate, because the fear of being injured is greater than the desire to injure.
1352.author: Cesare Beccaria

1353.text: On every front there are clear answers out there that can make this country stronger, but we're going to break through the fear and the frustration people are feeling. Our job is to make sure that even as we make progress, that we are also giving people a sense of hope and vision for the future.
1353.author: Barack Obama

1354.text: I was always afraid of dying. Always. It was my fear that made me learn everything I could about my airplane and my emergency equipment, and kept me flying respectful of my machine and always alert in the cockpit.
1354.author: Chuck Yeager

1356.text: To fight fear, act. To increase fear - wait, put off postpone.
1356.author: David Joseph Schwartz

1357.text: There are things which a man is afraid to tell even to himself, and every decent man has a number of such things stored away in his mind.
1357.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

1358.text: There is no such thing as paranoia. Your worst fears can come true at any moment.
1358.author: Hunter S. Thompson

1359.text: Boldness is a mask for fear, however great.
1359.author: John Dryden

1360.text: A nation that is afraid to let its people judge the truth and falsehood in an open market is a nation that is afraid of its people.
1360.author: John F. Kennedy

1361.text: If you let your fear of consequence prevent you from following your deepest instinct, your life will be safe, expedient and thin.
1361.author: Katharine Butler Hathaway

1362.text: Never be afraid to sit a while and think.
1362.author: Lorraine Hansberry

1363.text: A person's fears are lighter when the danger is at hand.
1363.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

1364.text: True nobility is exempt from fear.
1364.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

1365.text: Love is what we were born with. Fear is what we learned here.
1365.author: Marianne Williamson

1366.text: Having a child, that's always been my biggest fear. I want a child and I fear a child.
1366.author: Marilyn Monroe

1367.text: What is a fear of living? It's being preeminently afraid of dying. It is not doing what you came here to do, out of timidity and spinelessness. The antidote is to take full responsibility for yourself - for the time you take up and the space you occupy. If you don't know what you're here to do, then just do some good.
1367.author: Maya Angelou

1368.text: There is no passion so contagious as that of fear.
1368.author: Michel de Montaigne

1369.text: We lavish on animals the love we are afraid to show to people. They might not return it; or worse, they might.
1369.author: Mignon McLaughlin

1370.text: Fears are nothing more than a state of mind.
1370.author: Napoleon Hill

1371.text: True success is overcoming the fear of being unsuccessful.
1371.author: Paul Sweeney

1372.text: We consume our tomorrows fretting about our yesterdays.
1372.author: Persius

1373.text: I hasten to laugh at everything, for fear of being obliged to weep.
1373.author: Pierre Beaumarchais

1374.text: Nothing gives a fearful man more courage than another's fear.
1374.author: Umberto Eco

1375.text: I fear the Greeks, even when they bring gifts.
1375.author: Virgil

1376.text: We simply attempt to be fearful when others are greedy and to be greedy only when others are fearful.
1376.author: Warren Buffett

1377.text: He will never have true friends who is afraid of making enemies.
1377.author: William Hazlitt

1378.text: Pick the day. Enjoy it - to the hilt. The day as it comes. People as they come... The past, I think, has helped me appreciate the present - and I don't want to spoil any of it by fretting about the future.
1378.author: Audrey Hepburn

1379.text: This is all you have. This is not a dry run. This is your life. If you want to fritter it away with your fears, then you will fritter it away, but you won't get it back later.
1379.author: Laura Schlessinger

1380.text: Ultimately we know deeply that the other side of every fear is freedom.
1380.author: Marilyn Ferguson

1382.text: No good work is ever done while the heart is hot and anxious and fretted.
1382.author: Olive Schreiner

1383.text: As soon as the fear approaches near, attack and destroy it.
1383.author: Chanakya

1384.text: We should not fret for what is past, nor should we be anxious about the future; men of discernment deal only with the present moment.
1384.author: Chanakya

1385.text: At the end of the day, we must go forward with hope and not backward by fear and division.
1385.author: Jesse Jackson

1386.text: How strange this fear of death is! We are never frightened at a sunset.
1386.author: George MacDonald

1388.text: He who is overly attached to his family members experiences fear and sorrow, for the root of all grief is attachment. Thus one should discard attachment to be happy.
1388.author: Chanakya

1389.text: Follow the path of the unsafe, independent thinker. Expose your ideas to the danger of controversy. Speak your mind and fear less the label of 'crackpot' than the stigma of conformity.
1389.author: Thomas J. Watson

1390.text: Love will find a way through paths where wolves fear to prey.
1390.author: Lord Byron

1391.text: Power does not corrupt. Fear corrupts... perhaps the fear of a loss of power.
1391.author: John Steinbeck

1392.text: There are so many things to talk about between black people, Hispanic people, white people, gay people, men, women, it's all based on fear. We all have fears, this thing that stops us from embracing as we are one. We are never going to be one. People are messed up, but humor lets us see how ignorant we can be.
1392.author: Marlon Wayans

1394.text: You may be educated abroad, you may be a great scientist, politician, but you always have a sneaking fear that if you don't go to temples or do the ordinary things that you have been told to do, something evil might happen, so you conform. What happens to the mind that conforms? Investigate it, please.
1394.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

1395.text: There is no nation so powerful, as the one that obeys its laws not from principals of fear or reason, but from passion.
1395.author: Charles de Montesquieu

1396.text: African women in general need to know that it's OK for them to be the way they are - to see the way they are as a strength, and to be liberated from fear and from silence.
1396.author: Wangari Maathai

1397.text: I have a fear of things growing on things. I don't know where it came from. But I go hiking a lot, and sometimes I can't handle moss growing on trees or tumors on trees or mushrooms.
1397.author: Lara Jean Chorostecki

1398.text: You have to be sincere in your feelings. And fear is one of those, sometimes; doubt is one of those; jealousy, anger - all your emotions are not going to be considered the strong emotions; all of them are not going to be love, happiness, joy.
1398.author: Common

1399.text: Fear cannot be banished, but it can be calm and without panic; it can be mitigated by reason and evaluation.
1399.author: Vannevar Bush

1400.text: We should face reality and our past mistakes in an honest, adult way. Boasting of glory does not make glory, and singing in the dark does not dispel fear.
1400.author: Hussein of Jordan

1402.text: My motto is: feel the fear and do it anyway.
1402.author: Tamara Mellon

1403.text: We do not know what love is. We know the symptoms of it, the pleasure, the pain, the fear, the anxiety and so on. We try to solve the symptoms, which becomes a wandering in darkness. We spend our days and nights in this, and it is soon over in death.
1403.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

1404.text: Question with boldness even the existence of a God; because, if there be one, he must more approve of the homage of reason, than that of blind-folded fear.
1404.author: Thomas Jefferson

1405.text: Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.
1405.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

1407.text: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
1407.author: Mahatma Gandhi

1409.text: Many times, the decisions we make affect and hurt your closest friends and family the most. I have a lot of regrets in that regard. But God has forgiven me, which I am very thankful for. It has enabled me to forgive myself and move forward one day at a time.
1409.author: Lex Luger

1410.text: It's one of the greatest gifts you can give yourself, to forgive. Forgive everybody.
1410.author: Maya Angelou

1411.text: Never forget the three powerful resources you always have available to you: love, prayer, and forgiveness.
1411.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

1412.text: The heart of a mother is a deep abyss at the bottom of which you will always find forgiveness.
1412.author: Honore de Balzac

1413.text: Forgive your enemies, but never forget their names.
1413.author: John F. Kennedy

1414.text: Forgiveness is the final form of love.
