1414.author: Reinhold Niebuhr

1415.text: Forgiveness is a way of opening up the doors again and moving forward, whether it's a personal life or a national life.
1415.author: Hillary Clinton

1416.text: One forgives to the degree that one loves.
1416.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

1417.text: Forgiveness says you are given another chance to make a new beginning.
1417.author: Desmond Tutu

1418.text: To err is human; to forgive, divine.
1418.author: Alexander Pope

1419.text: Always forgive your enemies - nothing annoys them so much.
1419.author: Oscar Wilde

1420.text: Forgiveness is the fragrance that the violet sheds on the heel that has crushed it.
1420.author: Mark Twain

1421.text: Hate is self-destructive. If you hate somebody, you're not hurting the person you hate. You're hurting yourself. And that's a healing. Actually, it's a real healing, forgiveness.
1421.author: Louis Zamperini

1423.text: Forgiveness is the economy of the heart... forgiveness saves the expense of anger, the cost of hatred, the waste of spirits.
1423.author: Hannah More

1424.text: To forgive is to set a prisoner free and discover that the prisoner was you.
1424.author: Lewis B. Smedes

1425.text: Forgiveness is a virtue of the brave.
1425.author: Indira Gandhi

1426.text: I believe in Jesus Christ as my Lord and savior. I believe that Jesus died for my sins, and rose again, and that's my belief. I still don't know what 'Christian' means. I'm a follower of Christ, but I keep making a whole bunch of mistakes. And I thank God for forgiveness.
1426.author: Sherri Shepherd

1427.text: I can have peace of mind only when I forgive rather than judge.
1427.author: Gerald Jampolsky

1428.text: In the Bible it says they asked Jesus how many times you should forgive, and he said 70 times 7. Well, I want you all to know that I'm keeping a chart.
1428.author: Hillary Clinton

1429.text: Thank you, God, for this good life and forgive us if we do not love it enough.
1429.author: Garrison Keillor

1430.text: Forgive me my nonsense, as I also forgive the nonsense of those that think they talk sense.
1430.author: Robert Frost

1431.text: We cannot embrace God's forgiveness if we are so busy clinging to past wounds and nursing old grudges.
1431.author: T. D. Jakes

1432.text: Children begin by loving their parents; after a time they judge them; rarely, if ever, do they forgive them.
1432.author: Oscar Wilde

1433.text: On the Day of Atonement, Jews are commanded to seek forgiveness from the people we have hurt.
1433.author: Laura Schlessinger

1434.text: Let us not listen to those who think we ought to be angry with our enemies, and who believe this to be great and manly. Nothing is so praiseworthy, nothing so clearly shows a great and noble soul, as clemency and readiness to forgive.
1434.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

1435.text: Forgive, forget. Bear with the faults of others as you would have them bear with yours.
1435.author: Phillips Brooks

1436.text: Forgiveness is a funny thing. It warms the heart and cools the sting.
1436.author: William Arthur Ward

1437.text: You will know that forgiveness has begun when you recall those who hurt you and feel the power to wish them well.
1437.author: Lewis B. Smedes

1438.text: Only the brave know how to forgive... a coward never forgave; it is not in his nature.
1438.author: Laurence Sterne

1439.text: And you know, when you've experienced grace and you feel like you've been forgiven, you're a lot more forgiving of other people. You're a lot more gracious to others.
1439.author: Rick Warren

1440.text: I invite everyone to chose forgiveness rather than division, teamwork over personal ambition.
1440.author: Jean-Francois Cope

1441.text: Forgiveness is for yourself because it frees you. It lets you out of that prison you put yourself in.
1441.author: Louise L. Hay

1442.text: If Jesus Christ was who He claimed to be, and He did die on a cross at a point of time in history, then, for all history past and all history future it is relevant because that is the very focal point for forgiveness and redemption.
1442.author: Josh McDowell

1443.text: Forgiveness is indifference. Forgiveness is impossible while love lasts.
1443.author: Mary Boykin Chesnut

1444.text: Forgiveness is about empowering yourself, rather than empowering your past.
1444.author: T. D. Jakes

1445.text: The Dalai Lama's entire being is about peace and harmony, forgiveness and self-discipline. Those are qualities to be admired. I am really looking forward to meeting His Holiness.
1445.author: Joe Nichols

1446.text: If you don't believe God has forgiven you, you are actually saying that God needs to do more for your forgiveness, and that Jesus' sacrifice was not enough.
1446.author: Jud Wilhite

1447.text: The characteristics of an authentically empowered personality are humbleness, clarity, forgiveness and love.
1447.author: Gary Zukav

1448.text: To understand somebody else as a human being, I think, is about as close to real forgiveness as one can get.
1448.author: David Small

1449.text: Because forgiveness is like this: a room can be dank because you have closed the windows, you've closed the curtains. But the sun is shining outside, and the air is fresh outside. In order to get that fresh air, you have to get up and open the window and draw the curtains apart.
1449.author: Desmond Tutu

1450.text: All major religious traditions carry basically the same message, that is love, compassion and forgiveness the important thing is they should be part of our daily lives.
1450.author: Dalai Lama

1451.text: There is no revenge so complete as forgiveness.
1451.author: Josh Billings

1452.text: Forgive yourself for your faults and your mistakes and move on.
1452.author: Les Brown

1453.text: The practice of forgiveness is our most important contribution to the healing of the world.
1453.author: Marianne Williamson

1454.text: Forgiveness is not always easy. At times, it feels more painful than the wound we suffered, to forgive the one that inflicted it. And yet, there is no peace without forgiveness.
1454.author: Marianne Williamson

1456.text: Life is an adventure in forgiveness.
1456.author: Norman Cousins

1457.text: A winner rebukes and forgives; a loser is too timid to rebuke and too petty to forgive.
1457.author: Sydney J. Harris

1458.text: It is easier to forgive an enemy than to forgive a friend.
1458.author: William Blake

1459.text: Sweet mercy is nobility's true badge.
1459.author: William Shakespeare

1460.text: A mistake is always forgivable, rarely excusable and always unacceptable.
1460.author: Robert Fripp

1461.text: The bitterest tears shed over graves are for words left unsaid and deeds left undone.
1461.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

1462.text: How does one know if she has forgiven? You tend to feel sorrow over the circumstance instead of rage, you tend to feel sorry for the person rather than angry with him. You tend to have nothing left to say about it all.
1462.author: Clarissa Pinkola Estes

1463.text: When you are happy you can forgive a great deal.
1463.author: Princess Diana

1464.text: When you forgive, you in no way change the past - but you sure do change the future.
1464.author: Bernard Meltzer

1465.text: Never does the human soul appear so strong as when it foregoes revenge and dares to forgive an injury.
1465.author: Edwin Hubbel Chapin

1466.text: Acceptance and tolerance and forgiveness, those are life-altering lessons.
1466.author: Jessica Lange

1467.text: The ability to forgive is one of man's greatest achievements.
1467.author: Bryant H. McGill

1468.text: For me, forgiveness and compassion are always linked: how do we hold people accountable for wrongdoing and yet at the same time remain in touch with their humanity enough to believe in their capacity to be transformed?
1468.author: bell hooks

1469.text: It's toughest to forgive ourselves. So it's probably best to start with other people. It's almost like peeling an onion. Layer by layer, forgiving others, you really do get to the point where you can forgive yourself.
1469.author: Patty Duke

1470.text: I think we learn the most from imperfect relationships - things like forgiveness and compassion.
1470.author: Andrea Thompson

1471.text: When I was a kid I used to pray every night for a new bicycle. Then I realised that the Lord doesn't work that way so I stole one and asked Him to forgive me.
1471.author: Emo Philips

1472.text: Love in the real world means saying you're sorry 10 times a day.
1472.author: Kathie Lee Gifford

1473.text: Forgiveness is a gift you give yourself.
1473.author: Suzanne Somers

1474.text: The lesson is that you can still make mistakes and be forgiven.
1474.author: Robert Downey, Jr.

1475.text: Forgiveness is not a feeling - it's a decision we make because we want to do what's right before God. It's a quality decision that won't be easy and it may take time to get through the process, depending on the severity of the offense.
1475.author: Joyce Meyer

1476.text: We think that forgiveness is weakness, but it's absolutely not; it takes a very strong person to forgive.
1476.author: T. D. Jakes

1477.text: I think it is important that we rebuild an atmosphere of forgiveness and civility in every aspect of our lives.
1477.author: T. D. Jakes

1478.text: There is no forgiveness in nature.
1478.author: Ugo Betti

1479.text: The glory of Christianity is to conquer by forgiveness.
1479.author: William Blake

1480.text: There is no love without forgiveness, and there is no forgiveness without love.
1480.author: Bryant H. McGill

1481.text: If there are dreams about a beautiful South Africa, there are also roads that lead to their goal. Two of these roads could be named Goodness and Forgiveness.
1481.author: Nelson Mandela

1482.text: One important theme is the extent to which one can ever correct an error, especially outside any frame of religious forgiveness. All of us have done something we regret - how we manage to remove that from our conscience, or whether that's even possible, interested me.
1482.author: Ian Mcewan

1483.text: Here is the amazing thing about Easter; the Resurrection Sunday for Christians is this, that Christ in the dying moments on the cross gives us the greatest illustration of forgiveness possible.
1483.author: T. D. Jakes

1485.text: The Gospel offers forgiveness for the past, new life for the present, and hope for the future.
1485.author: John Sentamu

1487.text: Satan tries to counterfeit the work of God, and by doing this, he may deceive many. To make us lose hope, feel miserable like himself, and believe that we are beyond forgiveness, Satan might even misuse words from the scriptures that emphasize the justice of God in order to imply that there is no mercy.
1487.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf

1488.text: Love is an act of endless forgiveness, a tender look which becomes a habit.
1488.author: Peter Ustinov

1489.text: In the evening of life we shall be judged on love, and not one of us is going to come off very well, and were it not for my absolute faith in the loving forgiveness of my Lord I could not call on him to come.
1489.author: Madeleine L'Engle

1490.text: Anger ventilated often hurries towards forgiveness; anger concealed often hardens into revenge.
1490.author: Edward G. Bulwer-Lytton

1491.text: I ask the people of Connecticut for their forgiveness, I should have paid more attention to people around me and people that I trusted but I am sorry for my actions and take full responsibility.
1491.author: John Rowland

1492.text: I have to ask Allah's forgiveness and not get angry, because they come to me out of love, and it's not fitting that I should turn to them in hatred.
1492.author: Abdul Qadeer Khan

1493.text: The first step in forgiveness is the willingness to forgive.
1493.author: Marianne Williamson

1494.text: I think the first step is to understand that forgiveness does not exonerate the perpetrator. Forgiveness liberates the victim. It's a gift you give yourself.
1494.author: T. D. Jakes

1495.text: If I say, 'I forgive you,' I have implicitly said you have done something wrong to me. But what forgiveness is at its heart is both saying that justice has been violated and not letting that violation count against the offender.
1495.author: Miroslav Volf

1496.text: Sin and forgiveness and falling and getting back up and losing the pearl of great price in the couch cushions but then finding it again, and again, and again? Those are the stumbling steps to becoming Real, the only script that's really worth following in this world or the one that's coming.
1496.author: Brennan Manning

1497.text: If you are bitter, you are like a dry leaf that you can just squash, and you can get blown away by the wind. There is much more wisdom in forgiveness.
1497.author: Vusi Mahlasela

1498.text: I really do believe that God is love, one of deep affection and grace and forgiveness and inspiration.
1498.author: William P. Young

1499.text: I did once seriously think of embracing the Christian faith. The gentle figure of Christ, so full of forgiveness that he taught his followers not to retaliate when abused or struck, but to turn the other cheek - I thought it was a beautiful example of the perfect man.
1499.author: Mahatma Gandhi

1500.text: Forgive those who have hurt you.
1500.author: Les Brown

1501.text: Forgiveness is an act of the will, and the will can function regardless of the temperature of the heart.
1501.author: Corrie Ten Boom

1502.text: God's forgiveness allows us to be honest with ourselves. We recognize our imperfections, admit our failures, and plead to God for clemency.
1502.author: Jonathan Sacks

1503.text: In Christ we see a maturity of love that flowers in self-sacrifice and forgiveness; a maturity of power that never swerves from the ideal of service; a maturity of goodness that overcomes every temptation, and, of course, we see the ultimate victory of life over death itself.
1503.author: Vincent Nichols

1504.text: When you make a mistake and the devil comes and tells you 'You're no good,' you don't have to take on the guilt and condemnation he wants to put on you. No! You can immediately confess your mistake to God, thank Him for forgiving you and cleansing you with the blood of Jesus, and move forward in the victory of His grace and forgiveness.
1504.author: Joyce Meyer

1505.text: Well, I've never left my faith - but have I made a lot of mistakes? But was I fortunate that I was brought up in that Pentecostal church, where I heard about God's love and God's forgiveness.
1505.author: Billy Ray Cyrus

1506.text: And as I ask for your forgiveness, I also ask for your support to keep all things in perspective and keep all things in proportion. The good of nine years versus the bad.
1506.author: John Rowland

1507.text: These subsidies from four European governments, which include aircraft launch assistance, capital injections, debt forgiveness, have enabled Airbus to develop and range market airliners well below cost.
1507.author: Norm Dicks

1508.text: And the only thing to do with a sin is to confess, do penance and then, after some kind of decent interval, ask for forgiveness.
1508.author: Joseph J. Ellis

1509.text: As we hone the ability to let go of distraction, to begin again without rancor or judgment, we are deepening forgiveness and compassion for ourselves. And in life, we find we might make a mistake, and more easily begin again, or stray from our chosen course and begin again.
1509.author: Sharon Salzberg

1510.text: I desired to become a Christian, and prayed earnestly for the forgiveness of my sins. I felt a peace of mind resulting, and loved every one, feeling desirous that all should have their sins forgiven, and love Jesus as I did.
1510.author: Ellen G. White

1511.text: One of the things that Dostoevsky talks about is that no character is too high to fall and no character is too low to be redeemed. 'Crime and Punishment' began with a person going out and consciously becoming a cold-blooded murderer, and it took 800 pages and an epilogue before the person finally asked for forgiveness.
1511.author: Jeffrey Bell

1512.text: One of the secrets of a long and fruitful life is to forgive everybody everything everynight before you go to bed.
1512.author: Bernard Baruch

1513.text: I shall be an autocrat: that's my trade. And the good Lord will forgive me: that's his.
1513.author: Catherine the Great

1514.text: God forgive you, but I never can.
1514.author: Elizabeth I

1515.text: Before we can forgive one another, we have to understand one another.
1515.author: Emma Goldman

1516.text: If there is something to pardon in everything, there is also something to condemn.
1516.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

1518.text: Forgiveness is like faith. You have to keep reviving it.
1518.author: Mason Cooley

1519.text: The stupid neither forgive nor forget; the naive forgive and forget; the wise forgive but do not forget.
1519.author: Thomas Szasz

1520.text: Inner peace can be reached only when we practice forgiveness. Forgiveness is letting go of the past, and is therefore the means for correcting our misperceptions.
1520.author: Gerald Jampolsky

1521.text: Certainly people make mistakes in their life. I'm no different, I've made mistakes. When people mess up, we forgive them. When I mess up, I ask for forgiveness.
1521.author: Michele Bachmann

1522.text: There would be no need for love if perfection were possible. Love arises from our imperfection, from our being different and always in need of the forgiveness, encouragement and that missing half of ourselves that we are searching for, as the Greek myth tells us, in order to complete ourselves.
1522.author: Eugene Kennedy

1523.text: It seems to me like Mother Nature's mercy and forgiveness have run dry, as we ceaselessly abuse her and take her for granted in order for us to continue our addiction to using fossil fuels. I've gotta say, I don't blame her. Not one bit.
1523.author: Gloria Reuben

1524.text: It is never too late to strengthen the foundation of faith. There is always time. With faith in the Savior, you can repent and plead for forgiveness. There is someone you can forgive. There is someone you can thank. There is someone you can serve and lift. You can do it wherever you are and however alone and deserted you may feel.
1524.author: Henry B. Eyring

1525.text: It is always the case that when the Christian looks back, he is looking at the forgiveness of sins.
1525.author: Karl Barth

1526.text: God created us for love, for union, for forgiveness and compassion and, yet, that has not been our storyline. That has not been our history.
1526.author: Richard Rohr

1527.text: Your heart has to be prepared ahead of time through faith and prayer and grace and mercy and love and forgiveness so you can keep your heart open in hell, when hell happens.
1527.author: Richard Rohr

1528.text: Forgiveness is not a one-time thing that happened the day you received Christ. It is an everyday thing, for the rest of your life.
1528.author: Joyce Meyer

1529.text: The power of forgiveness is huge; it is really big, and it can save this world.
1529.author: Immaculee Ilibagiza

1530.text: I could see that it was God's forgiveness and His mercy that I needed, and that was provided through Christ on the Cross for those who will receive Him as Lord and Savior. That is how I came to Christ.
1530.author: Kirk Cameron

1531.text: I thank the Lord for the great principle of repentance and forgiveness.
1531.author: Gordon B. Hinckley

1532.text: The blood of Christ covers all of our sins, but each of us must do personal business with God in order to experience his forgiveness.
1532.author: Lewis B. Smedes

1533.text: A prayer that must have a cannon behind it better never be uttered. Forgiveness ought not to go in partnership with shot and shell. Love need not carry knives and revolvers.
1533.author: Robert Green Ingersoll

1534.text: Forgiveness is the answer to the child's dream of a miracle by which what is broken is made whole again, what is soiled is made clean again.
1534.author: Dag Hammarskjold

1535.text: Forgiveness is the needle that knows how to mend.
1535.author: Jewel

1536.text: Christians - whether as a priest, a nun, a minister, whatever - have just been stereotyped to death. You try to be a model of kindness and love and forgiveness to all those around you, because you have received kindness and love and forgiveness from God through Christ. That's what Christianity is.
1536.author: Patricia Heaton

1537.text: God makes it really clear that society and civilization is really held together by the glue of families... When a man and a woman come together and say 'I do,' they are committing for a lifetime to love each other and to model what love is and what forgiveness is and what joy is to their kids.
1537.author: Kirk Cameron

1538.text: I deepen my experience of God through prayer, meditation, and forgiveness.
1538.author: Marianne Williamson

1539.text: I am making amends and seeking forgiveness. My only hope is that some good can come out of my situation.
1539.author: Jayson Blair

1540.text: Choosing forgiveness opens the door of your heart and makes way for a miracle in your life.
1540.author: Victoria Osteen

1541.text: For the millions of Americans, like my family, who believe that there is a creator God who can be known personally, Christmas is a celebration of Jesus' offer of love and forgiveness for all people.
1541.author: James Lankford

1542.text: When a deep injury is done us, we never recover until we forgive.
1542.author: Alan Paton

1543.text: God may forgive your sins, but your nervous system won't.
1543.author: Alfred Korzybski

1544.text: Selfishness must always be forgiven you know, because there is no hope of a cure.
1544.author: Jane Austen

1545.text: Forgive, O Lord, my little jokes on Thee, and I'll forgive Thy great big joke on me.
1545.author: Robert Frost

1546.text: Nothing inspires forgiveness quite like revenge.
1546.author: Scott Adams

1547.text: Holding on to anger, resentment and hurt only gives you tense muscles, a headache and a sore jaw from clenching your teeth. Forgiveness gives you back the laughter and the lightness in your life.
1547.author: Joan Lunden

1548.text: It's not an easy journey, to get to a place where you forgive people. But it is such a powerful place, because it frees you.
1548.author: Tyler Perry

1549.text: The remedy for life's broken pieces is not classes, workshops or books. Don't try to heal the broken pieces. Just forgive.
1549.author: Iyanla Vanzant

1550.text: Anger begets more anger, and forgiveness and love lead to more forgiveness and love.
1550.author: Mahavira

1551.text: The most important thing that I learned in growing up is that forgiveness is something that, when you do it, you free yourself to move on.
1551.author: Tyler Perry

1552.text: When I am able to resist the temptation to judge others, I can see them as teachers of forgiveness in my life, reminding me that I can only have peace of mind when I forgive rather than judge.
1552.author: Gerald Jampolsky

1553.text: Without forgiveness life is governed by... an endless cycle of resentment and retaliation.
1553.author: Roberto Assagioli

1554.text: I did a lot of things that I regretted and I certainly paid for my mistakes. You have to go and ask for forgiveness and it wasn't until I really started doing good and doing right, by other people as well as myself, that I really started to feel that guilt go away. So I don't have a problem going to sleep at night.
1554.author: Mark Wahlberg

1555.text: You can't legislate into existence an act of forgiveness and a true confession; those are mysteries of the human heart, and they occur between one individual and another individual, not a panel of judges sitting asking questions, trying to test your truth.
1555.author: Athol Fugard

1556.text: The full benefit of forgiveness of sin through the Savior's Atonement begins with repentance and baptism and then expands upon receiving the Holy Ghost.
1556.author: James E. Faust

1557.text: Without white South Africa realizing what it had done - and on the basis of that realization having the courage to ask for forgiveness - there can really be no significant movement.
1557.author: Athol Fugard

1558.text: I am 100% in the camp that says forgiveness is mostly about the forgiver.
1558.author: Hillary Clinton

1559.text: Murder is unique in that it abolishes the party it injures, so that society has to take the place of the victim and on his behalf demand atonement or grant forgiveness; it is the one crime in which society has a direct interest.
1559.author: W. H. Auden

1560.text: I would say the hierarchy has made terrible errors in judgment and it has to seek forgiveness by its members.
1560.author: William P. Leahy

1561.text: Well, of course I think people can be forgiven. But our justice system is not set up to dispense forgiveness. You can go to the local priest for that.
1561.author: Nancy Grace

1562.text: I love discussing social issues, but I'm not interested in scare tactics. I believe there is a way to bring awareness in tandem with forgiveness and love.
1562.author: Brie Larson

1563.text: I do not bring forgiveness with me, nor forgetfulness. The only ones who can forgive are dead; the living have no right to forget.
1563.author: Chaim Herzog

1564.text: It's far easier to forgive an enemy after you've got even with him.
1564.author: Olin Miller

1565.text: How unhappy is he who cannot forgive himself.
1565.author: Publilius Syrus

1566.text: I never forgive, but I always forget.
1566.author: Arthur Balfour

1567.text: My desire is to be a forgiving, non-judgmental person.
1567.author: Janine Turner

1568.text: Forgiveness really is so misunderstood, as well as the power it can release in an individual.
1568.author: Jennifer O'Neill

1569.text: Sometimes I see myself fine, sometimes I need a witness. And I like the whole truth, but there are nights I only need forgiveness.
1569.author: Dar Williams

1570.text: I discipline churchgoers with godly lessons and sharp words if they do not change their ways. My goal is to open their hearts so that they seek forgiveness.
1570.author: William Brewster

1571.text: On a level of simple personal survival, understanding and forgiveness are crucial... whether in an intimate personal relationship or on a global level.
1571.author: Edward Albert

1572.text: My desire is to stand up and brush myself off when I make mistakes and ask for forgiveness.
1572.author: Janine Turner

1573.text: Forgiveness isn't about condoning what has happened to you or someone else's actions against you.
1573.author: Jennifer O'Neill

1574.text: To sin offers repentance and forgiveness; not to sin offers only punishment.
1574.author: Jose Bergamin

1575.text: I like cast iron coated with enamel for longevity and forgiveness if I happen to take my eyes off the prize while pouring Chianti.
1575.author: Mario Batali

1576.text: 'Caught' is a novel of forgiveness, and the past and the present - who should be and who shouldn't be forgiven. None of my books are ever just about thrills, or it won't work.
1576.author: Harlan Coben

1577.text: Jesus' own witness of sacrificial love and forgiveness, and his work to heal the sick and care for those in need, represent God's ways and vision for us.
1577.author: Adam Hamilton

1578.text: I believe forgiveness is possible for everybody, for everything, but I'm a Buddhist.
1578.author: Alan Ball

1579.text: Paula Deen is a human being. She deserves forgiveness and a chance at redemption as much as anyone else. America is about redemption.
1579.author: Don Lemon

1580.text: The principle that certain sins should not receive the Church's testimony of forgiveness was probably no novelty at all, but had been applied in various churches; perhaps, however, with no strict consistency.
1580.author: Robert Rainy

1581.text: I believe the Scriptures teach that there's a literal heaven and a literal hell, just like Jesus said. And without forgiveness of sins that, yeah, the place of punishment is called hell.
1581.author: Kirk Cameron

1582.text: I have sinned against You, my Lord, and I would ask that your precious blood would wash and cleanse every stain until it is in the seas of God's forgiveness.
1582.author: Jimmy Swaggart

1583.text: Our history is an inevitable component of our being. One thing only can release us from the grip of our history. That one thing is forgiveness.
1583.author: Lewis B. Smedes

1584.text: In 2006, 2 years ago, I made a very serious mistake. A mistake that I am responsible for and no one else. In 2006, I told Elizabeth about the mistake, asked her for her forgiveness, asked God for his forgiveness.
1584.author: John Edwards

1585.text: He that cannot forgive others breaks the bridge over which he must pass himself; for every man has need to be forgiven.
1585.author: Thomas Fuller

1586.text: Can you really forgive if you can't forget?
1586.author: Sarah Jessica Parker

1587.text: I pray for forgiveness. For help and guidance. To be a better person. For the health of my family. For the world to be a better place.
1587.author: Tyson Fury

1588.text: Beware of the man who does not return your blow: he neither forgives you nor allows you to forgive yourself.
1588.author: George Bernard Shaw

1589.text: Amnesty is the forgiveness of something. Amnesty is anything that says, 'Do it illegally, it will be cheaper and easier.'
1589.author: Marco Rubio

1590.text: We often forgive those who bore us, but we cannot forgive those whom we bore.
1590.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

1591.text: Man has two great spiritual needs. One is for forgiveness. The other is for goodness.
1591.author: Billy Graham

1592.text: Every year during their High Holy Days, the Jewish community reminds us all of our need for repentance and forgiveness.
1592.author: Billy Graham

1593.text: To confer dignity, forgive. To express contempt, forget.
1593.author: Mason Cooley

1594.text: Yes, one can repent of moral transgression. The miracle of forgiveness is real, and true repentance is accepted of the Lord.
1594.author: Ezra Taft Benson

1595.text: If I owe Smith ten dollars and God forgives me, that doesn't pay Smith.
1595.author: Robert Green Ingersoll

1596.text: I read everything, but generally more fact than fiction - especially autobiographies and biographies. I've read 'Long Walk to Freedom' by Nelson Mandela at least twice on holiday. Every time, I'm totally awed by his vision, strength and forgiveness. I feel honoured to have got to know him and his wonderful wife Graca over the years.
1596.author: Richard Branson

1597.text: It's only through Christ that we can take full advantage of God's mercy and forgiveness through repentance in Jesus' name.
1597.author: Monica Johnson

1598.text: Just knowing you don't have the answers is a recipe for humility, openness, acceptance, forgiveness, and an eagerness to learn - and those are all good things.
1598.author: Dick Van Dyke

1599.text: Forgiveness is the remission of sins. For it is by this that what has been lost, and was found, is saved from being lost again.
1599.author: Saint Augustine

1600.text: I clearly have done things that were wrong. I've clearly had to seek God's forgiveness.
1600.author: Newt Gingrich

1601.text: People have to render judgment. In my case, I've said upfront openly, I've made mistakes at times. I've had to go to God for forgiveness. I've had to seek reconciliation. But I'm also a 68-year-old grandfather, and I think people have to measure who I am now and whether I'm a person they can trust.
1601.author: Newt Gingrich

1602.text: As a practicing Catholic all my life, my faith and the church are never far from my mind. The lessons I learned in the church have structured the way I've approached my life and my career. They were lessons of grace, kindness, forgiveness, and compassion.
1602.author: Donna Brazile

1603.text: I can forgive, but I cannot forget, is only another way of saying, I will not forgive. Forgiveness ought to be like a cancelled note - torn in two, and burned up, so that it never can be shown against one.
1603.author: Henry Ward Beecher

1604.text: God pardons like a mother, who kisses the offense into everlasting forgiveness.
1604.author: Henry Ward Beecher

1605.text: If there are occasions when my grape turned into a raisin and my joy bell lost its resonance, please forgive me. Charge it to my head and not to my heart.
1605.author: Jesse Jackson

1606.text: Each life is unique. But for all, repentance will surely include passing through the portal of humble prayer. Our Father in Heaven can allow us to feel fully the conviction of our sins. He knows the depths of our remorse. He can then direct what we must do to qualify for forgiveness.
1606.author: Henry B. Eyring

1607.text: Forgiveness is that subtle thread that binds both love and friendship. Without forgiveness, you may not even have a child one day.
1607.author: George Foreman

1608.text: Most of us need time to work through pain and loss. We can find all manner of reasons for postponing forgiveness. One of these reasons is waiting for the wrongdoers to repent before we forgive them. Yet such a delay causes us to forfeit the peace and happiness that could be ours.
1608.author: James E. Faust

1609.text: If we can find forgiveness in our hearts for those who have caused us hurt and injury, we will rise to a higher level of self-esteem and well-being.
1609.author: James E. Faust

1610.text: The fact is there is forgiveness for those who seek God. And I believe in the power of redemption.
1610.author: Rick Perry

1611.text: It's important to recognize that forgiveness is more than mere words; it's a heart attitude that induces a spiritual transformation.
1611.author: Victoria Osteen

1612.text: I was born into a Christian family and brought up in a Lutheran church. My faith has been the center point of my life, really, since I was a child, but at 16 years of age, I fully surrendered my life over to Christ. At that point, as a teenager, I began to grasp the concept of Christ's true love and forgiveness.
1612.author: Michele Bachmann

1613.text: The ineffable joy of forgiving and being forgiven forms an ecstasy that might well arouse the envy of the gods.
1613.author: Elbert Hubbard

1614.text: Reversing your treatment of the man you have wronged is better than asking his forgiveness.
1614.author: Elbert Hubbard

1616.text: Before Nelson Mandela was arrested in 1962, he was an angry, relatively young man. He founded the ANC's military wing. When he was released, he surprised everyone because he was talking about reconciliation and forgiveness and not about revenge.
1616.author: Desmond Tutu

1617.text: Since I began my practice of Forgiveness Therapy, it's now instinctual for me to choose to eat like I love myself - instead of eating like I wanted to punish myself. Plus I've not only lost weight, I've lost the anger and anxiety I was feeling, and so I feel happier and calmer within.
1617.author: Karen Salmansohn

1618.text: Our lack of forgiveness makes us hate, and our lack of compassion makes us hard-hearted. Pride in our hearts makes us resentful and keeps our memory in a constant whirlwind of passion and self-pity.
1618.author: Mother Angelica

1619.text: We have to look at loan forgiveness to incentivise young people to pursue degrees in areas where we know we need help.
1619.author: Elizabeth Esty

1620.text: No amount of debt restructuring, even debt forgiveness, will help the Greeks achieve real prosperity. What they need is not short-term relief but, rather, a long-term cure.
1620.author: Edmund Phelps

1621.text: The people who did you wrong or who didn't quite know how to show up, you forgive them. And forgiving them allows you to forgive yourself too.
1621.author: Jane Fonda

1622.text: Forgive, son; men are men; they needs must err.
1622.author: Euripides

1623.text: The gospel of Jesus Christ encompasses much more than avoiding, overcoming, and being cleansed from sin and the bad influences in our lives; it also essentially entails doing good, being good, and becoming better. Repenting of our sins and seeking forgiveness are spiritually necessary, and we must always do so.
1623.author: David A. Bednar

1624.text: I find forgiveness to be really healthy.
1624.author: Ben Affleck

1625.text: We believe that the farm should be building 'forgiveness' into the ecosystem. What does that mean? That a more forgiving ecosystem is one that can better handle drought, flood, disease, pestilence.
1625.author: Joel Salatin

1626.text: Asking for forgiveness is just one of the most painful kind of experiences.
1626.author: Nick Nolte

1627.text: Forgiveness is a big part of - especially post-civil rights movement - is a big part of African-American Christianity, and I wasn't raised within the Christian church; I wasn't raised within any church.
1627.author: Ta-Nehisi Coates

1628.text: You've just got to have a sense of respect for the person you have children with. Anger doesn't help anybody. Ultimately you have to say forgiveness is important, and honoring what you had together is important. But it's easy to say and harder to do.
1628.author: Nicole Kidman

1629.text: Every effort should be made to help build the new democratic nation with reconciliation and forgiveness, for the sake of Egypt and not for the benefit of a party or a group.
1629.author: Ahmed Zewail

1630.text: I believe in the forgiveness of sin and the redemption of ignorance.
1630.author: Adlai E. Stevenson

1631.text: Forgiveness is important in families, especially when there are so many secrets that need to be healed - for the most part, every family's got them.
1631.author: Tyler Perry

1632.text: I believe in forgiveness, I believe in second chances, and I believe we should find a way to restore the Second Amendment rights to people who are qualified and have shown themselves qualified to have those rights restored to them.
1632.author: Matt Bevin

1633.text: I learned a long time ago that some people would rather die than forgive. It's a strange truth, but forgiveness is a painful and difficult process. It's not something that happens overnight. It's an evolution of the heart.
1633.author: Sue Monk Kidd

1634.text: I learned a long time ago that some people would rather die than forgive. It's a strange truth, but forgiveness is a painful and difficult process.
1634.author: Sue Monk Kidd

1635.text: Forgiveness in any aspect of something that is complex is the greatest tool.
1635.author: Kate Hudson

1636.text: Forgiveness to the injured does belong; but they ne'er pardon who have done wrong.
1636.author: John Dryden

1637.text: Forgiveness is the key to action and freedom.
1637.author: Hannah Arendt

1638.text: He that cannot forgive others, breaks the bridge over which he himself must pass if he would ever reach heaven; for everyone has need to be forgiven.
1638.author: George Herbert

1639.text: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
1639.author: Euripides

1640.text: The greatest gift of life is friendship, and I have received it.
1640.author: Hubert H. Humphrey

1641.text: There are no strangers here; Only friends you haven't yet met.
1641.author: William Butler Yeats

1642.text: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into a friend.
1642.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

1643.text: Love is friendship that has caught fire. It is quiet understanding, mutual confidence, sharing and forgiving. It is loyalty through good and bad times. It settles for less than perfection and makes allowances for human weaknesses.
1643.author: Ann Landers

1644.text: Walking with a friend in the dark is better than walking alone in the light.
1644.author: Helen Keller

1645.text: There is nothing on this earth more to be prized than true friendship.
1645.author: Thomas Aquinas

1646.text: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.
1646.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

1647.text: A friend is what the heart needs all the time.
1647.author: Henry Van Dyke

1648.text: Friends are the siblings God never gave us.
1648.author: Mencius

1649.text: A real friend is one who walks in when the rest of the world walks out.
1649.author: Walter Winchell

1651.text: A friend is someone who gives you total freedom to be yourself.
1651.author: Jim Morrison

1652.text: Friendship is always a sweet responsibility, never an opportunity.
1652.author: Khalil Gibran

1653.text: I cannot even imagine where I would be today were it not for that handful of friends who have given me a heart full of joy. Let's face it, friends make life a lot more fun.
1653.author: Charles R. Swindoll

1654.text: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
1654.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

1655.text: Friendship... is not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything.
1655.author: Muhammad Ali

1656.text: A single rose can be my garden... a single friend, my world.
1656.author: Leo Buscaglia

1657.text: Remember that the most valuable antiques are dear old friends.
1657.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

1658.text: One loyal friend is worth ten thousand relatives.
1658.author: Euripides

1659.text: We're born alone, we live alone, we die alone. Only through our love and friendship can we create the illusion for the moment that we're not alone.
1659.author: Orson Welles

1660.text: True friendship multiplies the good in life and divides its evils. Strive to have friends, for life without friends is like life on a desert island... to find one real friend in a lifetime is good fortune; to keep him is a blessing.
1660.author: Baltasar Gracian

1661.text: The greatest healing therapy is friendship and love.
1661.author: Hubert H. Humphrey

1662.text: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy, they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
1662.author: Marcel Proust

1663.text: Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend.
1663.author: Albert Camus

1665.text: In everyone's life, at some time, our inner fire goes out. It is then burst into flame by an encounter with another human being. We should all be thankful for those people who rekindle the inner spirit.
1665.author: Albert Schweitzer

1667.text: In the sweetness of friendship let there be laughter, and sharing of pleasures. For in the dew of little things the heart finds its morning and is refreshed.
1667.author: Khalil Gibran

1668.text: I never considered a difference of opinion in politics, in religion, in philosophy, as cause for withdrawing from a friend.
1668.author: Thomas Jefferson

1669.text: When we honestly ask ourselves which person in our lives means the most to us, we often find that it is those who, instead of giving advice, solutions, or cures, have chosen rather to share our pain and touch our wounds with a warm and tender hand.
1669.author: Henri Nouwen

1670.text: Friendship is the shadow of the evening, which increases with the setting sun of life.
1670.author: Jean de La Fontaine

1671.text: A true friend is one who overlooks your failures and tolerates your success!
1671.author: Doug Larson

1673.text: Love is blind; friendship closes its eyes.
1673.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

1675.text: Do I not destroy my enemies when I make them my friends?
1675.author: Abraham Lincoln

1676.text: Rare as is true love, true friendship is rarer.
1676.author: Jean de La Fontaine

1678.text: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.
1678.author: Henry David Thoreau

1679.text: The bird a nest, the spider a web, man friendship.
1679.author: William Blake

1680.text: A tree is known by its fruit; a man by his deeds. A good deed is never lost; he who sows courtesy reaps friendship, and he who plants kindness gathers love.
1680.author: Saint Basil

1681.text: The most I can do for my friend is simply be his friend.
1681.author: Henry David Thoreau

1682.text: Friends and good manners will carry you where money won't go.
1682.author: Margaret Walker

1683.text: True friendship is like sound health; the value of it is seldom known until it is lost.
1683.author: Charles Caleb Colton

1684.text: True friends stab you in the front.
1684.author: Oscar Wilde

1685.text: Friends... they cherish one another's hopes. They are kind to one another's dreams.
1685.author: Henry David Thoreau

1686.text: Friendship is one mind in two bodies.
1686.author: Mencius

1687.text: If you have one true friend you have more than your share.
1687.author: Thomas Fuller

1688.text: It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages.
1688.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

1689.text: Love is like a friendship caught on fire. In the beginning a flame, very pretty, often hot and fierce, but still only light and flickering. As love grows older, our hearts mature and our love becomes as coals, deep-burning and unquenchable.
1689.author: Bruce Lee

1690.text: A true friend is someone who is there for you when he'd rather be anywhere else.
1690.author: Len Wein

1691.text: Each friend represents a world in us, a world not born until they arrive, and it is only by this meeting that a new world is born.
1691.author: Anais Nin

1692.text: A youth, when at home, should be filial and, abroad, respectful to his elders. He should be earnest and truthful. He should overflow in love to all and cultivate the friendship of the good. When he has time and opportunity, after the performance of these things, he should employ them in polite studies.
1692.author: Confucius

1693.text: The two most misused words in the entire English vocabulary are love and friendship. A true friend would die for you, so when you start trying to count them on one hand, you don't need any fingers.
1693.author: Larry Flynt

1694.text: Friendship multiplies the good of life and divides the evil.
1694.author: Baltasar Gracian

1695.text: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
1695.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

1696.text: I have learned that to be with those I like is enough.
1696.author: Walt Whitman

1697.text: I think it's important to have closure in any relationship that ends - from a romantic relationship to a friendship. You should always have a sense of clarity at the end and know why it began and why it ended. You need that in your life to move cleanly into your next phase.
1697.author: Jennifer Aniston

1699.text: Between men and women there is no friendship possible. There is passion, enmity, worship, love, but no friendship.
1699.author: Oscar Wilde

1701.text: True friendship ought never to conceal what it thinks.
1701.author: St. Jerome

1702.text: One look at an email can rob you of 15 minutes of focus. One call on your cell phone, one tweet, one instant message can destroy your schedule, forcing you to move meetings, or blow off really important things, like love, and friendship.
1702.author: Jacqueline Leo

1704.text: A true friend never gets in your way unless you happen to be going down.
1704.author: Arnold H. Glasow

1705.text: The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing... not healing, not curing... that is a friend who cares.
1705.author: Henri Nouwen

1706.text: Most people are enduring a marginalized isolation. One of the great obstacles to modern friendships is the 'religion of rush.' People are rushing all the time through time. Friendship takes time.
1706.author: John O'Donohue

1707.text: Never contract friendship with a man that is not better than thyself.
1707.author: Confucius

1708.text: Never make friends with people who are above or below you in status. Such friendships will never give you any happiness.
1708.author: Chanakya

1709.text: No person is your friend who demands your silence, or denies your right to grow.
1709.author: Alice Walker

1711.text: Depth of friendship does not depend on length of acquaintance.
1711.author: Rabindranath Tagore

1712.text: Friendship is two-sided. It isn't a friend just because someone's doing something nice for you. That's a nice person. There's friendship when you do for each other. It's like marriage - it's two-sided.
1712.author: John Wooden

1713.text: Friendship improves happiness and abates misery, by the doubling of our joy and the dividing of our grief.
1713.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

1714.text: A true friend freely, advises justly, assists readily, adventures boldly, takes all patiently, defends courageously, and continues a friend unchangeably.
1714.author: William Penn

1715.text: Only solitary men know the full joys of friendship. Others have their family; but to a solitary and an exile his friends are everything.
1715.author: Warren G. Harding

1716.text: Be slow in choosing a friend, slower in changing.
1716.author: Benjamin Franklin

1717.text: A friend is one who knows you and loves you just the same.
1717.author: Elbert Hubbard

1718.text: Since there is nothing so well worth having as friends, never lose a chance to make them.
1718.author: Francesco Guicciardini

1719.text: Be courteous to all, but intimate with few, and let those few be well tried before you give them your confidence.
1719.author: George Washington

1720.text: It's the friends you can call up at 4 a.m. that matter.
1720.author: Marlene Dietrich

1721.text: There is no friend like an old friend who has shared our morning days, no greeting like his welcome, no homage like his praise.
1721.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

1722.text: But friendship is precious, not only in the shade, but in the sunshine of life, and thanks to a benevolent arrangement the greater part of life is sunshine.
1722.author: Thomas Jefferson

1723.text: Sweet is the memory of distant friends! Like the mellow rays of the departing sun, it falls tenderly, yet sadly, on the heart.
1723.author: Washington Irving

1724.text: It seems to me that trying to live without friends is like milking a bear to get cream for your morning coffee. It is a whole lot of trouble, and then not worth much after you get it.
1724.author: Zora Neale Hurston

1725.text: There is a magnet in your heart that will attract true friends. That magnet is unselfishness, thinking of others first; when you learn to live for others, they will live for you.
1725.author: Paramahansa Yogananda

1727.text: There is some self-interest behind every friendship. There is no friendship without self-interests. This is a bitter truth.
1727.author: Chanakya

1728.text: Friendship will not stand the strain of very much good advice for very long.
1728.author: Robert Staughton Lynd

1729.text: Experts on romance say for a happy marriage there has to be more than a passionate love. For a lasting union, they insist, there must be a genuine liking for each other. Which, in my book, is a good definition for friendship.
1729.author: Marilyn Monroe

1731.text: Friendship may, and often does, grow into love, but love never subsides into friendship.
1731.author: Lord Byron

1732.text: Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love.
1732.author: Jane Austen

1733.text: If we listened to our intellect, we'd never have a love affair. We'd never have a friendship. We'd never go into business, because we'd be cynical. Well, that's nonsense. You've got to jump off cliffs all the time and build your wings on the way down.
1733.author: Ray Bradbury

1734.text: It is more shameful to distrust our friends than to be deceived by them.
1734.author: Confucius

1735.text: What I cannot love, I overlook. Is that real friendship?
1735.author: Anais Nin

1736.text: If there is such a thing as a good marriage, it is because it resembles friendship rather than love.
1736.author: Michel de Montaigne

1737.text: Few things tend more to alienate friendship than a want of punctuality in our engagements. I have known the breach of a promise to dine or sup to break up more than one intimacy.
1737.author: William Hazlitt

1738.text: On one side, citizens have great respect for the United States; they have a great feeling of friendship. That is solid. But in the opposition and in the political arena I often find criticism of the closeness of relations with the United States. That is a reality.
1738.author: Vicente Fox

1739.text: I have enjoyed most particularly reading the correspondence between Gustav Mahler and Richard Strauss. The genuine friendship, competitiveness and support that thread through their communications are life lessons for us all.
1739.author: Jessye Norman

1740.text: We call that person who has lost his father, an orphan; and a widower that man who has lost his wife. But that man who has known the immense unhappiness of losing a friend, by what name do we call him? Here every language is silent and holds its peace in impotence.
1740.author: Joseph Roux

1741.text: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.
1741.author: Oprah Winfrey

1742.text: An excellent man; he has no enemies; and none of his friends like him.
1742.author: Oscar Wilde

1743.text: A friendship can weather most things and thrive in thin soil; but it needs a little mulch of letters and phone calls and small, silly presents every so often - just to save it from drying out completely.
1743.author: Pam Brown

1744.text: She is a friend of mind. She gather me, man. The pieces I am, she gather them and give them back to me in all the right order. It's good, you know, when you got a woman who is a friend of your mind.
1744.author: Toni Morrison

1745.text: A friend in power is a friend lost.
1745.author: Henry Adams

1746.text: A friend should be one in whose understanding and virtue we can equally confide, and whose opinion we can value at once for its justness and its sincerity.
1746.author: Robert Hall

1747.text: Love is friendship set on fire.
1747.author: Jeremy Taylor

1748.text: Friendship always benefits; love sometimes injures.
1748.author: Seneca

1749.text: What sweetness is left in life, if you take away friendship? Robbing life of friendship is like robbing the world of the sun. A true friend is more to be esteemed than kinsfolk.
1749.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

1750.text: She discovered with great delight that one does not love one's children just because they are one's children but because of the friendship formed while raising them.
1750.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

1751.text: In my public service, I treasure my friendship with law enforcement officers. I admire what they do and support them in every aspect of their job. I have always looked upon law enforcement officers as my friends.
1751.author: Dirk Kempthorne

1752.text: Moral science is better occupied when treating of friendship than of justice.
1752.author: Thomas Aquinas

1753.text: Friendship is one of the most tangible things in a world which offers fewer and fewer supports.
1753.author: Kenneth Branagh

1754.text: For me my friendship with Omar Rodriguez from Mars Volta that friendship really means a lot to me because he's another creative person who works as hard as I do.
1754.author: John Frusciante

1755.text: Friendship is something that creates equality and mutuality, not a reward for finding equality or a way of intensifying existing mutuality.
1755.author: Rowan Williams

1757.text: The differences between friends cannot but reinforce their friendship.
1757.author: Mao Zedong

1759.text: I came to Venice for the first time in 1968 and was lucky enough to make the acquaintanceship, and then the friendship, of two Venetians, Roberta and Franco, who remain my best friends here after almost 50 years.
1759.author: Donna Leon

1760.text: I don't know if I've ever been in a clique. The older I've gotten, the more I've realized what a true friend really is. So my friendship circle has changed a bit.
1760.author: Aimee Teegarden

1761.text: As is natural with contiguous states having like institutions and like aims of advancement and development, the friendship of the United States and Mexico has been constantly maintained.
1761.author: Chester A. Arthur

1762.text: We come into relationships often very much identified with our needs. I need this, I need security, I need refuge, I need friendship. And all of relationships are symbiotic in that sense. We come together because we fulfill each others' needs at some level or other.
1762.author: Ram Dass

1763.text: The only things that are really permanent are love, family, friendship, and that is a lesson. At the end of the day, that's really what it boils down to. The rest of it is just stuff.
1763.author: Jared Kushner

1764.text: The love that comes from friendship is the underlying facet of a happy life.
1764.author: Chelsea Handler

1765.text: I've learned that friendship does not equate business, business does not equate friendship.
1765.author: Jill Scott

1766.text: A friend to all is a friend to none.
1766.author: Aristotle

1767.text: It is only the great hearted who can be true friends. The mean and cowardly, Can never know what true friendship means.
1767.author: Charles Kingsley

1768.text: Friendship needs no words - it is solitude delivered from the anguish of loneliness.
1768.author: Dag Hammarskjold

1769.text: A friend may well be reckoned the masterpiece of nature.
1769.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

1771.text: The best time to make friends is before you need them.
1771.author: Ethel Barrymore

1772.text: The real test of friendship is: can you literally do nothing with the other person? Can you enjoy those moments of life that are utterly simple?
1772.author: Eugene Kennedy

1773.text: Life has no blessing like a prudent friend.
1773.author: Euripides

1774.text: A true friend is the greatest of all blessings, and that which we take the least care of all to acquire.
1774.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

1775.text: Of all possessions a friend is the most precious.
1775.author: Herodotus

1776.text: When friendship disappears then there is a space left open to that awful loneliness of the outside world which is like the cold space between the planets. It is an air in which men perish utterly.
1776.author: Hilaire Belloc

1777.text: A friendship founded on business is better than a business founded on friendship.
1777.author: John D. Rockefeller

1778.text: It takes a long time to grow an old friend.
1778.author: John Leonard

1779.text: How delightful to find a friend in everyone.
1779.author: Joseph Brodsky

1780.text: Your friend is your needs answered.
1780.author: Khalil Gibran

1781.text: Let there be no purpose in friendship save the deepening of the spirit.
1781.author: Khalil Gibran

1782.text: A friend is, as it were, a second self.
1782.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

1783.text: It is important to our friends to believe that we are unreservedly frank with them, and important to friendship that we are not.
1783.author: Mignon McLaughlin

1784.text: Our most intimate friend is not he to whom we show the worst, but the best of our nature.
1784.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

1785.text: Without wearing any mask we are conscious of, we have a special face for each friend.
1785.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

1786.text: But friendship is the breathing rose, with sweets in every fold.
1786.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

1787.text: He has no enemies, but is intensely disliked by his friends.
1787.author: Oscar Wilde

1788.text: Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is far the best ending for one.
1788.author: Oscar Wilde

1789.text: The world is round so that friendship may encircle it.
1789.author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

1790.text: Nothing but heaven itself is better than a friend who is really a friend.
1790.author: Plautus

1791.text: I don't need a friend who changes when I change and who nods when I nod; my shadow does that much better.
1791.author: Plutarch

1792.text: False friendship, like the ivy, decays and ruins the walls it embraces; but true friendship gives new life and animation to the object it supports.
1792.author: Richard Burton

1793.text: A friend is a gift you give yourself.
1793.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

1794.text: The friend in my adversity I shall always cherish most. I can better trust those who helped to relieve the gloom of my dark hours than those who are so ready to enjoy with me the sunshine of my prosperity.
1794.author: Ulysses S. Grant

1795.text: Some people go to priests; others to poetry; I to my friends.
1795.author: Virginia Woolf

1796.text: When you choose your friends, don't be short-changed by choosing personality over character.
1796.author: W. Somerset Maugham

1797.text: My definition of a friend is somebody who adores you even though they know the things you're most ashamed of.
1797.author: Jodie Foster

1798.text: Instead of loving your enemies - treat your friends a little better.
1798.author: E. W. Howe

1799.text: To avoid being mistaken for a sellout, I chose my friends carefully. The more politically active black students. The foreign students. The Chicanos. The Marxist professors and structural feminists and punk-rock performance poets.
1799.author: Barack Obama

1801.text: As iron sharpens iron, so a friend sharpens a friend.
1801.author: King Solomon

1802.text: Lovers have a right to betray you... friends don't.
1802.author: Judy Holliday

1803.text: Friendship is the source of the greatest pleasures, and without friends even the most agreeable pursuits become tedious.
1803.author: Thomas Aquinas

1804.text: Loyalty and friendship, which is to me the same, created all the wealth that I've ever thought I'd have.
1804.author: Ernie Banks

1805.text: Look, I worked with American Republican presidents and Democratic presidents, all of them, and each of them has shown a deep and profound friendship to Israel, you know? I can't remember anybody who was in that sense negative as far as Israel is concerned.
1805.author: Shimon Peres

1806.text: Great is the victory, but the friendship of all is greater.
1806.author: Emil Zatopek

1807.text: Friendship is one of our most treasured relationships, but it isn't codified and celebrated; it's never going to give you a party.
1807.author: Hanya Yanagihara

1808.text: Friendship with ones self is all important, because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else in the world.
1808.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

1809.text: A friendship that like love is warm; A love like friendship, steady.
1809.author: Thomas Moore

1810.text: Friendship is but another name for an alliance with the follies and the misfortunes of others. Our own share of miseries is sufficient: why enter then as volunteers into those of another?
1810.author: Thomas Jefferson

1811.text: There is something in the unselfish and self-sacrificing love of a brute, which goes directly to the heart of him who has had frequent occasion to test the paltry friendship and gossamer fidelity of mere Man.
1811.author: Edgar Allan Poe

1812.text: Friendship often ends in love; but love in friendship - never.
1812.author: Charles Caleb Colton

1813.text: The essence of true friendship is to make allowance for another's little lapses.
1813.author: David Storey

1814.text: Music is the social act of communication among people, a gesture of friendship, the strongest there is.
1814.author: Malcolm Arnold

1815.text: Our scientific age demands that we provide definitions, measurements, and statistics in order to be taken seriously. Yet most of the important things in life cannot be precisely defined or measured. Can we define or measure love, beauty, friendship, or decency, for example?
1815.author: Dennis Prager

1816.text: The second one, the joint Truth and Friendship Commission, which we started now with Indonesia, that is the one that has been criticized; its terms of reference call for providing amnesty for those who cooperate in telling the truth. It does not lead to prosecution.
1816.author: Jose Ramos-Horta

1817.text: Love is a friendship set to music.
1817.author: Joseph Campbell

1818.text: I had three chairs in my house; one for solitude, two for friendship, three for society.
1818.author: Henry David Thoreau

1819.text: Friendship is also about liking a person for their failings, their weakness. It's also about mutual help, not about exploitation.
1819.author: Paul Theroux

1820.text: If the chemistry is right between star and photographer and the geometry of the pictures pleases the star, often the two people end up with a long-term professional friendship during which they continue to work together and to produce highly personal images.
1820.author: Eve Arnold

1821.text: A friend is a beloved mystery; dearest always because he is not ourself, and has something in him which it is impossible for us to fathom. If it were not so, friendship would lose its chief zest.
1821.author: Lucy Larcom

1822.text: A traitor is a betrayer - one who practices injury, while professing friendship. Benedict Arnold was a traitor, solely because, while professing friendship for the American cause, he attempted to injure it. An open enemy, however criminal in other respects, is no traitor.
1822.author: Lysander Spooner

1823.text: I really wasn't even aware that Batman and Superman had this kind of grudging friendship.
1823.author: Mark Valley

1824.text: Even an animal, if you show genuine affection, gradually trust develops... If you always showing bad face and beating, how can you develop friendship?
1824.author: Dalai Lama

1825.text: I define friendship as a bond that transcends all barriers. When you are ready to expect anything and everything from friends, good, bad or ugly... that's what I call true friendship.
1825.author: Harbhajan Singh

1827.text: The rule of friendship means there should be mutual sympathy between them, each supplying what the other lacks and trying to benefit the other, always using friendly and sincere words.
1827.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

1828.text: Friendship, of itself a holy tie, is made more sacred by adversity.
1828.author: Charles Caleb Colton

1829.text: Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and have her nonsense respected.
1829.author: Charles Lamb

1830.text: Eros will have naked bodies; Friendship naked personalities.
1830.author: C. S. Lewis

1831.text: Friendship is the marriage of the soul, and this marriage is liable to divorce.
1831.author: Voltaire

1832.text: Good fellowship and friendship are lasting, rational and manly pleasures.
1832.author: William Wycherley

1833.text: There is no friendship, no love, like that of the parent for the child.
1833.author: Henry Ward Beecher

1834.text: I understand by this passion the union of desire, friendship, and tenderness, which is inflamed by a single female, which prefers her to the rest of her sex, and which seeks her possession as the supreme or the sole happiness of our being.
1834.author: Edward Gibbon

1835.text: Don't flatter yourselves that friendship authorizes you to say disagreeable things to your intimates. On the contrary, the nearer you come into relation with a person, the more necessary do tact and courtesy become.
1835.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

1836.text: Secrecy is the chastity of friendship.
1836.author: Jeremy Taylor

1837.text: Friendship is an arrangement by which we undertake to exchange small favors for big ones.
1837.author: Charles de Montesquieu

1838.text: Love is rarer than genius itself. And friendship is rarer than love.
1838.author: Charles Peguy

1839.text: Friendship is a pretty full-time occupation if you really are friendly with somebody. You can't have too many friends because then you're just not really friends.
1839.author: Truman Capote

1840.text: Friendship is a disinterested commerce between equals; love, an abject intercourse between tyrants and slaves.
1840.author: Oliver Goldsmith

1841.text: To cement a new friendship, especially between foreigners or persons of a different social world, a spark with which both were secretly charged must fly from person to person, and cut across the accidents of place and time.
1841.author: Cornelia Otis Skinner

1842.text: Happiness is understanding that friendship is more precious than mere things, more precious than getting your own way, more precious than being in situations where true principles are not at stake.
1842.author: J. Donald Walters

1843.text: Friendship is a very taxing and arduous form of leisure activity.
1843.author: Mortimer Adler

1844.text: We became friends as we became a band. Our friendship evolved as the band evolved. It had its ups and downs, but it was mostly ups for the four of us. We got along well almost all of the time. Hey! We liked each other and we still do.
1844.author: Dave Blood

1845.text: My inspiration are the woman, friendship, and loneliness.
1845.author: Enrique Iglesias

1846.text: If one of two lovers is loyal, and the other jealous and false, how may their friendship last, for Love is slain!
1846.author: Marie de France

1847.text: I keep my friends as misers do their treasure, because, of all the things granted us by wisdom, none is greater or better than friendship.
1847.author: Pietro Aretino

1848.text: Love is the attempt to form a friendship inspired by beauty.
1848.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

1849.text: Even in the common affairs of life, in love, friendship, and marriage, how little security have we when we trust our happiness in the hands of others!
1849.author: William Hazlitt

1850.text: The best time to frame an answer to the letters of a friend, is the moment you receive them. Then the warmth of friendship, and the intelligence received, most forcibly cooperate.
1850.author: William Shenstone

1851.text: Do not keep on with a mockery of friendship after the substance is gone - but part, while you can part friends. Bury the carcass of friendship: it is not worth embalming.
1851.author: William Hazlitt

1852.text: My last public performance for money was in 1967. For free, it was 1972, with the exception of two little one-shot, one-song things. But that's just for friends, out of friendship for the people involved, and also because it was fun.
1852.author: Tom Lehrer

1853.text: Friendship is a wildly underrated medication.
1853.author: Anna Deavere Smith

1854.text: 'Shake It Up' definitely teaches kids about the importance of reaching for your dreams and setting high goals. It also teaches great lessons about friendship and family.
1854.author: Zendaya

1855.text: I definitely have guys that I'm friends with that I have a crush on, and you don't want to ruin the friendship.
1855.author: Miranda Cosgrove

1856.text: On the relationship side, if you teach people to respond actively and constructively when someone they care about has a victory, it increases love and friendship and decreases the probability of depression.
1856.author: Martin Seligman

1857.text: What drew me towards team sport were the camaraderie and friendship. The chance to celebrate victory and success with a group of other people is something I have enjoyed doing.
1857.author: Rahul Dravid

1858.text: It's the most exciting thing to watch God work when I've asked him about something, to listen to him and watch him work. It's like this friendship, and it just grows and grows and grows and grows.
1858.author: Charles R. Swindoll

1859.text: Primarily, 'Black Girl/White Girl' is the story of two very different, yet somehow 'fated' girls; for Genna, her 'friendship' with Minette is the most haunting of her life, though it is one-sided and ends in tragedy.
1859.author: Joyce Carol Oates

1860.text: When David Fincher called me up a few years ago and said, 'Hey, I'd like you to score this film 'The Social Network,' I said, 'I'm flattered, but I really don't have any real experience scoring films, and I'd rather not screw it up on a high-profile project. And I like you and I don't want to compromise our friendship.'
1860.author: Trent Reznor

1861.text: It is impossible to preserve my friendship with people who are allegedly leaders when they are attacking their own people, shooting at them, using tanks and other forms of heavy weaponry.
1861.author: Recep Tayyip Erdogan

1862.text: My aim is to create a happy society with genuine friendship. Friendship between Tibetan and Chinese peoples is very essential.
1862.author: Dalai Lama

1863.text: Friends confront each other sometimes, and sometimes the friendship lasts, and sometimes it doesn't.
1863.author: Brooke Elliott

1864.text: Taft was Roosevelt's handpicked successor. I didn't know how deep the friendship was between the two men until I read their almost four hundred letters, stretching back the to early '30s. It made me realize the heartbreak when they ruptured was much more than a political division.
1864.author: Doris Kearns Goodwin

1865.text: I'm friends with Taylor Swift, and I am tired of people asking me questions about our friendship. When I post a picture of us on Instagram, I'm posting a picture of me and my friend.
1865.author: Sarah Hyland

1867.text: I am deeply spiritual; I revel in those things that make for good - the things that we can do to shed a little light, to help place an oft-dissonant universe back in tune with itself... Long live art, long live friendship, long live the joy of life!
1867.author: Jessye Norman

1868.text: Fan the sinking flame of hilarity with the wing of friendship; and pass the rosy wine.
1868.author: Charles Dickens

1870.text: Friendship is a word, the very sight of which in print makes the heart warm.
1870.author: Augustine Birrell

1871.text: Never explain - your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway.
1871.author: Elbert Hubbard

1872.text: Nothing so fortifies a friendship as a belief on the part of one friend that he is superior to the other.
1872.author: Honore de Balzac

1873.text: People who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do.
1873.author: Isaac Asimov

1874.text: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.
1874.author: Elbert Hubbard

1875.text: Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.
1875.author: Margaret Mead

1876.text: We are all here on earth to help others; what on earth the others are here for I don't know.
1876.author: W. H. Auden

1877.text: A day without sunshine is like, you know, night.
1877.author: Steve Martin

1878.text: No man has a good enough memory to be a successful liar.
1878.author: Abraham Lincoln

1879.text: If you haven't got anything nice to say about anybody, come sit next to me.
1879.author: Alice Roosevelt Longworth

1880.text: Everything is funny, as long as it's happening to somebody else.
1880.author: Will Rogers

1881.text: Behind every great man is a woman rolling her eyes.
1881.author: Jim Carrey

1882.text: A woman's mind is cleaner than a man's: She changes it more often.
1882.author: Oliver Herford

1883.text: I may be drunk, Miss, but in the morning I will be sober and you will still be ugly.
1883.author: Winston Churchill

1884.text: Get your facts first, then you can distort them as you please.
1884.author: Mark Twain

1885.text: Go to Heaven for the climate, Hell for the company.
1885.author: Mark Twain

1886.text: Roses are red, violets are blue, I'm schizophrenic, and so am I.
1886.author: Oscar Levant

1887.text: My fake plants died because I did not pretend to water them.
1887.author: Mitch Hedberg

1888.text: I can resist everything except temptation.
1888.author: Oscar Wilde

1889.text: Wine is constant proof that God loves us and loves to see us happy.
1889.author: Benjamin Franklin

1890.text: Laugh and the world laughs with you, snore and you sleep alone.
1890.author: Anthony Burgess

1892.text: A successful man is one who makes more money than his wife can spend. A successful woman is one who can find such a man.
1892.author: Lana Turner

1893.text: I believe that if life gives you lemons, you should make lemonade... And try to find somebody whose life has given them vodka, and have a party.
1893.author: Ron White

1894.text: One advantage of talking to yourself is that you know at least somebody's listening.
1894.author: Franklin P. Jones

1895.text: I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by.
1895.author: Douglas Adams

1896.text: Too much agreement kills a chat.
1896.author: Eldridge Cleaver

1897.text: If you could kick the person in the pants responsible for most of your trouble, you wouldn't sit for a month.
1897.author: Theodore Roosevelt

1898.text: I'm sorry, if you were right, I'd agree with you.
1898.author: Robin Williams

1899.text: Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city.
1899.author: George Burns

1900.text: Trust is hard to come by. That's why my circle is small and tight. I'm kind of funny about making new friends.
1900.author: Eminem

1901.text: When you are courting a nice girl an hour seems like a second. When you sit on a red-hot cinder a second seems like an hour. That's relativity.
1901.author: Albert Einstein

1902.text: To succeed in life, you need three things: a wishbone, a backbone and a funny bone.
1902.author: Reba McEntire

1903.text: As far as I'm concerned, 'whom' is a word that was invented to make everyone sound like a butler.
1903.author: Calvin Trillin

1904.text: Laziness is nothing more than the habit of resting before you get tired.
1904.author: Jules Renard

1905.text: All generalizations are false, including this one.
1905.author: Mark Twain

1906.text: Drawing on my fine command of the English language, I said nothing.
1906.author: Robert Benchley

1907.text: I don't think anyone should write their autobiography until after they're dead.
1907.author: Samuel Goldwyn

1908.text: Progress is man's ability to complicate simplicity.
1908.author: Thor Heyerdahl

1910.text: I never liked you, and I always will.
1910.author: Samuel Goldwyn

1911.text: From there to here, and here to there, funny things are everywhere.
1911.author: Dr. Seuss

1912.text: If this is coffee, please bring me some tea; but if this is tea, please bring me some coffee.
1912.author: Abraham Lincoln

1913.text: Most comedy is based on getting a laugh at somebody else's expense. And I find that that's just a form of bullying in a major way. So I want to be an example that you can be funny and be kind, and make people laugh without hurting somebody else's feelings.
1913.author: Ellen DeGeneres

1915.text: Man cannot live by bread alone; he must have peanut butter.
1915.author: James A. Garfield

1916.text: Life would be tragic if it weren't funny.
1916.author: Stephen Hawking

1917.text: The trouble with having an open mind, of course, is that people will insist on coming along and trying to put things in it.
1917.author: Terry Pratchett

1918.text: I refuse to join any club that would have me as a member.
1918.author: Groucho Marx

1919.text: There cannot be a crisis next week. My schedule is already full.
1919.author: Henry A. Kissinger

1920.text: If women ran the world we wouldn't have wars, just intense negotiations every 28 days.
1920.author: Robin Williams

1921.text: I never said most of the things I said.
1921.author: Yogi Berra

1922.text: It's funny how most people love the dead, once you're dead, you're made for life.
1922.author: Jimi Hendrix

1923.text: It's simple, if it jiggles, it's fat.
1923.author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

1925.text: You can lead a man to Congress, but you can't make him think.
1925.author: Milton Berle
