1926.text: We are all born mad. Some remain so.
1926.author: Samuel Beckett

1928.text: A government that robs Peter to pay Paul can always depend on the support of Paul.
1928.author: George Bernard Shaw

1929.text: We owe a lot to Thomas Edison - if it wasn't for him, we'd be watching television by candlelight.
1929.author: Milton Berle

1930.text: We are supposed to enjoy the good stuff now, while we can, with the people we love. Life has a funny way of teaching us that lesson over and over again.
1930.author: Sheena Easton

1931.text: Nobody ever went broke underestimating the taste of the American public.
1931.author: H. L. Mencken

1932.text: What I am looking for is a blessing not in disguise.
1932.author: Jerome K. Jerome

1933.text: Between two evils, I always pick the one I never tried before.
1933.author: Mae West

1934.text: Design is a funny word. Some people think design means how it looks. But of course, if you dig deeper, it's really how it works.
1934.author: Steve Jobs

1935.text: Every time I see an adult on a bicycle, I no longer despair for the future of the human race.
1935.author: H. G. Wells

1936.text: As a child my family's menu consisted of two choices: take it or leave it.
1936.author: Buddy Hackett

1937.text: It's so different when you change your hair color, you're treated so differently. It's a very funny experience. It's fun - I love changing up my hair.
1937.author: Kate Bosworth

1938.text: I see fighters make funny videos about me and stick them on Facebook and get 20 likes. When I make a video, I sell it to Fox and make seven figures. That's the difference.
1938.author: Conor McGregor

1939.text: I'm undaunted in my quest to amuse myself by constantly changing my hair.
1939.author: Hillary Clinton

1940.text: I haven't spoken to my wife in years. I didn't want to interrupt her.
1940.author: Rodney Dangerfield

1941.text: Reality continues to ruin my life.
1941.author: Bill Watterson

1942.text: Smoking kills. If you're killed, you've lost a very important part of your life.
1942.author: Brooke Shields

1943.text: Everybody talks about the weather, but nobody does anything about it.
1943.author: Charles Dudley Warner

1945.text: One of the funny things about the stock market is that every time one person buys, another sells, and both think they are astute.
1945.author: William Feather

1946.text: I have never been hurt by what I have not said.
1946.author: Calvin Coolidge

1947.text: Housework can't kill you, but why take a chance?
1947.author: Phyllis Diller

1948.text: Everything I like is either illegal, immoral or fattening.
1948.author: Alexander Woollcott

1949.text: I saw a woman wearing a sweatshirt with Guess on it. I said, Thyroid problem?
1949.author: Arnold Schwarzenegger

1950.text: I have a new philosophy. I'm only going to dread one day at a time.
1950.author: Charles M. Schulz

1951.text: An idea isn't responsible for the people who believe in it.
1951.author: Don Marquis

1952.text: Prejudice is a great time saver. You can form opinions without having to get the facts.
1952.author: E. B. White

1953.text: Society is like a stew. If you don't stir it up every once in a while then a layer of scum floats to the top.
1953.author: Edward Abbey

1954.text: People always ask me, 'Were you funny as a child?' Well, no, I was an accountant.
1954.author: Ellen DeGeneres

1955.text: If I want to knock a story off the front page, I just change my hairstyle.
1955.author: Hillary Clinton

1956.text: When we talk to God, we're praying. When God talks to us, we're schizophrenic.
1956.author: Jane Wagner

1957.text: It's amazing that the amount of news that happens in the world every day always just exactly fits the newspaper.
1957.author: Jerry Seinfeld

1958.text: There are lots of people who mistake their imagination for their memory.
1958.author: Josh Billings

1960.text: I was eating in a Chinese restaurant downtown. There was a dish called Mother and Child Reunion. It's chicken and eggs. And I said, I gotta use that one.
1960.author: Paul Simon

1961.text: By all means let's be open-minded, but not so open-minded that our brains drop out.
1961.author: Richard Dawkins

1962.text: If at first you don't succeed... so much for skydiving.
1962.author: Henny Youngman

1964.text: You know the funny thing, I don't get along with rich people. I get along with the middle class and the poor people better than I get along with the rich people.
1964.author: Donald Trump

1965.text: I love Charlie, Billy Burke's character. Writing for him is so spectacular, he's so funny and wry and every scene he's in he just takes. There's a scene in 'Eclipse' where Bella tells him she's a virgin, and it's the funniest, most awkward scene I've ever seen on film.
1965.author: Melissa Rosenberg

1966.text: Memories are doing funny things to us.
1966.author: Milos Forman

1967.text: Some people say funny things, but I say things funny.
1967.author: Don Rickles

1968.text: We try to make the name longer and longer every year. First, it was 'Larry the Cable Guy's Christmas Spectacular.' Then it was 'It's a Very Larry Christmas.' Now it's 'Larry the Cable Guy's Hula-palooza Christmas Luau.' I'll tell you what it is: It's funny. That's what it is. Who cares what the name of it is? It is a funny special.
1968.author: Larry the Cable Guy

1969.text: Any girl can be glamorous. All you have to do is stand still and look stupid.
1969.author: Hedy Lamarr

1970.text: I wouldn't totally rule out doing Letterman or the Tonight Show if I had a set that I just happened to write that I thought was funny but was still appropriate for network censors. But I'm not going to go out of my way.
1970.author: Joe Rogan

1971.text: I think the word 'pregnant' is funny.
1971.author: Tracy Morgan

1972.text: I like bowling. I suck at it, but I like it. You know what's so funny? I have days when I'm absolutely great at doing it, and then I have days when I just don't understand it.
1972.author: Lil' Kim

1973.text: It's really funny - when I'm depressed or I'm having a hard time, I'll write really fun stuff. And then when I'm really happy, I write really depressing stuff.
1973.author: Kathleen Hanna

1974.text: What after all, is a halo? It's only one more thing to keep clean.
1974.author: Christopher Fry

1975.text: If you want a guarantee, buy a toaster.
1975.author: Clint Eastwood

1976.text: I consider that a man's brain originally is like a little empty attic, and you have to stock it with such furniture as you choose.
1976.author: Arthur Conan Doyle

1977.text: The four building blocks of the universe are fire, water, gravel and vinyl.
1977.author: Dave Barry

1978.text: I cannot sing, dance or act; what else would I be but a talk show host.
1978.author: David Letterman

1979.text: I wish the government would put a tax on pianos for the incompetent.
1979.author: Edith Sitwell

1980.text: I was so naive as a kid I used to sneak behind the barn and do nothing.
1980.author: Johnny Carson

1981.text: There's a great power in words, if you don't hitch too many of them together.
1981.author: Josh Billings

1982.text: If you want to be thought a liar, always tell the truth.
1982.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

1983.text: I used to be Snow White, but I drifted.
1983.author: Mae West

1984.text: The reports of my death have been greatly exaggerated.
1984.author: Mark Twain

1985.text: Cure for an obsession: get another one.
1985.author: Mason Cooley

1986.text: Experience is what you have after you've forgotten her name.
1986.author: Milton Berle

1987.text: This suspense is terrible. I hope it will last.
1987.author: Oscar Wilde

1988.text: Why don't you get a haircut? You look like a chrysanthemum.
1988.author: P. G. Wodehouse

1989.text: Because of their size, parents may be difficult to discipline properly.
1989.author: P. J. O'Rourke

1990.text: Cleanliness becomes more important when godliness is unlikely.
1990.author: P. J. O'Rourke

1991.text: I'm thankful for the three ounce Ziploc bag, so that I have somewhere to put my savings.
1991.author: Paula Poundstone

1992.text: He looked about as inconspicuous as a tarantula on a slice of angel food.
1992.author: Raymond Chandler

1993.text: I have tried to know absolutely nothing about a great many things, and I have succeeded fairly well.
1993.author: Robert Benchley

1994.text: I'm writing a book. I've got the page numbers done.
1994.author: Steven Wright

1995.text: I cook with wine, sometimes I even add it to the food.
1995.author: W. C. Fields

1997.text: I never expected to see the day when girls would get sunburned in the places they now do.
1997.author: Will Rogers

1998.text: Working with Julie Andrews is like getting hit over the head with a valentine.
1998.author: Christopher Plummer

1999.text: I drank some boiling water because I wanted to whistle.
1999.author: Mitch Hedberg

2000.text: My mother was against me being an actress - until I introduced her to Frank Sinatra.
2000.author: Angie Dickinson

2001.text: It all started when my dog began getting free roll over minutes.
2001.author: Jay London

2002.text: My father would take me to the playground, and put me on mood swings.
2002.author: Jay London

2003.text: I recorded my hair this morning, tonight I'm watching the highlights.
2003.author: Jay London

2004.text: I've experienced plenty of times when something I think is funny doesn't do very well. And there are times when something I don't think is funny makes the audience laugh so hard.
2004.author: Carrot Top

2005.text: In preschool, I would plan out my show-and-tell every week to be funny and exciting. Then in first grade I wrote a play, and my classmates and I performed it as a puppet show.
2005.author: Maxim Knight

2007.text: I read a funny story about how the Republicans freed the slaves. The Republicans are the ones who created slavery by law in the 1600's. Abraham Lincoln freed the slaves and he was not a Republican.
2007.author: Marion Barry

2008.text: People say funny things all the time during really serious moments in life.
2008.author: Mark Ruffalo

2009.text: And, in a funny way, each death is different and you mourn each death differently and each death brings back the death you mourned earlier and you get into a bit of a pile-up.
2009.author: Nigella Lawson

2010.text: For sheer sexiness, a man must be beautiful. Funny. yes. Clever, no.
2010.author: Jilly Cooper

2011.text: The only guaranteed way to make something not very funny is to make it vague.
2011.author: Thomas Lennon

2012.text: I don't need to convince anybody that I know kung fu, but maybe somebody needs to know that I really can act, without doing a Chinese accent or a funny walk.
2012.author: David Carradine

2013.text: Great, big, serious novels always get awards. If it's a battle between a great, big, serious novel and a funny novel, the funny novel is doomed.
2013.author: Neil Gaiman

2014.text: Her friends say she is very funny. At a family dinner, she stood to go, and the footman very properly pulled her chair away. At that moment I asked her a question and she sat down again, except there was no chair. Everyone, including the Queen, laughed and laughed.
2014.author: Prince Andrew

2015.text: Life was a funny thing that happened to me on the way to the grave.
2015.author: Quentin Crisp

2016.text: It's not so much what you learn about Mumbai, it's what you learn about yourself, really. It's a funny old hippie thing, but it's true as well. You find out a lot about yourself and your tolerance, and about your inclusiveness.
2016.author: Danny Boyle

2017.text: As soon as you are trying to be funny or dramatic, that's when things start feeling fake and boring.
2017.author: Joseph Gordon-Levitt

2018.text: I actually think of being funny as an odd turn of mind, like a mild disability, some weird way of looking at the world that you can't get rid of.
2018.author: Calvin Trillin

2019.text: Life can be dramatic and funny all in the same day.
2019.author: Jennifer Aniston

2020.text: As soon as I realized you could be funny as a job, that was the job I wanted.
2020.author: Seth Rogen

2021.text: I'd love to do a comedy. I'm terrified of comedy. I don't think I'm funny, but I guess that's why it's so thrilling.
2021.author: Jared Padalecki

2022.text: If you could cross a lion and a monkey, that's what I'd be, because monkeys are funny and lions are strong.
2022.author: Marlon Wayans

2023.text: There's a rule of writing: if everything is funny, nothing is funny; if everything is sad, nothing is sad. You want that contrast.
2023.author: J. Michael Straczynski

2024.text: I showed what I can do with butter, right? Eighty-five percent increase in sales. I'm very proud of them Country Life ads. They were funny and clever and classy like the Toblerone ads I grew up with.
2024.author: John Lydon

2025.text: I like cartoons. I like 'Foster's Home for Imaginary Friends.' It's funny! It has things that kids wouldn't get. It's like, if you're mature, you get it. I like that and 'The Fairly OddParents.'
2025.author: David Archuleta

2026.text: The only time I get sick of making people laugh is when I'm in a non-writing-joke mode, and I just can't seem to come up with anything new that's funny. That's a tough place to be as a comedian.
2026.author: Bill Burr

2027.text: My favorite kind of humor is basically, if it was happening to you, it wouldn't be funny, but to observe it, it's hilarious.
2027.author: Bill Burr

2028.text: I would say just start writing. You've got to write every day. Copy someone that you like if you think that perhaps could become your sound, too. I did that with Hemingway, and I thought I was writing just like Hemingway. Then all of a sudden it occurred to me - he didn't have a sense of humor. I don't know anything he's written that's funny.
2028.author: Elmore Leonard

2029.text: It's funny... you can make fun of AIDS or Haiti, but if you make fun of some starlet in Hollywood's looks? That's like the one thing... the line you are not to cross.
2029.author: Daniel Tosh

2030.text: I don't know why I get away with some things. But I'm not a misogynistic, racist person. Yet I do find those jokes funny, so I say them. And I try to say everything kind of in a good spirit.
2030.author: Daniel Tosh

2031.text: Everyone has at least one story, and each of us is funny if we admit it. You have to admit you're the funniest person you've ever heard of.
2031.author: Maya Angelou

2032.text: My dad would go to work every day and write in a room full of funny people. He enjoyed it. I know great writers who find the process agonising but to me, writing has always been sheer joy.
2032.author: Joss Whedon

2033.text: I haven't done Vine in a long time, and when I first started, I just did stuff that I thought was funny.
2033.author: Maisie Williams

2034.text: Being a humorist is not a voluntary thing. You can tell this because in a situation where saying a funny thing will cause a lot of trouble, a humorist will still say the funny thing. No matter how inappropriate.
2034.author: P. J. O'Rourke

2035.text: A lot of newspaper columns used to be written in a rat-a-tat-tat, fast-paced style - and they tended to be funny. They were a little relief from the grimmer, grayer parts of the newspaper, and one of the best people at doing this was Will Rogers.
2035.author: P. J. O'Rourke

2036.text: The men I idolized built their bodies and became somebody - like Sylvester Stallone and Arnold Schwarzenegger - and I thought, 'That can be me.' So I started working out. The funny thing is I didn't realize back then that I was having a defining moment.
2036.author: Dwayne Johnson

2037.text: Some of my fans don't really like it when I respond to people who say things that are trying to be hurtful on social media. But I think it's kind of funny. There's a lot of things that make me laugh, that people would try and say those things. I mean, there's some that I can't even retweet or respond to just because of how bad it is.
2037.author: Rickie Fowler

2038.text: Phil Hartman was brilliant, and Dave Foley is a really funny guy. Phil Hartman was actually even funnier offstage than he was onstage because he would say nasty things. Dave Foley's very funny, very witty guy, very quick.
2038.author: Joe Rogan

2039.text: It may sound funny, but I love the South. I don't choose to live anywhere else. There's land here, where a man can raise cattle, and I'm going to do it some day.
2039.author: Medgar Evers

2040.text: If I were two-faced, would I be wearing this one?
2040.author: Abraham Lincoln

2041.text: Common sense is the collection of prejudices acquired by age eighteen.
2041.author: Albert Einstein

2042.text: Conversation would be vastly improved by the constant use of four simple words: I do not know.
2042.author: Andre Maurois

2043.text: I would never die for my beliefs because I might be wrong.
2043.author: Bertrand Russell

2044.text: The tax collector must love poor people, he's creating so many of them.
2044.author: Bill Vaughan

2046.text: All right everyone, line up alphabetically according to your height.
2046.author: Casey Stengel

2047.text: I love fools' experiments. I am always making them.
2047.author: Charles Darwin

2048.text: Thinking is one thing no one has ever been able to tax.
2048.author: Charles Kettering

2049.text: I love mankind; it's people I can't stand.
2049.author: Charles M. Schulz

2050.text: There are only three things women need in life: food, water, and compliments.
2050.author: Chris Rock

2051.text: They say marriages are made in Heaven. But so is thunder and lightning.
2051.author: Clint Eastwood

2052.text: It is a scientific fact that your body will not absorb cholesterol if you take it from another person's plate.
2052.author: Dave Barry

2054.text: There's nothing wrong with being shallow as long as you're insightful about it.
2054.author: Dennis Miller

2055.text: To label me an intellectual is a misunderstanding of what that is.
2055.author: Dick Cavett

2056.text: There's one thing about baldness, it's neat.
2056.author: Don Herold

2057.text: Every cloud has its silver lining but it is sometimes a little difficult to get it to the mint.
2057.author: Don Marquis

2058.text: A pessimist is a person who has had to listen to too many optimists.
2058.author: Don Marquis

2059.text: I'm spending a year dead for tax reasons.
2059.author: Douglas Adams

2060.text: I think they should have a Barbie with a buzz cut.
2060.author: Ellen DeGeneres

2061.text: My grandmother started walking five miles a day when she was sixty. She's ninety-seven now, and we don't know where the hell she is.
2061.author: Ellen DeGeneres

2062.text: I'm for whatever gets you through the night.
2062.author: Frank Sinatra

2063.text: If you cannot get rid of the family skeleton, you may as well make it dance.
2063.author: George Bernard Shaw

2064.text: Frisbeetarianism is the belief that when you die, your soul goes up on the roof and gets stuck.
2064.author: George Carlin

2065.text: A child of five would understand this. Send someone to fetch a child of five.
2065.author: Groucho Marx

2066.text: Anyone who says he can see through women is missing a lot.
2066.author: Groucho Marx

2067.text: It is even harder for the average ape to believe that he has descended from man.
2067.author: H. L. Mencken

2068.text: All men are equal before fish.
2068.author: Herbert Hoover

2069.text: She was a handsome woman of forty-five and would remain so for many years.
2069.author: J. B. Priestley

2070.text: I don't deserve this award, but I have arthritis and I don't deserve that either.
2070.author: Jack Benny

2071.text: If you don't mind, it doesn't matter.
2071.author: Jack Benny

2072.text: Well, if I called the wrong number, why did you answer the phone?
2072.author: James Thurber

2073.text: Do not worry about avoiding temptation. As you grow older it will avoid you.
2073.author: Joey Adams

2074.text: If it weren't for Philo T. Farnsworth, inventor of television, we'd still be eating frozen radio dinners.
2074.author: Johnny Carson

2075.text: Who included me among the ranks of the human race?
2075.author: Joseph Brodsky

2076.text: Every man has his follies - and often they are the most interesting thing he has got.
2076.author: Josh Billings

2077.text: Flattery is like cologne water, to be smelt, not swallowed.
2077.author: Josh Billings

2078.text: Life is hard. After all, it kills you.
2078.author: Katharine Hepburn

2079.text: If two wrongs don't make a right, try three.
2079.author: Laurence J. Peter

2080.text: Communism is like one big phone company.
2080.author: Lenny Bruce

2081.text: I believe in rules. Sure I do. If there weren't any rules, how could you break them?
2081.author: Leo Durocher

2082.text: If truth is beauty, how come no one has their hair done in the library?
2082.author: Lily Tomlin

2083.text: People say that life is the thing, but I prefer reading.
2083.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

2084.text: We need two kinds of acquaintances, one to complain to, while to the others we boast.
2084.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

2085.text: You see much more of your children once they leave home.
2085.author: Lucille Ball

2086.text: Age is something that doesn't matter, unless you are a cheese.
2086.author: Luis Bunuel

2087.text: If at first you don't succeed, blame your parents.
2087.author: Marcelene Cox

2088.text: Tragedy is when I cut my finger. Comedy is when you fall into an open sewer and die.
2088.author: Mel Brooks

2089.text: If God wanted us to fly, He would have given us tickets.
2089.author: Mel Brooks

2090.text: A committee is a group that keeps minutes and loses hours.
2090.author: Milton Berle

2091.text: Never take a solemn oath. People think you mean it.
2091.author: Norman Douglas

2092.text: Turn up the lights. I don't want to go home in the dark.
2092.author: O. Henry

2093.text: If men knew how women pass the time when they are alone, they'd never marry.
2093.author: O. Henry

2094.text: Progress might have been alright once, but it has gone on too long.
2094.author: Ogden Nash

2096.text: The fascination of shooting as a sport depends almost wholly on whether you are at the right or wrong end of the gun.
2096.author: P. G. Wodehouse

2097.text: Memories are like mulligatawny soup in a cheap restaurant. It is best not to stir them.
2097.author: P. G. Wodehouse

2098.text: I don't have a bank account because I don't know my mother's maiden name.
2098.author: Paula Poundstone

2099.text: I want my children to have all the things I couldn't afford. Then I want to move in with them.
2099.author: Phyllis Diller

2100.text: The only time I ever enjoyed ironing was the day I accidentally got gin in the steam iron.
2100.author: Phyllis Diller

2101.text: When I eventually met Mr. Right I had no idea that his first name was Always.
2101.author: Rita Rudner

2102.text: I found there was only one way to look thin: hang out with fat people.
2102.author: Rodney Dangerfield

2103.text: The way my luck is running, if I was a politician I would be honest.
2103.author: Rodney Dangerfield

2104.text: Two wrongs don't make a right, but they make a good excuse.
2104.author: Thomas Szasz

2106.text: Fashions have done more harm than revolutions.
2106.author: Victor Hugo

2108.text: Infuse your life with action. Don't wait for it to happen. Make it happen. Make your own future. Make your own hope. Make your own love. And whatever your beliefs, honor your creator, not by passively waiting for grace to come down from upon high, but by doing what you can to make grace happen... yourself, right now, right down here on Earth.
2108.author: Bradley Whitford

2109.text: Hope is being able to see that there is light despite all of the darkness.
2109.author: Desmond Tutu

2110.text: We must accept finite disappointment, but never lose infinite hope.
2110.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

2111.text: A good teacher can inspire hope, ignite the imagination, and instill a love of learning.
2111.author: Brad Henry

2112.text: I believe that imagination is stronger than knowledge. That myth is more potent than history. That dreams are more powerful than facts. That hope always triumphs over experience. That laughter is the only cure for grief. And I believe that love is stronger than death.
2112.author: Robert Fulghum

2113.text: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow. The important thing is not to stop questioning.
2113.author: Albert Einstein

2114.text: There was never a night or a problem that could defeat sunrise or hope.
2114.author: Bernard Williams

2117.text: Love recognizes no barriers. It jumps hurdles, leaps fences, penetrates walls to arrive at its destination full of hope.
2117.author: Maya Angelou

2118.text: Where there is no vision, there is no hope.
2118.author: George Washington Carver

2119.text: Hope is like the sun, which, as we journey toward it, casts the shadow of our burden behind us.
2119.author: Samuel Smiles

2120.text: All that I am, or hope to be, I owe to my angel mother.
2120.author: Abraham Lincoln

2121.text: Black and white are the colors of photography. To me they symbolize the alternatives of hope and despair to which mankind is forever subjected.
2121.author: Robert Frank

2122.text: All the great things are simple, and many can be expressed in a single word: freedom, justice, honor, duty, mercy, hope.
2122.author: Winston Churchill

2123.text: Forgiving does not erase the bitter past. A healed memory is not a deleted memory. Instead, forgiving what we cannot forget creates a new way to remember. We change the memory of our past into a hope for our future.
2123.author: Lewis B. Smedes

2124.text: A leader is a dealer in hope.
2124.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

2125.text: Let your hopes, not your hurts, shape your future.
2125.author: Robert H. Schuller

2127.text: You cannot hope to build a better world without improving the individuals. To that end, each of us must work for his own improvement and, at the same time, share a general responsibility for all humanity, our particular duty being to aid those to whom we think we can be most useful.
2127.author: Marie Curie

2129.text: Our uniqueness, our individuality, and our life experience molds us into fascinating beings. I hope we can embrace that. I pray we may all challenge ourselves to delve into the deepest resources of our hearts to cultivate an atmosphere of understanding, acceptance, tolerance, and compassion. We are all in this life together.
2129.author: Linda Thompson

2130.text: I hope that in this year to come, you make mistakes. Because if you are making mistakes, then you are making new things, trying new things, learning, living, pushing yourself, changing yourself, changing your world. You're doing things you've never done before, and more importantly, you're doing something.
2130.author: Neil Gaiman

2131.text: Keep all special thoughts and memories for lifetimes to come. Share these keepsakes with others to inspire hope and build from the past, which can bridge to the future.
2131.author: Mattie Stepanek

2132.text: Each time a man stands up for an ideal, or acts to improve the lot of others, or strikes out against injustice, he sends forth a tiny ripple of hope, and crossing each other from a million different centers of energy and daring, those ripples build a current that can sweep down the mightiest walls of oppression and resistance.
2132.author: Robert Kennedy

2133.text: I find hope in the darkest of days, and focus in the brightest. I do not judge the universe.
2133.author: Dalai Lama

2135.text: The worst thing that can happen in a democracy - as well as in an individual's life - is to become cynical about the future and lose hope.
2135.author: Hillary Clinton

2136.text: Creativity is a great motivator because it makes people interested in what they are doing. Creativity gives hope that there can be a worthwhile idea. Creativity gives the possibility of some sort of achievement to everyone. Creativity makes life more fun and more interesting.
2136.author: Edward de Bono

2137.text: When we meet real tragedy in life, we can react in two ways - either by losing hope and falling into self-destructive habits, or by using the challenge to find our inner strength. Thanks to the teachings of Buddha, I have been able to take this second way.
2137.author: Dalai Lama

2138.text: Imagine all the people living life in peace. You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one. I hope someday you'll join us, and the world will be as one.
2138.author: John Lennon

2139.text: Hope is the thing with feathers that perches in the soul - and sings the tunes without the words - and never stops at all.
2139.author: Emily Dickinson

2140.text: I only hope that we don't lose sight of one thing - that it was all started by a mouse.
2140.author: Walt Disney

2141.text: The happy Union of these States is a wonder; their Constitution a miracle; their example the hope of Liberty throughout the world.
2141.author: James Madison

2142.text: In the end, that's what this election is about. Do we participate in a politics of cynicism or a politics of hope?
2142.author: Barack Obama

2143.text: You are not here merely to make a living. You are here in order to enable the world to live more amply, with greater vision, with a finer spirit of hope and achievement. You are here to enrich the world, and you impoverish yourself if you forget the errand.
2143.author: Woodrow Wilson

2145.text: We must free ourselves of the hope that the sea will ever rest. We must learn to sail in high winds.
2145.author: Aristotle Onassis

2146.text: Every year we celebrate the holy season of Advent, O God. Every year we pray those beautiful prayers of longing and waiting, and sing those lovely songs of hope and promise.
2146.author: Karl Rahner

2147.text: Stay positive and happy. Work hard and don't give up hope. Be open to criticism and keep learning. Surround yourself with happy, warm and genuine people.
2147.author: Tena Desae

2149.text: It is my goal to love everyone. I hate no one. Regardless of their race, religion, their proclivities, the desire of their heart and how they want to live their life and the decisions that they make. I can even respect people's decisions and lifestyle choices just as I hope they have the courtesy to respect my decisions and my choices.
2149.author: Kirk Cameron

2150.text: We have always held to the hope, the belief, the conviction that there is a better life, a better world, beyond the horizon.
2150.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

2151.text: The mind is never satisfied with the objects immediately before it, but is always breaking away from the present moment, and losing itself in schemes of future felicity... The natural flights of the human mind are not from pleasure to pleasure, but from hope to hope.
2151.author: Samuel Johnson

2153.text: We must restore hope to young people, help the old, be open to the future, spread love. Be poor among the poor. We need to include the excluded and preach peace.
2153.author: Pope Francis

2154.text: I hope everyone that is reading this is having a really good day. And if you are not, just know that in every new minute that passes you have an opportunity to change that.
2154.author: Gillian Anderson

2155.text: Hope smiles from the threshold of the year to come, whispering, 'It will be happier.'
2155.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

2156.text: We talk a lot about hope, helping, and teamwork. Our whole message is that we are more powerful together.
2156.author: Victoria Osteen

2157.text: Few things in the world are more powerful than a positive push. A smile. A world of optimism and hope. A 'you can do it' when things are tough.
2157.author: Richard M. DeVos

2158.text: I said to my soul, be still, and wait without hope, For hope would be hope for the wrong thing.
2158.author: T. S. Eliot

2159.text: Maybe all one can do is hope to end up with the right regrets.
2159.author: Arthur Miller

2160.text: I hope that my daughter grows up empowered and doesn't define herself by the way she looks but by qualities that make her a intelligent, strong and responsible woman.
2160.author: Isaiah Mustafa

2161.text: Hope begins in the dark, the stubborn hope that if you just show up and try to do the right thing, the dawn will come. You wait and watch and work: you don't give up.
2161.author: Anne Lamott

2162.text: Everything that is done in the world is done by hope.
2162.author: Martin Luther

2164.text: Your ordinary acts of love and hope point to the extraordinary promise that every human life is of inestimable value.
2164.author: Desmond Tutu

2165.text: A very small degree of hope is sufficient to cause the birth of love.
2165.author: Stendhal

2166.text: It is often when night looks darkest, it is often before the fever breaks that one senses the gathering momentum for change, when one feels that resurrection of hope in the midst of despair and apathy.
2166.author: Hillary Clinton

2167.text: Don't give up. Don't lose hope. Don't sell out.
2167.author: Christopher Reeve

2168.text: Lord save us all from old age and broken health and a hope tree that has lost the faculty of putting out blossoms.
2168.author: Mark Twain

2169.text: Hope is the only bee that makes honey without flowers.
2169.author: Robert Green Ingersoll

2171.text: How wonderful that we have met with a paradox. Now we have some hope of making progress.
2171.author: Niels Bohr

2172.text: If I can have the opportunity to go into an editing room, it's like the golden ticket for me. All I want is to learn about everything else in the filmmaking process. I just directed a music video which just came out and that'd sort of be the area of the field that I'm going to move into, I hope.
2172.author: Nikki Reed

2173.text: I hope you will go out and let stories happen to you, and that you will work them, water them with your blood and tears and you laughter till they bloom, till you yourself burst into bloom.
2173.author: Clarissa Pinkola Estes

2174.text: You just have to keep trying to do good work, and hope that it leads to more good work. I want to look back on my career and be proud of the work, and be proud that I tried everything. Yes, I want to look back and know that I was terrible at a variety of things.
2174.author: Jon Stewart

2175.text: The human heart has hidden treasures, In secret kept, in silence sealed; The thoughts, the hopes, the dreams, the pleasures, Whose charms were broken if revealed.
2175.author: Charlotte Bronte

2176.text: The trouble with most people is that they think with their hopes or fears or wishes rather than with their minds.
2176.author: Will Durant

2178.text: What gives me the most hope every day is God's grace; knowing that his grace is going to give me the strength for whatever I face, knowing that nothing is a surprise to God.
2178.author: Rick Warren

2179.text: Hope is important because it can make the present moment less difficult to bear. If we believe that tomorrow will be better, we can bear a hardship today.
2179.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

2180.text: The youth is the hope of our future.
2180.author: Jose Rizal

2181.text: Nothing is black or white, nothing's 'us or them.' But then there are magical, beautiful things in the world. There's incredible acts of kindness and bravery, and in the most unlikely places, and it gives you hope.
2181.author: Dave Matthews

2182.text: The very least you can do in your life is to figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof.
2182.author: Barbara Kingsolver

2183.text: Disappointment is a sort of bankruptcy - the bankruptcy of a soul that expends too much in hope and expectation.
2183.author: Eric Hoffer

2184.text: You are as young as your self-confidence, as old as your fears; as young as your hope, as old as your despair.
2184.author: Samuel Ullman

2185.text: Today's students can put dope in their veins or hope in their brains. If they can conceive it and believe it, they can achieve it. They must know it is not their aptitude but their attitude that will determine their altitude.
2185.author: Jesse Jackson

2186.text: If you keep thinking about what you want to do or what you hope will happen, you don't do it, and it won't happen.
2186.author: Desiderius Erasmus

2188.text: Hope can be the most wonderful thing in the world or it can crush your heart like an eggshell.
2188.author: Harlan Coben

2189.text: 'Halal in the Family' will expose a broad audience to some of the realities of being Muslim in America. By using satire, we will encourage people to reconsider their assumptions about Muslims, while providing a balm to those experiencing anti-Muslim bias. I also hope those Uncles and Aunties out there will crack a smile!
2189.author: Aasif Mandvi

2190.text: I hope the millions of people I've touched have the optimism and desire to share their goals and hard work and persevere with a positive attitude.
2190.author: Michael Jordan

2191.text: We must vote for hope, vote for life, vote for a brighter future for all of our loved ones.
2191.author: Ed Markey

2192.text: A lot of presidential memoirs, they say, are dull and self-serving. I hope mine is interesting and self-serving.
2192.author: William J. Clinton

2193.text: Sometimes I only hope to make a good popcorn movie.
2193.author: Lou Diamond Phillips

2194.text: The other day I got a text from a boy, but it wasn't hot. I mean, if you're going to text me every day, you haven't seen me for months and you're trying to seduce me, you'd better spice up that text and make it more exciting than 'How was your day? I hope you're having a beautiful one.' Sadly, I haven't been doing a lot of kissing lately.
2194.author: Chloe Sevigny

2195.text: Little progress can be made by merely attempting to repress what is evil. Our great hope lies in developing what is good.
2195.author: Calvin Coolidge

2196.text: The capacity for hope is the most significant fact of life. It provides human beings with a sense of destination and the energy to get started.
2196.author: Norman Cousins

2197.text: Hope is such a bait, it covers any hook.
2197.author: Oliver Goldsmith

2198.text: All kids need is a little help, a little hope and somebody who believes in them.
2198.author: Magic Johnson

2199.text: We must rediscover the distinction between hope and expectation.
2199.author: Ivan Illich

2201.text: There is no medicine like hope, no incentive so great, and no tonic so powerful as expectation of something tomorrow.
2201.author: Orison Swett Marden

2202.text: But Hopes are Shy Birds flying at a great distance seldom reached by the best of Guns.
2202.author: John James Audubon

2203.text: The theological virtue of hope is the patient and trustful willingness to live without closure, without resolution, and still be content and even happy because our Satisfaction is now at another level, and our Source is beyond ourselves.
2203.author: Richard Rohr

2204.text: The United States is the world's best hope, but if you fetter her in the interests and quarrels of other nations, if you tangle her in the intrigues of Europe, you will destroy her power for good and endanger her very existence.
2204.author: Henry Cabot Lodge

2205.text: I hope people think of me as a bit older. I do have a beard. That makes me look very old.
2205.author: Jack Whitehall

2206.text: Hope springs eternal, even in politics.
2206.author: Gwen Ifill

2208.text: I've flown across America, I've scaled fences, I've stood under windows and gone out of my way hundreds of times. I'm a hopeless romantic. There's no hope for me.
2208.author: Joel Madden

2209.text: I wish you a tolerable Thursday. That's all any of us can hope for.
2209.author: April Winchell

2210.text: Friends from the press, China needs to learn more about the world, and the world also needs to learn more about China. I hope you will continue to make more efforts and contributions to deepening the mutual understanding between China and the countries of the world.
2210.author: Xi Jinping

2211.text: The simplistic solutions of Deepak Chopra cannot stand against the lofty and deep teachings of Jesus Christ. Only in His answers will we find the ultimate hope for the human heart.
2211.author: Ravi Zacharias

2212.text: Every time you dive, you hope you'll see something new - some new species. Sometimes the ocean gives you a gift, sometimes it doesn't.
2212.author: James Cameron

2213.text: 'You are no saint,' says the devil. Well, if I am not, I am a sinner, and Jesus Christ came into the world to save sinners. Sink or swim, I go to Him; other hope, I have none.
2213.author: Charles Spurgeon

2214.text: Most of the important things in the world have been accomplished by people who have kept on trying when there seemed to be no hope at all.
2214.author: Dale Carnegie

2215.text: When I stand before God at the end of my life, I would hope that I would not have a single bit of talent left, and could say, 'I used everything you gave me'.
2215.author: Erma Bombeck

2216.text: War is just when it is necessary; arms are permissible when there is no hope except in arms.
2216.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

2217.text: She gave up beauty in her tender youth, gave all her hope and joy and pleasant ways; she covered up her eyes lest they should gaze on vanity, and chose the bitter truth.
2217.author: Christina Rossetti

2218.text: I hope to have communion with the people, that is the most important thing.
2218.author: Pope John Paul II

2219.text: Looking after my health today gives me a better hope for tomorrow.
2219.author: Anne Wilson Schaef

2220.text: I do believe that most men live lives of quiet desperation. For despair, optimism is the only practical solution. Hope is practical. Because eliminate that and it's pretty scary. Hope at least gives you the option of living.
2220.author: Harry Nilsson

2221.text: There will always be someone else with a different view than you. I appreciate them and would never say that they are wrong. I hope that they would give me that courtesy also.
2221.author: Melissa Etheridge

2223.text: Right now I'm not involved with anybody, but I hope by 75 I will be again.
2223.author: Stevie Nicks

2224.text: Hope is itself a species of happiness, and, perhaps, the chief happiness, which this world affords.
2224.author: William Samuel Johnson

2225.text: We never had a huge squad and we never had a great deal of choice. But in many ways that helps because you've got to make do with what you've got. You don't have too many problems about picking the team you just hope that everyone turns up on the day.
2225.author: Jack Charlton

2226.text: We're not a vocational school. If someone wants to get a high-paying job, I would hope that there are easier ways to do it than working through a formal computer science curriculum.
2226.author: Philip Greenspun

2227.text: There is hope and a kind of beauty in there somewhere, if you look for it.
2227.author: H. R. Giger

2228.text: I can only hope the federal aid made available today will be sufficient in our recovery efforts, and pray that our citizens continue to be safe from the fallout of this dangerous natural disaster.
2228.author: Mike Rogers

2229.text: The great gift of Easter is hope - Christian hope which makes us have that confidence in God, in his ultimate triumph, and in his goodness and love, which nothing can shake.
2229.author: Basil Hume

2230.text: I hope and trust the infinite, the eternal, and merciful and loving God. I worship Him and feel no guilt in my heart before him for what I am going to do.
2230.author: Alex Campbell

2231.text: These wars appear also to have given its death blow to colonialism and to imperialism in its colonial form, under which weaker peoples were treated as possessions to be economically exploited. At least we hope that such colonialism is on the way out.
2231.author: Emily Greene Balch

2232.text: Religion kept some of my relatives alive, because it was all they had. If they hadn't had some hope of heaven, some companionship in Jesus, they probably would have committed suicide, their lives were so hellish.
2232.author: Octavia Butler

2233.text: This year I hope to introduce legislation that would require Power Administrations to list direct and indirect costs associated with ESA compliance as a line item on customer's power bills.
2233.author: Cathy McMorris Rodgers

2234.text: My hope is that we continue to nurture the places that we love, but that we also look outside our immediate worlds.
2234.author: Annie Leibovitz

2235.text: I think what coaching is all about, is taking players and analyzing there ability, put them in a position where they can excel within the framework of the team winning. And I hope that I've done that in my 33 years as a head coach.
2235.author: Don Shula

2236.text: Anarchy is the only slight glimmer of hope.
2236.author: Mick Jagger

2237.text: I hope all you young girls see yourself up there... we were just like you.
2237.author: Mia Hamm

2238.text: The only way of knowing a person is to love them without hope.
2238.author: Walter Benjamin

2240.text: It is only by not paying one's bills that one can hope to live in the memory of the commercial classes.
2240.author: Oscar Wilde

2241.text: The ninety and nine are with dreams, content but the hope of the world made new, is the hundredth man who is grimly bent on making those dreams come true.
2241.author: Edgar Allan Poe

2242.text: The most insignificant people are the most apt to sneer at others. They are safe from reprisals. And have no hope of rising in their own self esteem but by lowering their neighbors.
2242.author: William Hazlitt

2243.text: I would like this to be a new day. I would hope now that we can focus on doing the people's business.
2243.author: Ernie Fletcher

2244.text: And God help Bruce Springsteen when they decide he's no longer God... They'll turn on him, and I hope he survives it.
2244.author: John Lennon

2245.text: It's a pity that the tennis is really going down the drain. Every year it's getting worse and worse and worse. There has to be a radical change, and I hope it will be really soon.
2245.author: Marat Safin

2246.text: I hope that I'm always struggling, really. You develop when you're struggling. When you're struggling, you get stronger.
2246.author: Andrew Garfield

2247.text: If you start in the pit of despair with these profane, awful things, even a glimmer of hope or awareness is going to occur that's much brighter coming from this dark, awful beginning.
2247.author: Chuck Palahniuk

2248.text: I totally disagree with the view that the Tibet struggle will die, and there will be no hope for Tibet, after the Dalai Lama passes away.
2248.author: Dalai Lama

2249.text: I have cherished the ideal of a democratic and free society in which all persons live together in harmony and with equal opportunities. It is an ideal which I hope to live for and to achieve. But if needs be, it is an ideal for which I am prepared to die.
2249.author: Nelson Mandela

2250.text: I still believe in a place called Hope.
2250.author: William J. Clinton

2251.text: In Scotland over many years we have cultivated through our justice system what I hope can be described as a 'culture of compassion.' On the other hand, there still exists in many parts of the U.S., if not nationally, an attitude towards the concept of justice which can only be described as a 'culture of vengeance.'
2251.author: Keith O'Brien

2252.text: Now science has presented us with a hope called stem cell research, which may provide our scientists with many answers that have for so long been beyond our grasp.
2252.author: Nancy Reagan

2253.text: Whether you've seen angels floating around your bedroom or just found a ray of hope at a lonely moment, choosing to believe that something unseen is caring for you can be a life-shifting exercise.
2253.author: Martha Beck

2254.text: Iranian filmmakers are not passive. They fight whenever they can, as creative expression means a lot to them. The restrictions and censorship in Iran are a bit like the British weather: one day it's sunny, the next day it's raining. You just have to hope you walk out into the sunshine.
2254.author: Asghar Farhadi

2255.text: I have had extremely good relations with the United States and with both parties (Republicans and Democrats), and I hope to continue to have these good relations, which I, again repeating, do not consider to be mutually exclusive with having good relations with Venezuela or Ecuador or whichever country in South America.
2255.author: Juan Manuel Santos

2256.text: I'm a vegetarian and very much active in regards to how I feel about animal rights and protecting animals and giving animals a voice. But at the same time, I appreciate and respect other people's decisions to eat meat. The only thing that I hope is that people are educated, that they're aware, that they're living a conscious lifestyle.
2256.author: Abbie Cornish

2257.text: Japan's beautiful seas and its territory are under threat, and young people are having trouble finding hope in the future amid economic slump. I promise to protect Japan's land and sea, and the lives of the Japanese people no matter what.
2257.author: Shinzo Abe

2258.text: The vast Pacific Ocean has ample space for China and the United States. We welcome a constructive role by the United States in promoting peace, stability and prosperity in the region. We also hope that the United States will fully respect and accommodate the major interests and legitimate concerns of Asia-Pacific countries.
2258.author: Xi Jinping

2259.text: I get asked to read new works a lot, in the hope that I will give a quotation and I will only give a 'puff' for a book I truly love.
2259.author: Peter James

2260.text: Hope is the motivation that empowers the unemployed, enabling them to get out of bed every single morning with unbounded enthusiasm as they look for work.
2260.author: Emanuel Cleaver

2261.text: What's interesting about Twitter and the influencers that someone follows - like, say, Shaquille O'Neal - is that they see someone who is using the exact same tools that they have access to, and I think that inspires this hope to be able to really engage with someone like him.
2261.author: Jack Dorsey

2262.text: Over the years I've learned how to lock myself up in a prison of hope, knowing that God has nothing but His best planned for me. He promised me things concerning my ministry and my life.
2262.author: Joyce Meyer

2263.text: I was always a fan of the old-style comics. I loved vaudeville. I loved Milton Berle, Dick Shawn, Phyllis Diller, Don Rickles, Charlie Callas, all those guys. Hilarious. I love the Bing Crosby and Bob Hope movies, and Abbott & Costello. My television influences were 'Monty Python's Flying Circus,' 'Benny Hill,' and 'Hee Haw.'
2263.author: Larry the Cable Guy

2264.text: If you don't like me, life goes on, you know what I mean? But I hope you do like me. Because I think that in addition to being pushy, I'm nice.
2264.author: Christine Quinn

2265.text: Outside of the cross of Jesus Christ, there is no hope in this world. That cross and resurrection at the core of the Gospel is the only hope for humanity. Wherever you go, ask God for wisdom on how to get that Gospel in, even in the toughest situations of life.
2265.author: Ravi Zacharias

2266.text: I'm naturally an optimist, but my basis for hope is rooted in my understanding of human nature.
2266.author: Al Gore

2267.text: We need to move into a culture of peace. What I hope to promote is the idea that we all need each other and that the greatest happiness in life is not how much we have but how much we give. That's a wealth that's priceless. You can't buy compassion.
2267.author: Herbie Hancock

2268.text: There is in every child at every stage a new miracle of vigorous unfolding, which constitutes a new hope and a new responsibility for all.
2268.author: Erik Erikson

2269.text: To many, peace is what enables development and is critical in providing opportunities to young people. To some - especially those from regions involved in conflict - peacekeeping and efforts to preserve peace are absolutely vital in bringing prosperity and hope for the future.
2269.author: Kim Yuna

2270.text: Of the big horror movies of the '70s, you have 'The Omen,' 'The Sentinel,' 'Rosemary's Baby,' 'The Stepford Wives,' 'Burnt Offerings' - these are all romantic fatalist movies where there's a sort of glimmer of hope... but darkness wins.
2270.author: Chuck Palahniuk

2271.text: My main hope is eventually, in modern education field, introduce education about warm-heartedness, not based on religion, but based on common experience and a common sort of sense, and then scientific finding.
2271.author: Dalai Lama

2272.text: The murder of Lumumba, in which the U.S. was involved, in the Congo destroyed Africa's major hope for development. Congo is now total horror story, for years.
2272.author: Noam Chomsky

2274.text: I hope that 'Jaws' will have brought sharks into the public interest at a time when we desperately need to reevaluate our care for the environment.
2274.author: Peter Benchley

2275.text: We don't need mandatory, non-sectarian prayers read over the loudspeaker to 'put God back in schools.' God never left the schools. God is still at work through the hundreds of thousands of gifted teachers and administrators, committed parents, and passionate volunteers who seek to help give our children 'a future with hope.'
2275.author: Adam Hamilton

2276.text: I'm learning a lot about how to be one of the 'good' actors. You'd hope that it's natural to be a good person, and kind, but I'm learning how to deal with long, sometimes boring days.
2276.author: Lily James

2277.text: Oftentimes when you see adaptations of books you like, you're let down. As an author, you assume that they are going to suck. A little bit of hope is dangerous.
2277.author: Gayle Forman

2278.text: The expectation in the Obama Administration, or at least the hope, is that a nuclear deal with the West could ultimately moderate Iranian behavior by helping to integrate the country more thoroughly into the international system. Will this happen? It's impossible to predict, of course. We will only know if we get there.
2278.author: Dexter Filkins

2279.text: When I consider life, it is all a cheat. Yet fooled with hope, people favor this deceit.
2279.author: John Dryden

2281.text: No matter how dark the moment, love and hope are always possible.
2281.author: George Chakiris

2282.text: One lives in the hope of becoming a memory.
2282.author: Antonio Porchia

2283.text: He that lives upon hope will die fasting.
2283.author: Benjamin Franklin

2284.text: When you say a situation or a person is hopeless, you are slamming the door in the face of God.
2284.author: Charles L. Allen

2286.text: All hope abandon, ye who enter here!
2286.author: Dante Alighieri

2287.text: The work goes on, the cause endures, the hope still lives and the dreams shall never die.
2287.author: Edward Kennedy

2290.text: Tomorrow hopes we have learned something from yesterday.
2290.author: John Wayne

2291.text: Three grand essentials to happiness in this life are something to do, something to love, and something to hope for.
2291.author: Joseph Addison

2292.text: In this world you've just got to hope for the best and prepare for the worst and take whatever God sends.
2292.author: Lucy Maud Montgomery

2293.text: The hope of a secure and livable world lies with disciplined nonconformists who are dedicated to justice, peace and brotherhood.
2293.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

2296.text: The sudden disappointment of a hope leaves a scar which the ultimate fulfillment of that hope never entirely removes.
2296.author: Thomas Hardy

2297.text: Hope is a state of mind, not of the world. Hope, in this deep and powerful sense, is not the same as joy that things are going well, or willingness to invest in enterprises that are obviously heading for success, but rather an ability to work for something because it is good.
2297.author: Vaclav Havel

2298.text: Isn't it the moment of most profound doubt that gives birth to new certainties? Perhaps hopelessness is the very soil that nourishes human hope; perhaps one could never find sense in life without first experiencing its absurdity.
2298.author: Vaclav Havel

2299.text: Hope is definitely not the same thing as optimism. It is not the conviction that something will turn out well, but the certainty that something makes sense, regardless of how it turns out.
2299.author: Vaclav Havel

2300.text: Hope is not the conviction that something will turn out well but the certainty that something makes sense, regardless of how it turns out.
2300.author: Vaclav Havel

2301.text: Hope is the word which God has written on the brow of every man.
2301.author: Victor Hugo

2302.text: When we have lost everything, including hope, life becomes a disgrace, and death a duty.
2302.author: W. C. Fields

2303.text: It is only hope which is real, and reality is a bitterness and a deceit.
2303.author: William Makepeace Thackeray

2304.text: You can make positive deposits in your own economy every day by reading and listening to powerful, positive, life-changing content and by associating with encouraging and hope-building people.
2304.author: Zig Ziglar

2305.text: You believe that easily which you hope for earnestly.
2305.author: Terence

2306.text: Beware how you take away hope from another human being.
2306.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

2307.text: Hope is a risk that must be run.
2307.author: Georges Bernanos

2309.text: Anyone who doesn't believe in miracles is not a realist.
2309.author: David Ben-Gurion

2310.text: Chance has never yet satisfied the hope of a suffering people.
2310.author: Marcus Garvey

2311.text: It's a good place when all you have is hope and not expectations.
2311.author: Danny Boyle

2312.text: Be prepared, work hard, and hope for a little luck. Recognize that the harder you work and the better prepared you are, the more luck you might have.
2312.author: Ed Bradley

2313.text: If we all worked on the assumption that what is accepted as true is really true, there would be little hope of advance.
2313.author: Orville Wright

2314.text: I never read the life of any important person without discovering that he knew more and could do more than I could ever hope to know or do in half a dozen lifetimes.
2314.author: J. B. Priestley

2315.text: If you die you're completely happy and your soul somewhere lives on. I'm not afraid of dying. Total peace after death, becoming someone else is the best hope I've got.
2315.author: Kurt Cobain

2316.text: I hope that posterity will judge me kindly, not only as to the things which I have explained, but also to those which I have intentionally omitted so as to leave to others the pleasure of discovery.
2316.author: Rene Descartes

2317.text: The charm of fishing is that it is the pursuit of what is elusive but attainable, a perpetual series of occasions for hope.
2317.author: John Buchan

2318.text: Where I am today... I still have my ups and downs, but I take it one day at a time and I just hope that I can be the best that I can possibly be, not only for myself, but also young people that are out there today that need someone to look up to.
2318.author: Demi Lovato

2319.text: Ali's got a left, Ali's got a right - when he knocks you down, you'll sleep for the night; and when you lie on the floor and the ref counts to ten, hope and pray that you never meet me again.
2319.author: Muhammad Ali

2320.text: Desperation is the raw material of drastic change. Only those who can leave behind everything they have ever believed in can hope to escape.
2320.author: William S. Burroughs

2321.text: I hope that people will finally come to realize that there is only one 'race' - the human race - and that we are all members of it.
2321.author: Margaret Atwood

2322.text: When people talk of the freedom of writing, speaking or thinking I cannot choose but laugh. No such thing ever existed. No such thing now exists; but I hope it will exist. But it must be hundreds of years after you and I shall write and speak no more.
2322.author: John Adams

2323.text: Desire is the starting point of all achievement, not a hope, not a wish, but a keen pulsating desire which transcends everything.
2323.author: Napoleon Hill

2324.text: Come, gentlemen, I hope we shall drink down all unkindness.
2324.author: William Shakespeare

2325.text: Our human compassion binds us the one to the other - not in pity or patronizingly, but as human beings who have learnt how to turn our common suffering into hope for the future.
2325.author: Nelson Mandela

2326.text: Darkness comes. In the middle of it, the future looks blank. The temptation to quit is huge. Don't. You are in good company... You will argue with yourself that there is no way forward. But with God, nothing is impossible. He has more ropes and ladders and tunnels out of pits than you can conceive. Wait. Pray without ceasing. Hope.
2326.author: John Piper

2327.text: Given the scale of trauma caused by the genocide, Rwanda has indicated that however thin the hope of a community can be, a hero always emerges. Although no one can dare claim that it is now a perfect state, and that no more work is needed, Rwanda has risen from the ashes as a model or truth and reconciliation.
2327.author: Wole Soyinka

2328.text: When I see myself on film it makes me smile, I mean making a good living doing what I enjoy is soo much fun. I just hope that everyone has the chance to enjoy life like I do.
2328.author: Adrienne Barbeau

2329.text: I'm a good person, I hope. But I'm never as good as I want to be, never as nice as I want to be, never as generous as I want to be.
2329.author: David Tennant

2330.text: I hope that people will see that we don't have to sit by the sidelines and watch as the two major parties limit their choices to slightly different flavors of the status quo. It is, in fact, possible to join the fray, stand up for principles and offer a real alternative.
2330.author: Gary Johnson

2332.text: To cherish what remains of the Earth and to foster its renewal is our only legitimate hope of survival.
2332.author: Wendell Berry

2333.text: Hope is but the dream of those who wake.
2333.author: Matthew Prior

2334.text: In motivating people, you've got to engage their minds and their hearts. I motivate people, I hope, by example - and perhaps by excitement, by having productive ideas to make others feel involved.
2334.author: Rupert Murdoch

2335.text: I wish I had invented blue jeans. They have expression, modesty, sex appeal, simplicity - all I hope for in my clothes.
2335.author: Yves Saint Laurent

2337.text: The human body experiences a powerful gravitational pull in the direction of hope. That is why the patient's hopes are the physician's secret weapon. They are the hidden ingredients in any prescription.
2337.author: Norman Cousins

2338.text: The essence of optimism is that it takes no account of the present, but it is a source of inspiration, of vitality and hope where others have resigned; it enables a man to hold his head high, to claim the future for himself and not to abandon it to his enemy.
2338.author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

2339.text: There are only two lasting bequests we can hope to give our children. One of these is roots, the other, wings.
2339.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

2340.text: People crushed by laws, have no hope but to evade power. If the laws are their enemies, they will be enemies to the law; and those who have most to hope and nothing to lose will always be dangerous.
2340.author: Edmund Burke

2342.text: Put your heart, mind, and soul into even your smallest acts. This is the secret of success.
2342.author: Swami Sivananda

2344.text: Your work is going to fill a large part of your life, and the only way to be truly satisfied is to do what you believe is great work. And the only way to do great work is to love what you do. If you haven't found it yet, keep looking. Don't settle. As with all matters of the heart, you'll know when you find it.
2344.author: Steve Jobs

2345.text: Keep your face always toward the sunshine - and shadows will fall behind you.
2345.author: Walt Whitman

2346.text: We must let go of the life we have planned, so as to accept the one that is waiting for us.
2346.author: Joseph Campbell

2347.text: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says 'I'm possible'!
2347.author: Audrey Hepburn

2348.text: Today I choose life. Every morning when I wake up I can choose joy, happiness, negativity, pain... To feel the freedom that comes from being able to continue to make mistakes and choices - today I choose to feel life, not to deny my humanity but embrace it.
2348.author: Kevyn Aucoin

2349.text: Happiness is not something you postpone for the future; it is something you design for the present.
2349.author: Jim Rohn

2351.text: As we express our gratitude, we must never forget that the highest appreciation is not to utter words, but to live by them.
2351.author: John F. Kennedy

2352.text: I can't change the direction of the wind, but I can adjust my sails to always reach my destination.
2352.author: Jimmy Dean

2353.text: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
2353.author: Norman Vincent Peale

2354.text: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
2354.author: Theodore Roosevelt

2355.text: My mission in life is not merely to survive, but to thrive; and to do so with some passion, some compassion, some humor, and some style.
2355.author: Maya Angelou

2356.text: Start by doing what's necessary; then do what's possible; and suddenly you are doing the impossible.
2356.author: Francis of Assisi

2357.text: Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud.
2357.author: Maya Angelou

2358.text: A hero is someone who has given his or her life to something bigger than oneself.
2358.author: Joseph Campbell

2359.text: If opportunity doesn't knock, build a door.
2359.author: Milton Berle

2361.text: No act of kindness, no matter how small, is ever wasted.
2361.author: Aesop

2362.text: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
2362.author: Aristotle Onassis

2363.text: We know what we are, but know not what we may be.
2363.author: William Shakespeare

2364.text: Perfection is not attainable, but if we chase perfection we can catch excellence.
2364.author: Vince Lombardi

2365.text: Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky.
2365.author: Rabindranath Tagore

2366.text: Let us remember: One book, one pen, one child, and one teacher can change the world.
2366.author: Malala Yousafzai

2367.text: Let us sacrifice our today so that our children can have a better tomorrow.
2367.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

2368.text: Thousands of candles can be lighted from a single candle, and the life of the candle will not be shortened. Happiness never decreases by being shared.
2368.author: Buddha

2369.text: There are two ways of spreading light: to be the candle or the mirror that reflects it.
2369.author: Edith Wharton

2371.text: If you always put limit on everything you do, physical or anything else. It will spread into your work and into your life. There are no limits. There are only plateaus, and you must not stay there, you must go beyond them.
2371.author: Bruce Lee

2372.text: If you believe in yourself and have dedication and pride - and never quit, you'll be a winner. The price of victory is high but so are the rewards.
2372.author: Paul Bryant

2373.text: Shoot for the moon and if you miss you will still be among the stars.
2373.author: Les Brown

2374.text: What lies behind you and what lies in front of you, pales in comparison to what lies inside of you.
2374.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

2375.text: Every story I create, creates me. I write to create myself.
2375.author: Octavia E. Butler

2376.text: Memories of our lives, of our works and our deeds will continue in others.
2376.author: Rosa Parks

2377.text: If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music which he hears, however measured or far away.
2377.author: Henry David Thoreau

2378.text: We can't help everyone, but everyone can help someone.
2378.author: Ronald Reagan

2379.text: The undertaking of a new action brings new strength.
2379.author: Richard L. Evans

2380.text: When the sun is shining I can do anything; no mountain is too high, no trouble too difficult to overcome.
2380.author: Wilma Rudolph

2381.text: I thank you God for this most amazing day, for the leaping greenly spirits of trees, and for the blue dream of sky and for everything which is natural, which is infinite, which is yes.
2381.author: e. e. cummings

2382.text: If I have seen further than others, it is by standing upon the shoulders of giants.
2382.author: Isaac Newton

2383.text: The bird is powered by its own life and by its motivation.
2383.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

2384.text: Give light, and the darkness will disappear of itself.
2384.author: Desiderius Erasmus

2385.text: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
2385.author: George Eliot

2386.text: The world is full of magical things patiently waiting for our wits to grow sharper.
2386.author: Bertrand Russell

2387.text: Live your beliefs and you can turn the world around.
2387.author: Henry David Thoreau

2388.text: The measure of who we are is what we do with what we have.
2388.author: Vince Lombardi

2389.text: Don't limit yourself. Many people limit themselves to what they think they can do. You can go as far as your mind lets you. What you believe, remember, you can achieve.
2389.author: Mary Kay Ash

2390.text: I hated every minute of training, but I said, 'Don't quit. Suffer now and live the rest of your life as a champion.'
2390.author: Muhammad Ali

2391.text: Someone is sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago.
2391.author: Warren Buffett

2392.text: No matter what people tell you, words and ideas can change the world.
2392.author: Robin Williams

2393.text: When you get into a tight place and everything goes against you, till it seems as though you could not hang on a minute longer, never give up then, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.
2393.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

2394.text: The things that we love tell us what we are.
2394.author: Thomas Aquinas

2396.text: Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
2396.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

2397.text: What makes the desert beautiful is that somewhere it hides a well.
2397.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

2399.text: Even if I knew that tomorrow the world would go to pieces, I would still plant my apple tree.
2399.author: Martin Luther

2400.text: Turn your face to the sun and the shadows fall behind you.
2400.author: Unknown

2401.text: In a gentle way, you can shake the world.
2401.author: Mahatma Gandhi

2402.text: Everyone here has the sense that right now is one of those moments when we are influencing the future.
2402.author: Steve Jobs

2403.text: Once we believe in ourselves, we can risk curiosity, wonder, spontaneous delight, or any experience that reveals the human spirit.
2403.author: e. e. cummings

2404.text: How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world.
2404.author: Anne Frank

2405.text: Follow your bliss and the universe will open doors where there were only walls.
2405.author: Joseph Campbell

2406.text: The limits of the possible can only be defined by going beyond them into the impossible.
2406.author: Arthur C. Clarke

2407.text: What we achieve inwardly will change outer reality.
2407.author: Plutarch

2408.text: Only those who have learned the power of sincere and selfless contribution experience life's deepest joy: true fulfillment.
2408.author: Tony Robbins

2409.text: Your big opportunity may be right where you are now.
2409.author: Napoleon Hill

2410.text: Let your life lightly dance on the edges of Time like dew on the tip of a leaf.
2410.author: Rabindranath Tagore

2411.text: It is in your moments of decision that your destiny is shaped.
2411.author: Tony Robbins

2412.text: You must do the things you think you cannot do.
2412.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

2413.text: The power of imagination makes us infinite.
2413.author: John Muir

2414.text: Happiness resides not in possessions, and not in gold, happiness dwells in the soul.
2414.author: Democritus

2415.text: Love is a fruit in season at all times, and within reach of every hand.
2415.author: Mother Teresa

2416.text: Let us dream of tomorrow where we can truly love from the soul, and know love as the ultimate truth at the heart of all creation.
2416.author: Michael Jackson

2418.text: From a small seed a mighty trunk may grow.
2418.author: Aeschylus

2419.text: From what we get, we can make a living; what we give, however, makes a life.
2419.author: Arthur Ashe

2420.text: Wonder rather than doubt is the root of all knowledge.
2420.author: Abraham Joshua Heschel

2421.text: With self-discipline most anything is possible.
2421.author: Theodore Roosevelt

2422.text: Everyone has inside of him a piece of good news. The good news is that you don't know how great you can be! How much you can love! What you can accomplish! And what your potential is!
2422.author: Anne Frank

2423.text: Whoever is happy will make others happy too.
2423.author: Anne Frank

2424.text: There is nothing impossible to him who will try.
2424.author: Alexander the Great

2425.text: Keep your feet on the ground, but let your heart soar as high as it will. Refuse to be average or to surrender to the chill of your spiritual environment.
2425.author: Arthur Helps

2427.text: It seems to me we can never give up longing and wishing while we are thoroughly alive. There are certain things we feel to be beautiful and good, and we must hunger after them.
2427.author: George Eliot

2428.text: Be brave enough to live life creatively. The creative place where no one else has ever been.
2428.author: Alan Alda

2429.text: Throw your dreams into space like a kite, and you do not know what it will bring back, a new life, a new friend, a new love, a new country.
2429.author: Anais Nin

2430.text: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together, but do so with all your heart.
2430.author: Marcus Aurelius

2431.text: The only journey is the one within.
2431.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

2432.text: Two roads diverged in a wood and I - I took the one less traveled by, and that has made all the difference.
2432.author: Robert Frost

2433.text: If we did all the things we are capable of, we would literally astound ourselves.
2433.author: Thomas A. Edison

2434.text: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.
2434.author: Og Mandino

2435.text: Today is the only day. Yesterday is gone.
2435.author: John Wooden

2436.text: Each day provides its own gifts.
2436.author: Marcus Aurelius

2437.text: What great thing would you attempt if you knew you could not fail?
2437.author: Robert H. Schuller

2438.text: Tomorrow is the most important thing in life. Comes into us at midnight very clean. It's perfect when it arrives and it puts itself in our hands. It hopes we've learned something from yesterday.
2438.author: John Wayne

2439.text: If the doors of perception were cleansed everything would appear to man as it is, infinite.
2439.author: William Blake

2440.text: And when I breathed, my breath was lightning.
2440.author: Black Elk

2441.text: One today is worth two tomorrows.
2441.author: Benjamin Franklin

2442.text: Since we launched the original 'Pop Idol' in England, I've remained close with Simon Fuller. Working as executive producer on 'American idol' for its first seven years not only was an inspirational journey into the heart of American pop culture, it opened my eyes to the untapped potential of the incredibly dynamic young people in this world.
2442.author: Nigel Lythgoe

2443.text: How glorious a greeting the sun gives the mountains!
2443.author: John Muir

2444.text: I try not to put anything political on the forefront of what I'm trying to do creatively. At the same time, I do think it's wonderful when I hear people say that it's inspirational that I'm an Indian woman on camera. My life is very diverse, and my friends are a diverse group of people.
2444.author: Mindy Kaling

2445.text: Find out who you are and be that person. That's what your soul was put on this Earth to be. Find that truth, live that truth and everything else will come.
2445.author: Ellen DeGeneres

2446.text: Every moment and every event of every man's life on earth plants something in his soul.
2446.author: Thomas Merton

2447.text: Man never made any material as resilient as the human spirit.
2447.author: Bernard Williams

2448.text: Try to be like the turtle - at ease in your own shell.
2448.author: Bill Copeland

2449.text: Do your little bit of good where you are; it's those little bits of good put together that overwhelm the world.
2449.author: Desmond Tutu

2452.text: I've been absolutely terrified every moment of my life - and I've never let it keep me from doing a single thing I wanted to do.
2452.author: Georgia O'Keeffe

2453.text: I believe in living today. Not in yesterday, nor in tomorrow.
2453.author: Loretta Young

2454.text: Our time here is magic! It's the only space you have to realize whatever it is that is beautiful, whatever is true, whatever is great, whatever is potential, whatever is rare, whatever is unique, in. It's the only space.
2454.author: Ben Okri

2456.text: Act like you expect to get into the end zone.
2456.author: Christopher Morley

2459.text: Vitality shows in not only the ability to persist but the ability to start over.
2459.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

2460.text: I have always believed, and I still believe, that whatever good or bad fortune may come our way we can always give it meaning and transform it into something of value.
2460.author: Hermann Hesse

2461.text: Tears of joy are like the summer rain drops pierced by sunbeams.
2461.author: Hosea Ballou

2462.text: As people are walking all the time, in the same spot, a path appears.
2462.author: John Locke

2463.text: Let every dawn be to you as the beginning of life, and every setting sun be to you as its close.
2463.author: John Ruskin

2464.text: I believe every human has a finite number of heartbeats. I don't intend to waste any of mine.
2464.author: Neil Armstrong

2465.text: Happiness is the natural flower of duty.
2465.author: Phillips Brooks

2466.text: Thinking: the talking of the soul with itself.
2466.author: Plato

2467.text: If there were no night, we would not appreciate the day, nor could we see the stars and the vastness of the heavens. We must partake of the bitter with the sweet. There is a divine purpose in the adversities we encounter every day. They prepare, they purge, they purify, and thus they bless.
2467.author: James E. Faust

2468.text: Learning how to be still, to really be still and let life happen - that stillness becomes a radiance.
2468.author: Morgan Freeman

2469.text: This CD became something of a personal journey for me. The tone of the whole CD is uplifting and inspirational. It's an upper. We have enough downers in the world.
2469.author: Roma Downey
