2470.text: I do love to eavesdrop. It's inspirational, not only for subject matter but for actual dialogue, the way people talk.
2470.author: Lynda Barry

2471.text: Everything you want is out there waiting for you to ask. Everything you want also wants you. But you have to take action to get it.
2471.author: Jules Renard

2472.text: The books that help you most are those which make you think that most. The hardest way of learning is that of easy reading; but a great book that comes from a great thinker is a ship of thought, deep freighted with truth and beauty.
2472.author: Pablo Neruda

2473.text: A compliment is something like a kiss through a veil.
2473.author: Victor Hugo

2474.text: We are here to make another world.
2474.author: W. Edwards Deming

2475.text: Reach for it. Push yourself as far as you can.
2475.author: Christa McAuliffe

2476.text: Grace is the beauty of form under the influence of freedom.
2476.author: Friedrich Schiller

2477.text: God sleeps in the minerals, awakens in plants, walks in animals, and thinks in man.
2477.author: Arthur Young

2478.text: Just what future the Designer of the universe has provided for the souls of men I do not know, I cannot prove. But I find that the whole order of Nature confirms my confidence that, if it is not like our noblest hopes and dreams, it will transcend them.
2478.author: Henry Norris Russell

2479.text: From its brilliancy everything is illuminated.
2479.author: Guru Nanak

2480.text: A #2 pencil and a dream can take you anywhere.
2480.author: Joyce Meyer

2481.text: I want to make this world perfect.
2481.author: Malala Yousafzai

2482.text: I wanted to do something inspirational for my children.
2482.author: Harvey Weinstein

2483.text: Books are challenging and inspirational to me.
2483.author: Amy Sedaris

2484.text: To me, the Seventies were very inspirational and very influential... With my whole persona as Snoop Dogg, as a person, as a rapper. I just love the Seventies style, the way all the players dressed nice, you know, kept their hair looking good, drove sharp cars and they talked real slick.
2484.author: Snoop Dogg

2485.text: I don't dislike rappers or hip-hop or people who like it. I went to the Def Jam tour in Manchester in the '80s when rap was inspirational. Public Enemy were awesome. But it's all about status and bling now, and it doesn't say anything to me.
2485.author: Noel Gallagher

2486.text: When I was working at the Sprint store, I got laid off. I was bummed out, but I stayed positive. I used the money I had earned while working there to make my first album. Without that job, maybe 'Corazon Sin Cara' would never had been made. It's a very inspirational story.
2486.author: Prince Royce

2487.text: You never know when some small thing will lead to a big idea. Travel is very inspirational - but it's in the ordinary that I find my themes of love and work and family.
2487.author: Adriana Trigiani

2488.text: It is by acts and not by ideas that people live.
2488.author: Anatole France

2489.text: The only way to discover the limits of the possible is to go beyond them into the impossible.
2489.author: Arthur C. Clarke

2490.text: A place for everything, everything in its place.
2490.author: Benjamin Franklin

2491.text: Noble deeds that are concealed are most esteemed.
2491.author: Blaise Pascal

2492.text: Miracles are a retelling in small letters of the very same story which is written across the whole world in letters too large for some of us to see.
2492.author: C. S. Lewis

2493.text: When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go.
2493.author: Carol Burnett

2494.text: The Wright brothers flew right through the smoke screen of impossibility.
2494.author: Charles Kettering

2495.text: Love the moment and the energy of that moment will spread beyond all boundaries.
2495.author: Corita Kent

2497.text: I believe that if one always looked at the skies, one would end up with wings.
2497.author: Gustave Flaubert

2498.text: Tears are often the telescope by which men see far into heaven.
2498.author: Henry Ward Beecher

2499.text: In oneself lies the whole world and if you know how to look and learn, the door is there and the key is in your hand. Nobody on earth can give you either the key or the door to open, except yourself.
2499.author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

2500.text: Ideas shape the course of history.
2500.author: John Maynard Keynes

2501.text: It is not ignorance but knowledge which is the mother of wonder.
2501.author: Joseph Wood Krutch

2502.text: Yesterday we obeyed kings and bent our necks before emperors. But today we kneel only to truth, follow only beauty, and obey only love.
2502.author: Khalil Gibran

2503.text: Health is the greatest possession. Contentment is the greatest treasure. Confidence is the greatest friend. Non-being is the greatest joy.
2503.author: Lao Tzu

2504.text: The fact that I can plant a seed and it becomes a flower, share a bit of knowledge and it becomes another's, smile at someone and receive a smile in return, are to me continual spiritual exercises.
2504.author: Leo Buscaglia

2505.text: If the world seems cold to you, kindle fires to warm it.
2505.author: Lucy Larcom

2506.text: Look within. Within is the fountain of good, and it will ever bubble up, if thou wilt ever dig.
2506.author: Marcus Aurelius

2508.text: A human being has so many skins inside, covering the depths of the heart. We know so many things, but we don't know ourselves! Why, thirty or forty skins or hides, as thick and hard as an ox's or bear's, cover the soul. Go into your own ground and learn to know yourself there.
2508.author: Meister Eckhart

2509.text: If you accept the expectations of others, especially negative ones, then you never will change the outcome.
2509.author: Michael Jordan

2510.text: Cherish your visions and your dreams as they are the children of your soul, the blueprints of your ultimate achievements.
2510.author: Napoleon Hill

2511.text: Happiness is a butterfly, which when pursued, is always just beyond your grasp, but which, if you will sit down quietly, may alight upon you.
2511.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

2512.text: I said to the almond tree, 'Friend, speak to me of God,' and the almond tree blossomed.
2512.author: Nikos Kazantzakis

2513.text: When deeds speak, words are nothing.
2513.author: Pierre-Joseph Proudhon

2514.text: I have looked into your eyes with my eyes. I have put my heart near your heart.
2514.author: Pope John XXIII

2515.text: Of all human activities, man's listening to God is the supreme act of his reasoning and will.
2515.author: Pope Paul VI

2516.text: Nothing makes one feel so strong as a call for help.
2516.author: Pope Paul VI

2517.text: The best way out is always through.
2517.author: Robert Frost

2518.text: Every heart that has beat strongly and cheerfully has left a hopeful impulse behind it in the world, and bettered the tradition of mankind.
2518.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

2519.text: What we need is more people who specialize in the impossible.
2519.author: Theodore Roethke

2520.text: Hope is some extraordinary spiritual grace that God gives us to control our fears, not to oust them.
2520.author: Vincent McNabb

2521.text: The most beautiful thing in the world is, of course, the world itself.
2521.author: Wallace Stevens

2522.text: I celebrate myself, and sing myself.
2522.author: Walt Whitman

2524.text: I am not afraid of tomorrow, for I have seen yesterday and I love today!
2524.author: William Allen White

2526.text: We can change our lives. We can do, have, and be exactly what we wish.
2526.author: Tony Robbins

2527.text: If you could only love enough, you could be the most powerful person in the world.
2527.author: Emmet Fox

2528.text: For a gallant spirit there can never be defeat.
2528.author: Wallis Simpson

2529.text: Whatever you vividly imagine, ardently desire, sincerely believe, and enthusiastically act upon... must inevitably come to pass!
2529.author: Paul J. Meyer

2530.text: I believe there's an inner power that makes winners or losers. And the winners are the ones who really listen to the truth of their hearts.
2530.author: Sylvester Stallone

2531.text: There is nothing stronger in the world than gentleness.
2531.author: Han Suyin

2533.text: It is always the simple that produces the marvelous.
2533.author: Amelia Barr

2534.text: It is only in sorrow bad weather masters us; in joy we face the storm and defy it.
2534.author: Amelia Barr

2535.text: Mankind is made great or little by its own will.
2535.author: Friedrich Schiller

2536.text: You don't look out there for God, something in the sky, you look in you.
2536.author: Alan Watts

2537.text: The essential elements of giving are power and love - activity and affection - and the consciousness of the race testifies that in the high and appropriate exercise of these is a blessedness greater than any other.
2537.author: Mark Hopkins

2538.text: Your present circumstances don't determine where you can go; they merely determine where you start.
2538.author: Nido Qubein

2539.text: The most authentic thing about us is our capacity to create, to overcome, to endure, to transform, to love and to be greater than our suffering.
2539.author: Ben Okri

2541.text: Countless as the sands of the sea are human passions.
2541.author: Nikolai Gogol

2542.text: Without craftsmanship, inspiration is a mere reed shaken in the wind.
2542.author: Johannes Brahms

2543.text: Silence is the last thing the world will ever hear from me.
2543.author: Marlee Matlin

2544.text: I pray God may preserve your health and life many years.
2544.author: Junipero Serra

2545.text: Thought is the wind, knowledge the sail, and mankind the vessel.
2545.author: Augustus Hare

2546.text: When Maurice touched a keyboard, it was like something from a movie, magical. He would always give you something from a movie, and you'd go, what did you just play... immediately inspirational writings, amazing. That's what we're going to miss.
2546.author: Robin Gibb

2547.text: Look at a football field. It looks like a big movie screen. This is theatre. Football combines the strategy of chess. It's part ballet. It's part battleground, part playground. We clarify, amplify and glorify the game with our footage, the narration and that music, and in the end create an inspirational piece of footage.
2547.author: Steve Sabol

2548.text: A concerted effort to preserve our heritage is a vital link to our cultural, educational, aesthetic, inspirational, and economic legacies - all of the things that quite literally make us who we are.
2548.author: Steve Berry

2549.text: A lot of America is kind of done. People have been making films about it for 100 years. Everything to me feels used up. But Jo-Burg feels unbelievably inspirational to me.
2549.author: Neill Blomkamp

2550.text: I have amazing friends who have led inspirational lives.
2550.author: Andrew Shue

2551.text: 'Star Wars' is fun, its exciting, its inspirational, and people respond to that. It's what they want.
2551.author: George Lucas

2552.text: One of the things that I did before I ran for president is I was a professional speaker. Not a motivational speaker - an inspirational speaker. Motivation comes from within. You have to be inspired. That's what I do. I inspire people, I inspire the public, I inspire my staff. I inspired the organizations I took over to want to succeed.
2552.author: Herman Cain

2553.text: Almost every college playwright or sketch or improv comedian was sort of aware of Christopher Durang - even kids in high school. His short plays were so accessible to younger people and I think that was inspirational to me.
2553.author: Mindy Kaling

2554.text: It's inspirational to see someone who is dying smile.
2554.author: Arlen Specter

2556.text: Teachers need to be more inspirational. But it's also up to engineering to make itself more interesting.
2556.author: Bruce Dickinson

2557.text: Just as you wouldn't leave the house without taking a shower, you shouldn't start the day without at least 10 minutes of sacred practice: prayer, meditation, inspirational reading.
2557.author: Marianne Williamson

2558.text: Like the United Nations, there is something inspirational about New York as a great melting pot of different cultures and traditions. And if this is the city that never sleeps, the United Nations works tirelessly, around the clock around the world.
2558.author: Ban Ki-moon

2559.text: There are thousands of inspirational stories waiting to be told about young women who yearn for a great education. They are stories of struggle and stories of success, and they will inspire others to take action and work to change lives.
2559.author: Soledad O'Brien

2560.text: Personally, I can't see the appeal in trekking down to D.C. for a networking extravaganza, even if it is built around a special moment in American history. While I find the election of Barack Obama inspirational, I don't have a desire to memorialize it with overly effusive celebration.
2560.author: Jamie Johnson

2561.text: We sing inspirational songs, songs of praise and worship, and about how good and how big God is. We are magnifying the Lord.
2561.author: Fred Hammond

2562.text: If someone says 'grunge' or 'punk,' you know what the sound is, but if you say 'No Wave,' it's kind of mysterious. That was the most interesting part and should have been the most inspirational thing about it... here's this collective sonic insanity, and none of it sounds anything alike.
2562.author: Lydia Lunch

2564.text: Faith is love taking the form of aspiration.
2564.author: William Ellery Channing

2566.text: I know why I am here and my only real focused goal is to live each day to the fullest and to try and honor God and be an encouragement to others. What the future holds is firmly in God's hands, and I am very happy about that!
2566.author: Ken Hensley

2567.text: Let us make our future now, and let us make our dreams tomorrow's reality.
2567.author: Malala Yousafzai

2568.text: Architecture is not an inspirational business, it's a rational procedure to do sensible and hopefully beautiful things; that's all.
2568.author: Harry Seidler

2569.text: Space is an inspirational concept that allows you to dream big.
2569.author: Peter Diamandis

2570.text: Be not entangled in this world of days and nights; Thou hast another time and space as well.
2570.author: Muhammad Iqbal

2571.text: Had I not come out with an inspirational CD, you perhaps would have never known that I feel like I feel, that all songs, all the music I've ever done is a gift from God.
2571.author: Smokey Robinson

2572.text: Lee's great gifts are teaching and inspirational guidance, not administration and management.
2572.author: Cheryl Crawford

2574.text: So I wanted to sing inspirational music, and that's exactly how I approached it - only the words have been changed to declare my relationship with God.
2574.author: Smokey Robinson

2575.text: The good life is one inspired by love and guided by knowledge.
2575.author: Bertrand Russell

2577.text: The true sign of intelligence is not knowledge but imagination.
2577.author: Albert Einstein

2578.text: For beautiful eyes, look for the good in others; for beautiful lips, speak only words of kindness; and for poise, walk with the knowledge that you are never alone.
2578.author: Audrey Hepburn

2580.text: A people without the knowledge of their past history, origin and culture is like a tree without roots.
2580.author: Marcus Garvey

2581.text: The only source of knowledge is experience.
2581.author: Albert Einstein

2582.text: Knowledge is power. Information is liberating. Education is the premise of progress, in every society, in every family.
2582.author: Kofi Annan

2583.text: We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid.
2583.author: Benjamin Franklin

2584.text: Real knowledge is to know the extent of one's ignorance.
2584.author: Confucius

2585.text: Never stop fighting until you arrive at your destined place - that is, the unique you. Have an aim in life, continuously acquire knowledge, work hard, and have perseverance to realise the great life.
2585.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

2586.text: The great aim of education is not knowledge but action.
2586.author: Herbert Spencer

2587.text: Science is a way of thinking much more than it is a body of knowledge.
2587.author: Carl Sagan

2588.text: To know what you know and what you do not know, that is true knowledge.
2588.author: Confucius

2589.text: Ignorance is the curse of God; knowledge is the wing wherewith we fly to heaven.
2589.author: William Shakespeare

2590.text: The greatest obstacle to discovery is not ignorance - it is the illusion of knowledge.
2590.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

2592.text: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers. It may not be difficult to store up in the mind a vast quantity of facts within a comparatively short time, but the ability to form judgments requires the severe discipline of hard work and the tempering heat of experience and maturity.
2592.author: Calvin Coolidge

2593.text: Science knows no country, because knowledge belongs to humanity, and is the torch which illuminates the world. Science is the highest personification of the nation because that nation will remain the first which carries the furthest the works of thought and intelligence.
2593.author: Louis Pasteur

2594.text: Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire, emotion, and knowledge.
2594.author: Plato

2595.text: Knowledge will forever govern ignorance; and a people who mean to be their own governors must arm themselves with the power which knowledge gives.
2595.author: James Madison

2598.text: A good decision is based on knowledge and not on numbers.
2598.author: Plato

2599.text: The one exclusive sign of thorough knowledge is the power of teaching.
2599.author: Aristotle

2600.text: The aim of education is the knowledge, not of facts, but of values.
2600.author: William S. Burroughs

2601.text: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
2601.author: Immanuel Kant

2602.text: Knowledge will give you power, but character respect.
2602.author: Bruce Lee

2603.text: There are three principal means of acquiring knowledge... observation of nature, reflection, and experimentation. Observation collects facts; reflection combines them; experimentation verifies the result of that combination.
2603.author: Denis Diderot

2604.text: It is beyond a doubt that all our knowledge begins with experience.
2604.author: Immanuel Kant

2605.text: Carry out a random act of kindness, with no expectation of reward, safe in the knowledge that one day someone might do the same for you.
2605.author: Princess Diana

2606.text: To know, is to know that you know nothing. That is the meaning of true knowledge.
2606.author: Socrates

2608.text: The only fence against the world is a thorough knowledge of it.
2608.author: John Locke

2609.text: Risk comes from not knowing what you're doing.
2609.author: Warren Buffett

2610.text: I know of no time in human history where ignorance was better than knowledge.
2610.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

2611.text: Wisdom is the right use of knowledge. To know is not to be wise. Many men know a great deal, and are all the greater fools for it. There is no fool so great a fool as a knowing fool. But to know how to use knowledge is to have wisdom.
2611.author: Charles Spurgeon

2612.text: Opinion is the medium between knowledge and ignorance.
2612.author: Plato

2613.text: For the things of this world cannot be made known without a knowledge of mathematics.
2613.author: Roger Bacon

2616.text: The goal of education is not to increase the amount of knowledge but to create the possibilities for a child to invent and discover, to create men who are capable of doing new things.
2616.author: Jean Piaget

2617.text: Intelligence, knowledge or experience are important and might get you a job, but strong communication skills are what will get you promoted.
2617.author: Mireille Guiliano

2618.text: Those who have knowledge, don't predict. Those who predict, don't have knowledge.
2618.author: Lao Tzu

2619.text: Knowledge is power. Information is power. The secreting or hoarding of knowledge or information may be an act of tyranny camouflaged as humility.
2619.author: Robin Morgan

2620.text: The improvement of understanding is for two ends: first, our own increase of knowledge; secondly, to enable us to deliver that knowledge to others.
2620.author: John Locke

2621.text: When people rely on surface appearances and false racial stereotypes, rather than in-depth knowledge of others at the level of the heart, mind and spirit, their ability to assess and understand people accurately is compromised.
2621.author: James A. Forbes

2622.text: Happiness exists on earth, and it is won through prudent exercise of reason, knowledge of the harmony of the universe, and constant practice of generosity.
2622.author: Jose Marti

2625.text: Some people drink from the fountain of knowledge, others just gargle.
2625.author: Robert Anthony

2626.text: If education is always to be conceived along the same antiquated lines of a mere transmission of knowledge, there is little to be hoped from it in the bettering of man's future. For what is the use of transmitting knowledge if the individual's total development lags behind?
2626.author: Maria Montessori

2627.text: The control of information is something the elite always does, particularly in a despotic form of government. Information, knowledge, is power. If you can control information, you can control people.
2627.author: Tom Clancy

2628.text: A thorough knowledge of the Bible is worth more than a college education.
2628.author: Theodore Roosevelt

2629.text: We cannot stop natural disasters but we can arm ourselves with knowledge: so many lives wouldn't have to be lost if there was enough disaster preparedness.
2629.author: Petra Nemcova

2630.text: Our knowledge and all of our ideas are mutually connected; the more complicated they are, the more numerous must be the roads that lead to them and depart from them.
2630.author: Cesare Beccaria

2631.text: Three passions, simple but overwhelmingly strong, have governed my life: the longing for love, the search for knowledge, and unbearable pity for the suffering of mankind.
2631.author: Bertrand Russell

2632.text: The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom.
2632.author: Isaac Asimov

2633.text: True knowledge exists in knowing that you know nothing.
2633.author: Socrates

2634.text: You are the master of your own ship, pal. There are lots of people who fall into troubled waters and don't have the guts or the knowledge or the ability to make it to shore. They have nobody to blame but themselves.
2634.author: Evel Knievel

2635.text: If you have knowledge, let others light their candles in it.
2635.author: Margaret Fuller

2636.text: When knowledge is limited - it leads to folly... When knowledge exceeds a certain limit, it leads to exploitation.
2636.author: Abu Bakr

2637.text: Knowledge is love and light and vision.
2637.author: Helen Keller

2638.text: To acquire knowledge, one must study; but to acquire wisdom, one must observe.
2638.author: Marilyn vos Savant

2639.text: Knowledge has to be improved, challenged, and increased constantly, or it vanishes.
2639.author: Peter Drucker

2640.text: The larger the island of knowledge, the longer the shoreline of wonder.
2640.author: Ralph W. Sockman

2641.text: The gift of fantasy has meant more to me than my talent for absorbing positive knowledge.
2641.author: Albert Einstein

2643.text: It is not knowledge, but the act of learning, not possession but the act of getting there, which grants the greatest enjoyment.
2643.author: Carl Friedrich Gauss

2644.text: Liberty cannot be preserved without general knowledge among the people.
2644.author: John Adams

2645.text: The interpretation of dreams is the royal road to a knowledge of the unconscious activities of the mind.
2645.author: Sigmund Freud

2647.text: There is, however, another purpose to which academies contribute. When they consist of a limited number of persons, eminent for their knowledge, it becomes an object of ambition to be admitted on their list.
2647.author: Charles Babbage

2648.text: Despite my firm convictions, I have always been a man who tries to face facts, and to accept the reality of life as new experience and new knowledge unfolds. I have always kept an open mind, a flexibility that must go hand in hand with every form of the intelligent search for truth.
2648.author: Malcolm X

2649.text: Your competition is not other people but the time you kill, the ill will you create, the knowledge you neglect to learn, the connections you fail to build, the health you sacrifice along the path, your inability to generate ideas, the people around you who don't support and love your efforts, and whatever god you curse for your bad luck.
2649.author: James Altucher

2650.text: The modern mind is in complete disarray. Knowledge has stretched itself to the point where neither the world nor our intelligence can find any foot-hold. It is a fact that we are suffering from nihilism.
2650.author: Albert Camus

2652.text: Life is a travelling to the edge of knowledge, then a leap taken.
2652.author: D. H. Lawrence

2653.text: A little knowledge that acts is worth infinitely more than much knowledge that is idle.
2653.author: Khalil Gibran

2654.text: We believe... that by encouraging critical thinking and processing of knowledge we are creating full, well-rounded human beings... that will enable Qatar to build up its society. You cannot build a healthy society without giving your citizens a sense of ownership. Otherwise, they will not share with you the responsibilities.
2654.author: Moza bint Nasser

2655.text: There is this tremendous body of knowledge in the world of academia where extraordinary numbers of incredibly thoughtful people have taken the time to examine on a really profound level the way we live our lives and who we are and where we've been. That brilliant learning sometimes gets trapped in academia and never sees the light of day.
2655.author: Malcolm Gladwell

2656.text: Nature is the source of all true knowledge. She has her own logic, her own laws, she has no effect without cause nor invention without necessity.
2656.author: Leonardo da Vinci

2657.text: Probability is expectation founded upon partial knowledge. A perfect acquaintance with all the circumstances affecting the occurrence of an event would change expectation into certainty, and leave nether room nor demand for a theory of probabilities.
2657.author: George Boole

2658.text: Knowledge is proud that it knows so much; wisdom is humble that it knows no more.
2658.author: William Cowper

2659.text: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
2659.author: Albert Einstein

2660.text: Knowledge is the parent of knowledge. He who possesses most of the information of his age will not quietly submit to neglect its current acquisitions, but will go on improving as long as means and opportunities offer; while he who finds himself ignorant of most things, is only too apt to shrink from a labour which becomes Herculean.
2660.author: James Fenimore Cooper

2661.text: In 20 or 30 years, you'll be able to hold in your hand as much computing knowledge as exists now in the whole city, or even the whole world.
2661.author: Douglas Engelbart

2662.text: In a knowledge economy, natural selection favors organizations that can most effectively harness and coordinate collective intellectual energy and creative capacity.
2662.author: Justin Rosenstein

2663.text: Public schools helped create the idea of America and inculcate Americans with a few rudiments of knowledge. To judge by that very American item, the Internet, a few rudiments is all anyone cares to have.
2663.author: P. J. O'Rourke

2664.text: Knowledge rests not upon truth alone, but upon error also.
2664.author: Carl Jung

2665.text: When you know a thing, to hold that you know it, and when you do not know a thing, to allow that you do not know it - this is knowledge.
2665.author: Confucius

2666.text: Knowledge is a polite word for dead but not buried imagination.
2666.author: e. e. cummings

2667.text: Pain and foolishness lead to great bliss and complete knowledge, for Eternal Wisdom created nothing under the sun in vain.
2667.author: Khalil Gibran

2668.text: The natural desire of good men is knowledge.
2668.author: Leonardo da Vinci

2669.text: The knowledge of yourself will preserve you from vanity.
2669.author: Miguel de Cervantes

2670.text: Having knowledge but lacking the power to express it clearly is no better than never having any ideas at all.
2670.author: Pericles

2671.text: And what, Socrates, is the food of the soul? Surely, I said, knowledge is the food of the soul.
2671.author: Plato

2672.text: Entire ignorance is not so terrible or extreme an evil, and is far from being the greatest of all; too much cleverness and too much learning, accompanied with ill bringing-up, are far more fatal.
2672.author: Plato

2673.text: Knowledge is the eye of desire and can become the pilot of the soul.
2673.author: Will Durant

2674.text: Cherish that which is within you, and shut off that which is without; for much knowledge is a curse.
2674.author: Zhuangzi

2675.text: We are drowning in information but starved for knowledge.
2675.author: John Naisbitt

2676.text: We live on an island surrounded by a sea of ignorance. As our island of knowledge grows, so does the shore of our ignorance.
2676.author: John Archibald Wheeler

2677.text: I think we risk becoming the best informed society that has ever died of ignorance.
2677.author: Ruben Blades

2678.text: We don't know all the answers. If we knew all the answers we'd be bored, wouldn't we? We keep looking, searching, trying to get more knowledge.
2678.author: Jack LaLanne

2679.text: Knowledge is power only if man knows what facts not to bother with.
2679.author: Robert Staughton Lynd

2680.text: The doorstep to the temple of wisdom is a knowledge of our own ignorance.
2680.author: Benjamin Franklin

2681.text: Distinguishing the signal from the noise requires both scientific knowledge and self-knowledge.
2681.author: Nate Silver

2682.text: Knowledge is power. Most of us agree that something has to be done to strengthen Social Security, and I believe it's irresponsible to arbitrarily dismiss any idea, Republican nor Democrat, without giving it a hard look.
2682.author: Conrad Burns

2683.text: There is a general knowledge that I am multi-dimensional, that when you are creative you do a lot of things.
2683.author: Suzanne Somers

2684.text: After the knowledge of, and obedience to, the will of God, the next aim must be to know something of His attributes of wisdom, power, and goodness as evidenced by His handiwork.
2684.author: James Prescott Joule

2685.text: Because in the school of the Spirit man learns wisdom through humility, knowledge by forgetting, how to speak by silence, how to live by dying.
2685.author: Johannes Tauler

2686.text: There's no such thing is aging, but maturing and knowledge. It's beautiful, I call that beauty.
2686.author: Celine Dion

2687.text: The library, with its Daedalian labyrinth, mysterious hush, and faintly ominous aroma of knowledge, has been replaced by the computer's cheap glow, pesky chirp, and data spillage.
2687.author: P. J. O'Rourke

2688.text: Life is a culmination of the past, an awareness of the present, an indication of a future beyond knowledge, the quality that gives a touch of divinity to matter.
2688.author: Charles Lindbergh

2689.text: Zeal will do more than knowledge.
2689.author: William Hazlitt

2690.text: It makes a great deal of difference whether one wills not to sin or has not the knowledge to sin.
2690.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

2691.text: Lost wealth may be replaced by industry, lost knowledge by study, lost health by temperance or medicine, but lost time is gone forever.
2691.author: Samuel Smiles

2692.text: Ignorance is bold and knowledge reserved.
2692.author: Thucydides

2693.text: Knowledge cultivates your seeds and does not sow in your seeds.
2693.author: Khalil Gibran

2695.text: We can't have full knowledge all at once. We must start by believing; then afterwards we may be led on to master the evidence for ourselves.
2695.author: Thomas Aquinas

2696.text: Wisdom is a kind of knowledge. It is knowledge of the nature, career, and consequences of human values.
2696.author: Sidney Hook

2697.text: It is a matter of common knowledge that the government of South Carolina is under domination of a small ring of cunning, conniving men.
2697.author: Strom Thurmond

2698.text: To act on the belief that we possess the knowledge and the power which enable us to shape the processes of society entirely to our liking, knowledge which in fact we do not possess, is likely to make us do much harm.
2698.author: Friedrich August von Hayek

2699.text: Scientific discovery and scientific knowledge have been achieved only by those who have gone in pursuit of it without any practical purpose whatsoever in view.
2699.author: Max Planck

2700.text: Data is not information, information is not knowledge, knowledge is not understanding, understanding is not wisdom.
2700.author: Clifford Stoll

2701.text: It may, however, be said that the level of experience to which concepts are inapplicable cannot yield any knowledge of a universal character, for concepts alone are capable of being socialized.
2701.author: Muhammad Iqbal

2702.text: For whatever be the knowledge which we are able to obtain of God, either by perception or reflection, we must of necessity believe that He is by many degrees far better than what we perceive Him to be.
2702.author: Origen

2703.text: At each increase of knowledge, as well as on the contrivance of every new tool, human labour becomes abridged.
2703.author: Charles Babbage

2704.text: But the scientific importance of a change in knowledge of fact consists precisely in j its having consequences for a system of theory.
2704.author: Talcott Parsons

2705.text: G is Grace, the Flaming Star is the Torch of Reason. Those who possess this knowledge are indeed Illuminati.
2705.author: Adam Weishaupt

2706.text: I listen to them freely and with all the respect merited by their intelligence, their character, their knowledge, reserving always my incontestable right of criticism and censure.
2706.author: Mikhail Bakunin

2707.text: When I severe my connections with the A.I.A. I do so with my own self respect, as a matter of pride and I am sure within your knowledge of my character.
2707.author: Ralph Thomas Walker

2708.text: Prices are important not because money is considered paramount but because prices are a fast and effective conveyor of information through a vast society in which fragmented knowledge must be coordinated.
2708.author: Thomas Sowell

2709.text: The education that prepared me was my general education classes, which I tried to avoid when I was a stupid undergraduate, but which gave me the foundation of general knowledge that makes a career as a writer possible.
2709.author: Orson Scott Card

2710.text: Thought is the wind and knowledge the sail.
2710.author: David Hare

2711.text: Our knowledge is a receding mirage in an expanding desert of ignorance.
2711.author: Will Durant

2712.text: In complete darkness we are all the same, it is only our knowledge and wisdom that separates us, don't let your eyes deceive you.
2712.author: Janet Jackson

2713.text: Scholastic learning and polemical divinity retarded the growth of all true knowledge.
2713.author: David Hume

2714.text: Universities exist to transmit knowledge and understanding of ideas and values to students not to provide entertainment for spectators or employment for athletes.
2714.author: Milton Friedman

2715.text: If a little knowledge was a dangerous thing, a lot was lethal.
2715.author: Tom Sharpe

2716.text: When you deal with a person who's experiencing dementia, you can see where they're struggling with knowledge. You can see what they forget completely, what they forget but they know what they once knew. You can tell how they're trying to remember.
2716.author: Walter Mosley

2717.text: The most important seed I can sow in this life is my children, and the love and knowledge that I can bestow upon them and the help I can give them.
2717.author: Steven Seagal

2718.text: I think in the NFL knowledge is power, and you try to get the knowledge by whatever means.
2718.author: Steve Sabol

2719.text: Compassion is a practically acquired knowledge, like dancing. You must do it and practice diligently day by day.
2719.author: Karen Armstrong

2720.text: Imagine someone holding forth on biology whose only knowledge of the subject is 'The Book of British Birds,' and you have a rough idea of what it feels like to read Richard Dawkins on theology.
2720.author: Terry Eagleton

2721.text: Is there anything science should not try to explain? Science is knowledge and knowledge is power - power to do good or evil. Sometimes ignorance is bliss.
2721.author: Paul Davies

2722.text: The people I go after are the false experts, those who do not accept the limits of their knowledge.
2722.author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb

2723.text: Knowledge is not just the preserve of the educated elite. Just because someone has not had a formal education, that does not mean he does not have wisdom and common sense.
2723.author: Vikas Swarup

2724.text: All knowledge which ends in words will die as quickly as it came to life, with the exception of the written word: which is its mechanical part.
2724.author: Leonardo da Vinci

2725.text: I'd like to see people pay attention to the science of hip hop. The knowledge part, the political side of what hip hop could do, or where hip hop is gonna go. I always say it's gonna become universal as we become a galactic union.
2725.author: Afrika Bambaataa

2726.text: You will always have partial points of view, and you'll always have the story behind the story that hasn't come out yet. And any form of journalism you're involved with is going to be up against a biased viewpoint and partial knowledge.
2726.author: Margaret Atwood

2727.text: I have recently been able to see the new world - the quiet, the tranquility and the freedom it will bring with it. This is very comforting knowledge for me because I already know that what I envision eventually becomes a reality.
2727.author: Shari Arison

2728.text: I don't claim to know everything. I claim to be a seeker of knowledge.
2728.author: Marie Osmond

2729.text: Written in 1895, Alfred Nobel's will endowed prizes for scientific research in chemistry, physics, and medicine. At that time, these fields were narrowly defined, and researchers were often classically trained in only one discipline. In the late 19th century, knowledge of science was not a requisite for success in other walks of life.
2729.author: Peter Agre

2730.text: Knowledge is knowing that a tomato is a fruit. Wisdom is knowing not to put it in a fruit salad.
2730.author: Brian O'Driscoll

2731.text: I entreat masters to live a good life and faithfully to instruct their scholars, especially that they may love God and learn to give themselves to knowledge, in order to promote His honour, the welfare of the state, and their own salvation, but not for the sake of avarice or the praise of man.
2731.author: Jan Hus

2732.text: Learn when and how to use different data structures and their algorithms in your own code. This is harder as a student, as the problem assignments you'll work through just won't impart this knowledge. That's fine.
2732.author: Robert Love

2733.text: Of our relation to all creation we can never know anything whatsoever. All is immensity and chaos. But, since all this knowledge of our limitations cannot possibly be of any value to us, it is better to ignore it in our daily conduct of life.
2733.author: H. P. Lovecraft

2734.text: What we want is to see the child in pursuit of knowledge, and not knowledge in pursuit of the child.
2734.author: George Bernard Shaw

2735.text: Consider your origins: you were not made to live as brutes, but to follow virtue and knowledge.
2735.author: Dante Alighieri

2736.text: We are here and it is now. Further than that, all human knowledge is moonshine.
2736.author: H. L. Mencken

2737.text: When a man's knowledge is not in order, the more of it he has the greater will be his confusion.
2737.author: Herbert Spencer

2738.text: Reading furnishes the mind only with materials of knowledge; it is thinking that makes what we read ours.
2738.author: John Locke

2739.text: No man's knowledge here can go beyond his experience.
2739.author: John Locke

2740.text: Knowledge of the self is the mother of all knowledge. So it is incumbent on me to know my self, to know it completely, to know its minutiae, its characteristics, its subtleties, and its very atoms.
2740.author: Khalil Gibran

2741.text: Perplexity is the beginning of knowledge.
2741.author: Khalil Gibran

2742.text: No man can reveal to you nothing but that which already lies half-asleep in the dawning of your knowledge.
2742.author: Khalil Gibran

2743.text: Our knowledge can only be finite, while our ignorance must necessarily be infinite.
2743.author: Karl Popper

2744.text: Where there is shouting, there is no true knowledge.
2744.author: Leonardo da Vinci

2745.text: All our knowledge has its origins in our perceptions.
2745.author: Leonardo da Vinci

2746.text: Knowledge of the past and of the places of the earth is the ornament and food of the mind of man.
2746.author: Leonardo da Vinci

2747.text: The knower and the known are one. Simple people imagine that they should see God as if he stood there and they here. This is not so. God and I, we are one in knowledge.
2747.author: Meister Eckhart

2748.text: Today knowledge has power. It controls access to opportunity and advancement.
2748.author: Peter Drucker

2749.text: They say a little knowledge is a dangerous thing, but it's not one half so bad as a lot of ignorance.
2749.author: Terry Pratchett

2750.text: Even the knowledge of my own fallibility cannot keep me from making mistakes. Only when I fall do I get up again.
2750.author: Vincent Van Gogh

2751.text: The true method of knowledge is experiment.
2751.author: William Blake

2752.text: The aim of education is the knowledge not of facts but of values.
2752.author: William Ralph Inge

2753.text: Those people who develop the ability to continuously acquire new and better forms of knowledge that they can apply to their work and to their lives will be the movers and shakers in our society for the indefinite future.
2753.author: Brian Tracy

2754.text: The knowledge I have now is not the knowledge I had then.
2754.author: Stokely Carmichael

2755.text: One whose knowledge is confined to books and whose wealth is in the possession of others, can use neither his knowledge nor wealth when the need for them arises.
2755.author: Chanakya

2756.text: Without knowledge action is useless and knowledge without action is futile.
2756.author: Abu Bakr

2757.text: I'm hungry for knowledge. The whole thing is to learn every day, to get brighter and brighter. That's what this world is about. You look at someone like Gandhi, and he glowed. Martin Luther King glowed. Muhammad Ali glows. I think that's from being bright all the time, and trying to be brighter.
2757.author: Jay-Z

2758.text: Looking up and out, how can we not respect this ever-vigilant cognizance that distinguishes us: the capability to envision, to dream, and to invent? the ability to ponder ourselves? and be aware of our existence on the outer arm of a spiral galaxy in an immeasurable ocean of stars? Cognizance is our crest.
2758.author: Vanna Bonta

2759.text: Dogmatism and skepticism are both, in a sense, absolute philosophies; one is certain of knowing, the other of not knowing. What philosophy should dissipate is certainty, whether of knowledge or ignorance.
2759.author: Bertrand Russell

2760.text: It's kind of interesting, because hacking is a skill that could be used for criminal purposes or legitimate purposes, and so even though in the past I was hacking for the curiosity, and the thrill, to get a bite of the forbidden fruit of knowledge, I'm now working in the security field as a public speaker.
2760.author: Kevin Mitnick

2761.text: He will therefore have to use what knowledge he can achieve, not to shape the results as the craftsman shapes his handiwork, but rather to cultivate a growth by providing the appropriate environment, in the manner in which the gardener does this for his plants.
2761.author: Friedrich August von Hayek

2762.text: It is now common knowledge that the average American gains 7 pounds between Thanksgiving and New Year's Day.
2762.author: Marilu Henner

2764.text: Ignorance more frequently begets confidence than does knowledge: it is those who know little, and not those who know much, who so positively assert that this or that problem will never be solved by science.
2764.author: Charles Darwin

2765.text: One of the things that makes our military the best in the world is the certain knowledge of each soldier, sailor, airman, and Marine that they can always count on their comrades should they need help - that they will never be abandoned.
2765.author: Jon Kyl

2766.text: The wise man should restrain his senses like the crane and accomplish his purpose with due knowledge of his place, time and ability.
2766.author: Chanakya

2767.text: If you want to know the taste of a pear, you must change the pear by eating it yourself. If you want to know the theory and methods of revolution, you must take part in revolution. All genuine knowledge originates in direct experience.
2767.author: Mao Zedong

2768.text: It is with children that we have the best chance of studying the development of logical knowledge, mathematical knowledge, physical knowledge, and so forth.
2768.author: Jean Piaget

2769.text: We give you the facts. I told you information is power - knowledge is power. We can't be in an ideological battle to redeem the soul of this country if we don't have the facts.
2769.author: Tavis Smiley

2770.text: Cultures have long heard wisdom in non-human voices: Apollo, god of music, medicine and knowledge, came to Delphi in the form of a dolphin. But dolphins, which fill the oceans with blipping and chirping, and whales, which mew and caw in ultramarine jazz - a true rhapsody in blue - are hunted to the edge of silence.
2770.author: Jay Griffiths

2771.text: Knowledge is power, if you know it about the right person.
2771.author: Ethel Watts Mumford

2772.text: Sorrow is knowledge, those that know the most must mourn the deepest, the tree of knowledge is not the tree of life.
2772.author: Lord Byron

2773.text: A photographic portrait is a picture of someone who knows he is being photographed, and what he does with this knowledge is as much a part of the photograph as what he's wearing or how he looks.
2773.author: Richard Avedon

2774.text: The greater our knowledge increases the more our ignorance unfolds.
2774.author: John F. Kennedy

2775.text: The goal of education is the advancement of knowledge and the dissemination of truth.
2775.author: John F. Kennedy

2776.text: All men are born with a nose and five fingers, but no one is born with a knowledge of God.
2776.author: Voltaire

2778.text: Technology is so much fun but we can drown in our technology. The fog of information can drive out knowledge.
2778.author: Daniel J. Boorstin

2779.text: Knowledge is of no value unless you put it into practice.
2779.author: Anton Chekhov

2780.text: Integrity without knowledge is weak and useless, and knowledge without integrity is dangerous and dreadful.
2780.author: Samuel Johnson

2781.text: Whoever undertakes to set himself up as a judge of Truth and Knowledge is shipwrecked by the laughter of the gods.
2781.author: Albert Einstein

2782.text: The difference between a successful person and others is not a lack of strength, not a lack of knowledge, but rather a lack of will.
2782.author: Vince Lombardi

2783.text: Love takes up where knowledge leaves off.
2783.author: Thomas Aquinas

2784.text: To say, 'well done' to any bit of good work is to take hold of the powers which have made the effort and strengthen them beyond our knowledge.
2784.author: Phillips Brooks

2785.text: It is in moments of illness that we are compelled to recognize that we live not alone but chained to a creature of a different kingdom, whole worlds apart, who has no knowledge of us and by whom it is impossible to make ourselves understood: our body.
2785.author: Marcel Proust

2786.text: There is one quality which one must possess to win, and that is definiteness of purpose, the knowledge of what one wants, and a burning desire to possess it.
2786.author: Napoleon Hill

2787.text: Knowledge is in the end based on acknowledgement.
2787.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

2788.text: Music is at once the product of feeling and knowledge, for it requires from its disciples, composers and performers alike, not only talent and enthusiasm, but also that knowledge and perception which are the result of protracted study and reflection.
2788.author: Alban Berg

2789.text: It is possible to fly without motors, but not without knowledge and skill.
2789.author: Wilbur Wright

2790.text: Learn from me, if not by my precepts, then by my example, how dangerous is the pursuit of knowledge and how much happier is that man who believes his native town to be the world than he who aspires to be greater than his nature will allow.
2790.author: Mary Wollstonecraft

2791.text: To express the same idea in still another way, I think that human knowledge is essentially active.
2791.author: Jean Piaget

2792.text: At a family's most difficult time, I want to make sure at a minimum that they have the very basic of comforts: the ability to grieve their loss privately and the knowledge that their country is grateful for their loved one's sacrifice and service.
2792.author: Dave Reichert

2793.text: Knowledge of God's Word is a bulwark against deception, temptation, accusation, even persecution.
2793.author: Edwin Louis Cole

2796.text: Men honor what lies within the sphere of their knowledge, but do not realize how dependent they are on what lies beyond it.
2796.author: Zhuangzi

2797.text: Music is the one incorporeal entrance into the higher world of knowledge which comprehends mankind but which mankind cannot comprehend.
2797.author: Ludwig van Beethoven

2798.text: Youth is the period in which a man can be hopeless. The end of every episode is the end of the world. But the power of hoping through everything, the knowledge that the soul survives its adventures, that great inspiration comes to the middle-aged.
2798.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

2799.text: The study and knowledge of the universe would somehow be lame and defective were no practical results to follow.
2799.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

2800.text: Knowledge is invariably a matter of degree: you cannot put your finger upon even the simplest datum and say this we know.
2800.author: T. S. Eliot

2801.text: Mistakes are, after all, the foundations of truth, and if a man does not know what a thing is, it is at least an increase in knowledge if he knows what it is not.
2801.author: Carl Jung

2802.text: Science knows no country, because knowledge belongs to humanity, and is the torch which illuminates the world.
2802.author: Louis Pasteur

2803.text: My advice to women in general: Even if you're doing a nine-to-five job, treat yourself like a boss. Not arrogant, but be sure of what you want - and don't allow people to run anything for you without your knowledge.
2803.author: Nicki Minaj

2804.text: I'm not saying that atheists can't act morally or have moral knowledge. But when I ascribe virtue to an atheist, it's as a theist who sees the atheist as conforming to objective moral values. The atheist, by contrast, has no such basis for morality. And yet all moral judgments require a basis for morality, some standard of right and wrong.
2804.author: William A. Dembski

2805.text: All knowledge of cultural reality, as may be seen, is always knowledge from particular points of view.
2805.author: Max Weber

2806.text: Liberated from the error of pagan tradition through the benevolence and loving kindness of the good God with the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, and by the operation of the Holy Spirit, I was reared from the very beginning by Christian parents. From them I learned even in babyhood the Holy Scriptures which led me to a knowledge of the truth.
2806.author: Saint Basil

2807.text: Time is only an idea. There is only the Reality. Whatever you think it is, it looks like that. If you call it time, it is time. If you call it existence, it is existence, and so on. After calling it time, you divide it into days and nights, months, years, hours, minutes, etc. Time is immaterial for the Path of Knowledge.
2807.author: Ramana Maharshi

2808.text: The liberal professions, and in a wider sense the well-to-do classes, are certainly those with the liveliest taste for knowledge and the most active intellectual life.
2808.author: Emile Durkheim

2809.text: A leader is one who knows the way, goes the way, and shows the way.
2809.author: John C. Maxwell

2811.text: If your actions inspire others to dream more, learn more, do more and become more, you are a leader.
2811.author: John Quincy Adams

2812.text: You have to think anyway, so why not think big?
2812.author: Donald Trump

2813.text: I am not afraid of an army of lions led by a sheep; I am afraid of an army of sheep led by a lion.
2813.author: Alexander the Great

2814.text: Leadership and learning are indispensable to each other.
2814.author: John F. Kennedy

2815.text: Leadership is not about a title or a designation. It's about impact, influence and inspiration. Impact involves getting results, influence is about spreading the passion you have for your work, and you have to inspire team-mates and customers.
2815.author: Robin S. Sharma

2816.text: Management is doing things right; leadership is doing the right things.
2816.author: Peter Drucker

2817.text: The supreme quality for leadership is unquestionably integrity. Without it, no real success is possible, no matter whether it is on a section gang, a football field, in an army, or in an office.
2817.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

2818.text: The quality of a leader is reflected in the standards they set for themselves.
2818.author: Ray Kroc

2819.text: When you can't make them see the light, make them feel the heat.
2819.author: Ronald Reagan

2821.text: A genuine leader is not a searcher for consensus but a molder of consensus.
2821.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

2822.text: Innovation distinguishes between a leader and a follower.
2822.author: Steve Jobs

2823.text: Be a yardstick of quality. Some people aren't used to an environment where excellence is expected.
2823.author: Steve Jobs

2825.text: Only the guy who isn't rowing has time to rock the boat.
2825.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

2827.text: When your values are clear to you, making decisions becomes easier.
2827.author: Roy E. Disney

2828.text: A good leader takes a little more than his share of the blame, a little less than his share of the credit.
2828.author: Arnold H. Glasow

2829.text: I know of no single formula for success. But over the years I have observed that some attributes of leadership are universal and are often about finding ways of encouraging people to combine their efforts, their talents, their insights, their enthusiasm and their inspiration to work together.
2829.author: Queen Elizabeth II

2830.text: Don't find fault, find a remedy.
2830.author: Henry Ford

2831.text: If the highest aim of a captain were to preserve his ship, he would keep it in port forever.
2831.author: Thomas Aquinas

2832.text: Leadership is practiced not so much in words as in attitude and in actions.
2832.author: Harold S. Geneen

2834.text: Leadership is the capacity to translate vision into reality.
2834.author: Warren Bennis

2835.text: Leadership is not about the next election, it's about the next generation.
2835.author: Simon Sinek

2836.text: Speak softly and carry a big stick; you will go far.
2836.author: Theodore Roosevelt

2837.text: If you think you can do a thing or think you can't do a thing, you're right.
2837.author: Henry Ford

2839.text: Leaders must be close enough to relate to others, but far enough ahead to motivate them.
2839.author: John C. Maxwell

2840.text: It is better to lead from behind and to put others in front, especially when you celebrate victory when nice things occur. You take the front line when there is danger. Then people will appreciate your leadership.
2840.author: Nelson Mandela

2841.text: Think little goals and expect little achievements. Think big goals and win big success.
2841.author: David Joseph Schwartz

2843.text: Affirmation without discipline is the beginning of delusion.
2843.author: Jim Rohn

2844.text: Enlightened leadership is spiritual if we understand spirituality not as some kind of religious dogma or ideology but as the domain of awareness where we experience values like truth, goodness, beauty, love and compassion, and also intuition, creativity, insight and focused attention.
2844.author: Deepak Chopra

2845.text: The function of leadership is to produce more leaders, not more followers.
2845.author: Ralph Nader

2846.text: People ask the difference between a leader and a boss. The leader leads, and the boss drives.
2846.author: Theodore Roosevelt

2847.text: No man will make a great leader who wants to do it all himself or get all the credit for doing it.
2847.author: Andrew Carnegie

2848.text: Leadership is unlocking people's potential to become better.
2848.author: Bill Bradley

2849.text: High expectations are the key to everything.
2849.author: Sam Walton

2850.text: Outstanding leaders go out of their way to boost the self-esteem of their personnel. If people believe in themselves, it's amazing what they can accomplish.
2850.author: Sam Walton

2851.text: I think the currency of leadership is transparency. You've got to be truthful. I don't think you should be vulnerable every day, but there are moments where you've got to share your soul and conscience with people and show them who you are, and not be afraid of it.
2851.author: Howard Schultz

2852.text: My attitude is never to be satisfied, never enough, never.
2852.author: Duke Ellington

2854.text: Effective leadership is putting first things first. Effective management is discipline, carrying it out.
2854.author: Stephen Covey

2855.text: A throne is only a bench covered with velvet.
2855.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

2857.text: I suppose leadership at one time meant muscles; but today it means getting along with people.
2857.author: Mahatma Gandhi

2858.text: The speed of the leader is the speed of the gang.
2858.author: Mary Kay Ash

2859.text: Effective leadership is not about making speeches or being liked; leadership is defined by results not attributes.
2859.author: Peter Drucker

2860.text: A man who wants to lead the orchestra must turn his back on the crowd.
2860.author: Max Lucado

2861.text: There is no greater name for a leader than mother or father. There is no leadership more important than parenthood.
2861.author: Sheri L. Dew

2862.text: You don't lead by hitting people over the head - that's assault, not leadership.
2862.author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

2863.text: To me, leadership is about encouraging people. It's about stimulating them. It's about enabling them to achieve what they can achieve - and to do that with a purpose.
2863.author: Christine Lagarde

2864.text: Management is efficiency in climbing the ladder of success; leadership determines whether the ladder is leaning against the right wall.
2864.author: Stephen Covey

2867.text: Republican leadership in Congress let the energy companies write the energy bill that sent prices soaring, and has turned a blind eye to the struggles of working families trying to make ends meet.
2867.author: Sherrod Brown

2868.text: In Britain, you do your job. When you do an American TV show, there is a sense of being one with the crew, and there is a leadership element, which was a learning curve for me because it is very different culturally. In Britain, you just do it, leave and say, 'Thanks.'
2868.author: Theo James

2870.text: Leadership consists of picking good men and helping them do their best.
2870.author: Chester W. Nimitz

2871.text: I have always supported measures and principles and not men.
2871.author: Davy Crockett

2873.text: I'm not a natural leader. I'm too intellectual; I'm too abstract; I think too much.
2873.author: Newt Gingrich

2874.text: The exercise of power is determined by thousands of interactions between the world of the powerful and that of the powerless, all the more so because these worlds are never divided by a sharp line: everyone has a small part of himself in both.
2874.author: Vaclav Havel

2875.text: I am a general. My soldiers are the keys and I have to command them.
2875.author: Vladimir Horowitz

2876.text: If you care enough for a result, you will most certainly attain it.
2876.author: William James

2878.text: Be careful the environment you choose for it will shape you; be careful the friends you choose for you will become like them.
2878.author: W. Clement Stone

2880.text: If you have ideas, you have the main asset you need, and there isn't any limit to what you can do with your business and your life. Ideas are any man's greatest asset.
2880.author: Harvey S. Firestone

2881.text: Leadership is diving for a loose ball, getting the crowd involved, getting other players involved. It's being able to take it as well as dish it out. That's the only way you're going to get respect from the players.
2881.author: Larry Bird

2882.text: Leadership does not depend on being right.
2882.author: Ivan Illich

2883.text: Go as far as you can see; when you get there, you'll be able to see farther.
2883.author: J. P. Morgan

2884.text: It is rare to find a business partner who is selfless. If you are lucky it happens once in a lifetime.
2884.author: Michael Eisner

2885.text: Getting in touch with your true self must be your first priority.
2885.author: Tom Hopkins

2886.text: Many corporate leaders and employees have the right intentions, but it can be overwhelming when you consider how everything is affected from leadership styles, to organizational structure, to employee engagement, to customer service an marketplace.
2886.author: Simon Mainwaring

2887.text: One of the lessons of leadership worth emphasizing is that you want to get to know other great leaders and take their advice. At some point in your development, it's only people who've been in the seat of having to be leaders who can help you in a deep way.
2887.author: Jim Yong Kim

2888.text: The very essence of leadership is that you have to have vision. You can't blow an uncertain trumpet.
2888.author: Theodore Hesburgh

2889.text: All of the great leaders have had one characteristic in common: it was the willingness to confront unequivocally the major anxiety of their people in their time. This, and not much else, is the essence of leadership.
2889.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

2890.text: Leadership is a matter of having people look at you and gain confidence, seeing how you react. If you're in control, they're in control.
2890.author: Tom Landry

2891.text: Leadership is an active role; 'lead' is a verb. But the leader who tries to do it all is headed for burnout, and in a powerful hurry.
2891.author: Bill Owens

2892.text: Servant leadership is the foundation and the secret of Sam Walton's ability to achieve team synergy.
2892.author: Michael Bergdahl

2893.text: I think it is quite dangerous for an organisation to think they can predict where they are going to need leadership. It needs to be something that people are willing to assume if it feels relevant, given the context of any situation.
2893.author: Margaret J. Wheatley

2894.text: The 9/11 Commission recently released their report, citing important changes which need to be made to improve our nation's homeland security. I voiced my disappointment with the House leadership when this report was left until after the August recess for action.
2894.author: Leonard Boswell

2895.text: Leadership is working with goals and vision; management is working with objectives.
2895.author: Russel Honore

2897.text: Beginning under the Roman Empire, intellectual leadership in the West had been provided by Christianity. In the middle ages, who invented the first universities - in Paris, Oxford, Cambridge? The church.
2897.author: Nancy Pearcey

2900.text: Globalisation means many other countries are asserting themselves and trying to take over leadership. Please don't ask Americans to let others assume the leadership of human exploration. We can do wonderful science on the Moon, and wonderful commercial things. Then we can pack up and move on to Mars.
2900.author: Buzz Aldrin

2901.text: The country has sorted itself ideologically into the two political parties, and those partisan attachments have hardened in recent years. It will take an extraordinary event and act of leadership to break this partisan divide. I thought 9/11 might provide such an opportunity, but it was not seized.
2901.author: Thomas E. Mann

2902.text: I think America is in trouble, but it's not beyond repair. But it's going to take leadership who sees the greatness of this country and who believes that, once again, we can be one nation under God.
2902.author: Mike Huckabee

2904.text: The key to being a good manager is keeping the people who hate me away from those who are still undecided.
2904.author: Casey Stengel

2905.text: The great leaders have always stage-managed their effects.
2905.author: Charles de Gaulle

2906.text: How we think shows through in how we act. Attitudes are mirrors of the mind. They reflect thinking.
2906.author: David Joseph Schwartz

2907.text: Obstacles are things a person sees when he takes his eyes off his goal.
2907.author: E. Joseph Cossman

2908.text: Today a reader, tomorrow a leader.
2908.author: Margaret Fuller

2909.text: Making good decisions is a crucial skill at every level.
2909.author: Peter Drucker

2910.text: I look for what needs to be done. After all, that's how the universe designs itself.
2910.author: R. Buckminster Fuller

2911.text: If you want a quality, act as if you already had it.
2911.author: William James

2912.text: People buy into the leader before they buy into the vision.
2912.author: John C. Maxwell

2913.text: No matter how carefully you plan your goals they will never be more than pipe dreams unless you pursue them with gusto.
2913.author: W. Clement Stone

2914.text: If a window of opportunity appears, don't pull down the shade.
2914.author: Tom Peters

2915.text: Management is about arranging and telling. Leadership is about nurturing and enhancing.
2915.author: Tom Peters

2916.text: It is essential to employ, trust, and reward those whose perspective, ability, and judgment are radically different from yours. It is also rare, for it requires uncommon humility, tolerance, and wisdom.
2916.author: Dee Hock

2917.text: People who enjoy meetings should not be in charge of anything.
2917.author: Thomas Sowell

2918.text: There are three secrets to managing. The first secret is have patience. The second is be patient. And the third most important secret is patience.
2918.author: Chuck Tanner

2919.text: Without initiative, leaders are simply workers in leadership positions.
2919.author: Bo Bennett

2920.text: You have to lead people gently toward what they already know is right.
2920.author: Phil Crosby

2921.text: Honor bespeaks worth. Confidence begets trust. Service brings satisfaction. Cooperation proves the quality of leadership.
2921.author: James Cash Penney

2922.text: Leadership is getting someone to do what they don't want to do, to achieve what they want to achieve.
2922.author: Tom Landry

2923.text: The signs of outstanding leadership appear primarily among the followers. Are the followers reaching their potential? Are they learning? Serving? Do they achieve the required results? Do they change with grace? Manage conflict?
2923.author: Max de Pree

2924.text: Leadership is a privilege to better the lives of others. It is not an opportunity to satisfy personal greed.
2924.author: Mwai Kibaki

2925.text: We live in a society obsessed with public opinion. But leadership has never been about popularity.
2925.author: Marco Rubio

2926.text: In order to cultivate a set of leaders with legitimacy in the eyes of the citizenry, it is necessary that the path to leadership be visibly open to talented and qualified individuals of every race and ethnicity.
2926.author: Sandra Day O'Connor

2927.text: Leadership is about doing the right thing, even if it going against a vast number of naysayers and mediocre people.
2927.author: N. R. Narayana Murthy

2928.text: The cardinal responsibility of leadership is to identify the dominant contradiction at each point of the historical process and to work out a central line to resolve it.

2929.text: A good objective of leadership is to help those who are doing poorly to do well and to help those who are doing well to do even better.

2930.text: No institution can possibly survive if it needs geniuses or supermen to manage it. It must be organized in such a way as to be able to get along under a leadership composed of average human beings.

2931.text: Divorced from ethics, leadership is reduced to management and politics to mere technique.
2931.author: James MacGregor Burns

2932.text: True leadership lies in guiding others to success. In ensuring that everyone is performing at their best, doing the work they are pledged to do and doing it well.
2932.author: Bill Owens

2933.text: Vocational education programs have made a real difference in the lives of countless young people nationwide; they build self-confidence and leadership skills by allowing students to utilize their unique gifts and talents.
2933.author: Conrad Burns

2934.text: Leaders of the future will have to be visionary and be able to bring people in - real communicators. These are things that women bring to leadership and executive positions, and it's going to be incredibly valuable and incredibly in demand.

2935.text: If there is such a thing as good leadership, it is to give a good example. I have to do so for all the Ikea employees.
2935.author: Ingvar Kamprad

2936.text: The person who takes the oath of office in the next four months will shape not just the next four years, but the next forty years of our nation. In these next four years, we need proven leadership, proven judgment and proven values. America needs four more years of President Barack Obama.
2936.author: Rahm Emanuel

2937.text: It's a different era. Our job now is to show leadership and vision and to help the next generation of artists.
2937.author: Karen Kain

2938.text: If a guy is intimidated by a woman in leadership, he has real problems with his own concepts of masculinity. That's a harsh statement, but I believe it to be true.
2938.author: Tony Campolo

2940.text: Pay attention to those employees who respectfully ask why. They are demonstrating an interest in their jobs and exhibiting a curiosity that could eventually translate into leadership ability.
2940.author: Harvey Mackay

2941.text: I don't think leadership demands 'yes' or 'no' answers; I think leadership is providing the forum for making the right decision, which doesn't demand unanimity.
2941.author: Arthur Ochs Sulzberger, Jr.

2942.text: Leadership is absolutely about inspiring action, but it is also about guarding against mis-action.
2942.author: Simon Sinek

2943.text: Uncertainty is a permanent part of the leadership landscape. It never goes away.
2943.author: Andy Stanley

2944.text: There are good leaders who actively guide and bad leaders who actively misguide. Hence, leadership is about persuasion, presentation and people skills.

2945.text: A good cult delivers on its promises. A good cult nourishes the needs of its members, has transparency and integrity, and creates provisions for challenging its leadership openly. A good cult expands the freedoms and well-being of its members rather than limits them.
2945.author: Philip Zimbardo

2946.text: I think that in any group activity - whether it be business, sports, or family - there has to be leadership or it won't be successful.
2946.author: John Wooden

2947.text: Leadership is an intense journey into yourself. You can use your own style to get anything done. It's about being self-aware. Every morning, I look in the mirror and say, 'I could have done three things better yesterday.'
2947.author: Jeffrey R. Immelt

2948.text: No matter how good you think you are as a leader, my goodness, the people around you will have all kinds of ideas for how you can get better. So for me, the most fundamental thing about leadership is to have the humility to continue to get feedback and to try to get better - because your job is to try to help everybody else get better.
2948.author: Jim Yong Kim

2949.text: Leadership is something you earn, something you're chosen for. You can't come in yelling, 'I'm your leader!' If it happens, it's because the other guys respect you.
2949.author: Ben Roethlisberger

2950.text: The task of leadership is not to put greatness into humanity, but to elicit it, for the greatness is already there.
2950.author: John Buchan

2951.text: Leadership consists not in degrees of technique but in traits of character; it requires moral rather than athletic or intellectual effort, and it imposes on both leader and follower alike the burdens of self-restraint.

2952.text: You have to enable and empower people to make decisions independent of you. As I've learned, each person on a team is an extension of your leadership; if they feel empowered by you they will magnify your power to lead.

2953.text: Sport fosters many things that are good; teamwork and leadership.
2953.author: Daley Thompson

2954.text: The Leadership Training Institute of America trains and equips young men and women to be leaders with high standards of personal morality and integrity.
2954.author: Michael Burgess

2955.text: At that time, the army leadership said the implementation of this agreement would allow everyone, including the IRA, to take its political objectives forward by peaceful and democratic means.
2955.author: Gerry Adams

2956.text: You can never stop and as older people, we have to learn how to take leadership from the youth and I guess I would say that this is what I'm attempting to do right now.
2956.author: Angela Davis

2957.text: Leadership is getting players to believe in you. If you tell a teammate you're ready to play as tough as you're able to, you'd better go out there and do it. Players will see right through a phony. And they can tell when you're not giving it all you've got.
2957.author: Larry Bird

2959.text: In giving us children, God places us in a position of both leadership and service. He calls us to give up our lives for someone else's sake - to abandon our own desires and put our child's interests first. Yet, according to His perfect design, it is through this selflessness that we can become truly fulfilled.
2959.author: Charles Stanley

2960.text: God will never direct us to be prideful, arrogant and unforgiving, immoral or slothful or full of fear. We step into these things because we are insensitive to the leadership of the Holy Spirit within us.
2960.author: Charles Stanley

2961.text: I want American Dream growth - lots of new businesses, well-paying jobs, and American leadership in new industries, like clean energy and biotechnology.
2961.author: William J. Clinton

2962.text: Leadership can't be fabricated. If it is fabricated and rehearsed, you can't fool the guys in the locker room. So when you talk about leadership, it comes with performance. Leadership comes with consistency.
2962.author: Junior Seau

2964.text: Leadership must be likeable, affable, cordial, and above all emotional. The fashion of authoritarian leadership is gone. Football is about life. You can't be angry all day.
2964.author: Vicente del Bosque

2965.text: Leadership is all about taking people on a journey. The challenge is that most of the time, we are asking people to follow us to places we ourselves have never been.
2965.author: Andy Stanley

2966.text: I think there is probably no better person to aspire to emulate than Steve Jobs and what he has done at Apple in terms of his leadership, his innovation, not settling for mediocrity.
2966.author: Howard Schultz

2967.text: I am the wealthiest man, not just in Europe, but in the whole world. I collect emotions. I am wealthy in that the people of Russia have twice entrusted me with the leadership of a great nation such as Russia - I believe that is my greatest wealth.
2967.author: Vladimir Putin

2968.text: I vividly remember a conversation I had many years ago in 1974, which marked a turning point in my leadership journey. I was sitting at a Holiday Inn with my friend, Kurt Campmeyer, when he asked me if I had a personal growth plan. I didn't. In fact, I didn't even know you were supposed to have one.
2968.author: John C. Maxwell

2969.text: There's the assumption being made by the national security advisers to the Obama administration that the North Korean leadership is not suicidal, that they know they will be obliterated if they attacked the United States. But I would point that everything in South Korea and Japan is well within range of what they might want to do.
2969.author: Oliver North

2970.text: In a world of complex threats, our security and leadership depends on all elements of our power - including strong and principled diplomacy.
2970.author: Barack Obama

2971.text: I hope telling the story of how I went from being a single mom to serving in the Texas State Senate to running for governor will remind others that with the right leadership in government, where you start has nothing to do with how far you go.
2971.author: Wendy Davis

2972.text: I believe in servant leadership, and the servant always asks, 'Where am I needed most?'
2972.author: Mike Pence

2973.text: We are looking for a set of personal characteristics that predict success, the first and foremost of which is perseverance in the face of challenges. We also look for the ability to influence and motivate others who share your values, strong problem-solving ability, and leadership.
2973.author: Wendy Kopp

2974.text: I think one of the keys to leadership is recognizing that everybody has gifts and talents. A good leader will learn how to harness those gifts toward the same goal.
2974.author: Ben Carson

2975.text: Inability to make decisions is one of the principal reasons executives fail. Deficiency in decision-making ranks much higher than lack of specific knowledge or technical know-how as an indicator of leadership failure.
2975.author: John C. Maxwell

2976.text: The trouble with the Labour Party leadership and the trade union leadership, they're quite willing to applaud millions on the streets of the Philippines or in Eastern Europe, without understanding the need to also produce millions of people on the streets of Britain.
2976.author: Arthur Scargill

2977.text: Leadership cannot really be taught. It can only be learned.
2977.author: Harold S. Geneen
