3577.text: Perseverance is failing 19 times and succeeding the 20th.
3577.author: Julie Andrews

3578.text: If you don't like how things are, change it! You're not a tree.
3578.author: Jim Rohn

3579.text: Do you want to know who you are? Don't ask. Act! Action will delineate and define you.
3579.author: Thomas Jefferson

3580.text: Every exit is an entry somewhere else.
3580.author: Tom Stoppard

3581.text: If you want to succeed you should strike out on new paths, rather than travel the worn paths of accepted success.
3581.author: John D. Rockefeller

3582.text: No bird soars too high if he soars with his own wings.
3582.author: William Blake

3583.text: Either you run the day or the day runs you.
3583.author: Jim Rohn

3584.text: Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Willing is not enough; we must do.
3584.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

3586.text: Expect problems and eat them for breakfast.
3586.author: Alfred A. Montapert

3587.text: The people who influence you are the people who believe in you.
3587.author: Henry Drummond

3588.text: Follow your dreams, work hard, practice and persevere. Make sure you eat a variety of foods, get plenty of exercise and maintain a healthy lifestyle.
3588.author: Sasha Cohen

3589.text: The will to succeed is important, but what's more important is the will to prepare.
3589.author: Bobby Knight

3590.text: Decide what you want, decide what you are willing to exchange for it. Establish your priorities and go to work.
3590.author: H. L. Hunt

3591.text: Be gentle to all and stern with yourself.
3591.author: Saint Teresa of Avila

3592.text: If you don't design your own life plan, chances are you'll fall into someone else's plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much.
3592.author: Jim Rohn

3593.text: Do the one thing you think you cannot do. Fail at it. Try again. Do better the second time. The only people who never tumble are those who never mount the high wire. This is your moment. Own it.
3593.author: Oprah Winfrey

3594.text: Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future, act now, without delay.
3594.author: Simone de Beauvoir

3595.text: Do not wait to strike till the iron is hot; but make it hot by striking.
3595.author: William Butler Yeats

3596.text: Motivation will almost always beat mere talent.
3596.author: Norman Ralph Augustine

3597.text: It's always too early to quit.
3597.author: Norman Vincent Peale

3599.text: You simply have to put one foot in front of the other and keep going. Put blinders on and plow right ahead.
3599.author: George Lucas

3600.text: The past cannot be changed. The future is yet in your power.
3600.author: Unknown

3601.text: Pursue one great decisive aim with force and determination.
3601.author: Carl von Clausewitz

3603.text: If you fell down yesterday, stand up today.
3603.author: H. G. Wells

3604.text: Poverty was the greatest motivating factor in my life.
3604.author: Jimmy Dean

3605.text: One finds limits by pushing them.
3605.author: Herbert Simon

3606.text: After a storm comes a calm.
3606.author: Matthew Henry

3607.text: Be Impeccable With Your Word. Speak with integrity. Say only what you mean. Avoid using the word to speak against yourself or to gossip about others. Use the power of your word in the direction of truth and love.
3607.author: Don Miguel Ruiz

3608.text: The hardships that I encountered in the past will help me succeed in the future.
3608.author: Philip Emeagwali

3609.text: I learned that we can do anything, but we can't do everything... at least not at the same time. So think of your priorities not in terms of what activities you do, but when you do them. Timing is everything.
3609.author: Dan Millman

3610.text: Big shots are only little shots who keep shooting.
3610.author: Christopher Morley

3611.text: The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.
3611.author: Confucius

3612.text: Do your work with your whole heart, and you will succeed - there's so little competition.
3612.author: Elbert Hubbard

3613.text: We aim above the mark to hit the mark.
3613.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

3614.text: The first question which the priest and the Levite asked was: 'If I stop to help this man, what will happen to me?' But... the good Samaritan reversed the question: 'If I do not stop to help this man, what will happen to him?'
3614.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

3615.text: I've worked too hard and too long to let anything stand in the way of my goals. I will not let my teammates down and I will not let myself down.
3615.author: Mia Hamm

3616.text: When you fail you learn from the mistakes you made and it motivates you to work even harder.
3616.author: Natalie Gulbis

3617.text: It is very important to know who you are. To make decisions. To show who you are.
3617.author: Malala Yousafzai

3619.text: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.
3619.author: Carol Burnett

3620.text: Where there is a will, there is a way. If there is a chance in a million that you can do something, anything, to keep what you want from ending, do it. Pry the door open or, if need be, wedge your foot in that door and keep it open.
3620.author: Pauline Kael

3621.text: Know or listen to those who know.
3621.author: Baltasar Gracian

3622.text: To be a good loser is to learn how to win.
3622.author: Carl Sandburg

3623.text: Whatever you want in life, other people are going to want it too. Believe in yourself enough to accept the idea that you have an equal right to it.
3623.author: Diane Sawyer

3624.text: There is progress whether ye are going forward or backward! The thing is to move!
3624.author: Edgar Cayce

3625.text: Hitch your wagon to a star.
3625.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

3626.text: You need to overcome the tug of people against you as you reach for high goals.
3626.author: George S. Patton

3627.text: You must take action now that will move you towards your goals. Develop a sense of urgency in your life.
3627.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

3628.text: You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do.
3628.author: Henry Ford

3629.text: Learning is the beginning of wealth. Learning is the beginning of health. Learning is the beginning of spirituality. Searching and learning is where the miracle process all begins.
3629.author: Jim Rohn

3630.text: We are taught you must blame your father, your sisters, your brothers, the school, the teachers - but never blame yourself. It's never your fault. But it's always your fault, because if you wanted to change you're the one who has got to change.
3630.author: Katharine Hepburn

3631.text: Small deeds done are better than great deeds planned.
3631.author: Peter Marshall

3632.text: I'd rather attempt to do something great and fail than to attempt to do nothing and succeed.
3632.author: Robert H. Schuller

3633.text: Get action. Seize the moment. Man was never intended to become an oyster.
3633.author: Theodore Roosevelt

3634.text: There's a way to do it better - find it.
3634.author: Thomas A. Edison

3635.text: Determine never to be idle. No person will have occasion to complain of the want of time who never loses any. It is wonderful how much may be done if we are always doing.
3635.author: Thomas Jefferson

3636.text: The more we do, the more we can do.
3636.author: William Hazlitt

3637.text: The ultimate aim of the ego is not to see something, but to be something.
3637.author: Muhammad Iqbal

3638.text: No matter how many goals you have achieved, you must set your sights on a higher one.
3638.author: Jessica Savitch

3640.text: True happiness involves the full use of one's power and talents.
3640.author: John W. Gardner

3641.text: You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.
3641.author: Jack London

3642.text: You can never quit. Winners never quit, and quitters never win.
3642.author: Ted Turner

3644.text: Many are called but few get up.
3644.author: Oliver Herford

3645.text: They can conquer who believe they can.
3645.author: Virgil

3646.text: Begin to be now what you will be hereafter.
3646.author: William James

3647.text: Set your sights high, the higher the better. Expect the most wonderful things to happen, not in the future but right now. Realize that nothing is too good. Allow absolutely nothing to hamper you or hold you up in any way.
3647.author: Eileen Caddy

3648.text: We make the world we live in and shape our own environment.
3648.author: Orison Swett Marden

3649.text: Wherever you are - be all there.
3649.author: Jim Elliot

3650.text: We need to accept that the commandments of God aren't just a long list of good ideas. They aren't 'life hacks' from an Internet blog or motivational quotes from a Pinterest board.
3650.author: Dieter F. Uchtdorf

3651.text: I like motivational books, because I like the go-getting American spirit - your destiny is in your own hands, life is what you make it, don't accept your limitations, jump before you're pushed, leap before you look.
3651.author: Louise Mensch

3652.text: My first book was called, 'Mountain, Get Out of My Way,' where I did an autobiographical sketch, if you will, looking back at myself and looking back at things in my life, and juxtaposing them against things that are happening in other people's lives and trying to be motivational.
3652.author: Montel Williams

3653.text: Never retreat. Never explain. Get it done and let them howl.
3653.author: Benjamin Jowett

3654.text: There is always room at the top.
3654.author: Daniel Webster

3655.text: I really believe that everyone has a talent, ability, or skill that he can mine to support himself and to succeed in life.
3655.author: Dean Koontz

3656.text: You have to make it happen.
3656.author: Denis Diderot

3657.text: Always continue the climb. It is possible for you to do whatever you choose, if you first get to know who you are and are willing to work with a power that is greater than ourselves to do it.
3657.author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

3658.text: Do not wait; the time will never be 'just right.' Start where you stand, and work with whatever tools you may have at your command, and better tools will be found as you go along.
3658.author: George Herbert

3659.text: Never give in and never give up.
3659.author: Hubert H. Humphrey

3660.text: March on. Do not tarry. To go forward is to move toward perfection. March on, and fear not the thorns, or the sharp stones on life's path.
3660.author: Khalil Gibran

3662.text: I don't believe you have to be better than everybody else. I believe you have to be better than you ever thought you could be.
3662.author: Ken Venturi

3663.text: The more things you do, the more you can do.
3663.author: Lucille Ball

3664.text: The first step toward success is taken when you refuse to be a captive of the environment in which you first find yourself.
3664.author: Mark Caine

3665.text: One way to keep momentum going is to have constantly greater goals.
3665.author: Michael Korda

3666.text: Your heaviest artillery will be your will to live. Keep that big gun going.
3666.author: Norman Cousins

3669.text: Set yourself earnestly to see what you are made to do, and then set yourself earnestly to do it.
3669.author: Phillips Brooks

3672.text: You just can't beat the person who never gives up.
3672.author: Babe Ruth

3673.text: I've found that luck is quite predictable. If you want more luck, take more chances. Be more active. Show up more often.
3673.author: Brian Tracy

3674.text: Learn from the past, set vivid, detailed goals for the future, and live in the only moment of time over which you have any control: now.
3674.author: Denis Waitley

3676.text: Follow your inner moonlight; don't hide the madness.
3676.author: Allen Ginsberg

3677.text: There is nothing deep down inside us except what we have put there ourselves.
3677.author: Richard Rorty

3680.text: Step by step and the thing is done.
3680.author: Charles Atlas

3681.text: The weeds keep multiplying in our garden, which is our mind ruled by fear. Rip them out and call them by name.
3681.author: Sylvia Browne

3682.text: I am not afraid... I was born to do this.
3682.author: Joan of Arc

3683.text: Press forward. Do not stop, do not linger in your journey, but strive for the mark set before you.
3683.author: George Whitefield

3684.text: Opportunity does not knock, it presents itself when you beat down the door.
3684.author: Kyle Chandler

3685.text: You never know what motivates you.
3685.author: Cicely Tyson

3686.text: Success is the only motivational factor that a boy with character needs.
3686.author: Woody Hayes

3687.text: I like to put on hardcore when I have to clean my apartment, which I hate to do, but it's motivational. I like old heavy metal when I'm outside working on my car. Music has definite functions for me.
3687.author: Peter Steele

3690.text: I'm going to write a book, continue acting, continue motivational speaking and just share with people who I am and what I've learned in my second chance of life and pass it on to people in their first chance of life.
3690.author: J. R. Martinez

3691.text: I'm thrilled to continue my partnership with U by Kotex for Generation Know while helping to empower girls. I've always been a motivational resource for my younger sisters and hope I can positively impact and inspire other young girls too.
3691.author: Khloe Kardashian

3692.text: Religious speech is extreme, emotional, and motivational. It is anti-literal, relying on metaphor, allusion, and other rhetorical devices, and it assumes knowledge within a community of believers.
3692.author: Amy Waldman

3693.text: Marvin's Motivational Moments actually started as something that was actually therapeutic for me. I would sit up late at night after my wife passed trying to adjust to being alone.
3693.author: Marvin Sapp

3694.text: Be miserable. Or motivate yourself. Whatever has to be done, it's always your choice.
3694.author: Wayne Dyer

3695.text: If you ask me what I came into this life to do, I will tell you: I came to live out loud.
3695.author: Emile Zola

3696.text: Crave for a thing, you will get it. Renounce the craving, the object will follow you by itself.
3696.author: Swami Sivananda

3697.text: I was motivated to be different in part because I was different.
3697.author: Donna Brazile

3698.text: Earl Nightingale has inspired more people toward success and fortune than any other motivational speaker on the planet.
3698.author: Zig Ziglar

3699.text: The turning point was when I hit my 30th birthday. I thought, if really want to write, it's time to start. I picked up the book How to Write a Novel in 90 Days. The author said to just write three pages a day, and I figured, I can do this. I never got past Page 3 of that book.
3699.author: James Rollins

3700.text: Giving back, doing motivational speeches and stuff like that, that's always made me feel good. If you repeatedly go out there, and you are the change that you want to see, then that's what you are.
3700.author: Keke Palmer

3701.text: God always strives together with those who strive.
3701.author: Aeschylus

3702.text: To know oneself, one should assert oneself.
3702.author: Albert Camus

3703.text: The wise does at once what the fool does at last.
3703.author: Baltasar Gracian

3704.text: I've always tried to go a step past wherever people expected me to end up.
3704.author: Beverly Sills

3707.text: You can't expect to hit the jackpot if you don't put a few nickels in the machine.
3707.author: Flip Wilson

3708.text: Don't fight the problem, decide it.
3708.author: George C. Marshall

3709.text: The dog that trots about finds a bone.
3709.author: Golda Meir

3710.text: You will never win if you never begin.
3710.author: Helen Rowland

3711.text: If you think you can do it, you can.
3711.author: John Burroughs

3712.text: Leap, and the net will appear.
3712.author: John Burroughs

3713.text: A somebody was once a nobody who wanted to and did.
3713.author: John Burroughs

3714.text: To be wholly devoted to some intellectual exercise is to have succeeded in life.
3714.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

3715.text: You create your opportunities by asking for them.
3715.author: Shakti Gawain

3716.text: Always desire to learn something useful.
3716.author: Sophocles

3717.text: If you don't ask, you don't get.
3717.author: Stevie Wonder

3718.text: One may miss the mark by aiming too high as too low.
3718.author: Thomas Fuller

3719.text: If you've got a talent, protect it.
3719.author: Jim Carrey

3720.text: Go big or go home. Because it's true. What do you have to lose?
3720.author: Eliza Dushku

3721.text: From my tribe I take nothing, I am the maker of my own fortune.
3721.author: Tecumseh

3722.text: You have to learn the rules of the game. And then you have to play better than anyone else.
3722.author: Unknown

3723.text: Give Obama a script he has made his own, and he is the motivational speaker to end all speakers. Tony Robbins cloned with Honest Abe.
3723.author: Tina Brown

3724.text: Be thine own palace, or the world's thy jail.
3724.author: John Donne

3726.text: What is called genius is the abundance of life and health.
3726.author: Henry David Thoreau

3727.text: Oh, I would love to be a motivational speaker. I have pulled myself out of a million potholes, and I can see the potholes ahead of me. That doesn't mean that I could always do that so perfectly for my own life. I totally fall in potholes.
3727.author: Drew Barrymore

3728.text: I am not a has-been. I am a will be.
3728.author: Lauren Bacall

3729.text: People always accuse me of being motivational in a way, like it was a bad thing, but that's just how I was raised. My mom raised me in a positive environment, with lots of love in my heart, and that reflects in my music.
3729.author: Lenny Kravitz

3730.text: I've always thought of acting as more of an exercise in empathy, which is not to be confused with sympathy. You're trying to get inside a certain emotional reality or motivational reality and try to figure out what that's about so you can represent it.
3730.author: Edward Norton

3731.text: I started doing motivational tours. I've seen all kinds of people, from the CEOs to the lowest executive, opening up to their fears. We don't introspect as much as we should.
3731.author: Anupam Kher

3732.text: Our subliminal mental processes operate outside awareness because they arise in these portions of our mind that are inaccessible to our conscious self; their inaccessibility is due to the architecture of the brain rather than because they have been subject to Freudian motivational forces like repression.
3732.author: Leonard Mlodinow

3733.text: Do not weep; do not wax indignant. Understand.
3733.author: Baruch Spinoza

3734.text: I know not age, nor weariness nor defeat.
3734.author: Rose Kennedy

3735.text: As long as I'm not selling out the people that ride or die with me, I'm glad I'm not an MC. I'm a motivational speaker. I'm not that rapper dude.
3735.author: Young Jeezy

3737.text: How do you know you're going to do something, untill you do it?
3737.author: J. D. Salinger

3738.text: Typically, if you reward something, you get more of it. You punish something, you get less of it. And our businesses have been built for the last 150 years very much on that kind of motivational scheme.
3738.author: Daniel H. Pink

3739.text: I realized I love motivating and I love empowering and I love inspiring people. I did that as an athlete for 18 years, and I am able to do that as a motivational speaker now as well as doing work on television.
3739.author: Dominique Dawes

3740.text: I don't know what it's like to have a typical father figure. He's not the dad who's going to take me to the beach and go swimming, but he's such a motivational person.
3740.author: Tiffany Trump

3741.text: I want to be motivational and inspirational for everybody: my big aim is more women on bicycles.
3741.author: Marianne Vos

3742.text: One day, I got so disgusted that I sat down and wrote a list called 'Justin's list of things to do before he kicks the bucket.' I wrote it for myself and shortened it to 'Justin's Bucket List.' It was there on the wall, not as a story idea but as a motivational tool for myself, which actually ended up working pretty well.
3742.author: Justin Zackham

3743.text: I believe that any type of education can be great, but an education about ourselves can create something wonderful. I am a comedian, but people have called me a motivational speaker. I don't really consider myself that at all.
3743.author: Andy Andrews

3744.text: One good thing about music, when it hits you, you feel no pain.
3744.author: Bob Marley

3746.text: Music expresses that which cannot be said and on which it is impossible to be silent.
3746.author: Victor Hugo

3750.text: I think music in itself is healing. It's an explosive expression of humanity. It's something we are all touched by. No matter what culture we're from, everyone loves music.
3750.author: Billy Joel

3752.text: Music doesn't lie. If there is something to be changed in this world, then it can only happen through music.
3752.author: Jimi Hendrix

3755.text: Music is the movement of sound to reach the soul for the education of its virtue.
3755.author: Plato

3757.text: Music can change the world because it can change people.
3757.author: Bono

3758.text: Together with a culture of work, there must be a culture of leisure as gratification. To put it another way: people who work must take the time to relax, to be with their families, to enjoy themselves, read, listen to music, play a sport.
3758.author: Pope Francis

3759.text: After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music.
3759.author: Aldous Huxley

3761.text: Music in the soul can be heard by the universe.
3761.author: Lao Tzu

3762.text: Music is a higher revelation than all wisdom and philosophy.
3762.author: Ludwig van Beethoven

3763.text: I'm not a pretty princess, and I'm aware of that, so I like music that is really intense, really bold, and characters that in a way almost have a dark side and are kind of evil because, for me, that's when I feel my strongest and fiercest, when I'm not necessarily the good girl.
3763.author: Ashley Wagner

3764.text: Of all the music that reached farthest into heaven, it is the beating of a loving heart.
3764.author: Henry Ward Beecher

3765.text: Music is love, love is music, music is life, and I love my life. Thank you and good night.
3765.author: A. J. McLean

3766.text: Music is the emotional life of most people.
3766.author: Leonard Cohen

3767.text: My body is damaged from music in two ways. I have a red irritation in my stomach. It's psychosomatic, caused by all the anger and the screaming. I have scoliosis, where the curvature of your spine is bent, and the weight of my guitar has made it worse. I'm always in pain, and that adds to the anger in our music.
3767.author: Kurt Cobain

3769.text: Develop an interest in life as you see it; the people, things, literature, music - the world is so rich, simply throbbing with rich treasures, beautiful souls and interesting people. Forget yourself.
3769.author: Henry Miller

3770.text: For me, singing sad songs often has a way of healing a situation. It gets the hurt out in the open into the light, out of the darkness.
3770.author: Reba McEntire

3772.text: Music is the mediator between the spiritual and the sensual life.
3772.author: Ludwig van Beethoven

3773.text: Some people ask the secret of our long marriage. We take time to go to a restaurant two times a week. A little candlelight, dinner, soft music and dancing. She goes Tuesdays, I go Fridays.
3773.author: Henny Youngman

3774.text: I don't make music for eyes. I make music for ears.
3774.author: Adele

3775.text: You are the music while the music lasts.
3775.author: T. S. Eliot

3776.text: I don't need a holiday or a feast to feel grateful for my children, the sun, the moon, the roof over my head, music, and laughter, but I like to take this time to take the path of thanks less traveled.
3776.author: Paula Poundstone

3777.text: When I die, I want people to play my music, go wild and freak out and do anything they want to do.
3777.author: Jimi Hendrix

3778.text: Music is music, ultimately. If it makes you feel good, cool.
3778.author: Prince

3779.text: The earth has grown old with its burden of care, but at Christmas it always is young, the heart of the jewel burns lustrous and fair, and its soul full of music breaks the air, when the song of angels is sung.
3779.author: Phillips Brooks

3781.text: There is nothing stable in the world; uproar's your only music.
3781.author: John Keats

3782.text: I am happy to make money. I want to make more money, make more music, eat Big Macs and drink Budweisers.
3782.author: Kid Rock

3783.text: Like all music, the figured bass should have no other end and aim than the glory of God and the recreation of the soul; where this is not kept in mind there is no true music, but only an infernal clamour and ranting.
3783.author: Johann Sebastian Bach

3784.text: For me, music is my joy. It's my happiness. As long as this medicine, this chemo is in my body, I didn't have my love, my joy.
3784.author: Sharon Jones

3785.text: I feel like the reason people feel like they know me is because I'm giving you myself in the music. There's where the connection comes from; you can't Twitter that.
3785.author: J. Cole

3786.text: I was born with music inside me. Music was one of my parts. Like my ribs, my kidneys, my liver, my heart. Like my blood. It was a force already within me when I arrived on the scene. It was a necessity for me - like food or water.
3786.author: Ray Charles

3787.text: There is two kinds of music, the good, and the bad. I play the good kind.
3787.author: Louis Armstrong

3789.text: I've programmed myself musically to come up with love-feeling tracks that are romantic, sexy, but classy, all in one. And that's the challenge. Once I create that music, then the lyrical content starts to come - you know, the stories and things like that.
3789.author: R. Kelly

3790.text: Istanbul is inspiring because it has its own code of architecture, literature, poetry, music.
3790.author: Christian Louboutin

3791.text: The bass, no matter what kind of music you're playing, it just enhances the sound and makes everything sound more beautiful and full. When the bass stops, the bottom kind of drops out of everything.
3791.author: Charlie Haden

3792.text: Dre was one of my heros in the music industry. If he's not down for his homeboys, I don't wanna be a part of him or around him.
3792.author: Tupac Shakur

3793.text: Music is the shorthand of emotion.
3793.author: Leo Tolstoy

3794.text: Music is the soundtrack of your life.
3794.author: Dick Clark

3795.text: When superstition is allowed to perform the task of old age in dulling the human temperament, we can say goodbye to all excellence in poetry, in painting, and in music.
3795.author: Denis Diderot

3796.text: A film is - or should be - more like music than like fiction. It should be a progression of moods and feelings. The theme, what's behind the emotion, the meaning, all that comes later.
3796.author: Stanley Kubrick

3797.text: There is geometry in the humming of the strings, there is music in the spacing of the spheres.
3797.author: Pythagoras

3798.text: As you begin to realize that every different type of music, everybody's individual music, has its own rhythm, life, language and heritage, you realize how life changes, and you learn how to be more open and adaptive to what is around us.
3798.author: Yo-Yo Ma

3799.text: Music can bring about different vibes on the field, off the field, urban life, going to church, leaving church. Everything the world may bring, there's a song for it to put you in the right frame of mind.
3799.author: Cam Newton

3801.text: Life is one grand, sweet song, so start the music.
3801.author: Ronald Reagan

3802.text: Mathematics is the music of reason.
3802.author: James Joseph Sylvester

3803.text: May not music be described as the mathematics of the sense, mathematics as music of the reason? The musician feels mathematics, the mathematician thinks music: music the dream, mathematics the working life.
3803.author: James Joseph Sylvester

3804.text: Music is the wine which inspires one to new generative processes, and I am Bacchus who presses out this glorious wine for mankind and makes them spiritually drunken.
3804.author: Ludwig van Beethoven

3805.text: A great song is a great song, whether it's on vinyl or CD or cassette or reel to reel or mp3. Then again, that might be an overly optimistic view, but I do think that great music will transcend the medium in which it is delivered.
3805.author: Moby

3806.text: People are used to music that justifies street culture but something that's not touched on is why these kids act the way they act, live the way they live.
3806.author: Kendrick Lamar

3808.text: Today's symphonic music is sponsored by the upper structures of society.
3808.author: Sun Ra

3809.text: To me, this degree was an acknowledgment of my work in music.
3809.author: Chaka Khan

3810.text: I don't need anybody to market or promote me. If people don't want to hear this music, then it's not for them. You cannot please everybody.
3810.author: Lauryn Hill

3811.text: I've learned the importance of loving what you do. I have also learned more patience due to the nature of the music business.
3811.author: Randy Travis

3812.text: I always felt like there was a certain standard of music that I had to do from the beginning, even when I didn't have the recognition that I have now.
3812.author: Kendrick Lamar

3813.text: Mozart composed his music not for the elite, but for everybody.
3813.author: Andre Rieu

3814.text: If I had not had music in my life, I would be the neurasthenic vision of the playwright.
3814.author: Marsha Norman

3816.text: I live cinema and passionately love music, and my efforts in both these crafts are unfolding.
3816.author: Priyanka Chopra

3817.text: There's sketch, improv, writing, acting, music, and badminton. Those are the seven forms of comedy.
3817.author: T. J. Miller

3818.text: Music is my life. I love doing it, so I just do it nonstop all day. And with dancing, I wanted to put on a show for people. I don't want to just be sitting there doing nothing, so that's when I started to dance.
3818.author: Austin Mahone

3819.text: Being a professional musician doesn't mean you spend 12 hours a day playing music. It means you spend up to 12 hours a day taking care of business, dealing with litigation, with the various characters who've stolen your interests, or fending off hostile lawsuits from former members of the band.
3819.author: Robert Fripp

3820.text: I've never been much of a guitarist. I mean, I've played forever, but I was always more of a rhythm kind of guy. I don't read music.
3820.author: Oscar Isaac

3821.text: Music comes from an icicle as it melts, to live again as spring water.
3821.author: Henry Williamson

3822.text: Music is everybody's possession. It's only publishers who think that people own it.
3822.author: John Lennon

3824.text: Music is the divine way to tell beautiful, poetic things to the heart.
3824.author: Pablo Casals

3825.text: Music is forever; music should grow and mature with you, following you right on up until you die.
3825.author: Paul Simon

3827.text: Music has charms to sooth a savage breast, to soften rocks, or bend a knotted oak.
3827.author: William Congreve

3828.text: Music should strike fire from the heart of man, and bring tears from the eyes of woman.
3828.author: Ludwig van Beethoven

3829.text: If you want to be a rock star or just be famous, then run down the street naked, you'll make the news or something. But if you want music to be your livelihood, then play, play, play and play! And eventually you'll get to where you want to be.
3829.author: Eddie Van Halen

3830.text: I guess a good song is a good song is a good song, ya know.
3830.author: George Thorogood

3831.text: 'Hound Dog' took like twelve minutes. That's not a complicated piece of work. But the rhyme scheme was difficult. Also the metric structure of the music was not easy. 'Kansas City' was maybe eight minutes, if that. Writing the early blues was spontaneous. You can hear the energy in the work.
3831.author: Jerry Leiber

3832.text: Listening to soft music and the sound of the ocean is quite relaxing to me.
3832.author: LaToya Jackson

3833.text: The best of a book is not the thought which it contains, but the thought which it suggests; just as the charm of music dwells not in the tones but in the echoes of our hearts.
3833.author: John Greenleaf Whittier

3834.text: I could compare my music to white light which contains all colours. Only a prism can divide the colours and make them appear; this prism could be the spirit of the listener.
3834.author: Arvo Part

3835.text: People often complain that music is too ambiguous, that what they should think when they hear it is so unclear, whereas everyone understands words. With me, it is exactly the opposite, and not only with regard to an entire speech but also with individual words.
3835.author: Felix Mendelssohn

3836.text: Good music comes out of people playing together, knowing what they want to do and going for it. You have to sweat over it and bug it to death. You can't do it by pushing buttons and watching a TV screen.
3836.author: Keith Richards

3837.text: Music - that's been my education. There's not a day that goes by that I take it for granted.
3837.author: Billie Joe Armstrong

3838.text: Where there is devotional music, God is always at hand with His gracious presence.
3838.author: Johann Sebastian Bach

3839.text: Inspiration for my music just comes from, you know, my life experiences.
3839.author: Avril Lavigne

3840.text: It's really cool to see glowsticks at the show, to see dance music culture infiltrating and becoming one with the metal community.
3840.author: Jonathan Davis

3841.text: The acting part of me is not me. The music side is who I really am and what I want to talk about. It'll be hard for people to differentiate those different sides but I think it's possible. Once the music is out there, people will start to realize how serious I am about it rather than, 'Oh god, another actress making an album.'
3841.author: Lucy Hale

3842.text: Bob Marley is a huge influence. I love reggae music, but I also love the purpose of the songs he writes and the style of the music - it takes your worries away and makes you feel good, and I think that's what music is about.
3842.author: Colbie Caillat

3843.text: I think I could walk into any music shop anywhere and with a guitar off the rack, a couple of basic pedals and an amp I could sound just like me. There's no devices, customized or otherwise, that give me my sound.
3843.author: David Gilmour

3844.text: Starbucks has changed the rules of engagement for the music industry.
3844.author: Howard Schultz

3845.text: Soul music is about longevity and reaching and touching people on a human level - and that's never going to get lost.
3845.author: Jill Scott

3846.text: Music expresses what cannot be put into words I like to think, and I think the band makes a good go at it.
3846.author: Steven Tyler

3847.text: My dad has always been a big Ray Charles fan, and I've grown up listening to all kinds of music.
3847.author: Avicii

3848.text: I'm totally open to exploring different types of music. I just have to always remember to be true to who I am.
3848.author: Leon Bridges

3849.text: It requires wisdom to understand wisdom: the music is nothing if the audience is deaf.
3849.author: Walter Lippmann

3850.text: The tuba is certainly the most intestinal of instruments, the very lower bowel of music.
3850.author: Peter De Vries

3852.text: Music and silence combine strongly because music is done with silence, and silence is full of music.
3852.author: Marcel Marceau

3853.text: For me, music and life are all about style.
3853.author: Miles Davis

3854.text: In our music, in our everyday life, there are so many negative things. Why not have something positive and stamp it with blackness?
3854.author: Jamie Foxx

3855.text: I enjoy being happy every day, and hopefully you can hear my happiness in my music. Life is beautiful.
3855.author: Christina Milian

3856.text: Nevertheless the passions, whether violent or not, should never be so expressed as to reach the point of causing disgust; and music, even in situations of the greatest horror, should never be painful to the ear but should flatter and charm it, and thereby always remain music.
3856.author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

3857.text: I don't like painting flowers in my music. I like painting guts and pain.
3857.author: Jonathan Davis

3858.text: When I listen to music, I don't want to hear about flowers. I like death and destruction.
3858.author: Jonathan Davis

3859.text: When they look back on me I want 'em to remember me not for all my wives, although I've had a few, and certainly not for any mansions or high livin' money I made and spent. I want 'em to remember me simply for my music.
3859.author: Jerry Lee Lewis

3860.text: If the king loves music, there is little wrong in the land.
3860.author: Mencius

3861.text: I mean, there's times to rock and roll, and I love that too. But I think my first love is acoustic music.
3861.author: Graham Nash

3862.text: Jazz has borrowed from other genres of music and also has lent itself to other genres of music.
3862.author: Herbie Hancock

3863.text: Music is for people. The word 'pop' is simply short for popular. It means that people like it. I'm just a normal jerk who happens to make music. As long as my brain and fingers work, I'm cool.
3863.author: Eddie Van Halen

3864.text: To most white people, jazz means black and jazz means dirt, and that's not what I play. I play black classical music.
3864.author: Nina Simone

3865.text: I had spent many years pursuing excellence, because that is what classical music is all about... Now it was dedicated to freedom, and that was far more important.
3865.author: Nina Simone

3866.text: I became alienated from this religious upbringing, and started making music. I wanted to be a big star. All those things I saw in the films and on the media took hold of me, and perhaps I thought this was my god: the goal of making money.
3866.author: Cat Stevens

3867.text: Nobody will ever take Maurice's place, and he'll go on with us and he'll go on our music. He'll go on with us as the Bee Gees, and Maurice will always be with us.
3867.author: Robin Gibb

3868.text: Hunting, fishing, drawing, and music occupied my every moment. Cares I knew not, and cared naught about them.
3868.author: John James Audubon

3869.text: When I was younger, I was fascinated by David Bowie, for example. he had created an entire myth around himself. It was as important as his music.
3869.author: Lars von Trier

3870.text: You can fill this table up with people who are racist, homophobic, Satanist worshippers, sexist and we can be arguing but if you put on a song, I guarantee that people will stop and listen and that's what I love about music, it can bring people together.
3870.author: Charles King

3871.text: All old music was modern once, and much more of the music of yesterday already sounds more old-fashioned than works which were written three centuries ago.
3871.author: Peter Warlock

3872.text: I think the world is ready for some rock 'n' roll. Some real time guys that play their own instruments, write their own songs, and sing the music and have a good time doing it.
3872.author: Vince Neil

3873.text: I've been here 21 years, and I literally did walk up and down Music Row trying to break into the business. I felt very free to go into any publishing company.
3873.author: Steven Curtis Chapman

3874.text: Though everything else may appear shallow and repulsive, even the smallest task in music is so absorbing, and carries us so far away from town, country, earth, and all worldly things, that it is truly a blessed gift of God.
3874.author: Felix Mendelssohn

3875.text: City people live the city. We live in L.A., New York, we live in places where it's chaotic and you never know what's gonna happen. And that's the music - you never know what's gonna happen.
3875.author: Alice Cooper

3876.text: I do know the effect that music still has on me - I'm completely vulnerable to it. I'm seduced by it.
3876.author: Debbie Harry

3877.text: You know I take music seriously, right? So I expect journalists to take being a journalist seriously.
3877.author: Glenn Danzig

3878.text: Realistically, English is a universal language; it's the number one language for music and for communicating with the rest of the world.
3878.author: Enrique Iglesias

3879.text: I like to make music, I like rap music. Even if I'm white, I support that music. If I want to support it or any other white kid wants to support it more power to them.
3879.author: Kid Rock

3880.text: Mainly what I learned from Buddy... was an attitude. He loved music, and he taught me that it shouldn't have any barriers to it.
3880.author: Waylon Jennings

3881.text: You know, as you compose music, you're just off in your own world. You have no idea where reality is, so to have an idea of what people think is pretty hard.
3881.author: Roy Lichtenstein

3882.text: Being in Blur has allowed me to travel and hear the music that's being made all over the world.
3882.author: Damon Albarn

3883.text: This music has been around since before the beard on Moses. I happed to do it very well and I happen to have a lot of groovy songs that I know people are going to dig. I know more about it than you do.
3883.author: George Thorogood

3884.text: Music's always been really cathartic. It's the best drug for me to get away from the everyday pressures just for a second via a good song.
3884.author: Ville Valo

3885.text: I've never set out consciously to write American music. I don't know what that would be unless the obvious Appalachian folk references.
3885.author: Carlisle Floyd

3886.text: Music is the best way for me to say I love you.
3886.author: Mireille Mathieu

3887.text: I don't like to be labeled, to be anything. I've made the mistake before myself of labeling my music, but it's counter-productive.
3887.author: Neil Young

3888.text: The thing about my music is, there really is no point.
3888.author: Neil Young

3889.text: Nothing pleases me more than to go into a room and come out with a piece of music.
3889.author: Paul McCartney

3890.text: Drugs have nothing to do with the creation of music. In fact, they are dumb and self indulgent. Kind of like sucking your thumb!
3890.author: Courtney Love

3891.text: What annoys the hell out of me is the arrogance of some people. They don't even listen to our music, they decided in advance that they don't like it.
3891.author: Billie Joe Armstrong

3892.text: Richard Wagner, a musician who wrote music which is better than it sounds.
3892.author: Richard Wagner

3893.text: Not only did I get an A in music but I got an A in ladies.
3893.author: R. Kelly

3895.text: I love making music and I'm falling in love with making records, so it's like having two girlfriends. But I can handle it.
3895.author: Snoop Dogg

3896.text: Learning music by reading about it is like making love by mail.
3896.author: Luciano Pavarotti

3897.text: The world is full of poetry. The air is living with its spirit; and the waves dance to the music of its melodies, and sparkle in its brightness.
3897.author: James Gates Percival

3898.text: I came into music just because I wanted the bread. It's true. I looked around and this seemed like the only way I was going to get the kind of bread I wanted.
3898.author: Mick Jagger

3899.text: You know, traditional country music is something that's going to be around forever.
3899.author: George Strait

3900.text: Why be in music, why write songs, if you can't use them to explore life or an idealized vision of life? I believe a lot of our lives are spent asleep, and what I've been trying to do is hold on to those moments when a little spark cuts through the fog and nudges you.
3900.author: Rufus Wainwright

3901.text: I love electronic music, and I love drum and bass.
3901.author: Fred Durst

3902.text: Music became my focus. At 13, I was jamming with my mates. At 15, I was playing clubs.
3902.author: Bryan Adams

3903.text: I think every once in a while country has lost its way, but found its way back. It's always going to drift away from the traditional side, but then find a way to return. There's room for all kinds of influences be it pop, blues, gospel or whatever. But I will always say that I think we need more traditional country music coming down the pike.
3903.author: Randy Travis

3904.text: To me, country music tells a story about, and deals with, the way people live their lives and what they do.
3904.author: Randy Travis

3905.text: I mean, the shoe - there is a music to it, there is attitude, there is sound, it's a movement. Clothes - it's a different story. There are a million things I'd rather do before designing clothes: directing, landscaping.
3905.author: Christian Louboutin

3906.text: What's missing from pop music is danger.
3906.author: Prince

3907.text: The key to longevity is to learn every aspect of music that you can.
3907.author: Prince

3908.text: I think what people are attracted to about me, if anything, is my passion. People got exposed to my passion through music and song first.
3908.author: Lauryn Hill

3910.text: For my birthday this year, my girlfriends - who knew I'd just inherited my dad's turntable - gave me a carton of albums like 'Blue Kentucky Girl,' by Emmylou Harris, and 'Off the Wall,' by Michael Jackson. It's all stuff we grew up with. I mean, you can't have a music collection without Prince's 'Purple Rain' - it just can't be done!
3910.author: Connie Britton

3912.text: I never saw music in terms of men and women or black and white. There was just cool and uncool.
3912.author: Bonnie Raitt

3914.text: I consider myself kind of a reporter - one who uses words that are more like music and that have a choreography. I never think of myself as a poet; I just get up and write.
3914.author: Mary Oliver

3915.text: I don't think anybody is anybody else's moral compass. Maybe listening to my music is not the best idea if you live a very constricted life. Or maybe it is.
3915.author: Lou Reed

3916.text: My music is about being strong, even in your vulnerability.
3916.author: Miranda Lambert

3917.text: I think it's awesome to see people of all different ages from all kinds of backgrounds come together for the love of music.
3917.author: Miranda Lambert

3918.text: You shouldn't be in the music business if you're posing.
3918.author: Rod Stewart

3919.text: We didn't really expect to achieve anything outside of the UK, and it just went crazy. It's just crazy that people know our music. We're just humbled by it.
3919.author: Zayn Malik

3920.text: I want to reach the point where people hear my name and immediately think of real country music.
3920.author: George Strait

3921.text: My father was a minister and so rock music was banned in our house.
3921.author: Tori Amos

3922.text: Entertainment isn't just based on the very structured syndrome of European popular music, and it's great that there are so many thousands of people who are of the same opinion.
3922.author: Robert Plant

3923.text: The imminent demise of the large record companies as gatekeepers of the world's popular music is a good thing, for the most part.
3923.author: David Byrne

3924.text: Of emotions, of love, of breakup, of love and hate and death and dying, mama, apple pie, and the whole thing. It covers a lot of territory, country music does.
3924.author: Johnny Cash

3925.text: I'm never gonna stop music, it's like air to me.
3925.author: Dr. Dre

3926.text: I remember rap music. We used to party and dance off of it. Today it's all about a whole different angle... Rappers are going against each other, and it's more of a bragging, boasting thing.
3926.author: Flavor Flav

3927.text: I grew up with classical music when I was a ballet dancer. Now when I have to prepare an emotional scene, to cry or whatever, I listen to sonatas. Vivaldi and stuff. It's just beautiful to me.
3927.author: Diane Kruger

3928.text: At Spotify, we really want you to democratically win as a musician. We want you to win because your music is the best music.
3928.author: Daniel Ek

3929.text: When I started getting so many haters and closed doors, I decided to prove that it could be done. I was a divorced single mother of three at the time and a size 12 - not your typical model artist that labels feel work for the music industry.
3929.author: Jenni Rivera

3930.text: Mexican music runs through my veins. I loved it. Growing up, my father didn't allow us to listen to English music at home. That's all I heard. I had no choice.
3930.author: Jenni Rivera

3931.text: Baalbek is so beautiful. It is the heart of beauty in the Middle East - I want to embrace these people with my music. I will try so hard for them. Their president is a Christian, their prime minister is a Muslim. Music is for everyone.
3931.author: Mstislav Rostropovich

3932.text: We live with incessant music, all the time. It's like some weird musical purgatory, there is absolutely no rest for the ears, no space to absorb and reflect.
3932.author: James Blake

3933.text: I want to touch people's lives with my music and my lyrics.
3933.author: Romeo Santos

3934.text: I think wherever you go, when people hear good music, they will react to it.
3934.author: Wiz Khalifa

3935.text: Music is my passion, singing, performing. I play piano and musical theater is my background.
3935.author: Janel Parrish

3936.text: One of my core values is to help redefine what it means to be a strong and beautiful woman in the music and fashion worlds and to empower the wonderful things that make us unique.
3936.author: Janelle Monae

3937.text: I love the music of Lauryn Hill and Erykah Badu and more recently the music of Laura Marling. All these women share a strength and a wisdom in their voices and music that really makes me want to make music and sing.
3937.author: Lianne La Havas

3938.text: If you earned money listening to music, I'd be a millionaire.
3938.author: Michael Kiwanuka

3939.text: Once a song's out there, it's no longer mine. And that's the whole purpose of music: to belong to people.
3939.author: Sade Adu

3940.text: World music is about taking things from different places and bringing them together - which is great.
3940.author: Youssou N'Dour

3941.text: The best music happens when you have a personal connection to it. That same philosophy can extend to the instrument you hold in your hands: if a guitar means something special, you're bound to do great things with it.
3941.author: Frank Iero

3942.text: Music always turns into music. As soon as I play a key, push a key down, there's no theory any more. When I go and I hear a sound on the keyboard, all theories go out the window.
3942.author: Keith Jarrett

3943.text: I can't write a line without music - it provides just the right amount of distraction to keep me focused. Clearly, I still miss the noisy roommates.
3943.author: Stacy Schiff

3944.text: A 'Magik' session is a journey through different stages of emotions and the 'Search for Sunrise' is more chilling music for when you come home after a party or when you are just about to go to one.
3944.author: Tiesto

3945.text: At the end of the '90s and into 2000, electronic music was still an underground phenomenon, especially in America.
3945.author: Tiesto

3946.text: Music has shaped men's fashion, and transposed in a playful and witty manner its riding or military heritage. It is difficult to figure out who leads, but music and fashion are connected genetically.
3946.author: Hedi Slimane

3947.text: The patterns of big-band music are smooth and classical. It's got to be fresh. The brass section should crackle, like the sound of eggs being dropped into hot grease.
3947.author: Illinois Jacquet

3948.text: When I first began choreographing, I never thought of it as choreography but as expressing feelings. Though every piece is different, they are all trying to get at certain things that are difficult to put into words. In the work, everything belongs to everything else - the music, the set, the movement and whatever is said.
3948.author: Pina Bausch

3949.text: I'm a provincial. I live very much like a hermit: reading, listening to music, working in the cutting room, writing, commercial work - which doesn't take up that much time.
3949.author: Orson Welles

3950.text: In TV, film, and music there's a lot of snobbery, and I don't like it. I've never been a cultural snob.
3950.author: Simon Cowell

3951.text: I'm into fashion because it contains the mood of the day, of the moment - like music, literature, and art.
3951.author: Zaha Hadid

3952.text: When it comes to electronic music, I started listening to a lot of Daft Punk, way before I knew what house music was, and then progressed into a lot of Steve Angello, Eric Prydz, Axwell, Sebastian Ingrosso, and Laidback Luke.
3952.author: Avicii

3953.text: I don't like to define my music. To me, music is pure emotion. It's language that can communicate certain emotions and the rhythms cuts across genders, cultures and nationalities. All you need to do is close your eyes and feel those emotions.
3953.author: Yanni

3954.text: Hip-hop and electronic music are so similar, in the fact that they're both very visceral, have so much bass; a lot of times, it's the same tempos. The culture and some of the sound design is different but a lot of times, it's the same stuff.
3954.author: Skrillex

3955.text: I made the big turnaround in the early Nineties when I started hearing all the tenth generation punk bands like Green Day and Offspring and all those people. It just made me fall in love with punk again and remember my roots, and since that time I've always wanted to do more of that kind of music again.
3955.author: Jane Wiedlin

3956.text: If you wanna be famous, then it's okay if the music is fake, because fame isn't real.
3956.author: Josh Homme

3957.text: The work ethic at art school is completely different than the work ethic amongst people who get into music. People who paint, it's an honorable thing to spend all day and all night in front of your canvas - that is the romantic vision of the painter.
3957.author: Nick Cave

3958.text: Music drives you. It wakes you up, it gets you pumping. And, at the end of the day, the correct tune will chill you down.
3958.author: Dimebag Darrell

3959.text: With the Internet, bands can come and go every five minutes and the music looks disposable.
3959.author: Bruce Dickinson

3960.text: What worries me are these so-called radio stations with program directors who don't play all the different flavors of hip-hop. They should play the old with the new, 24/7, 365 days a year. A lot of these program directors are just jiving around and not playing all the good music for the people.
3960.author: Afrika Bambaataa

3961.text: Even in the most beautiful music there are some silences, which are there so we can witness the importance of silence.
3961.author: Andrea Bocelli

3962.text: I want my music to be accessible to every listener because I know that I really have something to say in terms of really, you know, removing thorns from people, thorns that really makes us unaware that we are bleeding with these thorns, like pain, grief, jealousy and so on.
3962.author: Vusi Mahlasela

3963.text: I was born with this love for music, and I say 'born with' because I don't really remember a day waking up and deciding that I'm going do to music. It's been all I've ever done and all I've ever wanted to do.
3963.author: Hunter Hayes

3964.text: I'm from Louisiana, and that's where I got my start, in Cajun music. There's a huge music scene down there centered around our culture. Those are people that are not making music for a living. They are making music for the fun of it. And I think that's the best way I could have been introduced to music.
3964.author: Hunter Hayes

3965.text: As a child growing up in a grey-skied Yorkshire village, I would occasionally happen upon a Bollywood movie on the television. After a few minutes watching a bunch of sari-clad dancers cavorting on a Swiss mountain to tuneless music, I would switch over to some proper drama about housing estates and single mothers.
3965.author: Simon Beaufoy

3966.text: Gospel music always relaxes me and calms my nerves.
3966.author: Gabby Douglas

3967.text: Everyone I talk to says stuff like, 'Music sucks today,' and I'm going to try and change all that.
3967.author: Tom DeLonge

3968.text: I like playing heavy metal music and pretending I'm a vampire in front of the mirror.
3968.author: Luke Mably

3969.text: There was a time that I was only known for being a plagiarist. It used to hurt at times because there was so much effort I was putting into music. And instead of that, it was a couple tunes that I had reproduced from folk songs to remake as film songs, which were being written about.
3969.author: Pritam Chakraborty

3970.text: I think it's so dope that I'm here in Chicago and contributing to the music scene that's thriving. People are so happy Chicago's shining that everyone is willing to say 'I represent Chicago.' That wasn't always the case.
3970.author: Chance The Rapper

3971.text: Find a beautiful piece of art. If you fall in love with Van Gogh or Matisse or John Oliver Killens, or if you fall love with the music of Coltrane, the music of Aretha Franklin, or the music of Chopin - find some beautiful art and admire it, and realize that that was created by human beings just like you, no more human, no less.
3971.author: Maya Angelou

3972.text: I always believed that my work should be unfinished in the sense that I encourage people to add their creativity to it, either conceptually or physically. Back in the 1960s, I was calling for 'Unfinished Music,' number one, and number two, with my artwork - I was taking unfinished work into the gallery. And that's how I was looking at it.
3972.author: Yoko Ono

3973.text: I had gone to a talent show - I was interested in American hip-hop music - with my older brother, to another town, and my town was attacked. I went from having an entire family to the next minute not having anything. It was very painful.
3973.author: Ishmael Beah

3974.text: Music is feeling. You can try to verbalize it. It really just hits you or it doesn't.
3974.author: Gene Simmons

3975.text: I have a love-hate relationship with the Grammys because I don't see the music world as a competitive sport.
3975.author: James Taylor

3976.text: An hour of violin lessons in Berlin is an hour where you get the child interested in music. An hour in a violin lesson in Palestine is an hour away from violence, is an hour away from fundamentalism.
3976.author: Daniel Barenboim

3977.text: Music is something that should speak for itself, straight from the heart. It took me a long time to understand that.
3977.author: Damon Albarn

3979.text: Work hard for what you want because it won't come to you without a fight. You have to be strong and courageous and know that you can do anything you put your mind to. If somebody puts you down or criticizes you, just keep on believing in yourself and turn it into something positive.
3979.author: Leah LaBelle

3981.text: In order to carry a positive action we must develop here a positive vision.
3981.author: Dalai Lama

3982.text: Once you replace negative thoughts with positive ones, you'll start having positive results.
3982.author: Willie Nelson

3983.text: Yesterday is not ours to recover, but tomorrow is ours to win or lose.
3983.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

3984.text: Find a place inside where there's joy, and the joy will burn out the pain.
3984.author: Joseph Campbell

3985.text: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shadow.
3985.author: Helen Keller

3988.text: I truly believe that everything that we do and everyone that we meet is put in our path for a purpose. There are no accidents; we're all teachers - if we're willing to pay attention to the lessons we learn, trust our positive instincts and not be afraid to take risks or wait for some miracle to come knocking at our door.
3988.author: Marla Gibbs

3989.text: Your smile will give you a positive countenance that will make people feel comfortable around you.
3989.author: Les Brown

3991.text: Adopting the right attitude can convert a negative stress into a positive one.
3991.author: Hans Selye

3996.text: Your attitude is like a box of crayons that color your world. Constantly color your picture gray, and your picture will always be bleak. Try adding some bright colors to the picture by including humor, and your picture begins to lighten up.
3996.author: Allen Klein

3997.text: God never ends anything on a negative; God always ends on a positive.
3997.author: Edwin Louis Cole

3998.text: Correction does much, but encouragement does more.
3998.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

3999.text: I often think that the night is more alive and more richly colored than the day.
3999.author: Vincent Van Gogh

4000.text: No matter what you're going through, there's a light at the end of the tunnel and it may seem hard to get to it but you can do it and just keep working towards it and you'll find the positive side of things.
4000.author: Demi Lovato

4002.text: Positive anything is better than negative nothing.
4002.author: Elbert Hubbard

4004.text: You've done it before and you can do it now. See the positive possibilities. Redirect the substantial energy of your frustration and turn it into positive, effective, unstoppable determination.
4004.author: Ralph Marston

4005.text: Positive feelings come from being honest about yourself and accepting your personality, and physical characteristics, warts and all; and, from belonging to a family that accepts you without question.
4005.author: Willard Scott

4008.text: Trust in dreams, for in them is hidden the gate to eternity.
4008.author: Khalil Gibran

4009.text: Social media websites are no longer performing an envisaged function of creating a positive communication link among friends, family and professionals. It is a veritable battleground, where insults fly from the human quiver, damaging lives, destroying self-esteem and a person's sense of self-worth.
4009.author: Anthony Carmona

4010.text: To succeed, you need to find something to hold on to, something to motivate you, something to inspire you.
4010.author: Tony Dorsett

4011.text: While you're going through this process of trying to find the satisfaction in your work, pretend you feel satisfied. Tell yourself you had a good day. Walk through the corridors with a smile rather than a scowl. Your positive energy will radiate. If you act like you're having fun, you'll find you are having fun.
4011.author: Jean Chatzky

4012.text: At the end of the day, the most overwhelming key to a child's success is the positive involvement of parents.
4012.author: Jane D. Hull

4013.text: I think it's important to get your surroundings as well as yourself into a positive state - meaning surround yourself with positive people, not the kind who are negative and jealous of everything you do.
4013.author: Heidi Klum

4014.text: In every day, there are 1,440 minutes. That means we have 1,440 daily opportunities to make a positive impact.
4014.author: Les Brown

4015.text: When you show deep empathy toward others, their defensive energy goes down, and positive energy replaces it. That's when you can get more creative in solving problems.
4015.author: Stephen Covey

4017.text: When you wake up every day, you have two choices. You can either be positive or negative; an optimist or a pessimist. I choose to be an optimist. It's all a matter of perspective.
4017.author: Harvey Mackay

4018.text: A positive attitude causes a chain reaction of positive thoughts, events and outcomes. It is a catalyst and it sparks extraordinary results.
4018.author: Wade Boggs

4019.text: Pessimism leads to weakness, optimism to power.
4019.author: William James

4020.text: Always turn a negative situation into a positive situation.
4020.author: Michael Jordan

4021.text: Positive thinking will let you do everything better than negative thinking will.
4021.author: Zig Ziglar

4022.text: You're going to go through tough times - that's life. But I say, 'Nothing happens to you, it happens for you.' See the positive in negative events.
4022.author: Joel Osteen

4023.text: Choosing to be positive and having a grateful attitude is going to determine how you're going to live your life.
4023.author: Joel Osteen

4024.text: Your positive action combined with positive thinking results in success.
4024.author: Shiv Khera

4025.text: Our chief want is someone who will inspire us to be what we know we could be.
4025.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

4027.text: You are the sum total of everything you've ever seen, heard, eaten, smelled, been told, forgot - it's all there. Everything influences each of us, and because of that I try to make sure that my experiences are positive.
4027.author: Maya Angelou

4028.text: The most important thing is to try and inspire people so that they can be great in whatever they want to do.
4028.author: Kobe Bryant

4029.text: Look up, laugh loud, talk big, keep the color in your cheek and the fire in your eye, adorn your person, maintain your health, your beauty and your animal spirits.
4029.author: William Hazlitt

4030.text: I always like to look on the optimistic side of life, but I am realistic enough to know that life is a complex matter.
4030.author: Walt Disney

4032.text: I do believe we're all connected. I do believe in positive energy. I do believe in the power of prayer. I do believe in putting good out into the world. And I believe in taking care of each other.
4032.author: Harvey Fierstein

4033.text: It takes but one positive thought when given a chance to survive and thrive to overpower an entire army of negative thoughts.
4033.author: Robert H. Schuller

4035.text: As a tennis player, you have to get used to losing every week. Unless you win the tournament, you always go home as a loser. But you have to take the positive out of a defeat and go back to work. Improve to fail better.
4035.author: Stanislas Wawrinka

4038.text: Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.
4038.author: Colin Powell

4039.text: There is little difference in people, but that little difference makes a big difference. The little difference is attitude. The big difference is whether it is positive or negative.
4039.author: W. Clement Stone

4040.text: Don't let people disrespect you. My mom says don't open the door to the devil. Surround yourself with positive people.
4040.author: Cuba Gooding, Jr.

4041.text: I believe in Karma. If the good is sown, the good is collected. When positive things are made, that returns well.
4041.author: Yannick Noah

4042.text: Virtually nothing is impossible in this world if you just put your mind to it and maintain a positive attitude.
4042.author: Lou Holtz

4043.text: I believe in karma, and I believe if you put out positive vibes to everybody, that's all you're going to get back.
4043.author: Kesha

4044.text: A positive attitude can really make dreams come true - it did for me.
4044.author: David Bailey

4045.text: I'm a really, really optimistic and really, really positive person. My main thing is, 'Enjoy life. Celebrate life.'
4045.author: Luke Bryan

4047.text: There is no racial or ethnic involvement in Thanksgiving, and people who may be very distant from the Christian system can see the beauty and the positive spirit that comes from the holiday.
4047.author: John Clayton

4048.text: Confidence isn't optimism or pessimism, and it's not a character attribute. It's the expectation of a positive outcome.
4048.author: Rosabeth Moss Kanter

4049.text: The greatest gift of all time is that you can make creation infectious because people spend less time being negative... If you log all the time with negativity in the while world, I wonder how much better the world would be if people sat down and did something positive. It spirals.
4049.author: Skrillex

4051.text: The way positive reinforcement is carried out is more important than the amount.
4051.author: B. F. Skinner

4052.text: Today or any day that phone may ring and bring good news.
4052.author: Ethel Waters

4053.text: My optimism wears heavy boots and is loud.
4053.author: Henry Rollins

4054.text: If you're not making mistakes, then you're not doing anything. I'm positive that a doer makes mistakes.
4054.author: John Wooden

4055.text: My dear friend, clear your mind of cant.
4055.author: Samuel Johnson

4056.text: A good laugh is sunshine in the house.
4056.author: William Makepeace Thackeray

4057.text: Winners make a habit of manufacturing their own positive expectations in advance of the event.
4057.author: Brian Tracy

4059.text: You have to listen to the people who have a negative opinion as well as those who have positive opinion. Just to make sure that you are blending all these opinions in your mind before a decision is made.
4059.author: Carlos Ghosn

4060.text: I'm looking forward to influencing others in a positive way. My message is you can do anything if you just put your mind to it.
4060.author: Justin Bieber

4062.text: The internet could be a very positive step towards education, organisation and participation in a meaningful society.
4062.author: Noam Chomsky

4063.text: Listening is a positive act: you have to put yourself out to do it.
4063.author: David Hockney

4064.text: Museums are managers of consciousness. They give us an interpretation of history, of how to view the world and locate ourselves in it. They are, if you want to put it in positive terms, great educational institutions. If you want to put it in negative terms, they are propaganda machines.
4064.author: Hans Haacke

4065.text: When the negative thoughts come - and they will; they come to all of us - it's not enough to just not dwell on it... You've got to replace it with a positive thought.
4065.author: Joel Osteen

4066.text: It is as if my life were magically run by two electric currents: joyous positive and despairing negative - whichever is running at the moment dominates my life, floods it.
4066.author: Sylvia Plath

4067.text: The Games are just a nice, positive way to build friendships, camaraderie and, of course, self-esteem. Plus, the Games are a great opportunity for people to participate in sports who normally wouldn't.
4067.author: Greg Louganis

4068.text: We should be the pro-legal immigration party. A party that has a positive platform and agenda on how we can create a legal immigration system that works for immigrants and works for America.
4068.author: Marco Rubio

4069.text: But you see, our society is still trapped in this binary, black/white logic and that has had some very positive implications for our generation. It's had some very negative ones as well and one of the negative ones is that it creates enormous identity problems for people who have one black ancestor and all white ancestors for example.
4069.author: Henry Louis Gates

4070.text: You have a lot of ups and downs in coaching, especially, but I can't remember any bad times at this point. I mean, they're all good. A lot of tears when you lose, a lot of down times, but I can't remember any of them. They're all positive now. Even the bad times were good.
4070.author: Don Nelson

4071.text: European nations began World War I with a glamorous vision of war, only to be psychologically shattered by the realities of the trenches. The experience changed the way people referred to the glamour of battle; they treated it no longer as a positive quality but as a dangerous illusion.
4071.author: Virginia Postrel

4072.text: Say and do something positive that will help the situation; it doesn't take any brains to complain.
4072.author: Robert A. Cook

4073.text: It's a wonderful thing to be optimistic. It keeps you healthy and it keeps you resilient.
4073.author: Daniel Kahneman

4075.text: There is no advertisement as powerful as a positive reputation traveling fast.
4075.author: Brian Koslow

4076.text: There are powers inside of you which, if you could discover and use, would make of you everything you ever dreamed or imagined you could become.
4076.author: Orison Swett Marden

4077.text: Facing the press is not easy, but because you have to go, you have to try to take a lot of positive things for yourself from these face-to-face meetings.
4077.author: Jose Mourinho

4078.text: And I have to work so hard at talking positively to myself. If I don't, it's just real hard to get through the day, and I'll get really down, and just want to cry. My whole body language changes. I get more slumped over.
4078.author: Delta Burke

4079.text: Every positive value has its price in negative terms... the genius of Einstein leads to Hiroshima.
4079.author: Pablo Picasso

4080.text: I like to encourage people to realize that any action is a good action if it's proactive and there is positive intent behind it.
4080.author: Michael J. Fox

4081.text: I'm totally into new age and self-help books. I used to work in a bookstore and that's the section they gave me, and I got way into it. I just loved the power of positive thinking, letting yourself go.
4081.author: Jason Mraz

4082.text: Instead of hating, I have chosen to forgive and spend all of my positive energy on changing the world.
4082.author: Camryn Manheim

4083.text: When push comes to shove, it ain't the science that's going to lift you up - it's the belief, the spiritual side of life, that's going to lift you up, no matter what religion you are.
4083.author: Kirstie Alley

4084.text: Positive thinking is more than just a tagline. It changes the way we behave. And I firmly believe that when I am positive, it not only makes me better, but it also makes those around me better.
4084.author: Harvey Mackay

4085.text: Positive social emotions like compassion and empathy are generally good for us, and we want to encourage them. But do we know how to most reliably raise children to care about the suffering of other people? I'm not sure we do.
4085.author: Sam Harris

4087.text: I was very pleased that the positive things about me and my game outshone the aggressive style of play I use. I would never tone that down, because I believe in that style of play, and I believe that you can play rough on the court and still be a good sport.
4087.author: Sue Wicks

4088.text: It was great fun. We had gone on tour in between the sessions and reconnected with the audience and got a lot of energy back from them, a lot of positive energy.
4088.author: Roger Andrew Taylor

4089.text: Either positive or negative comments are good because it shows I am still relevant.
4089.author: Justin Guarini

4090.text: Instead of yelling and spanking, which don't work anyway, I believe in finding creative ways to keep their attention - turning things into a game, for instance. And, when they do something good, positive reinforcement and praise.
4090.author: Patricia Richardson

4091.text: I had to develop the mentality and stay positive about making my comeback.
4091.author: Alonzo Mourning

4092.text: I am a positive person. I never think of the glass as half empty. I just keep pushing forward.
4092.author: Rosie Perez

4093.text: I realize I will always be the poster child for police brutality, but I can try to use that as a positive force for healing and restraint.
4093.author: Rodney King

4094.text: I'm an algebra liar. I figure two good lies make a positive.
4094.author: Tim Allen

4095.text: It's a positive thing to talk about terrible things and make people laugh about them.
4095.author: Louis C. K.

4096.text: I like video games, I like tech, I like being positive.
4096.author: Jimmy Fallon

4097.text: Perhaps trying to move away from my problems and focus on the positive is the best I can do.
4097.author: Jenni Rivera

4098.text: To protect people's lives and keep our children safe, we must implement public-works spending and do so proudly. If possible, I'd like to see the Bank of Japan purchase all of the construction bonds that we need to issue to cover the cost. That would also forcefully circulate money in the market. That would be positive for the economy, too.
4098.author: Shinzo Abe

4099.text: I'm a big cockeyed optimist. I try to accentuate the positive as opposed to the negative.
4099.author: Betty White

4100.text: We must not constantly talk about tackling obesity and warning people about the negative consequences of obesity. Instead we must be positive - positive about the fun and benefits to be had from healthy living, trying to get rid of people's excuses for being obese by tackling the issue in a positive way.
4100.author: Andrew Lansley

4101.text: Love is a positive, symbiotic, reciprocal flow between two or more entities.
4101.author: Inga Muscio

4102.text: Very gifted people, they win and they win, and they are told that they win because they are a winner. That seems like a positive thing to tell children, but ultimately, what that means is when they lose, it must make them a loser.
4102.author: Joshua Waitzkin

4103.text: All personality traits have their good side and their bad side. But for a long time, we've seen introversion only through its negative side and extroversion mostly through its positive side.
4103.author: Susan Cain

4104.text: Decades of research have shown that most happy families communicate effectively. But talking doesn't mean simply 'talking through problems,' as important as that is. Talking also means telling a positive story about yourselves.
4104.author: Bruce Feiler

4105.text: In my work in Haiti, I've seen the hugely positive effects that happen when people come together to build something in the middle of the most desperate situations.
4105.author: Olivia Wilde

4106.text: If you look at attitudes today and where they are headed, it's clear to me that supporting equal rights, including the rights to civil marriage, is a net positive for winning elections, as well as the right thing to do.
4106.author: Ken Mehlman

4107.text: Sometimes, reading my own media, the negativity can upset me, but I just deal with things on a positive basis. I mean, I have up to 20,000 people singing my words back to me on a nightly basis - they share my hopes and fears, and they relate to my own life experiences. Life can be pretty isolating, but that connection is always amazing.
4107.author: James Blunt

4108.text: Take your mind off the problems for a moment, and focus on the positive possibilities. Consider how very much you are able to do.
4108.author: Ralph Marston

4109.text: I love baseball. The game allowed me the influence to impact kids in a positive way. This gives me a chance to talk to some social issues.
4109.author: Cal Ripken, Jr.

4110.text: It's actually cool to be positive and optimistic and idealistic. It's cool to see yourself doing beautiful, great things.
4110.author: Tom DeLonge

4111.text: Living with anyone for many years takes skill. To keep peace in the household, couples learn to adapt to one another, hopefully in positive ways.
4111.author: Diane Ackerman

4112.text: Every person gets negative things, they learn from those negative things, and you become a positive person.
4112.author: Kapil Dev
