4676.text: Success is achieved by developing our strengths, not by eliminating our weaknesses.
4676.author: Marilyn vos Savant

4678.text: Young man, the secret of my success is that at early age I discovered that I was not God.
4678.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

4679.text: The key to success is to keep growing in all areas of life - mental, emotional, spiritual, as well as physical.
4679.author: Julius Erving

4681.text: Be thankful for what you have; you'll end up having more. If you concentrate on what you don't have, you will never, ever have enough.
4681.author: Oprah Winfrey

4682.text: Gratitude makes sense of our past, brings peace for today, and creates a vision for tomorrow.
4682.author: Melody Beattie

4686.text: At times our own light goes out and is rekindled by a spark from another person. Each of us has cause to think with deep gratitude of those who have lighted the flame within us.
4686.author: Albert Schweitzer

4687.text: Feeling gratitude and not expressing it is like wrapping a present and not giving it.
4687.author: William Arthur Ward

4690.text: If you are really thankful, what do you do? You share.
4690.author: W. Clement Stone

4692.text: I was given such a great gift. It's a miracle that never stops amazing me and reminding me to give thanks, every day. Having a wife and daughter gives me a lot more purpose. I was much more selfish before, but now I think about what kind of role model I'll be. I just want to be a better man.
4692.author: Jake Owen

4695.text: Whatever we are waiting for - peace of mind, contentment, grace, the inner awareness of simple abundance - it will surely come to us, but only when we are ready to receive it with an open and grateful heart.
4695.author: Sarah Ban Breathnach

4697.text: Joy is the simplest form of gratitude.
4697.author: Karl Barth

4698.text: When you practice gratefulness, there is a sense of respect toward others.
4698.author: Dalai Lama

4700.text: Gratitude is the sign of noble souls.
4700.author: Aesop

4701.text: The thankful receiver bears a plentiful harvest.
4701.author: William Blake

4703.text: None of us got to where we are alone. Whether the assistance we received was obvious or subtle, acknowledging someone's help is a big part of understanding the importance of saying thank you.
4703.author: Harvey Mackay

4704.text: I am thankful the most important key in history was invented. It's not the key to your house, your car, your boat, your safety deposit box, your bike lock or your private community. It's the key to order, sanity, and peace of mind. The key is 'Delete.'
4704.author: Elayne Boosler

4705.text: Talent is God-given; be humble. Fame is man-given; be thankful. Conceit is self-given; be careful.
4705.author: Harvey Mackay

4706.text: I'm thankful to God for having a family that's been there for me. He's been there from the time I was a child to even now with my family helping with my little boy. It's worth more than words could ever describe. That's one of the ways I've been able to stay grounded is thanks to family and God.
4706.author: Ashton Shepherd

4707.text: All I ever wanted really, and continue to want out of life, is to give 100 percent to whatever I'm doing and to be committed to whatever I'm doing and then let the results speak for themselves. Also to never take myself or people for granted and always be thankful and grateful to the people who helped me.
4707.author: Jackie Joyner-Kersee

4708.text: Thank you for life, and all the little ups and downs that make it worth living.
4708.author: Travis Barker

4709.text: In this world of sin and sorrow there is always something to be thankful for; as for me, I rejoice that I am not a Republican.
4709.author: H. L. Mencken

4710.text: I believe that if you don't derive a deep sense of purpose from what you do, if you don't come radiantly alive several times a day, if you don't feel deeply grateful at the tremendous good fortune that has been bestowed on you, then you are wasting your life. And life is too short to waste.
4710.author: Srikumar Rao

4711.text: If a fellow isn't thankful for what he's got, he isn't likely to be thankful for what he's going to get.
4711.author: Frank A. Clark

4712.text: Thanksgiving is a time when the world gets to see just how blessed and how workable the Christian system is. The emphasis is not on giving or buying, but on being thankful and expressing that appreciation to God and to one another.
4712.author: John Clayton

4713.text: Some people are always grumbling because roses have thorns; I am thankful that thorns have roses.
4713.author: Alphonse Karr

4714.text: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the parent of all the others.
4714.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

4715.text: Appreciation is the highest form of prayer, for it acknowledges the presence of good wherever you shine the light of your thankful thoughts.
4715.author: Alan Cohen

4716.text: My advice: Take a second out of the day today and be thankful for your family.
4716.author: Jenna Morasca

4717.text: When it comes to life the critical thing is whether you take things for granted or take them with gratitude.
4717.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

4718.text: Gratitude bestows reverence, allowing us to encounter everyday epiphanies, those transcendent moments of awe that change forever how we experience life and the world.
4718.author: John Milton

4719.text: Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.
4719.author: Henry Ward Beecher

4721.text: For what I have received may the Lord make me truly thankful. And more truly for what I have not received.
4721.author: Storm Jameson

4722.text: Let us be grateful to the mirror for revealing to us our appearance only.
4722.author: Samuel Butler

4723.text: Let me encourage you to get up every day and focus on what you do have in life. Be thankful for the blessings of the little things, even when you don't get what you expect.
4723.author: Victoria Osteen

4724.text: It is just that we should be grateful, not only to those with whose views we may agree, but also to those who have expressed more superficial views; for these also contributed something, by developing before us the powers of thought.
4724.author: Aristotle

4725.text: There's no happier person than a truly thankful, content person.
4725.author: Joyce Meyer

4726.text: I know that when I pray, something wonderful happens. Not just to the person or persons for whom I'm praying, but also something wonderful happens to me. I'm grateful that I'm heard.
4726.author: Maya Angelou

4727.text: Be grateful for what you have and stop complaining - it bores everybody else, does you no good, and doesn't solve any problems.
4727.author: Zig Ziglar

4728.text: When you are grateful - when you can see what you have - you unlock blessings to flow in your life.
4728.author: Suze Orman

4729.text: Every Thanksgiving, we all write down three things we're thankful for and put them in a hat. Then we pass the hat around the dinner table and everyone has to guess who wrote what!
4729.author: Debby Ryan

4730.text: Often people ask how I manage to be happy despite having no arms and no legs. The quick answer is that I have a choice. I can be angry about not having limbs, or I can be thankful that I have a purpose. I chose gratitude.
4730.author: Nick Vujicic

4731.text: Keep your eyes open to your mercies. The man who forgets to be thankful has fallen asleep in life.
4731.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

4732.text: Gratitude is the most exquisite form of courtesy.
4732.author: Jacques Maritain

4733.text: I have nothing to ask for, thanks to God. Everything I have, God has given me.
4733.author: Mariano Rivera

4734.text: I'd like to say to all my fans out there, thanks for the support. And to all my doubters, thank you very much because you guys have also pushed me.
4734.author: Usain Bolt

4735.text: I'm really thankful to God, man. Like now, I'm really making a real comeback with my group. With or without a record, with or without a movie. And behind all the negative press behind this movie.
4735.author: Ike Turner

4736.text: We have to be thankful to the Czechs that they did their duty. The Czech Republic won, I can't believe it. It was a huge party with all the people here.
4736.author: Ruud van Nistelrooy

4738.text: I'm just very thankful. And I say that a lot because that's the most important message.
4738.author: Pharrell Williams

4739.text: I think my mother is my biggest influence. There are so many things I hate about her but at the same time I'm thankful for her. All I know is that when I'm a parent I want to be just like my mom. I can talk to my mom more than any of my friends could talk to their parents.
4739.author: Nikki Reed

4740.text: China has not established the rule of law and if there is a power above the law there is no social justice. Everybody can be subjected to harm. I'm just a citizen: my life is equal in value to any other. But I'm thankful that when I lost my freedom so many people shared feelings and put such touching effort into helping me.
4740.author: Ai Weiwei

4741.text: I am definitely a Type A personality, always rushing around, trying to do too much, not good at just lying on the beach. But I'm so thankful for everything I have: wonderfully supportive parents and sisters, the best husband in the world, terrific students I love teaching and hanging out with, and above all, my two amazing daughters.
4741.author: Amy Chua

4742.text: I did not break up the Beatles. You can't have it both ways. If you're going to blame me for breaking the Beatles up, you should be thankful that I made them into myth rather than a crumbling group.
4742.author: Yoko Ono

4743.text: Being away from home was tough, but the challenge and the thrill of being on Broadway was so fulfilling, and I'm thankful to my husband for making it possible and holding it down at home.
4743.author: Nicole Ari Parker

4744.text: As a husband, father and public servant, I'm thankful for the counsel and wisdom of my older brothers - Bill, who was a priest, and Kevin, who is a priest.
4744.author: Denis McDonough

4745.text: Sometimes our light goes out but is blown into flame by another human being. Each of us owes deepest thanks to those who have rekindled this light.
4745.author: Albert Schweitzer

4746.text: No one who achieves success does so without acknowledging the help of others. The wise and confident acknowledge this help with gratitude.
4746.author: Alfred North Whitehead

4747.text: Immensely grateful, touched, proud, astonished, abashed.
4747.author: Boris Pasternak

4748.text: Feeling gratitude isn't born in us - it's something we are taught, and in turn, we teach our children.
4748.author: Joyce Brothers

4749.text: The hardest arithmetic to master is that which enables us to count our blessings.
4749.author: Eric Hoffer

4750.text: Thank you, dear God, for this good life and forgive us if we do not love it enough. Thank you for the rain. And for the chance to wake up in three hours and go fishing: I thank you for that now, because I won't feel so thankful then.
4750.author: Garrison Keillor

4751.text: Thankfulness is the beginning of gratitude. Gratitude is the completion of thankfulness. Thankfulness may consist merely of words. Gratitude is shown in acts.
4751.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

4752.text: No duty is more urgent than that of returning thanks.
4752.author: James Allen

4753.text: It is another's fault if he be ungrateful, but it is mine if I do not give. To find one thankful man, I will oblige a great many that are not so.
4753.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

4754.text: Thanks to television, for the first time the young are seeing history made before it is censored by their elders.
4754.author: Margaret Mead

4755.text: I work very hard, and I play very hard. I'm grateful for life. And I live it - I believe life loves the liver of it. I live it.
4755.author: Maya Angelou

4756.text: I am thankful for laughter, except when milk comes out of my nose.
4756.author: Woody Allen

4757.text: It's been quite a roller coaster ride, but I've grown and learned a lot about myself. The greatest thing is being able to interact with fans and touch people's lives... for that I give thanks.
4757.author: Christina Aguilera

4758.text: Gratitude changes the pangs of memory into a tranquil joy.
4758.author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

4759.text: I am going to spend my time today just thanking the people that played a role in my career, because I truly do believe that I was blessed by a lot of people that paths crossed mine as I went down the road in my career.
4759.author: Nolan Ryan

4760.text: God has two dwellings; one in heaven, and the other in a meek and thankful heart.
4760.author: Izaak Walton

4761.text: Dear Lord, I'm so grateful I'm still loved.
4761.author: Vivien Leigh

4762.text: Such lovely warmth of thought and delicacy of colour are beyond all praise, and equally beyond all thanks!
4762.author: Marie Corelli

4763.text: The trick is to be grateful when your mood is high and graceful when it is low.
4763.author: Richard Carlson

4764.text: I've been giving back since I was a teen, handing out turkeys at Thanksgiving and handing out toys at toys drives for Christmas. It's very important to give back as a youth. It's as simple as helping an old lady across the street or giving up your seat on the bus for someone who is pregnant.
4764.author: Queen Latifah

4765.text: When I started counting my blessings, my whole life turned around.
4765.author: Willie Nelson

4766.text: I wouldn't change anything. I've made mistakes, but thanks to those mistakes, I've learned.
4766.author: Enrique Iglesias

4767.text: I am what I am, I'm doing very well in my life, and I'm thankful to God for that.
4767.author: LL Cool J

4768.text: I'm thankful for serendipitous moments in my life, where things could've gone the other way.
4768.author: Rick Springfield

4769.text: Of all the characteristics needed for both a happy and morally decent life, none surpasses gratitude. Grateful people are happier, and grateful people are more morally decent.
4769.author: Dennis Prager

4770.text: I feel grateful because I have a lot of love in my life. I found the person I'm sharing my life with. I have a good man.
4770.author: Gisele Bundchen

4771.text: I was successful materially, but I know life is much more than worldly success. I saw all these blessings God had given me. The way to give thanks is obedience to God.
4771.author: Hakeem Olajuwon

4772.text: I'm grateful for my brokenness. I'm grateful for my humility.
4772.author: James McGreevey

4773.text: As we look forward to freedom, the shining city on the hill and the best days of America lying ahead, it is the men and women in uniform who protect, defend and make us proud to whom we should look and give thanks every night.
4773.author: Robin Hayes

4774.text: Every day I've got to be thankful that I am alive, and you never know - the cliche is, I guess, you could get hit by a bus tomorrow, so you'd better be at peace with whatever you got going at the moment.
4774.author: Joseph Gordon-Levitt

4775.text: I give all the glory to God. It's kind of a win-win situation. The glory goes up to Him and the blessings fall down on me.
4775.author: Gabby Douglas

4776.text: The simple act of saying 'thank you' is a demonstration of gratitude in response to an experience that was meaningful to a customer or citizen.
4776.author: Simon Mainwaring

4777.text: I'm grateful for always this moment, the now, no matter what form it takes.
4777.author: Eckhart Tolle

4778.text: Be thankful for problems. If they were less difficult, someone with less ability might have your job.
4778.author: Jim Lovell

4780.text: I have a lot to be thankful for. I am healthy, happy and I am loved.
4780.author: Reba McEntire

4781.text: Drink and be thankful to the host! What seems insignificant when you have it, is important when you need it.
4781.author: Franz Grillparzer

4782.text: Those men and women are fortunate who are born at a time when a great struggle for human freedom is in progress. It is an added good fortune to have parents who take a personal part in the great movements of their time. I am glad and thankful that this was my case.
4782.author: Emmeline Pankhurst

4783.text: It makes me feel so amazing to know there's people out here that support me and follow me on Twitter and watch my shows on YouTube and come to my concert, so I'm very thankful.
4783.author: Austin Mahone

4784.text: I'm not going to tell you to meditate on what Christmas really means and be thankful.
4784.author: Monica Johnson

4785.text: As a child, I didn't know what I didn't have. I'm thankful for the challenges early on in my life because now I have a perspective on the world and kind of know what's important.
4785.author: America Ferrera

4786.text: The only jobs kids have are to do well in school, to be charming and polite, and be thankful. That's it. I'll house you, protect you, I'll even give my life for you, and in return, you will behave.
4786.author: Gene Simmons

4787.text: Strive to find things to be thankful for, and just look for the good in who you are!
4787.author: Bethany Hamilton

4788.text: In the household in which I was raised, the themes were pretty simple. 'Work hard. Don't quit. Be appreciative, be thankful, be grateful, be respectful. Also, never whine, never complain. And always, for crying out loud, keep a sense of humor.'
4788.author: Michael Keaton

4789.text: Be thankful we're not getting all the government we're paying for.
4789.author: Will Rogers

4790.text: I am a big defender of 'Harry Potter,' and I think any book that gets kids to read are books that we should cherish, we should be thankful for them.
4790.author: Judy Blume

4791.text: We can always find something to be thankful for, and there may be reasons why we ought to be thankful for even those dispensations which appear dark and frowning.
4791.author: Albert Barnes

4792.text: I had a somewhat religious upbringing. Not strict, but it was there, and I'm kind of thankful for that. If you grow up just watching MTV, that's its own form of religion, and it's not even based on happiness or communal responsibility. I mean, try to construct a worldview out of that.
4792.author: Win Butler

4793.text: Before I get out of bed, I am saying thank you. I know how important it is to be thankful.
4793.author: Al Jarreau

4794.text: We in the United States should be all the more thankful for the freedom and religious tolerance we enjoy. And we should always remember the lessons learned from the Holocaust, in hopes we stay vigilant against such inhumanity now and in the future.
4794.author: Charlie Dent

4795.text: I'm really thankful and complimented when people come to me and say, thank you for the great times for all these years. But I don't think about it as being a leader.
4795.author: Bill Kreutzmann

4796.text: I had the pleasure, as Robin said, to live a childhood dream as many young Americans and Puerto Rican children live that play youth baseball. And I feel honored and very thankful for that opportunity.
4796.author: Nolan Ryan

4797.text: I have spent over 60 years bent over a guitar and to know that I wrote 70 compositions that masters have recorded, that makes me feel so good and full, and proud and thankful to the good Lord.
4797.author: Jerry Reed

4798.text: As the daughter of a 25-year veteran of the armed forces, I am incredibly thankful for the sacrifices our women and men have made in Iraq, and continue to make in Afghanistan.
4798.author: Barbara Lee

4799.text: Every musician, their goal in life is to play music that people love, and I've accomplished my goal. I was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and left that chapter of my life and those people in the past. Good and bad, I've loved and am thankful for that chapter.
4799.author: Steven Adler

4800.text: It is okay to be an outsider, a recent arrival, new on the scene - and not just okay, but something to be thankful for... Because being an insider can so easily mean collapsing the horizons, can so easily mean accepting the presumptions of your province.
4800.author: Tan Le

4801.text: I don't know about changing my perspective, because motherhood is such a glorious blessing and I am very thankful for that. It's such a beautiful experience. I so strongly recommend it. It's bliss, love and fulfillment of another level.
4801.author: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan

4802.text: I'm a human just like anyone else. We all have our problems that we deal with on and off the field. I'm thankful to have a beautiful wife and child that can help ease those problems when you come home.
4802.author: Torrey Smith

4803.text: I believe that human beings are born first and given passports later. I'm really thankful for my journey. And it's a journey I didn't design.
4803.author: Alfonso Cuaron

4804.text: When a person doesn't have gratitude, something is missing in his or her humanity.
4804.author: Elie Wiesel

4805.text: The unthankful heart... discovers no mercies; but let the thankful heart sweep through the day and, as the magnet finds the iron, so it will find, in every hour, some heavenly blessings!
4805.author: Henry Ward Beecher

4806.text: Gratitude is a duty which ought to be paid, but which none have a right to expect.
4806.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

4807.text: Years ago, it was pretty hard to get people to empathize even a little bit with scaly, cold-blooded critters; now, thanks a lot to good PR from television, it is easier to get the message of reptile conservation and tolerance across. We have a lot to be thankful to reptiles for, not the least of which is their control of rodents.
4807.author: Romulus Whitaker

4808.text: My mother is such an incredibly strong woman. She raised a family of five boys extremely well. She made us all strong, loving, caring people. We all support each other. I'm really thankful to her.
4808.author: Henry Cavill

4809.text: Just don't let the hype of what people are saying and how much they love you, y'know, just take the compliment and be thankful that people are complimenting you, but don't let it consume you; don't let your circumstances around you and the way people view you make you act a certain way.
4809.author: Mary J. Blige

4810.text: At Thanksgiving, I always start at the top of my list and say I'm grateful for friends, family, and good health. Then I get more superficial... like being thankful for my Louboutins.
4810.author: Christie Brinkley

4811.text: Let a nation's fervent thanks make some amends for the toils and sufferings of those who survive.
4811.author: Edward Everett

4812.text: I say grace. I'm a big believer in grace. I happen to believe in a God that made all the food and so I'm pretty grateful for that and I thank him for that. But I'm also thankful for the people that put the food on the table.
4812.author: Alton Brown

4813.text: We sing a little song before we eat, a little blessing before we eat, and it's really - we're thanking the Lord and the Earth for the food that we eat, and it really brings you together in a profound kind of way.
4813.author: Phil Lesh

4814.text: I'm thankful for all the things that this job has given me and my family. But probably the thing that I am most proud of throughout my career is that, not only myself, but my family and the people around me have just been regular people, which we are.
4814.author: Brett Favre

4815.text: What's blessed about my life is that I have been able to connect with the global audience on a regular basis. I am thankful for everybody's love, and I reciprocate that, but I also have to deliver on every occasion.
4815.author: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan

4816.text: I do believe that God blessed me in life with a wonderful family, a successful career, and a loving marriage, and remain thankful for that blessing.
4816.author: Bonnie Tyler

4817.text: I was in the postseason twice and I'm thankful for that.
4817.author: Ryne Sandberg

4818.text: Thank God we're living in a country where the sky's the limit, the stores are open late and you can shop in bed thanks to television.
4818.author: Joan Rivers

4819.text: Does not the gratitude of the dog put to shame any man who is ungrateful to his benefactors?
4819.author: Saint Basil

4820.text: I'm thankful to my family, friends, and fans for all of their support.
4820.author: Serena Williams

4821.text: I'm really looking forward to the Hall of Fame ceremonies. It's going to be unbelievable - just crazy. I'm looking forward to thanking all the fans for inspiring me to go out there and play my best football each and every game.
4821.author: Jerry Rice

4822.text: Every one of our greatest national treasures, our liberty, enterprise, vitality, wealth, military power, global authority, flow from a surprising source: our ability to give thanks.
4822.author: Tony Snow

4823.text: I realize how unique my path has been. And I'm thankful for that.
4823.author: Vanessa Paradis

4824.text: I've done it all. I'm thankful and proud of what I've accomplished in my life. I hope to keep doing it.
4824.author: Ralph Stanley

4825.text: If I could write a story that would do for the Indian one-hundredth part what 'Uncle Tom's Cabin' did for the Negro, I would be thankful the rest of my life.
4825.author: Helen Hunt Jackson

4826.text: We have to be thankful considering our number as a family we enjoy very good health generally but you may be sure me and my partner have quite enough to exercise our minds and occupy our attention.
4826.author: John Hawley

4827.text: I am very thankful and blessed to have a healthy and happy baby boy and baby mama.
4827.author: Eric Church

4828.text: The 'Night Train' has already been a crazy ride for me. We flew around making TV appearances and stadium announcements all over the country, fueled by little more than coffee and adrenaline... so many fans jumped on board with us, and I couldn't be more thankful.
4828.author: Jason Aldean

4829.text: I'm thankful to have time to write.
4829.author: Paul Watson

4830.text: There is such a thing as 'thanks-feeling' - feeling thankful. This ought to be the general, universal spirit of the Christian.
4830.author: Charles Spurgeon

4831.text: I'm just really, really thankful. I'm thankful to the doctors; I'm thankful to the family that donated the kidney.
4831.author: Natalie Cole

4832.text: I'm happy with who I am inside. I'd hate to have accolades and all that and not really be happy with who I was. So I'm really thankful for my family and for the support system that I have for being the person that I am today. I'm proud of who I am.
4832.author: Keke Palmer

4833.text: Thanks to the Interstate Highway System, it is now possible to travel across the country from coast to coast without seeing anything.
4833.author: Charles Kuralt

4834.text: We can be thankful to a friend for a few acres, or a little money; and yet for the freedom and command of the whole earth, and for the great benefits of our being, our life, health, and reason, we look upon ourselves as under no obligation.
4834.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

4835.text: From too much love of living, From hope and fear set free, We thank with brief thanksgiving Whatever gods may be That no life lives for ever; That dead men rise up never; That even the weariest river Winds somewhere safe to sea.
4835.author: Algernon Charles Swinburne

4836.text: Sometimes we need to remind ourselves that thankfulness is indeed a virtue.
4836.author: William Bennett

4837.text: Well, there's not a day goes by when I don't get up and say thank you to somebody.
4837.author: Rod Stewart

4838.text: By and large, the gospel of grace is neither proclaimed, understood, nor lived.
4838.author: Brennan Manning

4839.text: A federal judge did as he was supposed to do and upheld the Constitution. We should be thankful that we have judiciary that will do that.
4839.author: Michael Newdow

4840.text: Well, my first languages are German and Spanish because I was brought up by a Spanish mother and a German father, so I always spoke both languages at home. I'm very thankful that I was brought up in a bilingual house.
4840.author: Daniel Bruhl

4841.text: Charity never humiliated him who profited from it, nor ever bound him by the chains of gratitude, since it was not to him but to God that the gift was made.
4841.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

4842.text: I would maintain that thanks are the highest form of thought, and that gratitude is happiness doubled by wonder.
4842.author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

4843.text: A single grateful thought toward heaven is the most perfect prayer.
4843.author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing

4844.text: A proud man is seldom a grateful man, for he never thinks he gets as much as he deserves.
4844.author: Henry Ward Beecher

4845.text: Most people repent their sins by thanking God they ain't so wicked as their neighbors.
4845.author: Josh Billings

4847.text: Thankfully, dreams can change. If we'd all stuck with our first dream, the world would be overrun with cowboys and princesses.
4847.author: Stephen Colbert

4848.text: I'm thankful for the ability to share my faith in a lot of different places. It's something that I take as a responsibility and an obligation to handle as best as I can.
4848.author: Tim Tebow

4849.text: I am what I am thanks to my mother, my father, my brother, my sister... because they have given me everything. The education I have is thanks to them.
4849.author: Ronaldinho

4850.text: The brave who focus on all things good and all things beautiful and all things true, even in the small, who give thanks for it and discover joy even in the here and now, they are the change agents who bring fullest Light to all the world.
4850.author: Ann Voskamp

4851.text: The children have been a wonderful gift to me, and I'm thankful to have once again seen our world through their eyes. They restore my faith in the family's future.
4851.author: Jackie Kennedy

4852.text: I'm so thankful for my family and friends - they're really supportive. Everyone I work with on 'Austin & Ally;' the cast and crew are like my family now. We have so much fun, and I'm so happy they're in my life!
4852.author: Laura Marano

4853.text: I'm from Canada, so Thanksgiving to me is just Thursday with more food. And I'm thankful for that.
4853.author: Howie Mandel

4854.text: As with all commandments, gratitude is a description of a successful mode of living. The thankful heart opens our eyes to a multitude of blessings that continually surround us.
4854.author: James E. Faust

4855.text: The worst moment for the atheist is when he is really thankful and has nobody to thank.
4855.author: Dante Gabriel Rossetti

4856.text: I am thankful for all the blessings and talents I have been given, but most of all I am thankful for my loving and supportive family.
4856.author: Olivia Holt

4857.text: There is a lot to celebrate about that little Babe who was laid in a manger. Christians celebrate Christmas because they are thankful for the promise of salvation, which was delivered in human flesh and named Jesus.
4857.author: Monica Johnson

4858.text: He enjoys much who is thankful for little.
4858.author: Thomas Secker

4859.text: I'm just so lucky - my office is a racetrack. That is something I'm very thankful for. It's exciting, and it's challenging, and there are a lot of emotions and nerves that come with it, but right there before the gates open, before that minute and a half or two minutes of the race, it just hits you.
4859.author: Chantal Sutherland

4860.text: My first languages are German and Spanish because I was brought up by a Spanish mother and a German father, so I always spoke both languages at home. I'm very thankful that I was brought up in a bilingual house.
4860.author: Daniel Bruhl

4861.text: We are in a wrong state of mind if we are not in a thankful state of mind.
4861.author: Charles Spurgeon

4862.text: I know for me like I have a reputation of being kind of tough, I have a reputation of also being the girl next door, kind of sweet but I have standards and my thing is, it's me on that screen and I don't have control over everything in this and I'm grateful and thankful.
4862.author: Nia Long

4863.text: I can't say I'm thankful about being German because I sometimes experience it as a huge burden. But it is an integral part of me and I wouldn't want to escape it. I have accepted it.
4863.author: Bernhard Schlink

4864.text: I'm just shocked and thankful that I've gotten away with everything - experimenting here, trying at this, failing at that, being good in some things, not so good in others. It's kind of amazing that people are still sticking by me. When they come up to me in the street, I just want to write them all cheques.
4864.author: Michael Keaton

4865.text: The act is unjustifiable that either begs for a blessing, or, having succeeded gives no thanksgiving.
4865.author: Merle Shain

4866.text: Many of our prayers were not answered, and for this we are now grateful.
4866.author: William Feather

4867.text: When you solve a problem, you ought to thank God and go on to the next one.
4867.author: Dean Rusk

4868.text: Thankfully, while our self-righteousness reaches far, God's grace reaches farther.
4868.author: Tullian Tchividjian

4869.text: And I'm very surprised that all this stuff actually worked out to where I could have a career in film, gain the benefit of my education, and be thankful that I was able to break into my craft as an actor.
4869.author: Terrence Howard

4870.text: There was no instruction to be thankful that the Christians were special people, chosen people. There was no nationalistic, political or ethnic superiority to be thankful for.
4870.author: John Clayton

4871.text: I bless God for this retirement: I never was more thankful for any thing than I have been of late for the necessity I am under of self-denial in many respects.
4871.author: David Brainerd

4872.text: I am most thankful to Almighty Providence for mercies received, and determined still to press the case into public notice as a token of gratitude.
4872.author: William Banting

4873.text: I'm thankful I grew up the way I did. It made me a hard worker and insightful to other people's lives.
4873.author: Rachel Roy

4874.text: I'm thankful that my memory is good because my vision is going.
4874.author: Paula Poundstone

4875.text: I am both honored and blessed to have had such a wonderful career with the L.A. Galaxy and I am thankful for everything the club, the fans and the community has done for me and my family.
4875.author: Cobi Jones

4876.text: I went from not knowing anything to becoming really curious and wanting to know and respecting people in the industry, realizing how hard they work. I will always be thankful for 'Top Model' for that.
4876.author: Fatima Siad

4877.text: I'm thankful for the work that feminists like Gloria Steinem have done. I am a feminist, but the geography for women today is vastly different than it was in the '60s.
4877.author: Amber Heard

4878.text: I've got tapes that I'm so thankful that my father made - old reel-to-reel tapes. I've got a ton of those things at home. He kept those like fine diamonds, I mean he kept them, you know, in a box and was very, very careful of them, you know.
4878.author: Ricky Skaggs

4879.text: Teaching does allow me to keep one foot in the youthful waters I tend to occupy in my novels, so I'm thankful for that. My students also remind me on a daily basis that the stories I collected during my district attorney days are actually interesting to people who haven't had that experience.
4879.author: Alafair Burke

4880.text: May those who enjoy the faithful ministry of the Word feel exceedingly thankful for it. There are few blessings on Earth greater for a believer; and yet the Lord is frequently obliged to teach us the value of this blessing by depriving us of it for a season.
4880.author: George Muller

4881.text: In Latino culture, the quinceanera's a big thing - it's when a girl becomes a woman. But I think age is just a number - you become a woman with the responsibilities you take on and the decisions you make. I started realizing that every day is a gift - you have every day to be thankful you're alive.
4881.author: Emily Rios

4882.text: I'm certainly thankful for what the Cubs did for me. I respect their organization. It's the same way with the Atlanta Braves, an awfully fine organization. I respect everybody who's down there, and that's still where I live today. But the Cardinals represent the best years of my career.
4882.author: Bruce Sutter

4883.text: Music is very powerful and can make you feel whatever it is. If you listen to gospel, you're going to feel thankful, and you're going to want to call up people that you hate and tell them that you love them. When you listen to sexual music, it gets you in the mood.
4883.author: R. Kelly

4884.text: I have a fine level of recognition in the business and among the acting community now, so I consider myself one of the lucky ones. If I didn't think that, there would be something wrong with me. I'm grateful and thankful for what I've got.
4884.author: Philip Seymour Hoffman

4885.text: And I'm so thankful that I've been allowed to show another side of Trish.
4885.author: Trish Stratus

4886.text: I'm thankful to get the opportunity to direct. I hope I don't mess it up.
4886.author: Mark Harmon

4887.text: I still don't look at myself as a star. I've always had a thankful heart.
4887.author: Brenda Lee

4888.text: I'm thankful for not ever taking anything illegal.
4888.author: Pedro Martinez

4889.text: I'm thankful for my songs being at the top of the charts but I am human - I think people still have to remember that.
4889.author: Delta Goodrem

4890.text: I feel so thankful that I'm able to be a part of something that I love to wake up and run to work every day.
4890.author: Alexander Wang

4891.text: It feels great to win and I can't be more thankful to the Lord for walking me through every step. God was and is so faithful every time.
4891.author: Webb Simpson

4892.text: I'm just thankful to have a tour and work something I can focus on.
4892.author: Jerry Cantrell

4893.text: I am incredibly thankful for the strong support I have from my peers in the industry and of course my amazing fans.
4893.author: Miranda Lambert

4894.text: I'm thankful for Sarah Palin's vice presidential bid, which taught us that Alaska is not in a box off the coast of California.
4894.author: Paula Poundstone

4895.text: Even now, when I try and think of band names just randomly, I'm so thankful that 'fun.' is the name of the band. I never really think twice about it. It is so simple and so easy.
4895.author: Nate Ruess

4896.text: What's funny is my mom took me to the theater for the first time when I was six years old, and I was just amazed by it. I just said, 'Hey Mom, can I do this too?' And so she signed me up for little theater classes, and I remember my first audition for a play when I was seven years old was for 'The Thankful Elf.'
4896.author: Dana Davis

4897.text: I'm very thankful that I can make people happy just by signing my name.
4897.author: Yoko Ono

4898.text: I feel like I'm just doing a job. It's amazing to think that you affect other peoples' lives on such a grand scale. I'm so thankful for that, and I'm so lucky. It's hard to stop and think that people are interested in me.
4898.author: Kip Pardue

4899.text: I'm so thankful for my one year at regular high school in White Plains.
4899.author: Jennifer Damiano

4900.text: I am very thankful that I have lived the life I have lived. I am thankful for my Graves' disease, and I tell people, if I had my whole life to live over, I would have it, because it has really made me into the person that I am.
4900.author: Gail Devers

4901.text: I'm so thankful for that struggling period. That time is really great where you have no idea what's going to happen.
4901.author: Abbi Jacobson

4902.text: I am thankful I can see much to admire in all religions.
4902.author: Alfred Russel Wallace

4903.text: I'm one of the most fortunate people in the world.
4903.author: Rose Kennedy

4905.text: If you reflect often on how His Atonement has changed you, and if you give thanks often, you will find that your witness of Him gains power to touch the hearts of others. When those you invite out of your own testimony feel that witness, they will come to accept Him as their Lord and Savior.
4905.author: Henry B. Eyring

4906.text: I'm thankful for the incredible advances in medicine that have taken place during my lifetime. I almost certainly wouldn't still be here if it weren't for them.
4906.author: Billy Graham

4907.text: I'm grateful for the opportunities God gave me to minister to people in high places; people in power have spiritual and personal needs like everyone else, and often they have no one to talk to.
4907.author: Billy Graham

4908.text: I understand that being able to appeal to the public and having an amazing sense of humour is not something that comes easy. It's definitely a gift and for which I'm thankful.
4908.author: Kevin Hart

4909.text: Look folks, we know who built this country and we know who is going to rebuild it. It's you. Instead of vilifying you, we should be thanking you. We owe you.
4909.author: Joe Biden

4910.text: Old age is not a matter for sorrow. It is matter for thanks if we have left our work done behind us.
4910.author: Thomas Carlyle

4911.text: I think everything is going to be devastatingly sad - when the phone rings, I know somebody in my family's been hurt, somebody's going to die. I'm sure a therapist would go, 'That's not a good way to live,' but every time it's not that bad thing, I'm so thankful and appreciative.
4911.author: Sandra Bullock

4912.text: I'm thankful enough or blessed enough to be able to say that Miles Davis was a friend when he was alive, and he was a wonderful mentor and really, really funny, you know.
4912.author: Prince

4913.text: We can be thankful President Barack Obama is taking aim at one of the prime causes of climate change and extreme weather: air pollution. The EPA's carbon pollution standards are the most significant step forward our country has ever taken to protect our health by addressing climate change.
4913.author: Donna Brazile

4914.text: All of us, at certain moments of our lives, need to take advice and to receive help from other people.
4914.author: Alexis Carrel

4915.text: To enjoy good health, to bring true happiness to one's family, to bring peace to all, one must first discipline and control one's own mind. If a man can control his mind he can find the way to Enlightenment, and all wisdom and virtue will naturally come to him.
4915.author: Buddha

4916.text: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
4916.author: Lao Tzu

4918.text: If you're trying to achieve, there will be roadblocks. I've had them; everybody has had them. But obstacles don't have to stop you. If you run into a wall, don't turn around and give up. Figure out how to climb it, go through it, or work around it.
4918.author: Michael Jordan

4919.text: Today's mighty oak is just yesterday's nut, that held its ground.
4919.author: David Icke

4920.text: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
4920.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

4921.text: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.
4921.author: Jim Rohn

4922.text: Honesty is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.
4922.author: Thomas Jefferson

4923.text: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
4923.author: Socrates

4924.text: We are made wise not by the recollection of our past, but by the responsibility for our future.
4924.author: George Bernard Shaw

4925.text: The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails.
4925.author: William Arthur Ward

4926.text: Talent is God given. Be humble. Fame is man-given. Be grateful. Conceit is self-given. Be careful.
4926.author: John Wooden

4927.text: It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see.
4927.author: Henry David Thoreau

4928.text: People don't notice whether it's winter or summer when they're happy.
4928.author: Anton Chekhov

4929.text: It's the little details that are vital. Little things make big things happen.
4929.author: John Wooden

4931.text: By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest; Second, by imitation, which is easiest; and third by experience, which is the bitterest.
4931.author: Confucius

4933.text: A man must be big enough to admit his mistakes, smart enough to profit from them, and strong enough to correct them.
4933.author: John C. Maxwell

4935.text: Don't gain the world and lose your soul; wisdom is better than silver or gold.
4935.author: Bob Marley

4936.text: What makes Superman a hero is not that he has power, but that he has the wisdom and the maturity to use the power wisely. From an acting point of view, that's how I approached the part.
4936.author: Christopher Reeve

4937.text: I have just three things to teach: simplicity, patience, compassion. These three are your greatest treasures.
4937.author: Lao Tzu

4938.text: A good head and a good heart are always a formidable combination.
4938.author: Nelson Mandela

4941.text: Think big thoughts but relish small pleasures.
4941.author: H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

4942.text: If you don't know where you are going, any road will get you there.
4942.author: Lewis Carroll

4943.text: Never let your head hang down. Never give up and sit down and grieve. Find another way. And don't pray when it rains if you don't pray when the sun shines.
4943.author: Richard M. Nixon

4944.text: Those who improve with age embrace the power of personal growth and personal achievement and begin to replace youth with wisdom, innocence with understanding, and lack of purpose with self-actualization.
4944.author: Bo Bennett

4948.text: When it is obvious that the goals cannot be reached, don't adjust the goals, adjust the action steps.
4948.author: Confucius

4949.text: Knowing others is wisdom, knowing yourself is Enlightenment.
4949.author: Lao Tzu

4950.text: If you talk to a man in a language he understands, that goes to his head. If you talk to him in his language, that goes to his heart.
4950.author: Nelson Mandela

4951.text: No man was ever wise by chance.
4951.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

4953.text: The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.
4953.author: Walt Disney

4956.text: Everything comes to us that belongs to us if we create the capacity to receive it.
4956.author: Rabindranath Tagore

4957.text: Democracy is a pathetic belief in the collective wisdom of individual ignorance.
4957.author: H. L. Mencken

4958.text: The way you see people is the way you treat them, and the way you treat them is what they become.
4958.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

4963.text: Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake.
4963.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

4964.text: Never reach out your hand unless you're willing to extend an arm.
4964.author: Pope Paul VI

4965.text: It is not wisdom but Authority that makes a law.
4965.author: Thomas Hobbes

4966.text: Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.
4966.author: Francis Bacon

4967.text: If you only have a hammer, you tend to see every problem as a nail.
4967.author: Abraham Maslow

4968.text: A long habit of not thinking a thing wrong gives it a superficial appearance of being right.
4968.author: Thomas Paine

4969.text: We are what our thoughts have made us; so take care about what you think. Words are secondary. Thoughts live; they travel far.
4969.author: Swami Vivekananda

4970.text: Step with care and great tact, and remember that Life's a Great Balancing Act.
4970.author: Dr. Seuss

4973.text: There are many ways of going forward, but only one way of standing still.
4973.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

4974.text: Set your course by the stars, not by the lights of every passing ship.
4974.author: Omar N. Bradley

4975.text: He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the universe.
4975.author: Marcus Aurelius

4976.text: Be as you wish to seem.
4976.author: Socrates

4977.text: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.
4977.author: Carl Jung

4978.text: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.
4978.author: Thomas A. Edison

4979.text: The greater danger for most of us lies not in setting our aim too high and falling short; but in setting our aim too low, and achieving our mark.
4979.author: Michelangelo

4980.text: Year's end is neither an end nor a beginning but a going on, with all the wisdom that experience can instill in us.
4980.author: Hal Borland

4981.text: Give me a lever long enough and a fulcrum on which to place it, and I shall move the world.
4981.author: Archimedes

4982.text: In every walk with nature one receives far more than he seeks.
4982.author: John Muir

4983.text: If you want a thing done well, do it yourself.
4983.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

4984.text: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
4984.author: Saint Augustine

4985.text: Without freedom of thought, there can be no such thing as wisdom - and no such thing as public liberty without freedom of speech.
4985.author: Benjamin Franklin

4986.text: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.
4986.author: Henry Ford

4987.text: We cannot become what we need to be by remaining what we are.
4987.author: Max de Pree

4988.text: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.
4988.author: Sigmund Freud

4990.text: There are three methods to gaining wisdom. The first is reflection, which is the highest. The second is limitation, which is the easiest. The third is experience, which is the bitterest.
4990.author: Confucius

4992.text: He who learns must suffer. And even in our sleep pain that cannot forget falls drop by drop upon the heart, and in our own despair, against our will, comes wisdom to us by the awful grace of God.
4992.author: Aeschylus

4993.text: Avoid having your ego so close to your position that when your position falls, your ego goes with it.
4993.author: Colin Powell

4994.text: In dwelling, live close to the ground. In thinking, keep to the simple. In conflict, be fair and generous. In governing, don't try to control. In work, do what you enjoy. In family life, be completely present.
4994.author: Lao Tzu

4995.text: A day of worry is more exhausting than a week of work.
4995.author: John Lubbock

4997.text: A charming woman... doesn't follow the crowd. She is herself.
4997.author: Loretta Young

5000.text: I praise loudly. I blame softly.
5000.author: Catherine the Great

5001.text: Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.
5001.author: Og Mandino

5003.text: As you walk down the fairway of life you must smell the roses, for you only get to play one round.
5003.author: Ben Hogan

5004.text: How many cares one loses when one decides not to be something but to be someone.
5004.author: Coco Chanel

5005.text: It's better to be a lion for a day than a sheep all your life.
5005.author: Elizabeth Kenny

5006.text: The motto of chivalry is also the motto of wisdom; to serve all, but love only one.
5006.author: Honore de Balzac

5007.text: We never understand how little we need in this world until we know the loss of it.
5007.author: James M. Barrie

5008.text: The time to repair the roof is when the sun is shining.
5008.author: John F. Kennedy

5009.text: It is a common experience that a problem difficult at night is resolved in the morning after the committee of sleep has worked on it.
5009.author: John Steinbeck

5011.text: The higher we are placed, the more humbly we should walk.
5011.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

5012.text: True wisdom comes to each of us when we realize how little we understand about life, ourselves, and the world around us.
5012.author: Socrates

5013.text: Nine-tenths of wisdom is being wise in time.
5013.author: Theodore Roosevelt

5014.text: The three great essentials to achieve anything worth while are: Hard work, Stick-to-itiveness, and Common sense.
5014.author: Thomas A. Edison

5015.text: Even if you're on the right track, you'll get run over if you just sit there.
5015.author: Will Rogers

5016.text: Giving opens the way for receiving.
5016.author: Florence Scovel Shinn

5018.text: He is no fool who gives what he cannot keep to gain what he cannot lose.
5018.author: Jim Elliot

5019.text: The opportunity for brotherhood presents itself every time you meet a human being.
5019.author: Jane Wyman

5023.text: Let us be about setting high standards for life, love, creativity, and wisdom. If our expectations in these areas are low, we are not likely to experience wellness. Setting high standards makes every day and every decade worth looking forward to.
5023.author: Greg Anderson

5024.text: Always keep your mind as bright and clear as the vast sky, the great ocean, and the highest peak, empty of all thoughts. Always keep your body filled with light and heat. Fill yourself with the power of wisdom and enlightenment.
5024.author: Morihei Ueshiba

5025.text: If suffering brings wisdom, I would wish to be less wise.
5025.author: William Butler Yeats

5026.text: What wisdom can you find that is greater than kindness?
5026.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

5027.text: No party has a monopoly on wisdom. No democracy works without compromise. But when Governor Romney and his allies in Congress tell us we can somehow lower our deficit by spending trillions more on new tax breaks for the wealthy - well, you do the math. I refuse to go along with that. And as long as I'm President, I never will.
5027.author: Barack Obama

5029.text: O, what a tangled web we weave when first we practise to deceive!
5029.author: Walter Scott

5032.text: Irony is the gaiety of reflection and the joy of wisdom.
5032.author: Anatole France

5033.text: All human wisdom works and has worries and grief as reward.
5033.author: Johann Georg Hamann

5034.text: Though sages may pour out their wisdom's treasure, there is no sterner moralist than pleasure.
5034.author: Lord Byron

5035.text: If the highest things are unknowable, then the highest capacity or virtue of man cannot be theoretical wisdom.
5035.author: Leo Strauss

5036.text: But the law of God came from heaven indeed. God wrote it with his finger, it is the fountain of all wisdom, and therefore shall it continue for ever, and never have an end.
5036.author: John Jewel

5037.text: You can only learn so much from books. You can only learn so much from education. Ultimately, it is the wisdom of God that will carry you through in the toughest situations of life.
5037.author: Ravi Zacharias

5040.text: There is a wisdom of the head, and a wisdom of the heart.
5040.author: Charles Dickens

5041.text: A ruffled mind makes a restless pillow.
5041.author: Charlotte Bronte

5042.text: The chief condition on which, life, health and vigor depend on, is action. It is by action that an organism develops its faculties, increases its energy, and attains the fulfillment of its destiny.
5042.author: Colin Powell

5043.text: It has long been an axiom of mine that the little things are infinitely the most important.
5043.author: Arthur Conan Doyle

5045.text: Wisdom is knowing what to do next; virtue is doing it.
5045.author: David Starr Jordan

5046.text: Wisdom stands at the turn in the road and calls upon us publicly, but we consider it false and despise its adherents.
5046.author: Khalil Gibran

5047.text: It takes a great man to give sound advice tactfully, but a greater to accept it graciously.
5047.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

5048.text: To wear your heart on your sleeve isn't a very good plan; you should wear it inside, where it functions best.
5048.author: Margaret Thatcher

5050.text: You've got to go out on a limb sometimes because that's where the fruit is.
5050.author: Will Rogers

5051.text: People spend too much time finding other people to blame, too much energy finding excuses for not being what they are capable of being, and not enough energy putting themselves on the line, growing out of the past, and getting on with their lives.
5051.author: J. Michael Straczynski

5053.text: The future has already arrived. It's just not evenly distributed yet.
5053.author: William Gibson

5054.text: Counsel woven into the fabric of real life is wisdom.
5054.author: Walter Benjamin

5055.text: The wisdom of the wise is an uncommon degree of common sense.
5055.author: Dean Inge

5056.text: It is like the seed put in the soil - the more one sows, the greater the harvest.
5056.author: Orison Swett Marden

5057.text: The more one pleases everybody, the less one pleases profoundly.
5057.author: Stendhal

5058.text: Combine the extremes, and you will have the true center.
5058.author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

5059.text: Above all, you must fight conceit, envy, and every kind of ill-feeling in your heart.
5059.author: Abraham Cahan

5060.text: Follow your instincts. That's where true wisdom manifests itself.
5060.author: Oprah Winfrey

5061.text: Wisdom has never made a bigot, but learning has.
5061.author: Josh Billings

5062.text: Central banks don't have divine wisdom. They try to do the best analysis they can and must be prepared to stand or fall by the quality of that analysis.
5062.author: Mary Kay Ash

5067.text: Wisdom is knowing when you can't be wise.
5067.author: Paul Engle

5068.text: Imagination allows us to escape the predictable. It enables us to reply to the common wisdom that we cannot soar by saying, 'Just watch!'
5068.author: Bill Bradley

5069.text: Life is the only real counselor; wisdom unfiltered through personal experience does not become a part of the moral tissue.
5069.author: Edith Wharton

5070.text: The experience gathered from books, though often valuable, is but the nature of learning; whereas the experience gained from actual life is one of the nature of wisdom.
5070.author: Samuel Smiles

5071.text: The greatest wisdom is to realize one's lack of it.
5071.author: Constantin Stanislavski

5072.text: The man who makes everything that leads to happiness depends upon himself, and not upon other men, has adopted the very best plan for living happily. This is the man of moderation, the man of manly character and of wisdom.
5072.author: Plato

5073.text: Our experience is composed rather of illusions lost than of wisdom acquired.
5073.author: Joseph Roux

5076.text: Through mutual understanding, sincerity and goodwill, and with great wisdom and broad views, the leaders on both sides should jointly initiate new opportunities for peace, stability, cooperation and mutual benefit.
5076.author: Chen Shui-bian

5077.text: And when the world is created, it is created in such a way that those eternal objects of God's loving wisdom become actualities - interacting with one another, relating to God in the finite realm.
5077.author: Rowan Williams

5078.text: Not engaging in ignorance is wisdom.
5078.author: Bodhidharma

5079.text: God in His wisdom has decided that He will reward no works but His own.
5079.author: Johannes Tauler

5081.text: Genius unrefined resembles a flash of lightning, but wisdom is like the sun.
5081.author: Franz Grillparzer

5082.text: The wisdom of the wise, and the experience of ages, may be preserved by quotation.
5082.author: Isaac D'Israeli

5083.text: But what is liberty without wisdom, and without virtue? It is the greatest of all possible evils; for it is folly, vice, and madness, without tuition or restraint.
5083.author: Edmund Burke

5086.text: If we have built on the fragile cornerstones of human wisdom, pride, and conditional love, things may look good for a while, but a weak foundation causes collapse when storms hit.
5086.author: Charles Stanley

5088.text: We can't really digest food unless there's hunger. So we can't really assimilate spiritual wisdom unless we feel the need for it.
5088.author: Radhanath Swami

5089.text: All conventional wisdom has an element of truth to it, but good design requires more than an element of truth - it requires an ensemble of correct assumptions and valid calculations.
5089.author: Henry Petroski

5090.text: We humans have lost the wisdom of genuinely resting and relaxing. We worry too much. We don't allow our bodies to heal, and we don't allow our minds and hearts to heal.
5090.author: Thich Nhat Hanh

5092.text: I imagine God to be like my father. My father was always the voice of certainty in my life. Certainty in the wisdom, certainty in the path, certainty always in God. For me God is certainty in everything. Certainty that everything is good and everything is God.
5092.author: Yehuda Berg

5093.text: The philosophy of life is this: Life is not a struggle, not a tension... Life is bliss. It is eternal wisdom, eternal existence.
5093.author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi

5095.text: Each of us finds his unique vehicle for sharing with others his bit of wisdom.
5095.author: Ram Dass

5096.text: Some coaches pray for wisdom. I pray for 260-pound tackles. They'll give me plenty of wisdom.
5096.author: Chuck Noll

5098.text: Wisdom lies neither in fixity nor in change, but in the dialectic between the two. A constant coming and going: wisdom lies in the momentary.
5098.author: Octavio Paz

5099.text: Consider this point. It is a main point of true wisdom. Whenever there is an execution of purpose, there must be an agent.
5099.author: Adoniram Judson

5100.text: The tradition is a fence around the law; tithes are a fence around riches; vows are a fence around abstinence; a fence around wisdom is silence.
5100.author: Akiva ben Joseph

5102.text: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
5102.author: Alan Kay

5103.text: Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one.
5103.author: Albert Einstein

5105.text: Who is wise in love, love most, say least.
5105.author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

5106.text: Never interrupt someone doing what you said couldn't be done.
5106.author: Amelia Earhart

5108.text: Dost thou love life? Then do not squander time, for that is the stuff life is made of.
5108.author: Benjamin Franklin

5109.text: The doors of wisdom are never shut.
5109.author: Benjamin Franklin

5110.text: Nothing that you have not given away will ever be really yours.
5110.author: C. S. Lewis

5112.text: You can't sweep other people off their feet, if you can't be swept off your own.
5112.author: Clarence Day

5113.text: Be happy. It's one way of being wise.
5113.author: Sidonie Gabrielle Colette

5114.text: Applause is a receipt, not a bill.
5114.author: Dale Carnegie

5115.text: Don't taunt the alligator until after you've crossed the creek.
5115.author: Dan Rather

5116.text: If you do not express your own original ideas, if you do not listen to your own being, you will have betrayed yourself.
5116.author: Rollo May

5117.text: He who lives by the crystal ball soon learns to eat ground glass.
5117.author: Edgar Fiedler

5118.text: Perhaps too much of everything is as bad as too little.
5118.author: Edna Ferber

5119.text: Blessed are those who give without remembering and take without forgetting.
5119.author: Elizabeth Bibesco

5120.text: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
5120.author: Epictetus

5121.text: You must learn day by day, year by year to broaden your horizon. The more things you love, the more you are interested in, the more you enjoy, the more you are indignant about, the more you have left when anything happens.
5121.author: Ethel Barrymore

5122.text: Start with what is right rather than what is acceptable.
5122.author: Franz Kafka

5123.text: When a thing is done, it's done. Don't look back. Look forward to your next objective.
5123.author: George C. Marshall

5124.text: Look around for a place to sow a few seeds.
5124.author: Henry Van Dyke

5125.text: Beware, so long as you live, of judging men by their outward appearance.
5125.author: Jean de La Fontaine

5126.text: This is the highest wisdom that I own; freedom and life are earned by those alone who conquer them each day anew.
5126.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

5128.text: Climb the mountains and get their good tidings.
5128.author: John Muir

5129.text: It isn't what you do, but how you do it.
5129.author: John Wooden

5130.text: A man should always consider how much he has more than he wants.
5130.author: Joseph Addison

5131.text: Your sacred space is where you can find yourself again and again.
5131.author: Joseph Campbell

5132.text: Never cut what you can untie.
5132.author: Joseph Joubert

5133.text: The wheel that squeaks the loudest is the one that gets the grease.
5133.author: Josh Billings

5134.text: Always be a first-rate version of yourself, instead of a second-rate version of somebody else.
5134.author: Judy Garland

5135.text: Never does nature say one thing and wisdom another.
5135.author: Juvenal

5136.text: The teacher who is indeed wise does not bid you to enter the house of his wisdom but rather leads you to the threshold of your mind.
5136.author: Khalil Gibran

5137.text: Keep me away from the wisdom which does not cry, the philosophy which does not laugh and the greatness which does not bow before children.
5137.author: Khalil Gibran

5138.text: Wisdom ceases to be wisdom when it becomes too proud to weep, too grave to laugh, and too selfish to seek other than itself.
5138.author: Khalil Gibran

5139.text: A mistake is simply another way of doing things.
5139.author: Katharine Graham

5140.text: If I don't have wisdom, I can teach you only ignorance.
5140.author: Leo Buscaglia

5141.text: It's easier to resist at the beginning than at the end.
5141.author: Leonardo da Vinci

5143.text: Nobody can give you wiser advice than yourself.
5143.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

5144.text: If you set out to be liked, you would be prepared to compromise on anything at any time, and you would achieve nothing.
5144.author: Margaret Thatcher

5145.text: My father said there were two kinds of people in the world: givers and takers. The takers may eat better, but the givers sleep better.
5145.author: Marlo Thomas

5146.text: That old law about 'an eye for an eye' leaves everybody blind. The time is always right to do the right thing.
5146.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

5147.text: The truest wisdom is a resolute determination.
5147.author: Napoleon Bonaparte
